text:
Flasche bei Craftbeer-shop.de
Gold, klar, etwas großporiger Schaum
Hopfen, Aprikose, etwas Mango, etwas Zitrus
Pils-malzig, etwas bitter, schwer. Nicht so fruchtig wie Aroma vermuten lässt. Sehr lecker

Pint draft at Kennet Square brew pub
A clear yellow with a white head that laces nicely, 
A malty and spicy
T early hops up front followed by spicies and bready malt.
P mild bitter, no sour, no sweet
O wonderful pils with bit of hoppy spice
Klares Goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, leicht fruchtig, Zitronenschale, grasig, Heu, trocken, leicht herb.

Clear yellow pour with a frothy white head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma is mild funk with a spicy, earthy characters. Taste follows the nose with big hops up front followed by spicies and bready, malty subtleties. The finish is dry. Very nice hoppy pils
330ml bottle. Pours yellow. Syrup, peach, very floral, something a touch metallic, lingering bitterness. Its quite crisp and refreshing even with all that bitterness. Fine.
It is a lot harsher than I thought it would be, the hops bring a thud of dryness to the palate. Does have a hint of sweetness but the rasping edges of the hops are the central theme.
Clear yellow colour with thin soapy head. Its a typical lager pilsener. Perhaps with slightly more pronounced hop notes. Fairly clean and fresh. Decent stuff.

Light pale straw color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, floral hops, & some citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, citrus, and spice; Finish is dry & slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good stuff - I enjoyed this one.

(Victory Prima Pils) Can 355ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 5.3%
Golden yellow colour on the body, clear, with a small white head on top, with good density. 
Aroma of grass, hay, earthy notes, noble hops.
Taste has grass, earthy notes and a nice citrusy touch, while being pretty bitter.
Medium thin body, biting carbonation. 
Very good.raisin,
Excellent tasting beer! Yummy. Smooth as can be, though fairly weak ABV at 5.3%. I will definitely drink this again. Another winner from Victory!

12 ounce bottle. Pours pale golden with a thin white head that lingers. Taste is of malt, grass, honey and hops. Similar aroma. Taste is similar. Has a decent body with a with a slight bitter and dry finish. Easy to drink and rather enjoyable.

I have been told that a 3.7 is more appropriate than the 3.5 I wanted to rate this beer. To be fair, I would never purposefully buy a pilsner myself... theyre fine for sipping or rating because your wonderful and amazing boyfriend likes them, but not in my upper tiers along with a good IPA or belgian. That being said, its somewhat sweet and very refreshing. Pours a bright golden color, as if you had taken a multivitamin in the morning. Simple and malty. Tastes best on the first warm day of spring in the northeast, when you finally get to come home and cuddle with your booboo and watch Bobs Burgers.
Can at Great Grog fair. Clear golden. Nose is grass, green beans. Tastes very refreshing, some green vegetables but not in a bad way, sweetish malts.

Typical gold, fizzy pilsner appearance, but much better aroma and taste. Malty, a touch of citrus and some yeasty notes. Very clean, slightly bitter or crisp. Needs to be served very cold. Pilsners are not my favorites, but this was good, and on a hot summer So Cal day, it would be perfect. Id buy it, and would love to have it in my cellar. From a bottle at a friends house

Bottle; pours clear gold with a white head; aroma of bread, malt, citrus, and a hint of grass; taste is light bitter with malt, bread, citrus, and some faint grass notes; finish is dry with a light bitterness; not a Pilsener guy but this is pretty good

Keg (Kittys, Helsinki)
Sweet fruity aroma. Pale, brief small head. Watery palate, a bit fizzy. Sweet malts, a bit fruity. Slightly starchy finish, some graininess. Pretty boring lager, but drinkable. Finishes a bit watery. I can actually taste the carbonic acid, which is never a good sign. Boring fizzy swill, unbelievably over-rated.

Keg Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2009, Parsons Green, London in July 2009 - And Bottle - Pale Yellowy Gold in colour. Very hoppy; flowery and grassy hops. Fruity; grapefruit and lemon. Malty; nice caramel malt base. Crisp and refreshing. Bitingly hoppy citrus fruity pilsener. Dry hoppy finish. Nice Pilsener! 
(2009-07)

Pours light yellow with a white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Medium carbonation with smooth mouthfeel. Grassy nose with a crisp medium / earthy bitterness that finishes crisp & dry with a bit of lingering bitterness. Just the right amount of hops to make this Pilsner stand out from the crowd.

Can. Pale gold pour. Clear. Frothy white head, decent retention. Lots of grain, Saaz, pilsner malt shines through like a sun ray through fog. Medium bitterness. A beautiful display of the grain bill though. Victory is solid.

Golden color with white head. Aroma is cereals, grainy, some earthy noble hops and a touch of citrus/lemongrass. Taste is more cereals and grain, grassy noble malts, very fresh. Dry finish. Silky, slightly watery mouthfeel. Pleasant and rather long aftertaste of lemongrass and earthy noble hops. A nice, clean and crisp Pilsner - not as hoppy or intense I would have hoped for, though.

Got this in the CAN. Light yellow with really nice head. Its a pilsner with a bit more hop kick to it. Not bad for a pilsner, definitely more flavor than a lot of other pilsners I have tried. Wish the lousy distributors in my area could have got this in bottles but for some reason they are on a CAN kick.
0,355 l bottle herbs, cereal, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Sampled from tap at Craft Beer Corner. Clear, golden yellow with a large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Fruity-grassy, herbal-spicy aroma of lemongrass, ginger, pineapple and white pepper. Fruity-grassy, herbal-spicy taste of lemongrass, pineapple, ginger and white pepper, followed by a short, moderately grassy-bitter, herbal-spicy and dry finish. Almost medium-bodied, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice!
Six pack from Hot Rods in Mount Vernon. Solid pilsner. I see this beer being a regular staple in my supply.

Bottle from West Side. Pours a slightly hazy gold with a finger of foam that lingers. Light skunk on the nose. Clean and crisp malt with some light grain. Nice clover honey mid-palate. Finish is smooth and crisp with lemon.

Pale golden pour with a frothy white head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma is dominated hops with a spicy, earthy characters. Taste follows the nose with big hops up front followed by spicies and bready, malty subtleties. The finish is dry. Very nice hoppy pils
Bottle in the US - Nice crisp and fresh bitter pils. Aroma is lightly citrus, pepper and saaz hops. Body medium malty. Good.

Tap @ Keg & Brew. Clear straw colour with a foamy white head. Spicy Saaz aromas, filled with grass and backing malts. Moderate, but perfectly bitter, with citrus, grass and pepper hops and solid backing malts. Good carbonation, medium bodied and dry finishing. What a great pilsner. Why cant brewers get theses styles right. Sometimes a refreshing beer is what is required, and this is right up there with the best Ive had.
12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of bread, citrus and grains. Nice beer
Tap @ Spring Lounge, Manhattan. Pours clear golden with a rich white head. Aromas and flavours of bread, citrus, pine and malt. Clean and fresh. Finishes lightly bitter. Excellent pilsener.

Can with conflicting dates on the stamp and importers sticker. Pours a clear straw gold, lots of carbonation, finger of foam. Big Saaz punch, strong grass and hay aroma. Hops up front, grass and a little citrus but staying nicely Noble, with malt flavour in the swallow, bready, a nice lingering peppery feel. Gentle carbonation, light-medium, dry finish. A superb beer to slam after work.
Draught at Brewdog Helsinki. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, grass, toast and a bit of pine. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, pine, grass and toast. Very nice pils.

0.5 l draught @ William K Kurvi, Helsinki. Very pale lager with a nice head. This has quite a lot citrus flavoured hops. Not too much, though. Taste is close to session APA. Body is quite weak, more like Helles than Pilsener.

Sampled from a bottle at Winberies restaurant in Oak Park, Chicago. Pours a slightly hazy light gold with a solid white head. Crisp flavours with a good dough-like malt taste and notes of grass and herbs. Good flavour of Czech hops giving a refreshing finish. A good non-European Pilsner. Very drinkable.
Another great beer from Victory. lovely and fresh with a lovely hop profile. crisp, clean and well balanced
Lovely and crisp beer. Not a big PILS fan, but really enjoyed the hop character of this beer, Crisp and clean finish with a nice upfront nose

5.3%ABV. Pilsner.

Poured out light gold 4ºSRM.

Nose is creamy and redolent of steamed corn.

Mouthfeel is light and beery. Palate has sweet pale malt with water biscuits, dough and wheat flour. There is some minerality to the palate, but very light. Hops are noble and balanced perfectly.

Finish is clean with light hop bitter.

Goes on Favorites List!
Not really what I look for in a pilsener, way too hoppy. But too light to enjoy as an IPA type of drink. Tolerable, but really all wrong IMO.
Classic pils aroma. Clean, short, and refreshing. Stereotypical German malt & yeast concoction. Great pilsner overall.
Bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma has grass, citrus, hops. Taste is malty with long and dry quite bitter aftertaste. Flavors of grass, citrus, fruits. Refreshing and crisp.
Aromas of lemon, green apple, and grass. Taste is lemon, light sweet doughy malts,green apple, and a a faint grass hop bite in the finish.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a flute. Big, fluffy white head that slowly dissipates and leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Clear yellow-gold with very fine carbonation. A little citrus in the nose, otherwise malty. Medium body, great mouthfeel, soft and smooth. Well balanced, with a lightly bitter finish. A joy to drink. I dont frequent pilsners, but this is the best that Ive had.

Originally rated on 9/9/08. "First of all this is not one of my favorite styles but victory put out a pretty good beer. It pored a golden yellow body with a huge amount of carbonation which gave it a nice little bite. Aroma and flavors of malts, mild hops and a little lemon. Crisp and refreshing it has more body than the average pilsner. "
33cl bottle. Hazy gold color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Aroma is cereal, hops, light grass, light vegetable.
Nose is sweet, hay. Great carbonation. Long, sour finish. Lot of flavor, just not my thing. Maybe worth another shot. Not that great, but at least they tried.
On tap at a dive bar in Portland with Gyngus the dog. Its a pretty good beer, just a mellow pills.

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours golden with a nice, white head and lacing. The aroma was a little skunky. It was also hoppy. The taste was hops, cracker, and lemon. It was crisp and refreshing. The hops blended nicely with the dryness and subtle sweetness. This was a well-balanced balanced beer. You wont get much better from this style.

£2.29, lots of flavour, creamy banana taste, big aftertaste. Easy to drink lager that's much nicer than standard fare. Would drink again and again

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Baltimore s harbor. Good but low noble hop aroma. Oxidized pils malt flavor. Just ok.

Draft. Clear golden with one finger white head. Aroma of mango, citrus, light floral and slight grapefruit. Taste is sweet mango, bitter grapefruit, citrus, grass and some light floral notes. Dry medium mouthfeel, light to medium carbonation and medium lasting bitter aftertaste.
On tap at The Rookery. Pours crystal gold with a thin white head. Aroma is flowery, maybe hand soap from the server. Flavour is crisp, but a little heavy. Finish is nicely bitter.
Pours clear golden with a lively head. Aroma is malty. Drinks easily, but not overly complex.

Tap at Great Notion Brewing.

A: Clear gold in color, foamy white head. 

N: Straw, grass, pine, minerality, sulfur, earth, some corn, spent grains. Lemon zest and white grape. 

T: Quite clean. Grainy sweetness and a pleasing bitterness.

M: Light body, spritzy carbonation, no alcohol. 

A: A bright and easy-drinking pilsener. Quintessential and a great example of what makes this style my favorite.
hay, grass, alcohol, frothy, clear, pale, lightly bitter, light body, fizzy, bitter,

Aroma of strong floral hops. Appearance, well what youd expect from a pils. Yellow and fizzy. Palate quite smooth. Taste is unusual. Seems to either have wrong malts or hops. Fruity hops like citra or equinox not sure. But whatever it is its not suitable to the style. Too much like an IPA with its fruity hop follow through and not enough bitterness that is typical 
for a good pils style. The ale heads might like it but its not a proper pils. Simple as.

Grasig floral. Hoppy? Jo! Riecht und schmeckt klar tschechisch. Während des Trunkes ein klein wenig süß, dann aber schnell schön bitter. Nicht übel. Im Nachtrunk dezent prickelnd säuerlich und für ein Pils voll und kräftig. 335ml/3Euro aus dem BROLTERS in Bremen.
Very floral almost skunky. Pours pale. Has about everything youd want in a pils. Very consistent from bottle to tap. High drinkability.
hay, bread, grass, herbs, golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, average carbonation, bitter,
Pours a nice straw yellow with decent head. Aroma includes grassy herbs and sweet bready malts. Taste is crisp, sweet, and hoppy. Spicy hops with a tad of sweetness. A great pilsener for hopheads!!!!

Slightly sweet, barnyard aroma. Pours a light amber with active carbonation but a rapidly dissipating head.First sips reveal an initial sweetness that rapidly is overtaken by the bitterness characteristic of the style. On the palate, the carbonation displays a refined liveliness. The finish is bitter but not long.
Bottle. Pours a gold colour with a fluffy white head, light aroma with some fruit, taste is bitter and fruity with a dry bitter finish.

0.355l botte thanks to Cristobal37. Golden body with a thin white head. Aroma of bread, orange zest, honey and a decent amount of grassy hops. Taste of bread, grains, orange zest and grassy hops. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation. Very nice.
Bottle from K&L Wine in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is honey, slightly floral, grassy and herbal. Very drinkable. The classic pils motif.
Pours hazy pale yellow with thin white head. Nose is sweet malt. Aromas are sweet malts, herbal and flowery hops. Average carbonation, medium body. Medium sweet and grainy finish

Bottle to glass. Aroma: honey and slight herbal. Appearance: crystal clear light golden yellow. Small white head. Taste: sweet-dry lemon rind. Palate: light medium body, moderate prickly carbonation, considerable lingering bitterness.

Aroma is light, dry, sweet malt, earthy hops, great for the style. Appearance is golden straw, white head, mostly clear. Taste is earthy hops, bitter, sweet malt, corn, wheat, like a pilsener. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, creamy, crisp carbonation, lots of corn in the aftertaste. Overall, this is decent.

2015 BJCP Category: 5D German Pils (thanks to Jim for this bottle!) 
AROMA: Spicy, slightly piney hops. Lightly sweet malt character akin to crackers. 10/12APPEARANCE: Darker gold color; clear and effervescent. Average, white, foamy head. Good retention and lacing. 3/3FLAVOR: More bitter than most of the style. Strong spicy hop flavor with some piney/resiny character in the finish. Malt is light and blonde with some graham cracker taste in the background. 17/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium/light body; consistently crisp. Refreshing while in the mouth, but hops linger with a dry, starchy sensation. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Rare to see an American brew this to-spec for the style. Would be better in cans rather than bottles. 8/10TOTAL SCORE: 42/50
Motherfuckers, this is a very good and delicious pilsner. I could drink about a million of these.

Bottle from OBriens, Athlone [210316]
Golden blonde, clear, frothy white head
Aroma - soft floral, light sweet, hint of lemon, soft sweet floral hop, light nose
Taste of sweet pale malts, soft floral hop, spicy peppery, bit unusual for a lager, quite sweet malty
Palate - Soft carb, medium body, bit oily. Finish is slightly dry with a fairly bitter linger
Overall - Nice lager hops in this, more hoppy than usual for a lager, like it
Bottle on sale at Bradleys. Straight from the bottle. Nice citrus hop aroma. More rounded than I expected for the style. Biscuits and a touch of grapefruit.

Pretty surprised considering I'm not a huge pile fan. The aroma alone is enticing with crisp hops. Initial taste makes the tongue tingle and then the dry bitterness finishes. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottiglia. Lintensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste poco, a bassa carbonazione e bollicine di media grandezza. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. La frizzantezza è data da bollicine fini a carbonazione abbondante, persistente ed insistita. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. Il dolce medio quasi sovrasta lamaro percettibile. Lintensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è dissetante e semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. In bocca arrivano sentori di miele, pane, fiori.
Great flowery aroma, starts off sweet but finishes dry. Solidly Good, but not great or noteworthy.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 355 ml Bottle. 
Strong aroma and nice clear golden color. White head. Tastes nice, first sweet then very balanced bitter taste. Medium body with some carbonation. Very nice pils.
Beautiful gold pilsner with a lasting thin head and a perfectly balanced bitterness & body. Soft, clean & very smooth with a semi-dry finish. Excellent Pilsner.

Bottle at Postkontoret, march 3rd 2015. Light goløden body with a lasting white head. Aroma of grain and spicy hops. Taste is mild sweet with bread and earth, pleasant bitterness. Grassy finish with a crisp mouthfeel.

At Chappies. A crisp very light malt wheat notes that is smooth leaving no aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
From the bottle to a pilsner. Classic pilsner crystal clear yellow in the glass. Giant soapy head. Nose is corn wheat, sweet. First taste is sweet, grains, even bodied. Decent. Sluggable.

Medium/light aroma of sweet artificial malts. Light yellow color with small white head and clear liquid. medium/light taste with sweet malts and wheat. Narrow taste spectrum with short malty aftertaste. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall, artificial and lame.
Yellow color, white head, aroma of lager yeast, malts, lemon, dough. Taste is very well balanced, light sweet and slightly bitter. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation.

Why is it that I continue to purchase, imbibe and review brews from styles that I dont really like? Unfathomable. But, heres a pilsner. Certainly has that all too familiar barnyard hay taste. Doesnt look like much, sits in the glass pretty flat and lackluster. Bready, not complex, nothing going on here. This is not at all a bad beer, just a pretty middle of the road attempt at an overdone style.
My favorite Pilsner. Perfect for any day, hot or cold. Hop forward pilsner. Good malt presence. Very crisp and clean finish.

355ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden with a quickly dissolving uneven white head. Aroma is very light with sweet malts, honey, some sweet fruits, taste is similar with a light hoppy finish. Medium body, light carbonation. Some final dryness, a bit too sticky sweetness.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI. Lightly hazy yellow. Ginger citrus aroma. Sharp, then a mild honey sweetness. Finish is long with more ginger. Pretty citrusy for a pilsner. Almost like a Shandy.

Slightly sweet malty citrus aroma. Murky golden color with a very little head that dissipates really quickly. Has a huge hop flavor with a citrus flavor. Each sip is clean and crisp with a dry finish.

From bottle in footed pilsner. Cloudy golden colour with yeast and slight citrus on the nose. Smooth drinking from beginning to end. As someone who normally lives in a world of high-alpha hops, I can respect this as a very well-executed pilsner. Should revisit closer to the source!

Pours a hazy golden color with a very thin white head. Has a pleasant smell of grapefruit and orange. Has a thin, pleasant mouthfeel with flavors of grapefruit and floral, earthy hops. Has an underlying bitterness with a crisp, smooth finish. Quite good for a pilsener.

Lukt: Humle og malt.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Søtlig humle og malt.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar, Praha sammen med Bryne.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Pours a very pale or light straw color. Very nice tall, but not too thick white head. Some retention but nice lacing. Clear, but not super carbonated.Aroma is hoppy, fruity, citrusy earthy. Its also very bready. This smells super.Taste is hoppy and even a little buttery. Slightly nutty and earthy. A little herby, and spicy. Its pretty complex for such a light beer  It does have some decent malt, but overwhelmed by the hops.Mouthfeel is surprisingly light. Very smooth, clean, crisp and dry. Finishes bitter and slightly sour.Overall, this is really good. Its well done and tastes great also. I think Ill go grab another one!
Yellow colour, white head, aroma of lager yeast, malts, lemon, dough. Taste is very well balanced, light sweet and slightly bitter. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation.
Bottle from brad...thx man...drinkable but not fantastic...its a pilsner so not as hoppy as i like....good but great...not sure.

First tried this at Barcade in Brooklyn about 8 years ago. Have always rated it very highly for a pils. Got hold of some bottles from Beer Cartel here in Australia. Pretty sharp hop hit but a very drinkable brew. Slight head with minimal lacing. Aroma is mild considering the taste. Could use a touch more carbonation I feel. Enjoy this as cold as possible. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in Prague-CZ at the Beergeek pub with Mowbeer. Pours a golden clear color with a white adhesive head. Nose: lavender-jasmine flowers, melon, summer fruit. Mouth: frizzy palate and finish, malty character, small hops presence but well-done.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2015 On tap in LA. I?m not a pilsner fan but this really impressed me. Fresh crisp pilsner, lots of noble hop aroma, clean, refreshing, delicious. Best pilsner I?ve had for sure. 4.0 // had on tap again a few days later. Good but not like the other glass. Hops were a bit grassy and seemed less crisp. 3.7

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey, consumed on 9/11/2015. Clear golden straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of hay, floral notes, wheat. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, hay, wheat. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Good beer little strong and hoppy more than I would like. Looking for something like a Stella 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear orangish yellow in color with a thin white head. Slight citrus aroma. The taste is a little citrus and hops with some malts and a faint coffee flavor. Not bad but average at best.

Sweetly hopped aroma, grassy notes. A beautiful, frothy but quickly dissipating off-white head over pale gold. Wonderful mouthfeel with the correct level of effervescence. Nice marriage of esters, sweetness and hops...great take on the style.
This beer can compete against Eurpoean Pilseners. It has a slightly stronger body and slightly more hop flavor than its continental cousins. I consider this to be in my top five favorite Pilseners.

Tap. I waited till I could try it at the source. Pours crystal clear golden, small creamy off white head, nice lacing. Aroma is light, Bready, grass, grain. Flavor has a hint of sweetness, light plus bitterness, fresh baked bread, field grass, hints of honey, some grain. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Solid for style.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 Bottle in pint glass from Downtown Discount Beverage, Dover NH. Aroma is bready malt with yeasty dough, leather and basement, mild burnt herbs. Appearance is clear pale yellow with greenish tinge (a little urine-like) with persistent but mild sparkle and small head with fair persistence and mild lacing. Taste is medium bitter and sour. Palate is medium bodied with oily texture with lively carbonation and long very dry finish. Overall, an interesting smelling beer with capable other aspects. A good offering for the style.
Had on draft at Tap & Handle. Pilsner malt is in both the aroma and flavor. There is a firm floral hop aroma, fruity, sweet malts, grainy, light bitterness in the finish, honey. This is a tasty beer.

Bottle. Pour is clean gold with a nice white head. Aroma and flavor are so clean and enticing with floral hop notes and light clean malty notes dominating. Also a touch of yeast in there. Love this beer.

Bottle into tulip. Golden. Grassy, malty, bready floral aroma and taste. Something else unique and enticing that I can't identify. Smells and tastes like a lazy late summer afternoon. Great Pilsner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear yellow, little head. Aroma grassy, biscuity. Taste is balanced maybe a touch of caramel with hops behind. A good clean lager.

Classic American craft lager, I assume this was a bold reaction against the culture of bland mass-marketed pale lagers at the time. Bottle bought at GBBF and consumed at home. Medium sized, yellowish white, regularly shaped head, colour a deep and bright yellow golden, clear with quiet sparkling. Lovely American hops aroma, impressions of lemon zest, starfruit, yellow grapefruit, field flowers, fresh cucumber, hint of pine resin, unripe pineapple, even a touch of lavender, white bread. Crisp, clean onset, minerally fizz but refined, smooth honeyish malt sweetishness, touch bready, shifting to a relatively long hoppy finish, very aromatic with delicate citrus peel and flower notes, very subtle salty edge but most of all deeply bittering and drying the throat in a non-agressive, elegant way. Must have been one of the first IPLs (India pale lager), the kind of boutique Pilseners delicately hopped with IPA hops and thus making a statement that pale lager is able to achieve great finesse as well. Lovely, almost feminin kind of graciousness, this is the kind of pale lagers that should be a lot more on the foreground in craft beer culture.

Light old bready pils malty nose, some honey, herbs. Med light bodied, herby, quite nice wet/bushy hoppy flavour. Bit murky bready, but I like the hops here.-- bb

빅토리 브루 - 빅토리 프리마 필스 5.3% ABV 마시기 쉬운 술로 알려진 필스너의 아로마, 바디, 테일의 개성을 모두 증폭시킨 힘있는 필스너. 금주법 시대 이전의 라거-필스너맛& 유추할 수 있는 좋은맥주

(Keg at Konttori, Tampere, 20150808) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass and grain, both mild. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, grass, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter. A harsh pils.
A small taste from a friend (tap) @ Harrys. Pours hazy golden with a medium head. Aroma is fruity malts. Flavor is fruity malts with a hoppy finish. Decent.
Pours a pale gold with a long-lasting white foam head. Aroma is bread malts and floral hops. Flavor is sweet bread with some floral hops and a mild bitterness in the finish. Quite good.
.5l on tap @ Harrys. Pours clear staw yellow with nice thick foamy white head. Aroma is malts, hops, some floral and bread notes. Flavor is mostly same. Nice refreshing and well made pils.
Provdatum okänt. Pissgul färg. Mycket trevlig balans mellan en kolaartad malt och en pilsnerhumlebeska med bett. Snabbt försvinnande skum.

Very classic Pilsner. Pours a light golden clear with small head and moderate lacing. Not sweet with moderate German hop bitterness. Aroma of toasted hops. Medium bodied medium bitter finish. Good representation of this style.

Victory Prima Pils 
As a part of Variety of Victory I got this Pilsner from Victory Brewing. 

Its a clear, yellow, beer with a one finger high, white head. 

Nose: Floral, grass, spice, biscuit and yeast. 
Taste: Biscuit, caramel malt, white bread, hops and hay. 
Body: Medium, creamy body. Medium, soft carbonation. Dry finish and a great bitterness. Smooth taste! 

Really good, balanced pilsner!

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Lovely straw colour, white head. Hoppy, fresh, floral. Very nice bitterness, some sweetness, quite balanced, crisp. Light/medium body, medium/high carbonation, bitter finish. Very nice and refreshing!

Clean earthy herbal aroma. Taste starts sweet and soon becomes bready and bitter, very nice interplay between the bitterness and maltiness they balance out well although the bitterness come out on top. A nice dry clean and refreshing pilsner with nice bitter finish.

Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours straw yellow with rising bubbles. White froth head. Spice, dough, hay nose. Flavour is biscuit with medium bitter, bit of grapefruit, hay finish. Refreshing, nicely balanced pils

On Tap @ Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Almost clear golden, with a small white head. Slightly hoppy aroma, citrus, grass and biscuit. Medium carbonation, light and dry mouthfeel. The taste is fresh, red apple, malt, yeast, bread, fresh herbs. Dry finish.

PRIMA PILLS IS ONLY GOOD ON DRAGFT. THE BOTTELS TASTE FUNNY THEN DRINKING IT COLD ON TAP IS TASTEY. ITS A GOOD AND SMOOTHE ALE THAT HAVE LITE FLAVER OF FRUIT AND SPICE. DONT CONFUSE THESE PILLS WITH MILLER LITES PILLSNER THEY. ARE TOTALLY DIFFERENT. MILLER IS TRIPLE HOPS BREWED BUTT THE SECRET IS DO THEYRE OWN HOPS WHAT PLINY CREATED TO BE THE BEST BEER IN HISTORY. LET ME TELL YOU VICTORY THAT YOU ARE NO PLINY BUT THAT THANK YOU FOR NOT SAY (IPA "INDIA PALE ALE)" ON THE LABEL. TRUTH IN AVERTIZING IS IMPORTANTE.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden color. Aroma and taste are citrus and grassy..

Pours slightly hazy yellow with minimal head. Lightly hopped nose with yeast ester and bready malt. Flavor is fruity for the style but rounded out with the malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a pissy yellow from a bottle, minimal head despite vigorous pour. Nose of wheat, flavor of spicy Saaz, a little skunked, old bottle? Not so great.
Flaska från @msbrindbergs, tack! Guldgul vätska med vitt skum. Härlig välhumlad pilsner utan att ta i för mycket... Riktigt smarrig!

Flaska genom privatimport. 
Klar gyllene vätska med vitt skum. 
Doftar friskt och gott!
Älskar verkligen välhumlad pilsner/lager, förädling helt enkelt och här har man lyckats. 
Mycket bra!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

EBD 9/16/15. Pours a clear golden. Normal head volume and retention, outstanding lacing.

Nice, but light, nose of herbal and spicy hops over a mild biscuit with lager yeast.

Heavy light body with a smooth texture that has a subtle creamy aspect at times. Perfect carbonation with a nice effervescent burst in the middle and a rollicking prickly finish.

The flavor profile is world class. It is intense (hop flavor), somewhat complex and well balanced. It begins with Saaz hop flavor (not as pronounced as Urquel, unfortunately) that flows into a mild bitterness in the middle. As the bitterness asserts itself, a biscuit sweetness arrives to provide a tasty balance. The finish is a bit dry, not quite clean and a nice Saaz hop flavor lingers over a subtle sweetness coupled with a mild bitterness. THIS is what a German pilsner should taste like.
I want to like this beer but has a weird aftertaste that lingers... unfortunately not a huge fan

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Enjoy by date reads "15 Sept 2015"A - Very clean on the nose. Hops lend grassy, lemon notes. Light, sweet malts. Fresh baked bread. Mild honey as the beer warms. A - Beautiful, clear gold with fluffy white head. Little to no lacing. T - Crispy sweet flavors up front (reflective of the nose) perfectly matched by herbal hops. Supreme balance. The meshing of hops and malt creates a near apricot-like flavor.  P - Light bodied, dry finish with lingering herbal notes on the pallet. O - Fantastic American take on the German pilsner with a slightly more accentuated hop profile.

Solid easy drinking Pilsner. Stands out but is subtle at same time. Truly a beer craft and BMC drinkers alike can appreciate 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle or two shared with Posey at the creek. Pours a clear golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is slight grass and slight floral. Flavor follows and is nice crisp and clean. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12FL OZ ($21 12pack) The first go around with this beer company I got a 2 year expired 12pack and it was weak, but thanks to the great guys at Canoga Park BevMo; they swapped it out and discovered the brewer dropped off that 2 year expired and a 3 year expired. crazy! but after that SnaFu I go to rate this one. very carbonated. great taste and easy going.
Clear golden, low carbonation, medium frothy head. Light caramel banana pine aromas. Quite sweet, probably a bit too much for mine.

Bottle - Clear yellow with no head. Crisp flavor profile with floral hints. Getting hints of pine and grass to it. A decent amount of malt sweetness on this beer and I was hoping for a little more hop bitterness to balance it out. Decent for this style but nothing that blew my doors off.

Pours clear straw with one finger of fluffy white head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, no lacing. (3/5) Nose is grassy hops, grainy malt. (6/10) Taste is mild sweet, mild to moderate bitter. (7/10) Light body, moderate carbonation, crisp lightly bitter finish. (4/5)

As pilsners go, a decent example of the style, albeit somewhat more highly hopped than is typical. Which is of course the reason I consider it a decent example. Crisp, refreshing, and quite drinkable. (14/20)
Ordentliches Pils mit einer wuerzigen Note. Angenehm trocken, etwas Hopfen, ein wenig Wuerze und ein recht trockener Schluss. Knackig. einfach, vollkommen ok.

27th May 2015: on-tap at 101 Tap House, Oceanside. Decent Pilsner all round. Golden, clear and bright with a full white head. Crisp feel to the brew even if the aroma (like most Lager/Pilsners) was weak and thin. Mild malty lead over the hops in the flavouring: nothing spectacular or outstanding within the brew, just a very refreshing beer and really pleased I came across it while out in California.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 Grassy, grainy and savory complimented with moderate bitterness, although it is more bitter than most pilsners. Thin body and lightly textured. Very dry, finishes quickly and cleanly. One of my summer go to favorites.

The beer has got a clear golden colour with an airy head and crisp body. Aroma of hops and citrus fruits. Taste of hops, malt, bread, citrus fruits and grass. Bitter-hoppy finish. Refreshing and solid.

12 oz. bottle. Pours golden and slightly cloudy. Has a compact, white, head that dissipates moderately. Aroma is sweet and malty. Taste is fairly bitter, which goes against what you would expect from the aroma. It is very hoppy with a medium body and slightly creamy texture. Carbonation is average. The finish is all hops. Im not a big fan of super-hoppy beer and this one doesnt impress me either. However, I do like the aroma and the texture of the beer. Would I buy this beer again? Probably not, considering how many other beers are out there that I like better. If a friend served these at a BBQ, would I drink one? Absolutely, as I can see how a cold one of these would hit the spot on a warm, sunny day.

On tap at OConnors. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma sweet, malty, flowers, herbs, grass and earth. Taste is sweet, almost sticky, earthy, grassy hops with a sweet and slightly astringen finish. Too sweet, didnt go well with me at all

An excellent craft pilsener from the east coast US. From a bottle, I was impressed by both the aroma and appearance of the beer, the former was a sweet fruity and clean grassy hop aroma, some pale malt, and the appearance was a clear yellow gold with an exceptionally frothy and long-lasting head. Taste was a moderate flavor intensity of noble hops with a more soft fruity and flowery than bitter resiny accent, along with solid pale malt. Finished with a slightly more bitter hop aftertaste. Light and smooth on the palate, not too filling. A well-executed pilsener rendition.

Malty aroma with slight lagerish funk. Taste is malty, but that almost rice like maltiness that pilsners have. Not badly crafted at all, but that is what pilsners taste like to me. This one is well made and a refreshing beer but I am just not hugely into the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excellent Pilsner. The aroma is classic Pilsner. The taste is grassy Pilsner with just the right amount of hops.
In bottiglia. Aroma di cereale, miele millefiori, erbaceo un pò ruvido. Al palato corpo leggero, sentori di miele ed erbaceo, un pò terroso. Non molto fine come aromi, comunque godibile.
Excellent clean and easy drinking pilsner. Great spring/summer beer. One of the better pilsners Ive tried.

12oz bottle. 6/15/15 code date. Appearance: Light golden and probably the clearest beer Ive ever seen. Nice thick white frothy head that lingers. 
Aroma: Floral, grassy hop notes on a light crackery malt base. 
Taste: Light crackery malt sweetness, with a subtle but strong hop bitterness to balance. Slight spiciness to the hops. 
Mouthfeel: Light bodied with a moderate, crisp carbonation. 
Finish: Spicy and herbal hop bitterness lingers. 
Overall: Beautiful looking pilsner with nice floral and spicy hop characteristics. Maybe slightly subdued bitterness for a German Pils

355mL bottle BB 31/10/2015
Clean golden body, foamy white head.
Pleasant enough aroma; honeyed, lightly toasted, corny malts, subtle floral hops.
Medium carbonation & body, quite crisp.
Corny malts, light biscuity character, floral hops, a hint of citrus, decent bitterness for style.
Nice enough, quite a traditional example - not really outstanding though.

Pours light golden yellow from bottle, minimal white head. Malty, rather clean aroma. Tasty pils malt, slides nicely into the bitter, with slightly oily finish. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Great pilsner, went down fast. Would easily drink again. Wife loves it.
Bright and characterized by a stable and white foam. Hoppy and citrucy aroma. Dry and refreshing. Good american pils!
Overall decent and to great extent quintessential pilsener. However, Oskar Blues version of this style is better.

Victorys Prima Pils is a classic in the craft brewing world and a favorite among East Coast folk. Its not hard to see why. This brew packs a lot of hop aroma into its light, golden, and effervescent body. The taste captures the best aspects of hops and lagers. Crisp sensations and moderate bitterness paired with clean yeast and bread flavor. The pairing of heavy hopping and lagers isnt as novel as it once was, but Prima Pils still has a special place in the beer world.

Bottle.

A- Corn, grains, subtle hops, slight citrus.

A- Golden color, hazy liquid, minimal white head.

T- Subtle bitterness, corn, cereal, lemon.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- Ive heard good things about this and honestly, I didnt know why, its a pilsener. After trying, I can agree that its a decent beer and the added subtle hop notes are nice but its still nothing that excited me. Pretty standard, good for its style I guess, but not that great of a beer.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2016 Light gold, clear, little lace, tall fluffy head. Floral and yeasty nose. Medium body, light flavor, bright and refreshing but rich mouthfeel, high carbonation but low heat, dry but lingering and delicious aftertaste. Very bitter almost hiding the underlying sweetness, crisp acidity, Hoppy is an understatement, delicately floral, resiny, honeyed finish, very complex. Like for many beer drinkers, a favorite. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My quest for an awesome pilsner brings me to this beauty. Its everything Ive been looking for: razor sharp crispness, hops that are tweaked a little higher than usual, a mineral salt body, & a lip smacking finish. Im highly impressed & a little depressed that I may not be able to get this at home. Recommended.

12 ounce bottle. Honey gold color. Rocky beige head with nice lacing. Grainy malt nose with a citrus hop bouquet. Flavor is wonderfully complex hops that are nicely supported by the rich malt backbone. The citrus hops are firm and bitter. Nicely balanced. Very German-like in character.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 Bottle from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes

Aroma: bread, grass
Appearance: pale gold, clear, white foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, 
Overall: decent pilsner, good for hot days
Tap at Beer Authority, New York. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some fruits, grain, dryness,some sweetness and malts.
Not bad but nothing special either. Light aroma and a very plain taste. Still smooth and easy to drink.

Bottle from Valhallas Goat. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of straw, herbs and lemon zest. Flavour of grain, Parma Violets and sorrel. Dry fnish. Thin body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. A clean, fresh Pilsener.

12 oz bottle poured into a tumbler..sunshine yellow with a fluffy white head..aroma of hops,bread..more hoppy than i expected it to be which was a good thing but not a big pilsener fan..this one wasnt bad though.
Mandag i annen feb-15, den første på det som skulle vise seg å bli en kveld med bare gode (og til dels fremragende øl): klar strågul, lite skum. Lett bitterhet med akkurat passe sødme. Elegant.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 09.02.15. Pale, clear golden. White head. Fine aroma of flowerfields, grass and Czech hops. Very good and slightly fruity taste of Czech pilsner. Moderate bitterness. Very high drinkability.
Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear, golden. Aroma of bread, hay. Sweet, with a bitter finish.
Low carbonation and a daunting orange colour. Malty biscuit and salt and just a very nice all round pils. Hops are the main feature here. Well done.

Appearance- small thin bone white head. No lacing. Clear golden hue. Lots of bubbles. 

Smell- clean. Floral, bready, malty. 

Taste- sweet floral hops up front, malts in the middle, and bitter dry finish on the back end. 

Mouthfeel- light body

Overall- a very nice Pilsner from a rock solid brewery. Would recommend and have again. 

Cheers!

355 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 5.3%. Clear golden colour, moderate to low white head. Nice aroma of floral, grassy and herbal hops, some sweetish malts in the background. Medium sweet and malty flavour, followed by distinct herbal hops. A good pilsener indeed, but some European ones are better.

12 oz bottle with Dad for super bowl. Just a solid all around beer. Classic. Light golden pour, white head. All the right Pils notes- yeasty, crisp, mellow hop bitterness, bready, grassy and super clean. Nice and dry in the finish without being bitter. Tastes like a pils should taste. Great. Caveat: for the style.
Bottle from the Sheffield Tap. Decent aroma of Orange peel. Taste is nicely bitter, herby with some citrus coming through. Refreshing.
Straw coloured, with a foamy white head. Hops, light malt. Light oily texture, medium carbonation, crisp, dry finish. Refreshing. Good beer.

[from notes].
Pours a light golden with a lasting white head.

Aroma is as expected for style, if a bit hoppier. Taste follows aroma but is even more hoppy, especially in the finish. Long lasting and moderately bitter hop finish and after-taste. Hints of sweet malts.

Nice medium, light body with medium, high carbonation imparting a crisp feel. Semi-dry finish.

O - a pils for hop-heads; this one is more hoppy than most pale ales.
355ml bottle at home, source unknown - clear golden, lot of bubbles, big creamy off-white head, grassy, floral hop aroma, poor lacing, hoppy lager, high carbonation, dry, bitter finish

Like it a lot. Grassy nose and lovely goldenrod color. Clean. Would buy again. Flavor good at cold cold temperature.


---all in good suds.
Its good. Hoppy but lots of Sweet malt. The problem is I really like pilsners and I dont need them to be hoppy like this but I still like it

Pours clear and golden with a fluffy white head. Aroma of bready pale malts and floral grassy hops. Tastes clean, sooth, mildly sweet taste of pale malt and well balanced floral hops. Clean, dry finish. Not overly bitter, very well done pils! I could drink a lot of this. A great sessionable beer.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2015 brown bottle poured into a pilsner glass
a: Clear golden yellow with fine light to average carbonation. A gentle pour yields a finger of white head that dissipates after about 5 minutes leaving a decent amount of lacing which holds nicely to the glass. Pools of foam also tend to remain on the surface of the beer.

s: Nothing sticks out. A little biscuit balanced by a subtle floral hop aroma.

t: Again, well balanced with a slight but noticeable hop bite. Smooth maltiness provides a hint of chewiness to the beer. Hops on the finish which is appealing as it lingers however Im not getting floral as in the nose. Not nearly as hoppy as some have opined and definitely not citrusy. Maybe slightly more piny or herbal.

m: Very light body with the bubbles providing a slight tingle. Doesnt look like much but I kind of like it. I think this works nicely against the malt too, tying the flavor profile together. I would like a bit more more carbonation in this beer.

o: Have to say Im a bit disappointed with Prima especially after reading that it is among the absolute best in the style. Very nice of course but doesnt really impress me in any way. Certainly nothing bad to report but while interesting, also a little underwhelming though I wouldl buy it again.
Aroma much like hay which is not what I call pleasant but a very smooth light taste that lingers. Good balance of hopes and malts and very refreshing on the palate. A good beer but IMHO not great

Bottle. Golden and dry.Slightly malty and left lots of lacing.Medium body and easy to drink. This was one of the late Michael Jacksons top 500 beers.Cant think why. Its pleasant but not that outstanding.
Straw-gold with some sediment, thin head. Smell is hoppy, metal, floral. Savory, with some hop/floral character. Good body.

12 oz. bottle from Best Damn Beer Store. Nose of yeast with a hint of hop citrus and florals. Taste of light cracker malt and mild herbal and citrus hops that provide good bitterness. Light bodied. Well balanced. A nice dry finish with just a hint of sustained bitterness. Excellent, refreshing Pilsner.
Bottle (12oz $2): Clear yellow with soapy white head that lasts. Nice hops aroma. I think that this one leans more toward the malts, but it is well balanced with hops.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear light amber with a white head that slowly drops to a full cover, long strands of lace. Really nice aroma of malt and citrus. Taste is malt that moves to grow into the palate, but is halted by assertive citrus hops and mild carbonation in the palate. All is not lost; the malt reappears deep in a long finish. A well-balanced and solid thirst quencher. Most excellent.

Pours hazy straw yellow, nice two finger frothy head, awesome lacing and great retention. Aroma of light pine, herbs and straw. Taste is wonderfully balanced sweet malts and clean bitterness. Light to medium bodied, lively carbonation and a creamy mouth feel. Finishes clean with notes of pine, flowering herbs, fresh hay and light citrus. A very nice Pilsner.

Pours straw yellowwith a thick white, long lasting head. Aroma is surprisingly complex with grass, straw, pine, bread and maybe some flowers. Flavour is balanced with a sweetness and crisp clean finish.

Huge foamy head that seems to last forever. Seems to be fine bubbly cover on top of bigger ones. Laces nicely on the glass. Straw yellow body with a touch of haze. Has sediment On closer examination I see sediment floating around which I havent seen in this style before. Citrus and floral aroma. Low key malty bitterness. Some sourness in background. A faint peppery feel on the tongue. Its good but had hoped for more.

From 345 ml bottle. Pours a clear straw yellow with a sudsy white head that collapses to a collar. Aromas of crackers, fresh cut grass, straw and lemon. Taste is white bread at first before a pleasant grapefruit bitterness comes through. White grapes and grassy hops towards the end. Crisp finish with a light fruity aftertaste. Does everything you could want from a Pilsner.
Rich maltiness, bready, pine/floral hops, clean finish. Very smooth and balanced pils with a nice crisp.
A Pilsner that ale drinkers would enjoy. Crisp, clean, and full of fruity flavour = a benchmark of the American take on the style.
Pours a clear yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, toasty, citrus, grass and some hops. Taste is dry leading to a moderately bitey bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy light golden, medium white head. Aroma of bread, hay, straw, some hop resin. Taste is light sweet. Medium-light body, soft carbonation, dry bitter finish that was bit off. Just an okay Pils to me.

The aroma this one brings to the table is pretty good, subtle tones of dried flowers, some bread and a slight sweetness. The taste is very crisp, light with a lingering bitterness and a grassy, hoppy finish. Very tasty brew and even if I dont spontaneously start free-running over roof tops or doing somersaults when I have a pilsener - Its good - plain and simple.

Pours a yellow gold color with a white head. Grass, floral, light hop and grain aroma. Floral, hop, grass and malt flavor. Very noticeable hap flavor for the style. Light body and average carbonation. Floral and hop finish.

Bottled from BBB
Hazy yellow with a white head. 
Bready and malty aroma with some citrus. 
Medium to high bitterness. 
Citric flavour with grassy hops.
Very clear straw appearance with minimal head and minimal carbonation. Over all found this to be nicely Bready and sweet but at the same time a easily drinkable refreshing beverage.

Pours a clear straw, lots of carbonation feeding a thin bubble head. Very nice, wholesome hops aroma. Very clean and fizzy mouthfeel, friendly hops flavor with a malty follow-through. Slight hops aftertaste with a slight sticky residue.

From Bottledog in London. Pale translucent gold-green with watery white head. Smells of crisp malt - cereal, biscuit and lots of sweet-ish corn. Nose is characteristic for a pils and quite flavourful. Tastes of slight spiced malt, lemon, relatively heavy bitterness, some straw and cereal. Body is light and somewhat frothy but with a little bit of slickness to balance it. A solid pils with plenty of sweet malt and grassy/straw hops.

Bottle from Bottledog in London at home. Clear golden Pilsner pour with dense white frothy head. Aroma is earthy, biscuit, spicy hops - sweeter, fuller Pilsner. Taste is spicy hops, then an unexpected sweet biscuit-y flavor. Clean bitter finish. Not as much hops as I expected but a good Pilsner nonetheless. Sweetness is a surprise, but fills out the palate nicely. Solid pils.
Bottle to Pils glass. Pours clear to cloudy light yellow with thin head. Subtle bread malt aroma. Hoppey taste almost like a Pale Ale. Leaves a dry finish in the mouth.

"a hop forward pils with a nicely balanced boquet of earthy hops and malt. not as clean, but more to it than your average pilsner. a nice summer beer, refreshing. well done. sampled 3/21/09, best by 3/9/09 - must be amazing fresh if its this good old. better than the hop devil with the same date."

Pours clear light yellow witha thin white head. Aroma is nearly non-existent. Subtle malts on the nose. Medium carbonation in the mouth with an aggressive hop taste. Very hippy for a pilsner. Almost tastes like a pale ale. Very good!
Golden with white head. Frosted breakfast cereal and orange peel citrus. Flavor; mild but present hop, some bitter, nice malt flavor and long dry finish. Distinctly pilsner. Very nice.

Bottle to pils glass - Nice golden color with good head retention and lacing. Has a nice eggshell aroma and a grassy dry taste. Im not a huge pils fan but I would have been shocked had this beer been less than a score of 95. This is one that I would definitely look for again.

12 oz bottle. Pale golden straw with some chill haze. A fluffy, sticky, white, long lasting head, and chunky lace. Aroma is bready malts and spicy hops.
Flavor is hoppy up front, with a touch of bready malt and a peppery finish.
12 oz. bottle. Poured a lively clear gold with thin film of head. Scattered patches of lace. Crisp lemon, bread, and dry finish. Thin bodied. Pleasant surprise for a pilsner.

On tap poured a clear yellow hue w/ a medium foamy head w/ nice lacing. Moderate straw aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish of short duration. Tastes are straw, light lemon and light malts. Light bodied.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to a pint. Crystal clear pale yellow with frothy white head and lingering lacing. Prominent maltiness on the nose with a hint of hop citrus and florals sneaking through. Dank pine resin flavors with long dry finish... Excellent Pilsner.
Bottle at Brewers, Gothenburg. Clear golden beer with a offwhite head. Hoppy fruity aroma. Hoppy a bit floral and caramel flavour.

355ml bottle, hazy golden pour with a bit of orange, small white head. Aroma bready malt, light caramel, grassy, citrus hop, very hoppy for a pilsner with a long dry bittter finish. light body, thin feel, fizzy carbonation. Good pilsner.

Pours a crystal clear light yellow with a good white head that fades to a film and leaves good lacing. Light aroma of sweet grains and zesty herbal hops. Taste of light cracker malt and mild herbal and citrus hops that provide a light bitterness. Finishes dry with just a nice faint hint of bitterness. Mouthfeel is crisp with a light/medium body and moderate carbonation. Very drinkable, refreshing and enjoyable. Very well made pilsner with a nice level of flavor.
From bottle... Clear yellow with white head, medium bitterness. Grapefruit hops taste that does not hit you over the head, followed by nice dry finish. This is a great beer for a hot day.
Really nice pils. Good light grain character with light fruit and floral hops. Excellent balance, nothing tuned up too much, very refreshing and drinkable.

Bottle. Clear pale yellow with large foamy white head, slight doughy aroma, high carbonation, crisp hoppy taste with grassy malt in the background, long finish with hops aftertaste. Quite a hoppy pilsner.
Bottle at Brewers Beer Bar, Göteborg. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy fruity aroma, grass, bready, hay, citrus notes. Hoppy caramel flavor, citrus, hay, floral, a bit artificial.

Pale golden color. Aroma is light hops and malt. Flavor is easy drinking hops. Some maltiness to it for balance. Sweet in the middle with a hoppy aftertaste. hoppier pils. Which I prefer. Very easy drinking.

(Bottle) Pours light hazy golden with a white head. The aroma holds a tight cracker-ish malt profile with some doughy undertones (mostly yeast but also some malty undertones). Woodsy, herbal, grassy,hay-like and light floral hop notes. A touch of old grapefruit.I love this brew but the sulfur hints is a slight let down. Quite mineral-driven and a tad to low on the PH-scale.The flavour is dry, medium bitter and light acidic with notes of nobel hops, Tight malt, clean grassy hops and a nice water profile.no fermentation-problems flavour wise.The mouthfeel is tight, mineral-ish, clean and medium carbonated. A tasty brew with some small adjustment potentials.

Look: pours a bright gold. White head. Very clear.
Smell: European hops. Yeast. Slight pine.
Taste: slight bitterness. 
Feel: medium carbonation. Very slight film in the mouth, but doesn't have the same dry taste. 
Overall: ok beer. Good cross between a pilsner and an IPA. Would like to see more west coast flavor but not bad.
First drank: home 9/3/14
Served: from a 12 oz. bottle

12 oz. bottle from Supermarket Liquors. Appearance: 3 fingers white head, straw yellow color, clear, head does not last too long. Aroma: fruity, wheat, earth leaves and yeast, floral. Palate: light body, average carbonation, light bitter finish, thin texture, crisp. Taste: Light fruity sweetness into a medium bitterness that lasts for a couple of seconds. Overall, very unique for style, drinkable and refreshing, and maybe a new favorite for the style.
12 oz bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a creamy head. Not a huge amount on the nose, but full of complex, fruity flavours with good Hoppy bitterness. Very nice lager
Pale yellow beer with a bitter fruit aroma. Taste is light and bitter with a touch of citrus coming through. Palate is slightly watery and it is slightly bland but its very drinkable.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small capped white head. Crisp grassy aroma with grainy pilsner malt and a touch of honey sweetness. Taste is crisp and clean with grassy, floral, and spicy hops and a moderate bitterness that is coupled with the pilsner graininess and a touch of honey sweetness and some light breadiness. Crisp mouthfeel with balanced carbonation and light to medium body. Very dry finish.
Earlier Rating: 1/7/2009 Total Score: 3.412oz bottle.  Poured a pale yellow in color with a fluffy white head and nice lacing.Smell is fresh malt and flowery hops.  Taste is a light sweet malt up front then the floral hops with some bitterness and a great dry finish.

Bottle @ BBB. Pours tiny hazy golden with a frothy white head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is subtle, tiny malty and floral with biscuits, dried flowers, hay, lemon peal and hints of sweet corn. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter and floral with biscuits, bread, hay, lemon zest and hints of soil and lemon balm. Mouthfeel is crisp, dry, astringent and light bodied. Finish is bitter, tiny malty and floral with bread, buttered biscuits, grass, lemon balm, soil and lemon zest. Tasty hoppy pilsener!
Great beer! Crisp dry refreshing. Floral hop aromas with subtle citrus bitter. Great with food.
Standard medium bitter pilsner. Relatively low on both aromas and flavors and not perfectly crisp. Good but nowhere near its reputation.

Bottle, 2 months old. Pours a very clear straw with some life. Cereal grains and Euro hops on the nose. Taste is clean, crisp, bitter and dry. My first favorite Pils from way back and still a go-to summer beer for me.
Bottle. Clear pale yellow with a bright white head. Aromas of straw, citrus, orange zest, and bread. Flavor is straw, bread, and light citrus. Light bodied, crisp with a dry, bitter end.
bottle oro schiuma media media persistenza lieve mieloso erbaceo untocco resinoso discrta secchezza buon amaro
Clear, bubbly, gold with white fizzy head. Malty and floral hops aroma. Great refreshing taste with a nice hops presence and a touch of citrus.

Transfer from BA review on 10-6-12- 
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance  Pours a golden colored brew with huge white head. The head has great retention, eventually fading to give a lighter level of lacing.

 Smell  The smell is a mix of a grainy and a light grapefruit citrus. Beyond that there is a small amount of a pine hop smell.

 Taste  The taste starts out of a malty grain flavor with some light sweetness. As the taste advances, some lemon and a grapefruit hop flavor come to the tongue. These two tastes (grapefruit and lemon) intensify as the taste moves on, although they never get too strong. In the end the hop, combined with the wheat and a newly arriving bitter earthy and grassy hop flavor, create a dry, bitter, wheat flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer was on light to medium side with a carbonation level that was on the average side. Both were quite nice as they suited the dry flavors and transitions well as well as made for a very drinkable brew.

 Overall  A nice refreshing, bitter beer.
From the tap poured a clear golden brew with a thin white head. Delicately balanced aromas ad flavors of malt. Very tasty.

Served on tap. Clear pale gold with a frothy white head which yields to copious lacing. Herbal hops dominate the aroma. Taste is made up of slight sweet orange with a dry hoppy finish. Feel is smooth and slightly astringent. Good.

355 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow with an average, frothy, long lasting, white head that laces. Mild aroma of hops, citrus and hay. Mild, sweet flavour of citrus, hay and a dry, hoppy, bitter finish. Medium body with oily texture and soft carbonation. Pretty good for a pilsner.

Color: light yellow, straw. Appearance: modest, rapidly disappearing head, excellent lacing. Aroma: overwhelming herbal, grassy, floral. Flavor: Very dry, hops/herbal, bitter, astringent. Texture: light bodied. Finish: long, lingering bitterness, extremely dry.
From bottle to mug unfortunately. Nice sweet lightly hoppy aroma. Slightly hazy with fluffy white head. Really nice focus in the hops just sweet enough to balance. Nice beer.

A well carbonated golden yellow pilsner that pours with a giant white head that fades quickly.
A big hop aroma spicy and floral sits atop a nice understated malt bill.
Brace yourself for this one. Big hop flavor flavor from the start with this one.
Finishes clean and dry, refreshing.
To me it seems as it warms up the flavor seems to flatten out and gets watery.
A big bold beer none the less.
Drink well my friends
One of the best pils on the planet the beer that introducted me to the craft beer movement

Draught & bottle hand over fist, left & right. Currently, drinking pre Randalls island Phish ferry. Pours a clear gold with small white head. Aroma is hay, grains, faint lemon drop. Flavor is crisp clear pale malt with some floral hop. Light body & refreshing taste, drinkable & quaffable! Crispy & dry hop finish. Great Pils

This yellow beer has a white undertone. It has a hop and spice aroma. It has as a full rich spicy flavor with subtle hints of lemon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

aroma was very pleasant yeast and hay smell, with a touch of citrus and a very slight hint of pine. Color was a rust/yellow with a very creamy head. a light bitter taste with a light hope taste. Mouthful was light. after taste had a hint of pine and a dry finish that makes you want more. Great Beer and would recommend this product to a new beer person to get them started in loving beer.

From a bottle. Pours a golden straw color with a rocky head. Nice lacing and good cling. Good hop aroma. Cut grass, a bit of pine. The flavor is crisp with a whisper of upfront sweetness and then a beautiful burst of Hallertau hops. Just a bit of bitter citrus with slight piney notes in the finish. Otherwise, its a crisp, dry, hoppy pilsner. Fantastic!
From a bottle. Cloudy amber, with a tight white head that laces well, fresh aroma and great citrus flavours. I liked it a lot.

Slightly hazy yellow with a snowy white head that lasts as long as the glass does. The aroma is pleasant, nothing too special but no faults. Mostly malty crackers and yeast. The flavor though is amazing, herbal hops perfectly balanced with the biscuit malts. Smooth and moderately thick mouthfeel. This is seriously good stuff, nice to see some Continental hops put front and center.

The body has a bright golden yellow color with plenty of sparkling carbonation and great clarity. The head is a wonderful thick and creamy topping with good retention. It also makes great lace rings on the glass as I drink. The aroma hits you in the nose with spicy floral and grassy hops over pale malt. Its flavor is a crisp clean mix of its aroma. Hop flavor steals the show with bold spicy floral and grassy botanical notes. Underneath there is a pale crisp malt base that finishes dry with some nice clean hop bitterness. The palate is light to medium bodied with an easy drinking light wet texture. Carbonation is very active and helps to clean the palate.

This is one of those beers that you could compare to an ice cold lemonade not in the sense of taste, but in the sense that it is one of those beers that you would find so refreshing when you got home from a hard days work or something like that. This beer tastes absolutely amazing. It is one of the most refreshing things you will ever drink. One of the things that I dont really like about it though is that the crown disappears fast. Other than that if you are an American looking for a domestic beer that you can honestly say that you are proud to drink, I suggest picking this up for a try.
12oz bottle into fluted glass - nose is lemon drop. Sip adds grass. Very crisp and refreshing. Really digging the hops in pilsners.

Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.

On draft. Possibly the best pilsener made in America. Big hops, big burst up front, then just kind of dissolves into a clean, dry finish. Flavors include lemon, white toast and the suggestion of pine resin. Could drink this every minute of summer.

Just another pilsner :( I really love this brewery and wanted something a little bit different from this beer. Not sure if it is just me not liking this particular beer or me not being a fan of pilsners? Anyway, tried it now and will stay away from it in the future, as well as, the rest of the pilsners out there!!

Pours a clear yellow. Nose is a touch floral - not the malt smell of a typical pils. Same is true for taste - some citrus and a touch of bitterness. This reminded me of a "light" IPA as opposed to a pils - but that works for me. Easy to drink, good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour. Clear golden with good white head. Hoppy aroma with floral and slight honey aroma. Light body with a smooth taste. Starts with floral taste but ends with a slight bitter aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap or off one of the best, lawnmower hops, just the ideal, pils pretty perfect per the hops department, all day every day.
Clear, pale golden with small white head. Pure malt aroma and taste, hops kick in at the finish, providing nice bite. Pure and simple pilsner.

On tap from Barn. Clean yellow with a finger of head. Cut grass with some floral hops on nose. Distant pine notes. Taste follows. Very crisp. Dry finish. Active carbonation. Complex, yet faithful to style. Really enjoyed.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Golden, fizzy toffee, violets on nose, very sweet, fizzy, floral, again violets, dry toffee, bitter.
Cloudy yellow pour from bottle. Moderate lacing, white. Spicy, tangy hops. Light malt, a bit biscuity. True to the style.

Pours gold with a white head. White toast, honey, floral aroma. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Honey, lemon, white toast, grass, light herbiness, light wood on the slightly bitter finish. Well balanced and very quaffable. Nice.

Aroma: very hoppy, floral, resin, spruce. Appearance: clear pale gold, medium frothy white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets go to background, hoppy bitters coming up, getting a bit dry, average-long finish, floral hops, spruce and resin again. Overall: excellent Pilsener, fantastically complex in aroma and palate for this style. Bottle from BottleDog Kings Cross, Holborn.
Bottle bier huis ossett. Yellow no head. Aroma is pale malts. Taste is pale malts strong hoppy finish. A bit too fizzy for me.

355ml Bottle from the Brewdog online shop (£2.80):
Fresh with a great blend of citrus and grassy hops & light pilsner malts. Theres a hint of sweetness& floral notes and overall the beer is light and refreshing without coming across as weak or bland.

A clear, light golden color with a 1cm foamy white head that holds as a nice surface lacing with a little extra left on the sides.

Grassy hops & citrus initially, alongside some spice & refreshing lemon flavors. A light malt base & hints of sweetness followed by a subtly bitter finish.

Smooth & light bodied with good carbonation with a light bitterness. There is a good balance throughout & the beer was incredibly easy to drink as a pilsner should be.

A great pilsner & definitely up there with some of the best of the style I have tried, in fact it could very possible be the best of the style I have tried. Dont pass up trying this one if you get the chance.
Bottle. A nice hoppy pils. Pours yellow with small white head. Nose is grains and citrus. Taste is clean with some nice hops.

Draft at Belmont Station. Clear straw color, small head, some lace. Under carbonated for style. Smells of bread and malt, lacks aroma hops. Light, sweet, crisp malt with understated bitterness in the middle, finishes dry and bitter but not lingering. Lacks aroma but very quaffable.

Typical light to deep gold pilsner color. Plenty of carbonation which I like from a pilsner. Typical pilsner aroma of grass/bread/biscuit whatever... Taste is wonderful. It has a very distinct hoppiness you dont find in other pilsners. Palate is wonderfully crisp. Great pilsner

Aroma is a mix of floral and bubble gum. Drank right from the bottle at nyc airport. Good hop profile with nice carbonation and mouth feel. Has that pleasant bubble gum flavor mid sip. Maybe from the yeast?

bottle at home from brewdog online
grassy nettley herbal noble hop character withsome orange blossom notes. medium body, good bready malt and grassy notes well balanced by spicey floral hops...saaz showing off its prowess here and goes down all too smoothly.
Light, sweet, bready, with some spicy, piney hop flavors and a slight bubblegum yeast flavor.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma CA. Pours a clear golden color with a bit of frothy head. Full of malty flavor and good balance of hops.
Had on tap at Barley Johns. A really nice looking pilsner in the glass with great clarity and thick head. Big hop aromas and flavors make this one of my favorite pilsners.

Poured golden and clear with a nice head. Aroma is nutty and citrusy. Spicey hops dominate the clean malty flavor with a pleasantly bitter aftertaste. Pilsner is not one of my favorite styles but I rather enjoyed this one. Go Pens!
355ml bottle from Brewdog Online Shop. Pours clear straw gold, thick white head. Aromas of corn, spicy grassy hops. Taste has light sweetness, big bitterness for the style. bitter finish. Not bad.

Probably my go to pilsner. Bottle. Gold. Lemon, grains, toast, a touch of honey. Extremely drinkable, light, medium carb - (done from memory because the rate I posted last night didnt save for some reason)
12 oz. bottle in a pilsner glass. Appearance is straw color with a golden hue and moderate white head. Aroma is grass, lemon, and bright noble hops. Taste follows the nose. A pretty solid pils.

12oz bottle poured into a pilsener glass. While the head is abundant, a bready, biscuity, toast aroma emanates. The toast aroma lingers as a very light caramel and citrus poke through. A noticeable pineapple / tropical fruit note comes through after awhile with a touch of pepper. The beer is a beautiful, clear, effervescent, sparkling straw gold color with a white, gelatin-like head consisting of small and micro bubbles. The head retains well with a nice puffy, creamy coverage atop the beer, and it leaves an ample, messy webbing lace. Its a prominently bitter beer, medium / medium-high levels, with a light sweetness to support it. The medium-full body has an active, yet soft carbonation in above-average quantity. Its a light, grainy texture that dry, crisp, and refreshing. The mouthfeel is primarily toasty and peppery which carries to the finish. The aftertaste is grain husk with a strong, bitter grapefruit membrane. After awhile a burnt toast and pineapple show up in the lingering aftertaste.
Its golden yellow. Great hops. Smells sweet and grain. Barley and strong bitterness taste.
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 Picked this up as part of a build your own 6 pack. Been looking to try this brewer after reading an article about how they work with veterans.  For the style, this is very good.

355ml bottle. A pilsner interpreted through American craft style. Strong noble hop flavour. Some pretty good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very refreshing! Light floral hops, citrus, grains and light caramel. A bit herbal and lemony in the finish. Really good example of how far you can push the style.
Decent smooth taste, slight hops on finish, slightly sweet and malty, very good balance!
I love the caramel and Saaz aroma of this beer. The body is very full without being heavy. Great finish with lots of lingering bready flavor .

A good dose of flowery hops with a hint of citrus. Light grainy aroma. No Esters, DMS, or sulfur. Appearance is a brilliant straw color with a white head with average head retention. Malt flavor is grainy with some pils sweetness through the middle, but finishes dry. Hop flavor is the showcase in this beer providing hints of flower and spice with a bitterness that lingers through and after the finish. Beer is fermented clean with no fruity esters. Mouthfeel is medium-light with medium carbonation that leaves a drying resin sensation on the mouth on the end. Overall, a great American version of a German pilsner.

Pours clear golden with small white head out of bottle. Aroma of apple juice, pine, grass, honey, and some hops. Great flavor of bread, oats, grass, and hint of hops. Good beer for a pilsner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great saaz hops and barley taste here. Definitely a great entry for the style. Pours blonde with some orange hue. Finishes with some crisp barley aroma, light bitterness. Tap at Churchkey.

Bottle. Pours a clear cidery gold with faint white head. Aroma is lovely: grass, meadow, honey, apple juice, oats, grain. Taste is orange rind, breakfast roll, grain, grassy hops, lightly soapy and resinous hop finish. Still my go-to pils. So good.
Weed aint like it was in the sixties, neither is pilsner. This is super dank yet true to style. Everything prima yet everything pils.
Say, why does this pilsener have a big ol picture of a hop flower on the label? *sip* Oh!

Bottle. Yellow with thin white head. Aroma of flora hops, grains, light citrus, and a hint of sweetness. Light body with strong hop bitterness upfront and grains notes with a bitter finish. More hops bitterness than I was expecting but nice.

Aroma: Slight hoppiness, slightly sweet and grainy. No sulfur, no fruit. Very low Diacetyl. No DMS. 8/12
Appearance: Pale gold, brilliant, frothy white head. 3/3
Flavor:slight malty grain sweetness under a lot of hop spiciness. Very Slight DMS. 15/20
Mouthfeel: Slightly creamy, bitterness throughout, medium high carb- 4/5
Overall: Carbonation plus hoppiness makes this very crisp and refreshing. 8/10
Total 38/50
From comments I expected this beer to be much better than it was, turned out to be very bitter with a bit of a garden hose smell, occasional hints of crisp malts and band aids.
Bottle from the grocery store. Pours a super bright transparent gold with thick cream colored head. Aroma of malt with a slight fruit hint. Taste of malt with pretty heavy carbonation.

Poured from a bottle. Clear golden color, medium white head. Mild his fragrance with a malt character. Light crisp flavor with a nice drinkability and clean finish.

Grassy, hoppy pilsner flavor, bitter aftertaste. Very good pilsner from Victory.

Pours a slightly cloudy pale yellow color, nice thick white head. Nose is lemon, pineapple, biscuit. Very drinkable, sweet biscuit flavor to start, with some sweet tropical flavors, with a slight crisp finish.This is very enjoyable beer, somewhat true to style and damn delicious.
This is about halfway to an ipa. Aroma, taste, and mouthfeel are very good here. Definitely could recommend this as an entry level ipa.
Draft pour. Very light pour with cloudy head. Not much of a pilsner fan but I have had worse. Strong aroma. Light flavor with a bitter finish. Not bad, but not really for me

12 oz bottle poured to glass. Very light yellow with a big white head with mostly big bubbles. The appearance is deceiving be aide the smell is strong hops, astringent, artichokes. The flavor brings more of the same with little malt flavor that tastes like pasta. The hops keep evolving though. It's gotta have the IBUs of an IPA but it works on this light beer.
