How: Bottle.
Where: Taylor & Jones with the Twist, Stockholm.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, grass, hops, citrus.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, hops, floral, grass.
Cant say enough about this beer. New to trying new beers. So far this is by far one of my favorites that I have tried in my young beer rating career.

12oz bottle. Enjoy by date on neck in fine print. This bottle is 3 weeks past the date. Great head retention for a Pilsner. Has powerful hop aroma. It pours clean and golden, and well carbonated, with a decent white head. It smells of traditional pale malt and some floral notes added, with an abundance of hops. It goes down easily, with the hops expressing themselves early, and the light smooth Pils malts dominating on the back-end. A great Pilsner, especially from an IPA lover.

Bottle 12oz.
Pours clear blond with low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of pils malt, honey, citrus. Taste is of bitterness, malt, citrus, pinot noir, flowers, perfume. Palate: Light-medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Good, tasty. Nice hop features.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, getreidig, fruchtig. Geschmack hopfig, grasig, lang anhaltende fruchtig Bitterkeit.
Bottle in the Canalhouse, Nottingham. Hazy golden with a small white head. Bitter an d hoppy. Very decent for the style. Citrus and pine notes in there.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 I have never tasted a Pilsener like this one. Very bitter for the style of beer, its more like an IPA really. I usually avoid Pilsner beers as much as possible but this one I would actually buy and enjoy!!

On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford.
Appearance: The body is clear and sparkling with a golden hue. The head is short and firm with a soft appearance and great retention. The head is light tan.
Aroma: The aroma is hop forward, sort of yellow gummy bear reminiscent with a slight harsh perfume edge to it. The malts are soft and out of the way, just a hint of sweetness.
Taste: This skews bitter and floral with a slightly sweet malt intro that gives way to the firm bitterness. The back end is dry and floral, lingering floral for a bit.
Palate: Full-bodied with soft to moderate carbonation.
Overall: This is a good pilsener, but Im still not fully in love with the style. I also find there to be a slight harshness on the aroma I dont enjoy very much. Overall this is a finely crafted pilsener though.

Flowery, herbal, citrusy aroma. Reminds me of tarragon or cardamom. Chamomile, also? Hard to pin down. Very unique. Dry taste but not astringent. Not a huge fan of pilsners, but this I could drink anytime.
Reminds me of American Dream with a slightly more refined hop-touch. Well worth the try.
Bottle from Beer Emporium bottle shop, Bristol. Light gold colour with a small white head. Aroma of grain with some fruitiness. Hoppy. Bitter and slightly dry finish. Enjoyable.
Draft. Pale yellow color. Tastes like a pilsner with something wrong with it. In a good way.

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh). 

Pours a very clear light amber with a bit of head. It's a beer. Bettr'n Bud, but pilsners seem to just not do it for me anymore.

January 29, 2014. 330mL bottle at beerbistro. Soapy pine aroma. Pale head didnt last long. More balanced than expected based on the aroma, not over the top with hops.
On draft. Golden straw color. Good carbonation. A slight hint of citrus. Dry aftertaste. Easy drinking. Lovely Pils.

Looks like a pilsner. On the bitter side, grassy, a citrus note, good earthy pils, on the bitter side. Refreshing.

Bottle from StarmoreBoss, Sheffield. Lightly hazy straw colour. Minimal, white head. Dry, grainy, light lemon. A fleeting, sherbet sweetness quickly gives way to the grainy dryness. Hoppy bitterness surprises. Crisp palate. Very refreshing. Very nice.

Light and too bitter for my taste. But it is true to style. Clear and great mouth feel.

Pours a cloudy light copper. Aroma is fruity and hoppy. Flavor is dominated by hops. Quite bitter for a pilsner in my opinion. Good, but not what I expected from the style.

12oz bottle poured into pilsner glass. Beer is clear, bright golden yellow with a white two-finger head that drops down some, but hangs on for the duration. Sticky lacing clings in patches to the glass. Aroma is more assertive than typical pilsners with herbal and citrus hop notes underpinned by bready malt. Taste follows the nose - strong spicy, herbal bitterness with light bread and grainy malt sweetness. Surprisingly medium in body, light and crisp texture, lively carbonation, long bitter finish.

Golden with a white head - Nice malty aroma with some hops as well - Good mlat body and a Nice hop flavour that gives a nice bitterness - Good hop bitter finish that is olmost dry - this was good and refreshing
Notes from 2009 -- light yellow in color, small head with good retention. Strong hop arona with sweet scent. Clean, crisp flavor, slightly sweet. Good beer, would like another.

355ml bottle. Golden shade and slightly hazy. Citrussy, soapy, tropical hop aroma. Pretty similar taste. Could be an IPA if not for the lager crispness. Medium body. Nice, clean, refined, but not a showstopper, just a great drinkable pils.

Bottle into footed pilsener. Translucent, pale orange color. Bready malt aroma, grassy hops, hint of floral. Taste is light spice, good hops flavor, bitter finish. Palate is fizzy, but refreshingly so. Very drinkable beer.,

On the fly from notes from last night.

A: Yellow with hazy clarity. Butter colored quilt of foam atop which grasps for the edges well. Spotty lacing.

S: Floral: jasmine, hibiscus and hints of grain. Nice. 

T: Buttery grains and hints of noble hops. Great bitterness on the mid-palate.

M: A little thick for the style IMO. Moderate carb. Barely slick in the finish.

O: Above average, but the mouthfeel and tastes dont up to the level of greatness I expect in a pils.

Serving type: on-tap

06-09-2011
Crisp pour on tattoo Im Gainesville Florida. Prim yellow gold tint with a thin head. Not getting much nose. so hoppy for a pils. Tastes more like a light crisp ipa.
Pours straw colored in glass. Aromas of malt and citrus. Taste follows nose. Full body nice carbonation. A bit to hoppy for my liking.

On tap at Spring Street Bar in downtown LA on Dec. 10th. First time for this legendary brew, but have to say it was not too impressive. Based on other beers tasted at same respected bar, it was not the establishment. Decent, but would I buy again? Probably not.

I got this at Binnys. Pours gold with a white head. Taste floral, citrus, bitter. I thought this was so so. I could drink this again.

hay, cereal, citrus, grass, leaves, skunky, pale, golden, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, fizzy, bitter,

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. For a filtered beer this certainly has an unfiltered pale yellow color to it with a white fizzy head that fades fast. The aroma is grainy and bready malts, citrus, and clean hop note. The body is in the medium range with a decent smooth texture. The taste has an upfront grainy, husky flavor with a lingering citrusy bitterness at the finish.
Pint at Alehouse in SAMO. Incredibly crisp, clean, and grassy. Floral notes. Light, golden color. Next to no head. Yeasty aftertaste, in a pleasant way. One of my favorite Pils.

Call it a pilsener if you like, but this is far more a pale ale bordering on an IPA. Its totally overrun with hops right out of the bottle with oranges and spruce trees dominating the nose. If there are malts anywhere in this concoction, they fail miserably at fending off waves of bitter dryness. Its a nice little beverage, but doesnt strike these tastebuds as a pilsener.
Draft at the Monkey Paw. Golden pour. White head. Dank musty flavor. Apricot and raisin notes. Not my favorite but also don't go for pilsners too often
Draft. Pours bright clear copper gold with a thin white head. Tastes malty and musky, like grains, slightly nutty, and light citrus. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like grains and malt.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Tap at little havana. Pours extremely clear gold with fizzy white head. Aroma is biscuit and cereal malts, light floral notes, lemon zest, and light oranges. Flavor is dry malt base, light citrus esters, and subtle hop bitterness; dry finish. Light/medium body and low carbonation.

Pretty solid beer, pours a nice golden color with a white head that remains and provides a bit of lacing. Smells is a bit floral with a small amount of malt. Taste begins a bit sweet and follows with floral hops with a bit a a bitter finish. Very refreshing

The aroma is flowery balanced with Pils malt graininess. A foamy white head rests atop a clear light-golden pour. Moderate lacing. The taste is floral up front giving way to a nice grainy finish with a pleasing bitter aftertaste. Medium-light body and medium carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel. Overall, this is a very well crafted Pilsner. Tasty, easy to drink, and very refreshing.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Bottle: nice golden sunshine body with a moderate chill-haze throughout; foamy, bone-white head tops things off, leaving a nice, dense sheet of lace as it recedes. Aroma is quite hoppy, even more so than youd expect from a pilsener. grass, dirt, earth, flowers, some herbs, a touch of dankness, & a decent mount of lemon & citrus zest. Slight must in the finish with a light spicy, pepper-like edge... probably from the Saaz. I wouldnt expect this much fruit from Saaz & Northern Brewer, but its there. Taste has heavy hops up front grass, flowers, light white pepper, grapefruit peels, orange zest, & a slight bite of pine & must in the finish. Nice breaded, cracker-y malt backbone, but its mostly covered by the hop assault. Nice beer, overall, though not exactly what I expect from a pilsener.
Little head, good lacing. Light amber color. Tasted like biting into an orange peel, which lingers. Better once paired with bacon and Mac-n-cheese.

Yeah okay, straw colored with a white head, looks like a typical light lager. The aroma is floral, grainy, pepper, cloves. Taste is a little hoppier than I expected, mostly earthy and floral flavors, some pepper and a slight trace of sulfur in the background. This is super easy drinking as expected. I dont normally drink this style. I havent had a pilsener in a very long time and was in the mood to change it up. Based on reviews and my fondness of Victorys other offerings I went with it and meanwhile it is certainly better than most or any pilseners than I can recall, the fact of the matter is that its still not my style. This however, would be a great transitional beer into the craft world for many though.
Bottle. Hoppiest pils Ive ever had. Like an IPA. Cloudy gold. Medium head. Taste is a hoppy flavor. Aroma is a hoppy smell.

Bottle poured into pint glass. Looks like any other lager. Pale straw, white head. Aroma is hay-like, very slight almost pepper notes. Taste is like sweet cereal, then the hop bitterness come thundering in. Very dry. Feels unbalanced. Its like a not-quite-right experimental. I was expecting more.

12oz bottle from Brewmasters in Wilson. Golden hue with normal clarity, fizzy initial head with mostly lasting off-white head, virtually no lacing. Light citrus hop on the nose. Moderate citrus hop on the initial taste, light average citrus hoppy finish. Lively carbonation on the palate.
Being a Philly guy I am typically partial to local beers and this is no exception. I love this brew. Super easy to drink. Had it on tap at Dandelion for $2 per pint. Best deal in town.
330ml bottle @ home. Ordered from Ales By Mail. Im not a friend of pilsner, but this is ok. Good hops.

Bottle. Pale gold, minimal white head, some lacing. Aroma: cereal, toasted, biscuit, sulphur. Taste: grass, lightly sweet, medium bitterness at end, short crisp dry bitter finish. Light body, average carbonation. Overall: Hoppy, Bitter pils to swallow.
Pours clear yellow, Aroma is mild skunk, floral, with some butterscotch. Flavor is hoppy, bitter, floral, orange, lemon, and grass. Mouth is dry and grainy with a bitter finish.
Bottle. Nice floral hoppy pilsner. Crisp and refreshing. Very drinkable and enjoyable.

Draught @ Fire Works, Arlington, VA. Pours clear golden with unstable white head. Clear aroma of yeats and hops. Bitter, hoppy flavour with estery and malty notes. A rather bitter aftertaste. A good pilsener from the Doua Neveg. You are never in doubt, however, that you left Europe long ago.

Keg @ Sedona. The pours gold with a small head. The nose is somewhat buttery. Light honeyed grain. Scones. The taste is cantaloupe. Light pissy citrus. More popcorn. Clean, dry finish. Light body, moderate carbonation.
Great natural pils. The aroma is sweet and light. The palate is persistent. You can really taste the hops on this one. Clean.

Love this offering from Victory. Hoppier than the average Pilsner for sure, but still refreshing. The hop presence is floral and absent of much bitterness at all. Incredible beer to drink on a warm day.
12 oz bottle from Bergen Park Liquors. Gold and clear with a white head. Pilsener malts, bitter spicy hops and light grains. Clean and crisp with a light to medium body and a dry finish.

From notes: Poured hazy straw color, with a 1-finger white head. Light lemony aroma with some grass mixed in, pretty much like the stereotypical pilsner. Light body, with a dry finish. Flavor is earthy up front, giving way to lemony citrus and some yeast at the back. Not really a pilsner fan, but pretty good.
Bottle. Pale straw color with little head. Aroma is citrus and hops. Taste matches the aroma. Considerable lingering bitterness on this one.

5.5% from Sugaya. A clear very pale gold with a thick foamy head. My wife is enjoying it & downing it fast... A clean hop aroma, I am getting a real Saaz vibe from it. The flavor is grassy but bitter, very dry. Kind of one dimensional compared to other top pilsners I have had but still quite good. A nice body, smooth, biscuit, grass, hay then bitter hops. Nice stuff.
Pours a clear light gold. Has a strong corn and cheese aroma. Taste is simiale to any pilsner but with some wheat and cheese flavor. Interesting beer...

Aromas of wheat and bread with a little celery and cheese. A large fizzy white head that lasts. Clear yellow. Medium body with thin texture. The finish is slightly metallic and bitter. A nice refreshing beer when you want something light.

Best by October 9th 2013... since thats five months away, my assumption is that this beer is probably very fresh.

Appearance: It looks like any other pilsener would -- a crystal clear yellow color. As many would affectionately refer to it as, it looks like piss. Not much lacing small white ring on top. Looks pretty ordinary.

Smell: A lot of hay, and also grain. As theres a big hop on the logo of this beer, I was expecting a pretty nice hop presence, and there *is* one. Its not so big that it morphs this into some sort of pilsener/IPA hybrid, but its more than welcome -- especially in the taste.

Taste: Yeah, probably the best pilsener Ive had. It has that typical flavor youd expect from a pilsener, but the hops lift it up a little bit. This is the most bitter beer Ive had from the style, but its not extreme, which I wouldnt expect. The amount of hops here compliment everything nicely. This is definitely a pilsener for hopheads. The mouthfeel is relatively thin, but has a nice body, given the style. A very good choice for a summer beer.

Not a *super* interesting beer, but its above average for a pilsener. Im not nearly as high on this beer as the majority of reviewers, but its still well worth trying out.

Appearance: Pours clear yellow then sits medium gold.
Smell: Bready with a hint of citrus
Taste: Has a considerable malt taste with a hoppy citrusy finish.
Mouthfeel: Crisp and with a great hop presence
Overall: A very refreshing take on a pilsner. Highly recommend trying.

Bottle. Medium yellow with average sized foamy white head. Fresh cut grass, grain, and light herbal bitterness. Light in flavor with just the slightest bitterness to finish. Smooth drinking, just heavier than water with very fine carbonation.

Pours a golden straw with a disappearing white head. Grassy aroma. Taste is grassy and bready upfront with a surprising hop strong finish. Bitter bitter bitter. Too bitta. Some floral notes. More depth than Urquell. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pale golden color, lightly carbonated. Honey floral aroma. Slightly sweet. Earthy, spicy hops balance it out. Delicious!

Reviewed 9-2-10.

I recently posted a thread on BA asking people about their favorite "flagship" brews. This one came up a lot, and with good reason. Ive had this pilsener many times, but not in a while, and Ive never reviewed it:

Ap: Sunflower yellow/gold, with about a 1/2 inch head and moderate carbonation.

Ar: Victory hop profile and then some! This is just pure malty, yeasty, flowery goodness!

T: German hops are present, and the beer is mildly sweet, with a slight bitter hop finish. No unpleasant lingering - everything is great!

P: Smooth as silk; Very "clean" beer and nearly flawless in regards to mouthfeel related to style.

O: I think I drank this one in about 2 minutes!

Quite simply, the best pilsener on the market!

12oz bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy straw yellow color with 2 fingers of bubbly head. Aroma is grassy, lager yeast, and some light lemony citrus. Taste is earthy, grassy, bready, with nice piney hop bitterness.
Golden with thin white head; aroma sligty sweet and hoppy aroma;Flava is hops with woody notes; feels light but crisp not watery; finishes dry and bitter

12oz bottle picked up at Total Beverage 
Clear golden with a medium sized white head and some lacing. Aroma of malts, bready, grassy and spices. Flavors of doughy, grassy, salt, sweet and sticky 
OK, but not for me.

From: Binnys, Champaign, IL
Date: Best by 2013-06-24
Glass: Ayinger willi glass

Prima Pils is an enjoyable German-style pilsner with a solid continental hop presence in both bitterness and flavor, which still lets some of the German pilsner malts to peek through as well. Easily drinkable for those who enjoy a bit more hop presence in their pilsners, this is an easy-go to for any time of the year.

Pours a brilliantly white-colored head, composed of small-sized bubbles that are packed densely together, giving a very frothy appearance. Retention is slightly above average, lasting about 1.5 minutes, fading to a thin cap of lace atop the body of the beer. Lacing is fairly good, consisting of small patterns and webs clinging to about a third of the glass interior. The beers body is a hazy (25-40% opaque) golden-orange color, light changing the hue to a bright, though pale, golden-yellow color. Carbonation is visible rising from the depths of the glass, sparse in number, but fairly quick to rise.

Aroma of notable continental hops right away, lending modest lemon, herbal and floral qualities, while the pilsner malt is not discounted either: the graininess and malty sweetness readily detectable in the background (perhaps a bit easier here since the bottle is nearly a month after its best-by date).

Front of palate finds pleasantly grainy and fresh pilsner malt flavors with a bit of light caramelized sugar sweetness (from Maillard reactions during the boil?) and hints of floral and lemon-like hops. Mid-palate of notable continental hop bitterness with attendant flavors of light lemon citrus, floral hoppiness with a slightly woodsy and herbal presence, and an underlying presence of grainy, slightly hot cereal-like pilsner malt that also contributes enough counterbalancing sweetness to make this work. Back of palate finds continued strong, clean (sharp? clear?) continental hop bitterness with undertones of herbal and light lemon citrus hop flavors and grainy pilsner malt. Aftertaste is of substantial hop bitterness, with herbal and floral qualities not far behind, along with hints of citric tartness and residual, slightly caramelized sugar sweetness from the malts.

Beer is of medium weight, with low to medium-low levels of carbonation, leading to a beer that softly, gradually foams up on the palate, then quickly settles to a smooth and slightly placid existence as it moves across the tongue. Never watery, but a bit more carbonation would suit this beer nicely. Closes very dry, with light stickiness remaining on the palate.

On tap at Tustin Brewing. Grassy hop aroma from a clear yellow body with a small but fluffy white head. More grassy hops with a bitey catty edge to it. Good biscuit malt to balance, but the hops really dominate. This makes it not really to Pilsner style for me, but that doesnt mean its not tasty and just a variation on the style. Definitely has a good Pilsner lager taste in general though. Finishes bitter that lasts for a long time. Ive had this from a bottle before and on tap it seems more hoppy and slightly thinner. Either way its delicious.

Bottle from Habershams, Savannah. It pours light hazy pale golden yellow with a medium white head. The nose is earthy, hay, grass, sweet dough, brioche and spice. The taste is crisp, grassy, pine, hay, earth, spice and dough with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Ultra refreshing beverage on a hot day in South Carolina!
Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with white head. Nose and taste of lemon bread, lemongrass, spicy malt, big pine hops, lightly salted bread and dry hay. Medium body.

Part of the Victory Sample box. Poured from bottle into footed pilsner. Pale clear yellow pour with pillowy white head. Plenty of fizzy bubbles. Taste is light, crisp, just a bit of bitterness. Nice hop presence to make this so much more interesting and better than your macro pils.

The bottle says "heaps of hops hiding under a full, frothy head. I found the aroma light on hops and the head dissipated almost instantly. Full-bodied on the palate with a smooth, non-bittered finish. Not a great beer, just okay.

A very authentic lager, it taste very strong to the palate, with an excellent after taste. The hops are very predominant in the mouth. Reminds me of a sweet looking lady that turns to a strong attitude on bed.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep gold with a 2-finger fluffy white cap. Aroma is a hop punch reminiscent of a pale ale, with maybe a bit of yeastiness to it. Taste is crisp and clean and pretty standard for a pils, but much hoppier than average. Dry, spicy finish with almost a saison quality as it warms. This is a pretty good beer, especially if you have a second one handy!
Bottle. Clear yellow gold with exceptional frothy white cap and solid lacing. As everyone is stating, solid hop backbone. Crisp pils aroma and flavor. Nice spicy and hop bite. Very dry finish.
As with all Vistory, if you dont like hops this might not be for you.  Different take on a Pils, pours pale gold with big head, light to medium body and a big hop presents

Pale yellow appearance poured from a bottle with small head.  

Taste was good but not my favorite pilsner...the bitter finish of the hops was  too much for this type of beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good example of a classic pilsner, maybe slightly more hoppy, just not very interesting in any way.
On draft at Churchkey in DC.  Pours a clear gold with a thick white head.  Slight hint of mint in the nose.  Spicy hop flavors with a mild hop backbone.  Bitter finish.
Bottle from Elevated, golden yellow pour with a thin white head. Aroma of pale malt and some spicy hops, light earthiness. Taste is grassy and some spicy pine hops.
Bottle.  This is one of the great beers of late summer and early fall.  A perfect crisp pils with good hopping.

Hmm, quite disappointing.  It has a pleasant aroma and very pretty pour but the hops are just too dry and off putting for my taste.  The golden pour with a big white head is the best thing about this beer.  Just not my cup of tea!
Bottle poor, minimal head and decent lacing.  A very bitter pilsner that is crisp.  I would recommend it if you wanted to try a different style of pilsner.

Bottle thanks to charule. Pours a clear yellow color. Pale white head. Fruity pils aroma. Effervescent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Poured clear yellow. Light white head. Slight citrus aroma. Quite smooth mild hop taste. Good session.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Poured from a bottle into a pilsner glass. Clear bright gold with a hearty white head that has a decent amount of lacing. Aroma is really malty, nutty, and a bit of straw. Taste is malty sweet balanced out by a sharp hop bitterness that sticks around. Simple and to the point. Would pair great with some pretzels.

Bottle at Sybarite Pig. Tulip. Pours a dark yellow nearly gold with light haze. One finger white head. Smell of citrus, grass, and alfalfa. Taste is grass, citrus lemon, slight sour yeasts and bitter hops. Balance is decent tipping toward almost too bitter for the style. But good overall.

A - Pours a clear pale gold with a 1 finger white head. Minimal lacing, average retention.

S - Spicy noble hops, sulfur lager yeast, lemon bread.

T - Loads of crisp grassy hops, juicy orange peel, sweet and grainy pale malt, lemon, spicy grass comes through strong on the finish.

M - Medium body, moderate soft carbonation, clean and dry.

Aggressive hop profile, very clean flavors, an excellent Pilsener.

Serving type: bottle

05-29-2011
Good light hoppy aroma. Clear yellow pour with medium white head. Taste is a little more bitter than Id like for a pilsner. Good (light) mouthfeel for the style.
Bottle from Metropolitan Diner in North Wales, PA. Did not expect this beer to be as hoppy as it was, and now I regret overlooking it over and over again. Very drinkable.

Pale yellow with light carbination. White foam head. Flowery hop aroma with a bready malt aroma. Taste is well balanced with the flowery hops and malt. Crisp, bitter finish. A very good example of a German pils.

Faint scents of malt, pine cone and green car air freshener.  Appearance is lackluster.. weak urine color with hardly any carbonation.  Beer is quite hoppy, especially for a Pils.  Bitter, but a little flat.  Its not bad.

Victory Prima Pils has a thick, off-white head and a hazy, brilliant, yellow appearance (like a glow stick), with a bit of lacing and lots of bubble streams. The aroma is of sweet, lemony malt, some sweetness, and an off, wall paper glue scent. Taste is the same, with lots of bitterness and that unpleasant glue note. Im also picking up aspirin. Mouthfeel is medium, and Victory Prima Pils finishes mostly dry, citrusy, and off-kilter. Maybe I got some of a bad batch, but I can only say that it is acceptably good, and thats being generous. Well, one cant say its not interesting. RJT
From tap. WOW! This is easy the best pils I have ever had. Wonderful clear golden with a white head. Aroma was bread, fruity hops and grain. Taste was a mellow pils with a crisp finish.
Bottle pours a light golden-yellow with a medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma of fruity malt and sweet bread. Taste is crisp and hoppy on the finish. A bold pilsener.
Hoppy. Smells sour and of lemons. Light beer and light in color. Overall a light but hoppy beer.
Pours hazy golden with a nice white head and tons of lacing. The aroma is a complex mix between citrus and grain.

A very hoppy pilsner with a nice bitter bite.  Pours a light yellow and and has a nice aftertaste.  Victory beers are always really good 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 14, 2013 Bottle at a wedding, aroma is bready malts and light hops, taste is more bitter than I would expect, great pils

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a nice white head and tons of lacing. Aroma of grain, hops and some citrus fruit. Taste is bitterly, nice pilsner taste, super easy to drink and super enjoyable; great beer.
June 2010. From bottle. Poured clear golden yellow with a nice white head. More hoppy than your traditional pilsner - and nothing wrong with that.

Hops and grain aroma, and could tell it was a pilsner. Clear golden color with fizzy white head. This became cloudy when pouring near the end of the bottle. Very crisp and somewhat dry. Higher carbonation and light. Hops bitterness up front lingers for sometime. This works if youre having more than one of these but not if you follow with a less hoppy style. This could have been toned down some. Still, there were grassy pilsner malts in the background . Very easy to drink.
Belle apparence. Arome très décevante, un peu herbeux et de banane. Au gout, tout simplement magnifique; très belle équilibre entre le malt et une puissante amertume. Peut-etre ma meilleur pils.
Poured out of a bottle to a medium bodied head. Mild beer aroma with a strong Pilsner taste.

pours medium gold with a thick white head that settles nicely into a thick film.  aroma is light and floral...pleasantly hopped, mildly spicy.  first couple sips of this brew suggested a bit of skunk and a bit extreme on the bitterness, but after the palate adjusted and it got a moment to breathe, it drank nicely.  still very bitter, there is a good level of floral and citrus hops, hint of malt and corn...solid for the style.  palate is well above average for the style...good level of creaminess...lingering bitterness.  not my favorite style, but a fine rendition nonetheless.
i dont think that this beer really requires any kind of explanation...its just universally the best year-round Pilsener brewed in America.
UPDATED: APR 2, 2013 Really diggin this beer. Love the mix of hops and malt in the aroma and flavor. I will definitely be buying this again when it gets warmer out.

I agree with other reviewers, this is the Easts best pilsener. Delicate flavor, subtle hops in the finish, great mouthfeel. A beer like this is tough to pull off - theres nowhere for imperfections to hide. Mellower than West Coast offerings. A classic, clean pils that I honestly prefer over the imports I can get.
Excellent beer with a mild aroma. Smooth taste with a hint a lemon. Overall quality throughout.
Great pils, though not my favorite style. Mild malt and hops. Earthy and a little lemon. Nose and taste are balanced well.

Best US pils available on the easy coast. If you know of better let me know. Need a break now and again from all the hop thrashing I've been doing to my tongue with mostly IPAs and DIPAs!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle->SA.  Clear pale yellow woth loose frothy head.  Aroma: strong pilsener grass, yeast, hops.  Taste: pure pilsener, with citrus hops and malt.  Crisp.
Bottle at home. Pours a classic yellow with lively head. Bready aroma with assertive earthy hop flavors. Dry finish. Extra points for a well-brewed beer.

Love this beer. Probably my favorite pilsner. Deep flavor with a great finish, my only down is the smell is not real strong. On a fresh pour, CO2 rolls like a New England snowstorm and holds a nice firm foam head.
One of the best Pils-type beer Ive ever had. Really hoppy. Nice head for a pils. I recommend this!

Bouteille de 12 fl. oz. Bière dorée translucide avec une mousse blanche crémeuse. Le nez est de grains (orge malté) frais, de pain et des houblons nobles. La bouche est succulente, amère, piquante en fin de bouche. Trop facile. Bière dune qualité irréprochable.

pours clear bright golden with a nice white head,s ome retention/lacing. herbaceous and lemon notes, very nice crisp pils malts, fresh graininess, bread, hint of toasted notes, light vinous notes. very nice medium long citrusy-peppery finish, medium body - oily. classic, quenching and good on a nice sunny afternoon early spring saturday.

Une deuxième bouteille en autant de jour.  Une robe finement voilée et jaune.  Un mince anneau de mousse blanche.  Un nez hallucinant de malts pâles et de grains frais sur lesquels sétendent une horde de houblons vifs et bien parfumés par leur éclatante noblesse.  Sur les papilles, des fleurs, des herbes et du poivre qui répondent avec dynamisme aux paroles lancées par de bonnes céréales fraîches et outrageusement savoureuses.  En bouche, un liquide qui a du coffre avec son pétillement vivifiant et sa texture qui métonne par son caractère huileux.  En finale, des houblons amers et expressifs en notes poivrées et autres merveilles de la Tchéquie.  Définitivement fantastique.  Maintenant, trouvons un endroit où il est possible de boire ce diamant à la pompe.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2013 A pilsener to help you forget all the awful ones.. Pale golden. Medium white head, frothy, lots of lace. If only all pilseners smelled this good..a little citrus, straw, grass, clean fresh hops. Crisp and refreshing. Lighter side of medium bodied.  Alot of  bitterness and some drying in the pleasant finish but maybe a bit too long lasting...encouraging another sip to refresh. Very hoppy after some initial sweetness.
Pours very pale. This is a really solid beer, very refreshing and with a little bitterness, and more hoppy aroma than most pilseners.

This is my favorite pilsner. That being said this is best fresh and cold, as most pilsners probably are. Over hopped for the style but welcome by me. Delicious. Solid malt and hopped like a generous pale ale.
Bottle. Pours a piss yellow with little head. Almost skunky beer aroma. Taste is decently hopped and very drinkable. Fantastic pilsener.

Pours hazy yellow with substantial white head. Aroma is characteristic pilsner, with some lemon and yeast on top. Taste is very crisp, dry, with a surprising emphasis on a medium hoppy finish. Totally clean the whole way through and not too light. Nice!
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear golden yellow pour with thin white frothy head, clean fresh floral aroma, clean crisp refreshing taste with a hint of citrus very refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a light head. A lot of suspended residuals in the pour. Very floral bouquet with a dry finish. Overall very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful gold color with quickly subsiding white head. Noble hops evident in the nose - though not aggressive. Flavor is grassy, herbal with a lot of hop flavor and bitterness. This is no wimpy pils.

12 ounce bottle into pilsener glass, best before 3/1/2013.  Pours fairly crystal clear golden straw color with a nice 1-2 finger dense white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Nice soapy lacing clings down the glass, with some light streaming carbonation.  Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, floral, grass, cracker, pepper, light pine, and herbal earthiness.  Very nice aromas with a good balance of hops and fruity lager esters.  Taste of big lemon, orange zest, apple, pear, pepper, pine, floral, grass, cracker, bread, hop earthiness, and floral spiciness.  Good amount of earthy herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, light fruits, floral, pepper, grass, cracker, bread, hop earthiness, and floral spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Damn nice flavor balance with good complexity; with a very hoppy flavor profile; and nearly zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and sticky mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent Pilsner style.  Great hoppy flavor balance with good complexity; and extremely smooth and crisp to drink.  A very enjoyable offering as expected.
Pours a strawy golden and smells strongly off woods and grass. Has a voluminous white head. Bitter sweet taste that lasts and finishes dry and clean. Very good pilsner
Awesome smooth beer that goes down well GT hoppy drank with friends beautiful head yum

12 oz bottle pours a clear golden color with moderate but vanishing white head and good lacing.  Aroma is hoppier than expected, but still with the grains and yeast which define the style.  Nothing skunky here. Body is light to medium, with light carbonation.  Taste is initially sweet with a bitter but perfect finish. Very easily drinkable. Im not usually a fan of pilseners unless they come from Europe in big cheap bottles, but this one pleases me.

A very tasty brew.  Appearance is nice but not fantastic.  Aroma is pretty pleasant.  Great hoppiness in the taste, almost to bitter pale ale levels.  I have loved this beer for years, and Im happy to say I can now get it locally.  Worth the price, and always buy a sixer, not a single.
Definitely the best pilsner I have had. Very clean and crisp with a nice hoppiness.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Notes from a few weeks ago...Yellow, clear, nice head and laces the cup the whole way down spiced hop character, crisp and refreshing aftertaste that is balanced, mild lemon peel sweetness balanced with spiciness. Big fan of the saazhops and this beer
On tap - now this is a pilsner I can write home about.  Good clean palate with the perfect hops vs. malt balance.

It poured a clear medium golden with a small white head that lasted several seconds and then disappeared. It had just a touch of lacing. The smell is sweet with a slight earthiness to it. The taste is sweet and grainy. Some of the earthiness comes through on the sip. The finish is both sweet and earthy. There is a light to medium body with normal sharpness from a pilsener on the tongue. This is an easy drinking pilsener that is worth coming back to.
Gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doft av gräs och en del citrus. Lätt brödighet. Inte så stram som en tysk pils. En humleprofil som drar mer åt det amerikanska hållet med citruss och tallbarr.

Pours light straw yellow with almost no head and OK lacing.  Aroma is grassy with a little sourness, as expected in a lager.  Taste was grassy hops, clean and mildly bitter.  Goes down clean, very easy drinking, not much of an aftertaste.  A great choice if youre in the mood for a pale lager.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 A fairly good pilsener, which is not usually my favorite style. 12oz bottle. Pours clear gold, with a fairly nice balance.
Draft. Citrus and spicy grass hops with a little caramel and some bready yeast. Meh, this brew is ok. I dont think it lives up to the hype.
Citrus nose. Good lacing. Floral and slightly bitter taste. Medium hops level. Dry finish
12 ounce bottle from Total Wine Sacramento, extremely grassy aroma, not impressed.
Feels like a great German pils I could get at a corner market in anytown Germany. Prima!

Pours straw gold with an orange undertone.  Slight citrus nose, little yeast with a respectable bit of malt behind it.  Some haze.  Looks and smells delightful.  I did not pour a head but the lacing shows good retention.  Hugs the glass like its in love.  The taste is grassy hops with a distinct oily bitterness.  Good malt spine, medium body, medium carbonation.  A little lemon and a  dry finish.  Good example of a classic pils.  Substantial hops, engaging aftertaste.
Well- Balanced, inoffensive at worst, nice and fruity at best. Great, thin head, too.
Bottle. Good flavor for a pils. Minimial color. Minor hop aroma. Overall a good lightly hoppy pilsner

Bottle.  Pours golden with slight haze and thin white head.  Grassy, hoppy aroma.  Big hops up front with a grassy, grapefruit flavor.  I do like the dry finish but its a bit funky and muddled at the beginning especially for a pilsener.  Just okay in my opinion, Im surprised by all the hype.

This beer is very drinkable and refreshing. Its something Id drink again. You can drink it with food  like a spicier dish perhaps or anything as heavy as chicken, really  or you could also enjoy this beer on its own. With this beer, what you smell is what you get. It meets expectations and is a good representative of a hoppy pilsner beer. Prima Pils is balanced enough that its non-offensive, but what makes this beer so complex is the way multiple types of hops come together. There are definitely several distinctive flavors here -- grapefruit, pine needles and bitter earthy soil -- which I found very interesting indeed.

pours yellow with a slight orange haze and small white head.  aroma is mostly grass and citrus hops.  taste is dry grassy hops, yeast, and cereal, with a bit of candied citrus and malt at the end; aftertaste is dry with more grass.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2013 Serving: from bottle--purchased at Total Wine & More.

Aroma: lightly hoppy.

Appearance: average-sized, frothy, white, initial head with no lacing and fully diminishing longevity.  Hazy, medium-yellow body.

Taste: lightly bitter, acetic initial flavor and heavily bitter finish with long duration.

Palate: full body, watery texture and fizzy carbonation.

Overall: a pilsener with a punch.  Thirst quenching with an interesting, hoppy taste.

One of my favorite pilsners. Beautiful golden color with a touch of cloudiness.  A nice florally hoppy flavor hits your tongue, followed by a light sweetness. The finish is a touch dry, but not too much, with a slight lingering bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A great American pilsner and one if the best pilsners period.  There's nothing about it I don't like.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great aroma, great taste. After drinking this brew you will be thoroughly satisfied..

Sample poured from bottle at a Victory Brewing Company tasting at Total Wine & More in Chantilly/Fairfax, VA.

Clear, light yellow with white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of pilsener, caramel, citrus and grass.

Taste of grass, floral hops, citrus, pine, caramel, earthy yeast and straw.

Medium/light body and medium/low carbonation. 

Very hoppy for a pils.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Grassy light malt light bitter hops. Some sweetness late in aroma. Clear straw with light white head. Hops meet with lighter malts in an easy drinking classic.
pale yellow with malt and yeast aromas - flavors are extremely well balanced with a slight peppery/malt finish

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2013 Smells of fresh, perfumy, floral, herbal noble hops, with some funky, sourdough notes.  Beautiful, clear, pale golden hue, with a moderately lasting, white head.  Snappy, spicy hoppiness, and German pale malt flavors equipped with biscuity dryness.  Light bodied, crisp and refreshing, lively carbonation, and finishes clean with lingering floral and perfumy hop flavors.
Pale yellow color with white head. Herbal and cereal aroma. At taste light sweet with moderate bitterness at finish.

Pours out a translucent golden orange.  A nice aroma of hay with some light toasty notes.  Flavors are crisp, with notes of citrus, grass, pine with a light toasty background.  Finishes out with a refreshing, bitterness that is not over powering.   Refreshing.

Faint aromas....nice pale yellow in color.  Nice blast of malt up front.  Crisp and clean, but finishes with way too much bittterness...especially the aftertaste...not sure if this is a bad batch ....will try again
Pours a light golden. Nice floral aromas...a touch of fruity flavour followed by a nice hop bite. Good smooth mouth feel with a bit of carbonation. Nice.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pilsener glass. Enjoy by September 13, 2011.

A: Pours a very solid straw color with a nice bubbly bone white head that has some very nice retention.

S: Some nice corned barley with a light spiced hop note.

T: Nicely hopped up at the forefront and that taste lasts throughout the mouth. There is some bitterness thrown in there as well and there is a nice balanced malt throughout.

M: Very crisp and refreshing with a nice light body. Light to medium carbonation. Nice solid tingle on the palate of the hops.

O: I loved this pilsener. So much taste and so refreshing. I want more.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-03-2011
Pours a hazy orange with a thin white head. Aromas of grassy hops and yeast. Has a good bit of hop character and an earthy mouthfeel with a dry, slightly bitter finish. Refreshing yet forgettable.

Pours a medium golden color with a finger of head that laces and settles quickly... on the nose its very doughy with a touch of grassy citrus. On the palate it has a great bready backbone with floral notes mixing with grassy noble hop touches... nice crisp refreshing pils with just enough bitterness to keep it exciting through the finish.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a thick white head. Dont get a lot off the nose, but I get some hints of floral. Light and easy to drink.
Bottle. Very light and clear. Hoppy aroma/. Crisp, clean and hoppy flavor. A very good representation of a Czexh Pilsner.

Overtones of fresh hop buds and florals, mingled with touches if citrus rind and a very mild malt counterbalance. Crisp, clean, dry and refreshing. Light and delicate. Truly a classic. Love the freshness and floral overtones. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

I got this as part of an M&M 6pk from Woodmans East in Madison, WI in summer 2012.

Pours a mostly clear goldenrod color with a bubbly white head. Scent is mild with hops, wheat, yeast, and hints of citrus. The taste is initially a sweet wheat tone that turns wet and slightly dry on the palette. Texture is smooth and refreshing as the beer is fairly complex for a pilsner. Leaves a slight chalky after taste. Not bad at all.

Bottle to glass. Pours clear gold with a soft soapy head that fades to a small ring. Aroma has bitter hops and pilsener malt pretty straight forward. Taste is nice and bitter with the malt rounding it all off. Palate is clean and dry. Very good Pilsener!

Clear golden color with a fluffy white head.  Excellent nose of floral and spicy hops along with biscuit and bready malts.  A touch of yeast with some light esters.  Plenty of citrus peel and even a light earthiness.  The flavor is crisp and dry.  Nice cracker and biscuit malt notes balanced by the citrus zest, floral, and spicy hop flavors.  A touch more bitter than youd normally expect from a pilsener, though.  Very clean and well balanced.
The best dry and crispy, yet flowery pils I know. the best in its style for craft beer lovers.

12 oz. bottle poured into a pilsner glass. 

A: Pours a golden straw color with an impressive luster to it. The head is a three finger white color with average retention. Eventually, the head settles to one finger with nice patches of lacing left on the glass.

S: Very zesty and grassy from the hops, with just a touch of citrus and earth. The hops take center stage over the pils malt backbone.

T: Plain and simple, this is a pilsner that thinks its an IPA. Lots of hop flavor and bitterness abound. Grass and earth are the initial flavors, before giving way to black pepper, grapefruit rind, lemon zest, and pine notes on the finish and aftertaste. Theres even a modicum of hop-driven complexity - a bit more than the average IPA, in fact. This is one of the more flavorful pilsners Ive had, with the malt backbone helping to keep the surprising hop profile in check...but only just.

M: Light and spritzy with healthy carbonation and big dryness. Not as easy to drink as other beers in its ilk, due to the (at times) strong bitterness, but its incredibly refreshing on a hot day.

O: This is a pilsner that makes you stop to think about what youre drinking. Its not as chuggable as others, but its much bigger than the average pils. Oh yeah, I like this one a lot. So much so, that I bought a case of the stuff.

Lightly toasty with mild Eurohop stank. Hazed yellow with lots of carbonation bursting forth. Sharply bitter, and not in the expected way for a saaz-laden beer. Theres some bran-malt undertaste as well. A light beer in the scheme of things, but very heavily assembled for pilsner.
One of the best American pilsners out there. A light appearance and body, a notable floral hop presence (but not overwhelming) and a solid bready malt foundation.

Nothing much to say here... So clean that it is kind of off-putting, the nice hop bite comes and save everything. It's not a bad product per se, just not something that I would seek out (to everyone it's taste they say). If only macrobrewers could take notes though, that'd be quite a nice first step...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really excellent pils. Beautiful head and lots of lacing, carbonation that looks stunning in a pilsner glass. Excellent hop/malt balance that finishes dry and leaves you wanting another. The robust hop foundation side-by-side with the rich malt body cannot be denied. Youre definitely going to more than one.

Clear yellow pour, nice 2 finger, foamy head.  Lightly kilned malt, and plenty of hops in the nose.  Medium bodied & bitter on the tongue.  Finish is smooth malt as back up with snappy, bitter hops as the lead performer.  Great Pils!

Bottle. Very nice, slightly stinky hop aroma (like Saaz and something else). Very light straw  color, little head. Mild yeast and hoppy flavors, some bready and grassy stuff in mid, sweet final. Thin body. A very good pils. Dont usually find one this good from US brewers.

The beer is transparent and light yellow in color. Bubbles emanating from the depths of the beer ascend rapidly to the surface. The head is thick and white, leaving ringlets of lacing around the perimeter of the pilsner glass.

The aroma is of lager malt, a slight funk (positive), floral notes / floral hops.

The flavor is quite tasty and refreshing. This is one of the better examples of a German Pilsener I have had, especially from an American brewery. The flavor leads with a malty, biscuity character, then gracefully transitions to a light hop bitterness in the finish. Personally, I would prefer the hop character to be slightly less pronounced, allowing the malt component to shine through a bit more, but I cant deny that this is done artfully.

Easy to drink, a bold flavor, distinctive. This is in the upper echelon of the style, without question.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-09-2011

Call me crazy or an amateur or whatever.  this beer is a very nice example of  the pilsener style.  nice and bready, good hop flavor and assertiveness and also a moderately bitter finish which i enjoyed.  nice and dry.  i enjoyed the bitterness and boldness for only being 5.3% and it really did have a huge frothy head.  an enjoyable pilsener no doubt

4 oz sample at Blind Tiger Ale House. Clear golden with almost with a white head. Aroma and taste of a pilsner grain with a malty backbone and some citrus. Medium bitterness. Refreshing and crisp pilsner, but its not my favorite style.

Pours a light gold with a thin white head. Aroma of bitter crisp hops. A little malt. Taste follows, nice light and easy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a slightly hazy straw golden with a thin white head. The aroma is spicy noble hops with some floral notes and hints of bread. The taste is very refreshing and light with medium bitterness and a nice clean malt flavor. Im not a huge pilsner fan but this one is fantastic.
Out of the bottle from Uptown. Pours a clear golden color with a thin white head. Smell is a little skunky like a typical pilsner. The taste is clean with a spicy finish. A very unique pilsner.

On tap. Pours a cloudy gold with a foamy white head and lacing. It has a spicy hop aroma with some pale malts in the background. There are spicy hops up front with some grass notes and some malt with a crisp but bitter aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, poured into a tulip tasting glass.  Big pour leads to two fingers sticky white head.  Beer is a beautiful golden straw.  Retention is high, as is lacing.  Crackery nose with spicy hop presence.  Herbal and floral, with notes of lime and a touch of sulfur.  Tastes surprisingly bitter for a pils.  Over the top noble hop presence leads to the same leafy/floral notes, along with a high degree of minerality and a bit of soapy bitterness.  Bright and lively carbonation keeps things light and refreshing, especially when paired with the dry aftertaste.  This is simply one of the best lagers I have ever tasted.  Very flavorful, bitter, drying and refreshing.  Easily the best pilsner I have tasted.  Kudos to Victory.

Poured a clear yellow gold with a very thin head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma with trace of hops as well as malt and a trace of lemon.  Taste  of hops bitterness, sweet malt and a hint of citrus. Light to medium body. Fresh hops flavour finish. Quite good.

Being a real hop head, I was intrigued by the label and descrption of the beer. I have really enjoyed Victorys Hop Wallop and Hop Devil, so I was curious about this one. Pours a bright yellow with a small head. Lots of carbonation as well. The aroma is one of lemon and grass. The taste is refreshing, again with some lemon and a dry finish. Im much more into IPAs but for a pilsner, this was pretty good.

Bottle from Bierzwerg: Excellent golden colour with medium white head. Aroma of grass, floral, yeast and bread. Taste of grass and bread, lightly bitter. Medium body, with average carbonation and bitter finish. Overall a very good pils beer that I would taste again some time.
Great for summer, crisp without forfeiting any gusto. Slightly zesty, minimal aftertaste. All around great for warm weather drinking!

Cloudy yellow pour. Slight lemon grass on nose.    Some citrus. Lemon zest.   Very refreshing. Pilsner.  Good stuff

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a pale golden yellow with little white head and light lacing. Aroma of floral, grassy hops, bready grains, and german yeast and malts. Taste follows suit, bubbly on the tongue. Its alright for a pils.

Pours golden and clear, with a white, loose head. Aroma is gorgeous - caramel, wheat, a bucket load of hops. Flavor is well balanced between a pleasantly refreshing dry, bitter finish and a sweet honey malt backbone.
Pours a pale yellow color with little to no head, highly carbonated. Aroma of floral hops, grain, and yeast.  Flavor is slightly lemony with grassy hops and grain. A pretty good summer beer.

A marginal Pilsner. Again, it seems Victory replicates what others are doing and with the same ingredients and profile. Pleasing aroma but too much effort put into the hopping without balance, leaving a sharp palate. Again, better than swill.

Pouts a hazy light orange color with a finger thick white head that retains well. Smell is definitely floral but doesn't linger that long. Wish aroma was as strong as the taste. Taste is floral hops. Also taste some lemony sweetness in the beginning but all the sweetness only lasts for a brief second before getting hit with the bold hops flavor. Full bodies. Light carbonation. Strong bitterness towards the middle and end. Crisp but not too fast on the finish. My rating is kind of low only because strong hops flavor isn't my preference. In its category I think it's a great beer!

Pours golden with a one finger white head that fades with some lacing left behind. Aroma is floral hops, lots of grass and hay, some cereal. Taste is crisp and refreshing with lemony hoppy notes that cleanse the palate nicely. Good brew
12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy golden color.  Aroma is grassy hops with some light malts.  Very drinkable, a good summertime beer.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 Yellow mostly clear, slight head ok carbonation.
 sweet grassy aroma with some sweet malt grain.
 Sweet hoppy grainy corn grassy  with taste of beer  for beer drinking persons whol like tha beer with some stuff.l like beer and can deal with this almost lemony bitter  tart pils so suck it up with me.
 Editing some more "sober" notes: of spice distinct mild sweet grain with  citrus a lemon/spice grassy pepper long bittering medium body. A pretty hopply,bitter enjoyable moderatley sweet pilsner.Pretty quenching but i consider it a little sweet to call it sessionable not that i wouldnt have a few at a time ocassionally.

Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of grassy notes, hay, and some light floral hops.  Flavor brings out the floral hops just a bit but blends well with the grass and hay.  A solid pils.
Refreshing and crisp beer with a very clean flavor. Pours light gold color with a thin light head. Starts with strong citrus hops but is balanced well by the malt base. Bittersweet finish.

Pours a clear light gold and has a thin white head that sticks around while  you drink. Aroma is fruity with a clean yeast and a light malty note. Taste is wonderful very crisp and the hop selection is on point with this and it takes over the flavor for a moment before the german light pils comes through. There is a citrus element that comes through the aroma and flavor that makes this beer very drinkable and refreshing, I think it is a good representation of style..

Straw colored appearance with a quickly dissipating frothy white head. The taste is floral and bready with a vanilla overtone to it.  A classic tasting pilsner with a clean tasting finish.  A good beer to share with friends.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Cant believe i havent rated this one yet, had it so many times but this one was on tap at Keg and Kitchen. Poured an active clearish gold, medium snow white head, good amount of lacing. Aromas and taste of german malts, pale malt, spicy grassy hops, pepper, and tobacco. A little dry and bitter but mostly a good refreshing summer drinker. Tried many more times, grown to appreciate and love the cleanliness of this pils. When fresh, its incredible

Aroma is grassy, lemony, and faint citrus hops. Poured a hazy pale yellow with a slight white head. Taste is a very pleasant mix of lemon, malty sweetness and then bitter grassy hops. Quick dry finish.

Bottle 12 oz, Bestway. Pours almost clear yellow golden with a small white head. Aroma is clean malty, soapy, grassy, fruity and slightly sweet; very nice. Flavor is crispy slightly acidy malty in front, middle adds pleasant sweetness almost caramel, fruits and nice bitterness that sustains and grows towards the end. Sweetness and maltyness with fruits also stay there all the way. Finishes with a longlived bitter dryish and fruity aftertaste. Excellent stuff.
On tap at Brick Store Pub in Decatur, GA. Pale gold color. Heavy on the grassy hops. Like chewing on a ball of grass. Bitter at the end but rounded

Pours a golden yellow with a nice soft head. Light malty flavor with just enough hop to to brighten it up. Sparkling mouthfeel and bright taste make it a great summer pils.

Pours a golden yellow-orange with a white head and aroma of hops and malts. Taste is well balanced, of hops, malts, and floral notes with a smooth, dry finish. Light, drinkable pilsner.

Pours a hazy golden yellow, nose is somewhat flat. Taste was not as flavorful as I expected, did have some citrus notes. Finish short and dry, was a little disappointing , or maybe I need to stay away Pilseners .......anyway will pass on this one. Quaff Score 3 / 10
Fresh growler to pint. Looks good; like a good pils should. Smells good too; light and doughy. Tastes decent with a good mouthfeel. A top-notch pils!
Malt, grassy hops, and a little citrus in the aroma.  Flavor starts bready and just a little sweet, with lots of grassy, bittering hops in the finish.  Really good beer for a warm day.
Super unimpressed. Super disappointed. Not sure what happened here, was excited. Tasted like an above average lager to me. What do I know? Not much it appears.
pale golden with small head. quite a lot of flavor for a pilsener -- particularly a generous amount of dry hoppy bitterness .
Really solid pils. Hazy golden pour. The aroma was bready and grassy. The taste was a nice smooth bitter flavor, but it also had a nice hop presence. Crisp, clean mouthfeel.

Pleasant aromas of bread, yeast and dough. Pours a bright, clear golden color with a decent white/tan foam top. Bittering hop bite upfront with a gentle biscuit/bread-like flavor in the back. Slightly sweet on the palate with a balancing bittering hop. Overall, a flavorful pilsner with a lot of bread and yeast characteristics accompanied by a faint citrus hop and sweet caramel malt. Id give this an A- rating.
This is a really nice pilsner.  Probably the best Ive had.  It is a simple beer with a light body and the perfect amount of hops for the style.  Great session / summer beer.

Yeah I could drink this one all day! Pours straw with slight foamy white head. Lacing is huge. Nose is cereal and grassy. In the mouth up front hop bite middle is maybe a bit buttery and finish is great typical pils bitter. Medium in the mouth with lively carbonation. Great classic for style!

Pours a golden straw color with a beautiful 4 finger white head that lasts quite a while.  Nice noble hop notes in the nose.  Taste is simple but amazing.  Fresh, hoppy, light.  Flawless beer.  Beautiful.

Bottle (bomber) poured into a tumbler (not the best way to enjoy it, I know).  Pours a golden yellow with a frothy head which diminishes to a light ring of foam.  Aroma of dry hops, way more intense than I couldve imagined.  Very, very floral for a pils.  Light malty character.  Tastes very bitter for a pils, as some other reviewers mention, to me this brew is more of an APA, even on the brink of being an IPA (the hop character is too dry for that though).  Body is light with a thin texture, carbonation is lively.  Moderately abrupt, bitter finish.  Objectively speaking, this brew is very well done, but this is not what I had in mind when I bought this.  Too intense (hoppy/bitter) for a pils.  But again, not a bad beer.

(33 cl bottle) Light yellow, slightly hazy, with a big white that rapidly dwindles to a thin layer. Intense citrussy and gassy smell. Hay-like maltiness. Medium body, moderately bitter taste. Good. Would like to try a draught version of that!

Light yellow with a thin white foam. Dissipates quickly to a ring. Aroma is malt and dry hops. Taste is balanced malt and hop with a dry finish. Good mouthfeel. Overall a good even Pils. Probably true to style but not my favorite. 

More beer please...

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Smells super hoppy. Tastes super hoppy. Such a hop hit, that this tastes for all the world like and IPA, or super hoppy APA. Yes, there is a little Pilsner hop flavour in the silky finish, but otherswise youd be hard pressed to know that this was purporting to be a Pils.  Thin and refreshing in the mouth and delicious.

Draught.
Pale straw, white head.
Malty, grainy aroma, citrus, faint diacetyl, yeast, peas.
Dry, light to medium body, medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, hops, grain, peas, citrus. (2012-05-03)

Pours yellow with a pillowy  half inch head. I don't get much aroma, slight hops. Light taste of malt, yeast and some spicy hops. Refreshing, but I had hoped for more.

On tap at Dino BBQ, Newark, NJ.  Beer pours golden with lively head, solid pilsner aroma - Saas hops, anyone?  Crisp, wheaty attack, clean middle and a nice bitter finish.  Simple, and solid.  About the best American pilsner Ive ever had.

For a pils this brew is like a power forward who just won the final 4. Slam dunk baby. So drink up and enjoy the sunshine.

-- raided in the wild, via Beer Buddy app

Originally reviewed: 1/24/09. Poured into a pilsner glass. Pours a slightly cloudy light gold with a massive white head that retained wonderfully. Excellent lacing rings as well. Smells of lemony zest, some slight piney notes, and grass. 

This beer is crisp, yet creamy. Bubbly, yet smooth. I like the way this feels on my tongue. Crisp hop bite, with lemon flavor coming through. Finishes sort of grassy, mirroring the scent. Not a bad aftertaste. I like this. I could drink a few of these...now to go get some more.
Draft. Poured a clear yellow with a hint of green. Big frothy white head though it disappeared entirely in a short time. Light grassy citrusy hop flavors. Clean and crisp with a light bite.
On tap at union. Pours clear light yellow. Not much head aroma of corn grass. Taste crisp clean would be good in summer

A: Poured a deep yellow with great carbonation and a fluffy white head. 

S: Nose is light but with grain, sweetness, light hops. 

T: Light hops, sweetness, grain, dash of hops a very, some light floral and honey notes 

M: Mouthfeel is light, sweet, light booze, sweetness. 

O: Drinkability is very good.

Bottle at Beefeeter Göteborg Cons 2012-04-27 Göteborg bb 2011-
Ar: floral, iron, citrus, elderflower flower, 
Ap, palw golden , frothy white head

355ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a 2 finger white head that has some nice retention and leaves some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is grassy hops and mild fruits and pale malts.  Taste is a sharp hoppy bite for the style and balanced nicely with some malty and fruity sweetness.  One of the best pilsener style beers that I have ever tried to date.

Nice straw color with frothy white head.  Aroma grassy but slight. Taste starts off with nice bitter bite.  Quite hoppy for a pils.  Hops are grassy and floral.  No alcohol flavor.  Very refreshing, great spring/summer beer.

Absolutely the best pils Ive ever had. Very pale yellow with quite a bit of chill haze. Rocky top dissipates by the time Im halfway down the glass. Subtle aroma hints of spicey and floral hops, notably absent are the usual minerally lager off notes. Flavor is mostly hops in front and hops in the finish. Tastes like a PIPA-pils IPA. This is what SA Boston Lager tested like before I became a hophead. One-of-a-kind and worth seeking out.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with a two finger white rocky head with awesome lacing.

Aroma of freshy cut grass and lemon waft up from the glass. Also some flowers with a little grain.

The flavor starts out with plenty of bread and a little bit of biscuit. Grassy hops quickly swoop in along with a stronger bitterness than I was expecting. This leads to an very dry, clean finish with lingering bitterness.

Wow this really is an amazing beer. It is extremely refreshing and an awesome thirst quencher. The bitterness might be a little high for a pilsener but it works very well in this beer. This will become a regular in my fridge.

My favorite domestic pils! Will still go for a pilsner urquell if I could only have one

Serving from bottle. Smells of fresh clean grains with some flowery hop notes. Pours straw yellow, very lite body, and very moderate foam. Taste is clean and crisp with Chardonnay dryness and bitter finish.  This is definitely my Prima pils if all that I have tried.

Appearance: Orange golden, clear. Small amount of white head.
Aroma: Hops, fruit, hidden malts.
Taste: Sharp hops, citric, Lots of bitterness.

Decent, not my favorite. The nose is lightly hoppy mostly in the floral ranve with some herbal notes. The beer is golden with a large white head. The beer is hop flavored mostly grass and herbal notes. The beer is very smooth.
Golden yellow ith a thin head with malty aroma.  Smooth malt flavor with a long finish.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2015 Re-review: Bottle into pint glass, clear golden color with white head. Aroma notes of malt sweetness and floral/citrus hops. Taste adds biscuit, grain and light herbal bitterness. Light body, moderate carbonation, crisp with light grass hop finish. Very tasty pils.

Super pale pour with a nice 2 finger head.  Head collapsed quick and left a little lacing.  Aroma of German hops is very prevelant.  Nice clear appearance.  Taste is very clean and refreshing.  Nothing special, but very easy to drink.

This bottle was dated best by dec 11. That got me a little annoyed as I didnt see it til home. That said it actually held up well. Aroma is a mess but I can attribute that to being 5 months past its prime. Taste was awesome. Dominated by floral hops. Very herbal, some jasmine and some citrus and minimal malt. Some funk but not bad considering age. Definitely trying this fresh. The only hoppy beer my girlfriends ever somewhat liked.
Big time floral nose - almost perfume like.  The flavor is the same with some grass and fresh shrubbery.  A little assertive on the hops to style, but I loved it.

Bright golden yellow with lots of tiny bubbles racing to the top. Bright white head that left a solid film and ok lacing. Grassy hops aromas with a touch of spice. Nice balance of caramel malt and grassy/earthy hops flavors. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, and a crisp clean finish.
Draft, clear yellow color. Crisp malts with some light hoppiness. Great example of a crisp clean pilsner

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2012 Poured from a 12oz. bottle.  Clear yellow color.  Little head.  Very hoppy taste.  Bitter finish with notes of citrus, with slight petroleum taste.   I?m bit torn on this beer.  While I admire the strength of the pilsner, its a bit too much for this style.

Golden yellow pour.  Very clear.  Grainy aroma with some grassy hops.  Nice aroma for a pils.  Lots of flavor for a pilsner.  Very smooth up front and a little bite at the end.  Flavor lingers for a while too.  Overall probably one of the best pilsners Ive tried.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden color with a small head. Aroma is dominated by grassy hops. Taste is crisp and dry with long lasting bitterness. Well balanced and very easy to drink. It might become a favorite... if Paul brings me some more :-)
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Draft at Momos Tennessee Street. Very pale gold with a white sudsy head. Nose is clean pilsner malts with floral, woody and spicy hop characteristics. Light pils sweetness up front quickly turning into tight crisp floral and spicy hop notes that finishes a bit bitter. Pretty good.
Bottle shared at a tasting at Dagans place. Pours yellow with a nice head, aroma of herbs, malt, flowers, flavor of herbs, leaves, grass with nice bitterness, medium bodied

Pours a hazy straw color with a small off white head. The aroma is of grassy and citrus hops along with bready malt.  Taste is minimal on the malt side with a big hoppy bitterness. Drinkability is very good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks zvikar. Clear greenish blond with a faint aroma. When stirred, sweet fruitiness appear. Thin, watery and non distinctive taste. Soft carbonation, light body. Insignificant.
Bière de soif idéale avec ses bourrasques florales croustillantes. Les céréales sont à larrière-plan des houblons nobles avec lamertume qui vient avec. Conçu pour être avalé en un seul mouvement.
Pours a clear bright yellow with a small white head. Has light hop aromas. Tast is crisp and bright, an excellent Pilsner
Pleasant pilsener to look at and pleasant to drink; has a slightly sour hint that I have not tasted in another pilsener. I could see myself enjoying several of these one after another.

Interesting.  Not a lot of aroma - malty.  Color is yellow gold hue with thin head.  Taste is malty - strong hints of banana, plus the hop bite.  Fruity, but not so citrusy to me - bitter, not so citrusy.  Fruity, yes, but banana seems to come through the most, followed by the strong bitterness which has a nice sensation on the back of the tongue.  Crisp and refreshing.

Pours yellow with a white fluffy head. Some lacing. Smells malty, floral and of tropical fruits. Taste is malty, hoppy, with notes of pineapple and citrus. Med-light body. Med carbonation. Very dry and well hopped after taste. This is a very solid brew, and a great example of a well hopped pils.

Pours a straw yellow with thick white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of floral hops, some citrus, slight toasted malt, and oddly some aloe (but not in a bad way).  Flavor matches well and was a pleasant surprise.
Bottle; hazy yellow with medium white head; aroma- fruity, citrus, grapefruit, hay; taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, lively, bitter finish. Really good.
Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow with white fluffy head. Sweet aroma of malts and grain. Taste is a citrus fruit, malt an light hops. Very refreshing!
Strangely lemony colour. Hazy. Faint citrus aroma. Taste is grapefruit, sweet malt aftertaste. For a pilsner this is very good.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours a clear straw gold with a nice long lasting white head.  Aroma of florals, citrus, and spices.  Taste is a great balance of malt, florals, grass, citrus, and spices.  Exceptional.

Clear golden straw hue with a half-inch stark white head. Nice carbonation. Nose of sharp floral, grassy hops and crisp, clean lager yeast. Palate begins with more of the same, then develops a sharper hoppiness. Medium bodied.
Bottle. Buttery malt  and light hops aroma. Clear golden with a moderate white head with good retention. Malty flavor with a very slight grassy hops bitterness. Solid but not memorable.
Kinda generic pils/lager. More depth of flavour than your average carbonated macro-bumph I guess, but overall not that impressed.

Tasted in December 2011 from a 12oz bottle at The Tavern.  Pours clear yellow with an average white head that leaves thin lace.  The nose is grassy, herbal, spicy, and citrus hops, very crisp and clean with just a touch of bread malt.  The flavor is super crisp and clean, with the bread malt up front, moving to the nicely bitter, herbal, and spicy grass hops.  The body is light with lively carbonation and a long herbal and bitter grassy hops finish.

From notes.  First reviewed 12/18/2011.  "Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

Prima Pils has a light golden straw color, more pale than vibrant. A medium-sized off-white head foams up on top before fading to a ring around the size of the glass.

The aroma has a slightly skunky hop aroma with a serious citrus edge. Light pilsener malt has just a hint of sweetness. Spicy, earthy hops and a bit of fresh cut grass add even more depth to the hoppy aroma.

This flavor impresses me at first and only gets better as I am able to analyze it more closely with each sip. The malt is quite dry, with just a hint of honey sweetness. A grassy bitterness starts to take hold. As the hops become more noticeable, a mostly earthy flavor comes through with a bit of spice on the tip of the tongue. The finish is firmly bitter with more grass and a bit of ammonia skunk.

At first I notice how grainy the front end is, along with how dry the mouthfeel is. The body feels a bit fuller than the average pilsener, but not by much. The carbonation is crisp but a little bit on the light side. There is a light residual hop oil after each sip. 

I was definitely surprised that I liked this as much as I did. It seems to be one of the best pilseners I have had. The combination of grainy pilsener malt, grassy and earthy hops, and yeast create a special beer that I will definitely be going back to.

Nice mouth feel but weak flavor and little lasting malt flavor. Generally fresh but uninteresting

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden color with a thin white head.  Aroma is hoppy and slightly spicy and very crisp. Taste is light malt, with an amazingly refreshing crisp dry hoppy finish. Perfectly balanced.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2012 The nose features notes of sweet, floral hops; bread; and a smack of fruity earthiness that rounds it all out very nicely. It pours a clear, golden elixir with a substantial, foamy, white head. The palate is on the light side, with a thin body and lively carbonation. The taste is manageably bitter and also a bit sweet, with a big hops and malts presence. It feels very fresh. It finishes dry and, again, very fresh, with a bitter but fruity aftertaste. At less than 6%, theres no excuse to stop drinking. The floral hoppiness almost makes it taste like a pale ale.

Bottle @ Timbers, Denver. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, biscuit, grass, citrus. Taste is malt, biscuit, rather hoppy, grass, grapefruit, light piney. Thin  body, lively carbonation. Nice and refreshing. 110312

On tap at marriot in Princeton. Poured golden clear color. Little to no ahead. I was expecting more malt but def stronger hop presence in this beer. Malt at first sip but hoppy taste and bitter in the after taste. Little piney in hop and malt was sweet

Poured from a 12oz bottle...

Appearance: Solid golden body full with bubbly carbonation.

Aroma: Slightly sweet, mild to heavily hopped.

Taste: Crisp, refreshing hop taste.

Palate: Medium body with medium carbonation.

Overall: Many attributes of a typical pilsener but moreso hop heavy then many Ive tried. Being that Im a hophead this beer sits well with me. A great addition to the style. Prosit!

Serving type: bottle

Pours a clear, bright gold with a thin head.
Aroma is delicate, light citrus,  almost a faint hint of banana.....
Taste is slightly bitter, but light and crisp.  Hops and some grain, breads...Absolutely excellent.

Pours a cloudy gold with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet, slightly citrusy, and the malt aromas are just pleasant. Taste is easy bitter malts, black pepper and sourdough in the finish. There is virtually no aftertaste. This would make a great session beer and is the best pilsener Ive had thus far.
Bottle. A complex but very good pilsner. Aroma is sweet and malty. Maybe a little floral. Taste is more difficult. Some lemon and hops among other things.

Nice pilsner from Victory. Poured to glass from 12 oz. bottle. Cloudy golen appearance with a foamy white head. Smell is sweet hoppy flavor. Taste is refreshing, clean, slight hoppiness and honey, with a mild malt flavor. Good brew, if anybody is new or wants to try a craft beer, I point them in the direction of this one.

aroma opens with some hop nose, warm flora flowery esters
color light meduim hue, lacing head
taste, slight bitter on the tongue, opens to flora earth hop tones, mild then sweetness from malt comes in
overall, desent beer, good balance.
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text:
Ar: Grassy, herbal, and spicy - a touch of lemon and light cracker.
Ap: Crystal-clear straw gold - large white head with good retention and fluffy chunks of lacing.
T: Spicy with light maltiness - herbal and bitter, with a clean maltiness, with a really minerally profile - long, prickly finish, hoppy and grassy.
P: Light body with high carbonation - finish is very dry.
O: An astounding pilsner - bright, hoppy, bitter, and exceptionally refreshing.

Gold with a fluffy white head. The aroma is lightly malty with a floral spiciness and earthy hop aroma. The flavor starts off clean with a spicy and fruity hop flavor followed by the appropriate bitterness. The malt flavor is light and clean and the mouthfeel is medium light and very smooth with ideal carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2012 Update: had on tap at victory brewing and I can say is wow. Fresh prima pils is the best beer i have ever had.




a: nice straw yellow color, foamy head

s: hoppy with floral notes

t: clean with floral notes and grain. The hops do not over power the beer but provide a nice bitterness.

m&d: medium body, with decent carbonation. Very refressing beer and extremely drinkable
Cereal and hoppy.  A lot going on with this one, cant really put my finger on it.  Dry, pleasantly bitter, lasting finish.
Bottle. Pale yellow with a vibrant white head. Crisp, dry with a nice hoppy bitterness. Very good.
The gold standard of Pilsners...clean, crisp, hoppy, and amazingly complex, I absolutley love this beer.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Poured hazy gold with a decent head that dissipated quickly, left nice lacing. Aroma was some spicy hops and malt. Taste is about the same but some lemon also sneaks in. Good bitterness and nice carbonation.
