Wow, what a surprise this was,  Pours clear yellow, like any of the macro-brews with a good sized head.  Aroma is fantastic with floral and spicy hop notes and a bit of malty sweetness. Thin in body with a good amount of carbonation.  One taste and you know this is the good stuff.  Spice, floral and grassy hops come through in a perfect meld with the malty sweetness.  Pilsner was my least favorite style until I tried this.  Fantastic.

Im not a pilsner drinker.  There, I said it.

Well, actually, I wasnt a pilsner drinker until I found this beer.  I was reluctant to try it but now that I did, Im hooked.

Hoppy and light grain aromas give a hint of whats to come.  Teasing flavors of hops drive this beer in a surprising way.

Drinkable, enjoyable, perfect.

very light yellow and totally see through. In fact, you might think its from Big Beer just from the look, even if it is a little hazier. But that first whiff will change your mind. Spicy and floral hops fill the glass so you know its actually got some flavor!

There is a bit of grainy malt here, but the hops really shine through. Spicy, floral, grassy, this packs a lot of flavor from the hops, but not so much that its overpowering. Very dry finish with the grainy and grassy flavors lingering.

One of the best pilsners there is! If only all beers marketed at pilsner tasted like this!
Bottle into a pilsner glass. Honey yellow color with a thick white head. Tastes of hops with light co2 and grass. Finish is clean with a hop after taste. Victory is a great beer maker.
Pours cloudy golden with a small head. Aroma american hops, fruits. Bitter on the tongue, a lot more bitter than your average pils out there with none of the buttery finish. Very dry palate. Not Bad.

Picked up a bomber bottle at The Marketplace in San Diego, CA.  Pours a clear straw-yellow.  Aroma is lovely; very citrusy, with grassy hop notes.  Body is light, and flavors include a nice, juicy fruitiness, herbal qualities, and a bitter finish which might be a tad too sharp and one-dimensional to some.  But overall, this is a very drinkable and tasty beer.  I dont drink too many pilsners, but this one passes the test.
I tend to not be a pils guy, but this is a really  nice version. Crisp, hoppy, lots of straw hops in the finish. Last night on my recent Florida trip--this fit the bill really nicely.

Bottle to lager glass. Nose is slight yeast with some light lemony citrus/grassy hop aroma. Light aroma of bicsuity malt. Pour was pale yellow with a frothy white head. Taste is light bran and bready malt with some bitter hops on the finish. I believe that the bittering hops overpower most of the other flavors a tad too much. Not bad but pilsners arent really my favorite brew anyhow.

Poured a champagne like look, golden color, full head.  Aroma has fresh floral hops and mild malt and barley.  Med light bitter.  Dry.  Good mouthfeel.  Fresh grains and hops on the mouth.  Good pilsner.

Bottle @ home. Prima Pils pours a hazy, banana yellow appearance with a good sized, white head. Husky/grainy, grassy hoppy, straw, herbal aroma. Strong straw/hay, grainy pale malty, grassy, lightly floral flavor. Definitely a solid Pilsener.

Pours  a pleasant golden yellow with a nice think white head.

Aroma is bright and hoppy, notes of grass, and pine.  A slight note bready malts lingers through.

light sweetness, and quite hoppy.  The hop flavor balance is good, but it is fairly bitter for the style. slightly sour with a long lingering aftertaste.

The beer has a slick feel to it that sticks to the back of your throat.

While pils are not my favorite style I guess I missed the boat on this particular one.  Ive had many other pils that I enjoy more then this one the long bitter aftertaste and mouthfeel just arent for me

On draft at 85 West in NYC. Pours a bright, golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, floral, a liitle bit of sweet malt. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bread, pine hops, with a crisp, bitter finish. An excellent pilsener.

12oz bottle pored golden yellow with big frothy head. The aroma of sweet malt and the mildness of the hops. The flavor is of the same sweet malt with hops, hops, hops. All well balanced and quite mild no real bitterness you would think. Very ggod pils.

Light, dry malty, minimal and light malt aroma. Fairly typical pilsner in that it is clean, crisp, light, slightly hoppy finish. Ok for a pils, and I could see drinking it again if I were in the mood for this type of beer, but overall as expected; somewhat uninteresting.

Deep yellow pour with white head and lace. Aroma is light earthy hops and light caramel. Light/medium malt, paper, and floral hops. Light/medium bodied with nice carbonation. A very nice bitter. Proof that a pils can be nice.
Light straw color body with brilliant white head. Aroma biscuit, spice, grass. Medium malt body with slight biterness> dry long lasting finish.

Bottle. Light straw with just a touch of haze. Rocky brilliant white head. Aromas of biscuity malt and some grassy hops. Aromas is not over stated but really nice. Flavours should lots of sweet malt before an assertive resiny bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel. Great beer.

Bottle (33 cl) from bierzwerg.de. Clear straw golden, large rocky white head. Hayish malt aroma with strong floral, herbal, and grassy hops. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with a massive, yet elegant bitterness. The best non-german pils Ive had.

Bottle from Bierzwerg web shop. Golden color with huge white head. One of those beers, which want to jump from my glass. Aroma of floral hops, malt caramel. taste, floral hops, nice bitter with light metallic hints. Long bitter finish. Nice.

Aroma is fresh aroma hops.... floral, lavender, citrus. lemon. Appearance is golden and crystal clear. Medium white tan head. Full carbonation, big bubbles. Looks like a glass of champagne. Taste is floral and citrus aroma hops forward. Much grapefruit hop bitterness present. Grainy malt sweetness also stands up to all the other flavors. Palate is medium light and very crisp. Much bitterness paired with a grapefruit twist make this a refreshing drink. Overall an excellent Pilsener. Everything is great. The best of the style I have had.

12 oz bottle.  Light golden pour.  Earthy aroma, yeast, crisp malt.  Taste is crisp pils malt, nice hoppy backbone that shines through at the end.  Its very good but I have a tough time rating pilseners too high.

Long Island, NY - 12 oz. bottle poured a hazy golden color with a good amount of head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is a definitely hoppy but not obnoxious. Its like a trip though a orchard of fruit trees with a hoppy touch. Initial taste is slightly sweet which is quickly taken over by the two distinct hops. The tones of both hops comes through but they go well together. Mouth feel is good, full But not too heavy. Im happy I found a good pils in a IPA heavy world. Good stuff...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle.  light gold pour with minimum head.  bread, malt, citrus. nice carbonation, with initial bitterness and some sweetness at the end. nice pils
Bottle. Medium white head with decent retention. Off-putting yet eye-catching almost fluorescent yellow body. Citrus. Bitter. Long bitter finish.

Bitter hops punch up front which dries out and then fades to sweet-ish. Lingers on the back of the tongue. Nice balance. Miller Lite IDing itself as this style is like Burger King calling itself gourmet.
Clear yellow colour. Subtle malt with some light hoppiness. Malt with bitter. Earthy hoppines. Foamy. Yum.

Golden-straw pour with a slowly descending eggshell head. Aroma is clean and refreshing, light bready malts, some hay, very light citrus and earth hop tones. Taste is a little bitter, not too sweet, well balanced. Finish is dry, crisp, yet a nice lingering aftertaste is present. This is a "true" pilsener, and pretty awesome, even in the dead of winter. Love the hop character. This is really tasty, easy drinking, and enjoyable. Nice job!

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2012 Aroma is very bready with an underlying hoppiness while the appearance is gold-yellow and cloudy.  The flavor has a nice hoppy bite up front with a bready/yeasty, malty backbone.  Different than other pilseners Ive had, this had a slight ale-like quality due to the cloudiness and stood out for the unique flavor because of it.

12oz bottle:: Appearance is golden brown with minimal white head. Aroma is of noble hops and a hint of malt. Flavor is very light bodied and distinct with noble hops but not overly bitter. Has a slight amount of malt to back and very well rounded. This could be the most drinkable beer Ive ever had.

One of the better pilsners I have had. Sweet smell, with a nice taste. Had on tap.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap - good size foamy head, llight straw color, sweet malt aroma and flavor balanced with a fair hop flavor
Doesnt look great.  Smells slightly floral, but the best pils you can find if you like hops.  Wonderful.

12 oz poured into a pint glass.  Poured a pale yellow that was slightly murky for a pils.  Aroma was very yeasty.  Taste was very wheaty and yeasty with the hops sneaking in late.  A very clean and crisp palate  with slight astringency in the aftertaste.  Overall a good pils but probably not in my top 10.
12 oz bottle. Mild malty aroma. Slightly fizzy small volume of head. Very dry finish. Bitter but without a hop taste. Good beer and an easy drinker.
Great beer from start to finish. Nothing too complex. just a nice floral, bitter brew. Cant go wrong with this one!

Have always appreciated Victory beers and prima is no different. This is one of more favorite pilsners they have. Its a perfect example of an America pilsner. The hops are big and floral on the nose, with more malt in the mouth playing alongside the notes of fresh citrus. It is very smooth and creamy with moderate carbonation and low alcohol. Id say there is a soft bitterness that is followed through the long finish and closes on a sweet hop taste.

355 ml bottle. Enjoy by date 21.03.2012.
Pours pale, clear golden colour with medium white head. Aroma of fresh grass, crisp and strongly hopped fruits, citrus mostly, some floral and herbal notes and light spicy notes. Flavour is citrus, orange peel, grass, herbs and earth. Very hoppy and bitter with a mild dry finish. Probably the best pilsener Ive tasted. Excellent.
3625

Purchased at Armanettis in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a dreary December Monday after work.  Appearance is pale yellow with a lighter-than-usual tint of gold, slight cloudiness, not much head, tiny carbonation bubbles rising to the top.  Aroma of crisp malts, a touch of lemon, a bit of lager yeast.  Nice pils smell.  Taste is fantastic, really nice crispness, very easy drinker, flavorful, light bitterness in the back end, this is done extremely well.  Great pilsener!
UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 The most delicious beer Ive ever tasted! Wonderfully hoppy, bitter, and crisp flavor that is not too heavy, nor spiced.

Poured from a tap into a pint glass at Vine Cottage in San Diego (La Mesa), Calif. Color was murky pale golden. Light head, maybe ¾ inches. Some lacing on the top that lasted throughout. Sporadic film on the sides.

Wasnt too impressed with the smell. The first thing I thought was shoe polish. Had some light citrus and grassy notes, but nothing too inspiring. 

Tasted kind of fruity up front. Lemon citrus hops came in right after, but grass tried to make its presence known. Little bitter on the finish.

Light body. Average carbonation. Refreshing and smooth.

An OK beer overall, but nothing Id write home about. Maybe it was the setting, giving the other ratings, but I guess Id have to give it another try.

Bottle, beersofeurope. Sweet malts and peppery hops beautifully combine to create an excellent pilsner. Sparkling pale yellow, with a clean white head, great mouthfeel, excellent carbonation , long spicy finish, with creaminess, yet some herbiness too.

Not quite bright on the pour, it sits quietly with just a sprinkling of fine carbonation dancing in uniform streams up to a tight, compact white crest atop. The head lasts the distance, a fine lace left in its wake. The body a misted orange gold. Soft zest of lemon and lime comes through on the nose under some clean, dusty grain, chaff and toothpick, and bright Saaz hops, very nice. Saaz hop dominated palate. Rough and mostly dry in back, very peppery and herbaceous. It peaks on the swallow and drops off with great haste, a bitter edge that grips the mouth well. The body is light but I would call it anything but delicate. Its got a reserved citrus fruit sweetness that adds a degree of tang to it, the malt profile being dry, dusty and just a little gritty. Impeccably balanced with little inklings of nuances that keep it interesting. Lightly floral, raspy, piney, the carbonation just enough to give it bounce. I love this beer. It isnt classic Pilsner but a modern twist of it that does stands alone. Wonderfully refreshing stuff!!  (12Fl.Oz, Enjoy by: 21/11/11, Mane Liquor, Belmont)

On tap @ Sierra, from notes.  One of my favorite craft pilsners, pours a nice off golden hue, some depth, more than what u would get from most pils.  Aromas are light and soft, some citrus and hops, bready and malty.  Palate is very clean and for a pilsner throws more depth with a slightly bitter finish.  Really well balanced.

Bottle at home.
Almost clear, pale yellow with a white head. Aroma light to moderate malty (caramel), medium hoppy (floral). Flavor llight sweet, moderate bitter, clean and long lasting. Light to medium body. Very nice.

36 cl bottle @ home, EB 21.03.2012
Aroma has lots of fruity and grassy hops  I wouldnt believe that this was bottom fermented. Also some wheat and hints of baking yeast. Flavour is hoppy and fruity with some grassy notes. Also some banana and grain. All the sweetish fruitiness present in aroma and flavour does not fit the other flavour palette perfectly. Did not pair well with muikkukukko, dark grain bread, peanuts or german beer cheese. Good, but definitely not a typical pils.
Bottle from craft beer outlet. Pours a hazy golden color, and has a grass aroma and taste with some lemon notes. Good summertime thirst quencher.
355ml bottle.  Pours a light gold with a large head.  Aroma is grassy hops with some light malts.  Taste has grass throughout.  Light floral and pineapple finish.

Draught at the Ginger Man NYC.
Very drinkable and simple pilsner, bit to clean for a top rateing from me.

From a 355ml bottle on 5/11/2011. Pours a clear pale golden colour with a fine medium head. Has a mild bready, citrus aroma with faint floral notes. Has a nice base of bready malt, some nice citrus fruit sweetness, and a pronounced hoppy finish. A very nice, high quality pils.

Pale golden color and fresh almost lemony aroma that is very smooth.  Taste comes across as if it would be very smooth and I am giving it the benefit of the doubt here as my bottle is a little skunky.  I unfortunately found after I opened it that the sell by date was 2 months prior to purchase.  Not to waste good beer, I soldiered on.  I can see if the taste were presented cleanly it would be complex and be an overall very refreshing beer.  I think I might need to get this one again in a non-outdated variety.
Pours golden and cloudy with a thick off-white head. Aroma is crisp, citrusy and floral.  Sweet citrus flavors followed by lingering bitterness.  Excellent pilsner!

Bottle. Pours golden with a whitish head.. some carbonation. Smells light.. some slight earthy scents in there. Tastes full bodied for a pilsner; however, goes down extremely smoothly.  A definite beer that you can drink anytime of the year.

From bottle. Pours light yellow, very thin white head. I was ready to write this off, but pleasantly surprised. Deep aroma of, light citrus lemon hops with a slight spiciness, yeast and malt. Taste is similar, well balanced, yeast and hops complent eachother well. Best lager Ive had

355ml bottle. Hazy straw colour with a collar of white foam. The aroma is quite strong given that this is a pilsener, sweet also. There is that familiar metallic pilsener taste in the mouth, although it is refreshing and has good drinkabilty. Goes down easy and a good session beer.
Bottle pours clear pale yellow with white head. Aroma is floral with a hint of bubblegum. Surprising hop bitterness for a pils. Crisp and dry. Much better than I expected.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Light golden pour with a small white head and some nice lacing. Spices, bread and light citrus on the nose. Light bread and citrus with a hint of grapefruit in the taste. Quite a good pils but perhaps a touch heavier on bitterness than your typical pils

Pale golden pour with a thick white head.  Very slight haze.  Spicy and floral hop aroma ... cant detect much malt.  Flavor starts with brief grassy, floral hop flavors quickly followed by a sharp and lasting bitterness.  No malt character evident.  Light bodied with a hint of astringency.  Nice beer ... Though a touch of maltiness would improve it in my opinion.

Purchased from Glenway Crossing in Cincinnati, Ohio - Alright, this twelve fluid ounce bottle pours a bright yellow brew with a tall, extremely fizzy white head of foam with a distinctly malty/sweet  yeast aroma. Tastewise, this one is definitely a true pilsner, with its balanced grain taste accented by the Saaz and German hops!
En botella,Palida con buena corona,poca retención.Fantastica pils,lúpulada refrescante.Con un toque a galleta.

Pours pale amber with a small fading head.
Nose shows spicy hops in abundance, with some soft green apple and grape notes in the background. Also noticeable phenols along with bready malt.
More bready malt as a flavour, also some spicy hops and piney notes. Finishes with a pretty assertive bitterness.
Nice moderately-light body, could use more carbonation though.
says "pils". Looks like a pils. Tastes like an IPA. Woah, nelly!!! A great treat, unless you were actually looking for a pils!
I felt that this was a strong hops statement for a pilsner. The cloudy appearance was interesting but it was not a classic pils. I still rated this a good session beer with plenty of taste
Pours a pale yellow, with an avg sized head.  Aroma of bready malts and hops.  Flavor of light hops and some grass.  Finishes bitter and a bit rough.

Bottle from Drink Monger. Pours a blonde colour with a lacy white head. Aroma of pineapple, mango, alcohol and caramel. Similar flavours with biscuity malt and a juicy passoin fruit finish  Moderate carbonation with light CO2 prickle. Lingering passionfruit flavour and a little bitter. I really like this!
Bottle.  Clear yellow, nice white head that clings.  Good pilsner hop aroma and bitter dry taste.  Im not a big pils fan, but enjoyed this.  Would recommend.

Bottle- Pours a light golden color, with a good head and nice lacing. Aroma of citrus, fresh grain and hint of sweetness. Taste of citrus, trace of spice, and mild grain sweetness. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Light body, crisp, clean, smooth and refreshing. Excellent balance. This is right up there at the head of the class for this style. Another gem from a six-pack mixer.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Clear light golden colour, white head. Nose is light malted, citrus, bit of hay. Flavour is hoppy, citric, bit malty. Fairly bitter finish. Good drinkable.
Bottle for Wednesday.  Pours golden with small soapy head. Taste is clean and crisp.  Light bread, hops, floral notes, some citrus as well.

A: Pale golden yellow.. thin white head that lasts for days.. good carbonation and lace..

S: Lovely spicy/bitter hops... some citric notes but mostly floral with a dash of malt in the back end

T: Mirrors the aroma nicely.. the hops are just wonderful european floral/citric style.. nice bready malt base keeps everything in line.. 

M: Light bodied.. good carbonation.. crisp, dry finish

O: Lovely... my favorite pils right now... so glad its local and i can get a sixtel whenever i want
Nice sized head pale gold pour aromas fruity sweet honey flavours woody honey good ibu medium citrus and even pear bright not crisp aftertaste is fruity honey malt mild lasting bitter
Clear pale yellow gold body with lasting head. A little bread and then a little spice in the aroma. Crisp and dry in taste, hops are more noticeable and quite drinkable.
9-20-09:Not a very special or interesting beer. pours a pale gold with white head. A beer I will try again as the brewer is solid and my palate have evolved since the original review.
This beer is wonderful. Bready and dry but still very bitter on the finish. Like a much more subtle IPA.

Pours a hazy straw yellow color with a substantial, fluffy white head. The aroma is an interesting combination of lemony acidity and some musty yeastiness. The flavor likewise features a combination of musty, earthy, and lemony hop characteristics, with a light biscuity malt presence adding some subtle sweetness. The fine, soft carbonation is pleasant and helps to make this one go down easily.  Although this bottle was only about a week away from the end of its suggested best before" date, it still provided a bright yet earthy flavor profile that was a bit unexpected but quite nice.

Pours a clear light golden/yellow, with a lightly frothy head that reduces to a thin foam within a minute or so. The aromas are light with a subtle spicy hop presence but otherwise smells of fresh noble hops with little malt aroma. The taste is a refreshing and clean blend of pilsner malt with a mild earthy and piney hop taste that lingers well on the back of the tongue. The mouthfeel is light and effervescent. Overall, a really excellent hoppy pilsner, quite refreshing.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 [9/11] Bottle. Barely hazy pale gold with a large white head. Aroma has a little bread, plenty of earth, flowers and lemon, some spices. Very slightly sweet with hay and a little bread before firm bitterness. Quite lemony. Finishes dry and bitter with spices. Leans much more towards German than Czech in depth of malt. Very good. [edit] Drinks better at 10C than colder.  [3.7] [3/15] Maybe not so dry at the end. Sweet classy but plain malt flavours nicely garnished with floral, spice and lemony notes.  [2/17] I suppose the beers the same and interestingly I like it about the same, but balance seems less tilted towards bitterness, Im less keen on the earthy notes and I wish the whole thing a little cleaner.

Pours a hazy gold with a thin white head.  Leaves some substantial lacing.  Aroma is almost perfectly balanced between hops and malt.  Taste is just as good as the aroma!  Probably the best Pilz Ive ever had.

12oz bottle. Slightly hazy yellow color, thin white head fading to minimal. Some lace. Great hops for a pils, yet still retains that nice, subdued, lagery balance. Nice crsip, tingly mouthfeel, little bit of hop/bread aftertaste. Savory/bitter taste. Best pils Ive had yet.

Im Geruch schön aromatisch zitrusartig-hopfig. Zunächst süßlicher Antrunk, der dann umschlägt in eine orangige Hopfigkeit. Zugleich tritt eine ordentliche Bitterkeit auf den Plan, welche dann im Abgang noch mal nachlegt und trocken nachhallt. 
Ohne Abstriche gut.Test vom 14.12.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Pours a nice yellow color.  Strong hops aroma.  Hops make this beer really reminiscent of an IPA.  Nice carbonation.
Very good pils, if you are looking for one.  I bought this six pack at Thorpes in RI.  Will get again if I ever am in need of something refreshing.

Tap. Nice for a pils. Golden with big white foamy head. Smells like neroli and maybe a little grassy. Tastes the same (perfumey) up front with a quick switch to an impactfullhop for a pils. Dry hoppy finish.

355ml bottle from Mybrewerytap

Pours light yellow with a small white head. Quite light aroma has notes of hops, malts and parfume. Taste is slightly malty and bitter with notes of hops and mild fruits. Hoppy and bitter finish. Okay, quite hoppy and bitter pilsner.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a  clear yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of strong perfume and some malts. Flavour of strong pale malts and grassy hops, hay and mild fruitiness as well. Medium bodied with a long, bitter and mild malty finish. Nice strongly hopped Pils.
Bitter with citrus hops. I expected this to be a very good pilsner and it is. Medium carbonated and somewhat light.

Bottle. Pours a golden yellow with as billowy a head as you want to pour it.  Aroma is pilsner which I can take it or leave it but just slight citrus sets it apart.  Taste is great with slight malt and some citrus and a nice subtle hop finish.  Sweet but not overly.  This is my favorite pilsner by far.  Keep it up.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle at home.  Pours a slightly cloudy straw to amber colour.  Smallish head that stays around.  Aroma dominated by resinous hops.  Not the most subtly flavoured beer Ive tasted - slightly sweet fruity base giving in to an intensely hoppy finish, just what I was looking for.  A big lager and one of the best Ive tasted.

A fantastic Pilsner. Intense flavor just at the limit of balance. Only flaw, if any, may be that its a little too everything (althought not as excessively hoppy as the otherwise fine Sam Adams Noble Pils). Great in bottle or on tap.

Bottled. Big citrus hop aroma, with little to no malt character coming through. Huge hop flavor: lemony, then grassy and peppery, then huge bitterness that lasts forever. It starts off quite sweet as well, though not malty, something like lemonade. An impressive showcase for hops, to be sure, but overall, a bit unpleasantly bitter. Very light, soapy body. Interesting and tasty, but too much.
Bottle. Blonde. Soft grassy citric aroma with spicy and mango notes. Firm grassy citric hopbitter flavor. Pineapple. Long oily hopbitter aftertaste. A nice spicy hoppiness in this excellent pilsener.

Golden beer with a medium, long lasting and white hed. Aroma is fresh and pure malty, grass; simple but good. Taste is medium bitter made with grassy hoppyness, also biscuity malts, dry. Taste is also simple just as aroma. The great, strong bitterness made this Pils almost as IPA. Smooth and medium bodied. Lots of hops are used for this beer that surprise me, otherwise simple, but very succesfull and tastefull.

Bottle from Bierzwerg. Poured clear golden with a thin white head. Aroma has some floral and fruity hoppy notes, along with some malt. Flavor is similar, fruity  citrus, hops, malt and quite strong bitter finish. Refreshing and crisp brew.
A nice palatable no nonsense beer. A pilsner on steroids, hop bitterness, nice body etc.

Bottle pours straw-gold with a white head. Aroma shows bready malt with florals, grass, and light citrus. Flavor shows the same while remaining clean and crisp without your typical pils skunk. Overall body is
light to moderate and the bitterness is well balanced.

355 mL bottle at Sheffield Tap.  Poured into a long glass, straw coloured with bubbly head and a lot of fizz.  Got more to its taste than the average pilsner.  Hopped and dry as well as straw.  Fresh and hoppy, its hides the normal pilsner aroma.  Its a good pilsner.

Im no hophead - but I quite enjoyed this one. Pours sparkling golden with a frothy white head. Very pretty. Wonderful aromas of grass, herbs, lemon. Very clean and crisp with a dry and bitter finish.

Bottle.  Vibrant golden beer with a strong white head.  The aroma is very lightly dry, and the flavour is very strongly hopped with heaps of dryness.  Overall a very nice refreshingly hopped and deeply dry beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown bottle, 12 ounces, purchased at Wegmans during a trip to Syracuse, savoured on August 11 2011; eye: yellowish, clear, no effervescence, off-white head that turns into a really tiny ring, no lacing; nose: slight perfumy, slight floral hops, light soap gum; mouth: perfumy, light floral hops, slight malt, mildly dry perfumy finale, medium-light body, good carbonation, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 12 onces, achetée chez Wegmans lors dun voyage à Syracuse, savourée le 11 août 2011; il : jaunâtre, claire, pas deffervescence, mousse blanc cassé qui se transforme en un très petit anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : sulfurisé, très léger parfumé, très léger houblon floral, léger gomme savon; bouche : sulfurisé, parfumé, léger houblon floral, très léger malt, finale moyennement sèche parfumée, corps moyen-léger, bonne carbonatation, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Crushed at Old Cs in Fort Collins. Pours golden with a sticky head. Incredibly balanced in nose and flavor. A lot of bread, biscuit, and bitter hops flowing through with an incredibly dry finish. A wonderfully crafted pils. Easy drinking and tasty as hell.

Keg at Euston Tap, London. A murky golden coloured pour with a medium white head. Malty, musty lemon aroma. Tastes malty, lemon, yeasty, slightly hoppy. I like Victory but this is not one of their best offerings IMO.

Bottle from MyBrewerytap.com. Pours slightly unclear golden with a small white head. Aroma of grassy hops. Taste is dry and grassy, medium bodied. Long lasting bitterness, a very hard hopped pilsner type beer.
Very good Pilsner.  When you want a good Pilsner or Lager, it needs to be refreshing and taste great.  Definitely an all day, every day, any season beer....a go to choice.

Bottle. Light golden, small to average and mostly lasting head. Moderate, malty and dryish aroma, lots of grassy hoppyness, some floral fruitiness. Body is medium, malty and dryish sweetish flavor, grassy hoppyness, faint caramel. Finish is average, malty and dry, grassy and some citrus hoppyness, faint caramel. Nice dryish and well hopped pils with faint caramel.

12oz bottle. Clear golden beer with a thick white head that laced my glass. Flavor is well-balanced between hops and malt, there is some good bitterness present, and the finish is dry. Overall, this is a crisp, flavorful, refreshing beer.
Poured clear yellow with a decent head. Hops right away with slightly bitter finish. Well-made, but too hoppy for a pils.

Beautiful golden color, with billowing white head. The aroma is herbal hops, straw, fresh grass, and lager yeast. Sprightly carbonation, medium bodied. The taste is first tangy lemons, then a smack of herbal hops, and more straw and hay notes. The finish is clean, dry, and lean and quick, as a good pilsner should be. The only drawback to me is that it is slightly over hopped, but that is a trademark for Victory. All in all its very good, but could be a little more refreshing if the hops were held back.
Very hoppy at first to the smell. Pours golden yellow with a thick white head. Sweet smells like almost honey like. Very delicious beer with a great taste with no after taste. Great beer

I really like the way the hops are the focus of this, the malt and yeast support the flavors of the hops. I could drink these any time since the noble hop flavors are there and fresh with some nice herbal and floral elements. The finish is dry which keeps you coming back for more.  Prima is a great example of an American Pilsner that pays tribute to German Pils yet puts their own stamp on it.

On tap at US Beerfest, North Bar, Leeds. Pours a clear-ish golden yellow with fairly big frothy head. Aroma of hops, citrus with a bit of lemon. Taste is very crisp and oddly complex for a pilsener - hops, grapefruit/general citrus. Very refreshing, would really hit the spot on a hot day. Medium-bodied too, so its not an inconsequential drink. Very good indeed, this one.

Overcompensation is a distinctly American problem at this point in brewing.  This does not taste like pilsener.  Underneath the outrageous amount of hops, you can taste something like a pilsener, but its hard.  This is the last time I go to the liquor store looking for something, and allow the people on staff to talk me into buying an American Craft Beer, because after decades of corporate swill which had almost no hops, American Craft brewers just cant bring themselves to brew a beer the way its meant to taste.  The way European breweries have brewed beers for centuries:  with a REASONABLE, and BALANCED amount of hops.  Its a shame, because you can tell that the beer, like many American Craft beers, is manufactured with an overall quality.  Dont get me wrong, theres a time and a place for a hop bomb.  Its called Pale Ale, and when I say this, I dont mean that EVERY pale ale should be a hop bomb... I mean that certain ones should as a change of pace.  Of course, most people wont even think this is a hop bomb, because any shred of nuance in the palate for most craft beer drinkers has been blasted away with a steady stream alpha acids, til the brain of the drinker learns to filter them out of his reality as a matter of course, and then more and more are needed to get the same effect.  Of course, you might say "but, if people like all these hops in a beer, then whats the problem?"  The problem is that once you dump a ton of hops into a stout, a hefeweizen, or a pilsener, is that they cease to be traditional stouts, hefeweizens and pilseners.  They then become something else.  You might call them "ultra hoppy stouts, hefeweizens and pilseners", but traditional brews they are not, and theyre beginning to taste all the same.  So, until the Craft Brewers of the USA start to gain some sense of equilibrium, Im basically finished trying new products of theirs, unless I have a reason to think its actually going to taste any different, and on the rare occasion that I actually want a hop bomb, Ill reach for a Three Floyds Alpha King because its one of the finest brews made, and it doesnt claim to be something its not.

8 July 2011, bottle. pale yellow, lear, occasional bubbles. smells like a sweet lager w/ slight grassy hops and faint lemon rind. med/thin body and slightly fizzy. tastes like a lager w/ a bit more lemon rind hops. okay.

330ml bottle. A brilliant, slightly hazy yellow-orange beer with a creamy, foamy, mostly lasting & lacing bright white head. Zesty citrus aromas underpinned by a pale malt sweetness. Grapefruity, lemon & lime on the tongue with a gentle floral sweetness to balance. Crisp, refreshing, hugely quaffable & thirst quenching. A firm mouthfeel with a slight dryness added by a good spritzy carbonation. Finishes with a lingering citrus, lightly herbal bitterness.

Nice Pour, hazy golden with white head, Smell lighter but well balanced hop and malt. Taste balanced with herbal notes and drying aftertaste. Smooth and balanced with a nice mellow hop profile. Solid Beer. Beer Disciples Rating: B+ 91/100

Poured from a cold bottle. Appearance is a clear gold with a stick white head of foam that lingers for a good while. Aroma is initially grainy and skunky, but after the initial shock wears off, Im able to pick up on some unexpected fruity esters and the soft hop influence. Upon the first sip, Im blown away by the light fruitiness of the beer and the easy going hoppy finish. This is one great beer. The mouthfeel is light yet spritzy. I could easily take huge gulps of this beer, but I think Ill continue sipping.

22oz. Bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a fluffy white head.  Lots of clingy lacing.  Aroma is light, citrusy hops and a bit lemon zest.  The taste is very crisp and highly drinkable.  Its light bitter hops with a refreshing citrus kick.  I was at the beach with this one and now it is my go to 90+ degree temp beer.  Almost unparalleled in drinkability and refreshment.  Wish I bought a couple of cases of this one.
Pours a pretty beautiful and cloudy pale gold. Less rusty tasting than most pilsners I still am not a huge fan. My least favorite from victory, but not bad.

Appearance:  bright honey gold with a short, fizzy head.   Aroma: light aroma, mainly grassy and peppery.    Taste: solid backbone of saltine crackers, with typical saaz peppery-ness, but a lot of additional hoppy notes as well:  grassy, a little floral.   Finish: long, dry and bitter.   Notes: Probably the hoppiest pilsner Ive ever had.  Finished more dry and bitter than light, crisp and refreshing.  Not bad, just a little hoppy for me in regards to my expectations for the style.    On tap at Birch and Barley.

Not a real pilsner guy, kind of a hop head but can appreciate other styles. This seems more like a wheat than a pils with the almond, wheat kernel, black pepper and lemon flavors. The aroma is similar with dried wheat, lemon peel and almond. Clear yellow with minimal white head. Fine carbonation and smooth flow.

Pour golden yellow white head. Aroma slight skunk, grass, floral, pils malt. Taste skunky, grassy, bit past its prime still decent bitterness and solid taste. MF light body fizzy carb. Solid but past its prime bottle is old.

Pours a clear highlighter yellow with a very nice, billowing  white head.  Aroma is malty hop pellets.  A crispy light body of pale malt and lots of hoppy pine.  Tastes German, finishes American.  The hops are definitely present and slightly intrusive to the subtlety of spot on malt flavor.  A perfect beer to pair with spicy asian cuisine.  I had it with Thai last night and it was mmm good!
Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is Light sweet, malty and rather hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. Excellent for a pilsener. 260511

Bottle sample @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Hazy yellow body, small white head. Aroma is pale malts, tart fruity raspberry-like tones and some hints of heather honey. Very refreshing. Taste is grassy tones of heather and cereals. Very nice blend, crisp hop tones. A bit intense for a pilsner, but still very nice. Bitter, long-lasting finish. A smooth drinkin lager that well deserves to be on top of its game.

Sampled @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011: Pours a semi clear pale yellow body with lots of small floaters and a near non existing off-white head. Aroma has a really fresh swing to it with lots of citrus, some raspberries, champagne-yeastiness and some nice malts. Near no carbonation and it has a light and somewhat watery texture. Champagne and peach are the first two flavors that comes to mind. It continues with a light herbal twist and a nice hopy and semi-dry finish. A good pilsner, and I get a feeling this rating could have been much better if I got this served as a pint and not only a sample.

Pours slightly hazy golden with a substantial whitish head that laces nicely. Aroma of citrus and grassy hops and subtle pale malts. Taste is hoppy with a touch sweetness. Medium body. Excellent pilsener.
On tap at the Brass Tap.  Pours a nice golden yellow that has a little sweetness aftertaste with a hint of grrains and hops.

Bottle at home. Citrus hop aroma. Golden straw color with thick white head and light lace. No malt flavor at all just a good bitterness. The bitter hop flavor lingers for a bit. This is a very good pilsener.

Not a pilsener fan, but is not bad at all. Pours golden with nice head and a little haziness. Nose is grassy bready hops and some honey sweetness. Nice bit of citrous also to balance things. Biscuit malt and lemon on the taste. Lots of bitterness on finish.

12 oz. bottle- Pours hazy (interesting) pale golden with a thin soapy white head and nice lacework, aroma is clean fresh hops, which is interesting because this beer is not fresh, it is past its expiration date by about two and a half months, I also get  citrusy lemon and fresh cut grass, nice beer so far. The taste is mellow yet has a hop bite, there is lemon and is  very dry, decent. The body is medium, finish is long and bitter, carbonation is high. Overall one of the best pilseners I have ever had, unfortunately the real thing from pilsner urquell was ruined when SAB miller purchased the beer, lets hope miller, or bud for that matter will leave this one alone, evil bastards.

This is a very good pilsner.  On tap @ Stone Bistro.  Pour is beautiful gold, slightly hazy, half-finger head which retains very well.  Aroma bread cereal, hints of grass & floral.  Taste is sweet, nice amount of body, finished with a slightly sweet aftertaste.  This is a quality brew, and Im very impressed.  I would enjoy having this beer again soon.

Probably one of my favorite pilsners, probably because the hint of hops in this brew.  Good clean, crisp flavor, maybe a little too much on the CO2 side.  One of Victorys better and best selling beers.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2011 Very nice Pils, grainy and earthy but with a solidly Euro floral finish.  Quite an easy drinking Pilsner, for sure, one of the most solid American offerings of the style.  The Saaz hops show off their usual herbal, bitter funky finish, yet the lovely pale malts provide a tasty counter to the seriously German fade.  Absolutely gorgeous as beers go, with a shining, bright, clear golden color, an unending head, and lacing galore.  I still feel Im not the best judge of Pilsners, since Im slowly learning the nuances of the style, but this beer is cool, a wonderfully beery-tasting beer.
Aroma is surprisingly sweet malts with a hint of grains. Taste is the other way around with the earthy hops coming through with some bitterness. Overall pretty decent, but not among the best.

From a nice ol bottle. The pour is a hazy bubbly yellow, with a thin head. The lacing was creamy and tight. Aromas were of yeast, sweet citrus and hops that were just a little zesty. The carbonation was light, and aided in the sweet malty goodness, with a splash of lemon and finishing with a bitter-dry hop aftertaste. Overall a fantastic pilsner, and possibly the best Ive come across.
Bottle.  Gold with quarter inch white head.  Aroma is grapefruit.  Flavor is citrus, caramel and hay/straw.  Nice pilsener.

Appears a nice golden color with a good white head. The head stays on as a white ring around the edge of the glass and leaves some lacing. The smell starts very bready but quickly becomes spicy. The taste is similar to a biscut at first, but again moves to a spicy and earthy flavor that really finishes nicely. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with a good sting from the carbonation and hops. Overall, a great pilsner that goes down easily and is very refreshing on a hot day.

I poured a 12 oz bottle dated "enjoy by July 17, 2011" into a shaker. Look, I dont like pilseners any more than you do, but this is as good as an American interpretation of the style could be. This raised a thick head out of the bottle despite an average pour, though this quickly dissipated to a ring of foam with lacing. A pale straw color, this fizzed nicely as I drank it, and went down like water - as a pilsener should do. Theres a hint of black peppery spice in the flavor that is surprising and pleasant, and the finish is longer, more complex, and hoppier than you would expect from the style. Overall, this is yet another notch in Victorys impressive belt.

355ml bottle into a pils glass. Bright yellow with hints of gold and a snow white head that leaves a goodly amount of lace. Zesty citrus (lemon) on the nose with a light cereal grain quality. Nice round palate that keeps that really zesty feel with a crisp refreshing finish.

Pours a very light gold with a 1 cm white head leaving decent lacing on the glass. Smell is strong with citrus and piney hops. Initial taste is string with citrusy hops. Finish is earthy malt with a bit of bitterness. Light body.

Das ziemlich hopfige Pils weist Getreidenoten auf, die später hinter der Grasigkeit zurückfallen. Erst später wird das Bier bitter und weist typische Pilselemente auf, durch den vollmudigen Hopfen, der alle Aufmerksamkeit auf sich zieht, wirkt das Bier schon wie ein mildes IPA. Die durchgängig vorhandene Herbe ist ebenfalls eher wenig im Mittelpunkt, aber um einiges intensiver als die bitteren Noten. Mal was Anderes! 7/9/9/8/10/9
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Had at small bar. Grassy and hoppy. Quite a crisp beer.  Not my favorite style but very well done for the style. Serving: Tap

12 oz bottle into footed pilsner glass. Thanks Brenn79. Stamped "Enjoy by Mar. 4, 2011." Expired--shit. Pours a hazy yellow (I thought it was filtered?) with a medium white crackling head that falls in a minute, leaving a light blanket. Aroma is grassy and a little lemony. Taste starts out sweet and a bit salty but quickly turns bitter--I like that in a pils. Crisp and refreshing. I wonder if the folks at Miller Lite have ever tasted one of these. They should be ashamed of their slogan "real pilsner taste" or "true American pilsner" or whatever it is. Highly carbonated and medium bodied. A truly great pils, expired or not.

Pours clear straw yellow with a thick white head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma of hops and cereal, some mustiness and grapefruit. Crisp carbonation, light body with a bitter finish.  A touch of sweetness up front with a lasting bitterness on the finish that is nicely complex.  Very good Pilsener, thats refreshing and complex.  A bit more hops than Id usually like for a session, but one Ill definitely enjoy again.
A classic style revisited. Very clean, fresh and rounded pilsen. Grass aroma. Taste: fresh bread, medium bitter finish.

12 oz. from variety pack. Aroma- Fresh grassy noble hop aroma. Appearance- Clear yellow with medium low head. Minimal retention though some lacing left behind. Taste- Plenty of hop flavor up front. Floral, woody and almost tea-like Some malt for support. Medium-high bitterness at the end that lingers a little. A great pils with plenty of noble hop character up front.

Draft @ Redcoat Tavern. Pours a pale straw yellow with a scummy white head with surprising lacing. Aroma is grassy with light citrus and flowery hops. Initial sweetness yields to significant bitterness and a long grain finish. Getting along extraordinarily well with my burger. Lovely.
Bottle. Pours a nice cold color. Minimal head. Smells of pine, lemon and cooriander. Taste starts sweet with crisp hoppy finish. Almost like a pale ale but still one of my favorite pilsners

UPDATED: APR 13, 2011 bottle.  Pours clear gold color with white frothy head.  Aroma of classic pilsener malts and hops.  Medium bodied with a dry, hopped up finish, featuring bitter floral notes and lemon citrus notes as well.  Medium bodied and hops dominate malts in flavor.  Overall pretty tasty, although much hoppier than is traditional for the style.  It is more bitter than some IPAs, and not refreshing.  Drinks more like an IPA or hoppy APA really.

Light golden color with a white head.  Bit of spice to the aroma with some hops and weeds prsent as well.  Pretty good taste to this pilsner.  Kinda hoppier than i would expect from this style of beer.  But good!
12oz bottle pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma of grass, hay, and light hops.  Very smooth mouthfeel, with a dry finish.  very nice pilsener

Pours a clean golden yellow color with aroma of flowers and hops.  THis beer appears light and refreshing but its taste and palate tricks you.  Its a hoppy tasting beer with a bitter aftertaste.  A dry beer that I am not a fan of.
12 oz bottle into a pint glass.  Aromas of malt and hops.  Appearance is golden with a white head.  Taste is typical pilsner, nice bite from the hops.  Refreshing, for sure, but not my style.

Mmm.  I like this one!  Quite delicious!  Great taste through and through. Mild taste with just enough hops to make everything interesting. Not too much hops as a summer beer.  Ill have a lot more of these!
Bottle taken home from the Euston Tap. Pours a hazy yellow, with a fluffy white head. Grassy hops, thin smooth malt, orange rind and a touch of grapefruit. Very crisp and tasty pilsener
Pours pale yellow, with a small white head. Aroma is citrus malts. Taste is much the same with a dry finish. Not my favorite style, but very good for a pilsner

The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is heavy on the pilsner malt with some grassy hops and bready malt mixed in. Overall, it smells like a classic pilsner. The flavor is heavy on the pilsner malt with some saaz hops mixed in. Tastes like exactly what you expect a pilsner to taste like. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Pours a pale yellow.  Aroma is full of citrusy hops, as is the taste.  Nice dry bitter finish.  Fantastic, as far as Pilseners go.  Would definitely buy again.

12oz bottle. Light golden pour with a thin soapy white head.  Nice aroma of citrus and a grassy note. Flavor is smooth and easying drinking. Citrusy hops up front and lingering on the finish. Overall a nice brew

12oz bottle drank from my Rodenbach Grand Cru glass... A medium clear dark gold, a nice bright finger cap, great sticky lacing. Could be a touch clearer but looks fine... The aroma is quite pleasant, tons of sweet grain, floral, spice, lemon, bitter finish. Very solid... The taste is zesty lemons, grain, and floral notes. The finish is very bitter and biting, so much flavor. Not a style I enjoy but this hits home closest to the major Euro versions.

pours hazy yellow with a nice white head and plenty of lacing.  aroma is good for a lager, leaning more towards malt and citrus than the traditional wet basement smell of pilseners.  body is medium.  The mouthfeel is crisp and overall this brew refreshes well.  taste is some piney hops and citrus with just a hint of swiss cheese.  finish is dry and bitter.  a nice beer although pilseners arent really my thing.

12 oz. bottle from Oades Big Ten

Ar:  Grassy and herbal hops, a touch of lemony hops.
Ap:  Pours a pale translucent yellow-gold with  a 1" white head that leaves just a bit of lace.
T: Clean flavors; honey, herbs, and a slightly grassy finish.
P: Relatively thin, medium-high carbonation.

O:  Nice.  Very nice!

Reviewed from notes, although Ive had this too many times to count.

Pours a niceclear golden straw color with plenty of visible carbonaion bubbles. Nice white head and a bit of lacing. Nose is grain and fresh noble hops. Herbal, floral, and a tad earthy. Taste balances the grain and bitterness quite well. Great, crisp mouthfeel with good carbonation levels. Drinks really well and is a Spring and Summer staple for me.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-20-2010

Aroma: Hints, very subtle if non-existant, of malt and citrus hops. Almost not there.
Appearance: Clear gold with minimal head.
Taste: Medium sweetness, light bitterness, hint of salt in the finish.
Palate: Slick, creamy texture, medium body, minimal carbonation with long finish.
Overall: Not perfect, but really yummy. A very well crafted and thought out beer.

Bottle. Hazy straw yellow pour, white bubbly head. Aroma of crisp grassy hops, faint bit of must in the malt, citrus rind/light fruit. Flavors of dry malt with a decent bit of grapefruit/citrus rind come into play, a slight earthiness/must is apparent as well. Light bubbly body, crisp/bitter/malty throughout with a dry lingering bitter finish. Overall, this is one of my top three session beers: its bright and crisp and overall just a very satisfying brew that I drink regularly all year round. This coupled with a very fair price point makes it a hard beer to beat. Most definitely my favorite summer brew as well as my favorite pilsener. I dont see what there is to not love about this beer.
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2011 Very clean refreshing plisener, take a budweiser and remove the off sour notes and metallic flavors, "aight"

650 ml bottle from Bevmo. Pours a translucent gold color with a small white head that immediately dissipates to a fine ring. The aroma is indistinct with some cereal grains and grassy hops. The flavor is a far sight better than the aroma, I get nice crisp hops that are nutty,spicy and grassy along with earthy malts. The palate is light but effective(and appropriate for the style) with lively carbonation. Finishes long and dry with lingering spicy hops. Overall: A very good american pils.
UPDATED: JUL 9, 2012 Not the greatest pils like people think it is. Overly hopped, but not in a bitterness sense, the malt character is lacking.

Pours clearish yellow with a large white head, very carbonated. Aroma is of hops, wheat, flowers, grass... very mellow. The taste is strong on the floral hops and wheat with a smooth and bitter aftertaste: very drinkable and smooth. Good job Victory.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 Bottle (drink by 8/3/2014) Finally, a fresh (enough) bottle of this beer! And now available in Louisville! Exciting. Aroma: Fresh cut grass; a little crackery; some very light fruity esters that remind me of pear. Appearance: Pour brilliant yellow/light gold with excitable, ever present carbonation whirling up to support a foamy head that settles into a slightly sticky ring. Flavor: Woah. Major grass up front with a cracker backdrop; malts tend toward honey as the flavor develops; finishing with a moderately bitter bite. The fruit of the nose is entirely absent, leaving only the characteristic dryness one expects from a Pilsener. Palate: Light body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: I can barely contain my excitement to have this beer in town; worthy of its high regard.

Bottled with a drink by date of March 1st, 2011... Id really like to try this fresh. Aroma of (light-medium) noble hops, lemon/citrus, toast and pear. Appearance is translucent gold with 1/3 inch white head. Flavor features hops throughout, with slightly roasted malt backbone and a subtle fruity finish. Palate is bubbly. Good, but not my favorite American Pilsener style beer; I still prefer the Schlafly Pilsener Beer, and I have had it at a similar age.

Pours slightly hazy yellow, nice fluffy white head.  Aroma has nice notes of grass, some pine, even floral hops, leading into some nice sweet bread and pils malt.  Taste is floral, piney, and some bitter grass, even a touch of lemon, some sweet biscuity bread, and a bitter, dry and clean finish.  Great example of the style.

From 12 oz bottle to tulip glass.  Yellowish color with a hint of amber.  Good head with decent lacing.  Smells of grassy hops.  Has a nice bitterness as the hops noticeable but not overbearing.   Light body with some lively carbonation.  Overall, I think this could be a nice summer evening beer.  I am not a big pils fan, but this one has enough hoppiness to make me a fan.
Bottle. CLear pale yellow with small white head. Flavour is malt, bitter, citrus, sweet, flower, hops and pine.
Wonderful pilsner. I enjoyed the tall head and the lingering finish. Lots of yeast and quit filling.
Pour is a light yellow color, with next to no white head. Nose is of lighter fruits and hops. Taste is very light and resembles the nose. Rather light and refreshing beer, easy drinker.

Pours pale golden yellow. Aroma is lightly grainy with a bit of a citrusy lemon overtone. Very hoppy. Everything else is prototypical pilsner witg the exception of floral bitterness throughout. Crisp dry finish with a lingering bitterness.

Well crafted pils, very flavorful, well hopped, has that sharp intense flavor to it, goes down smooth, tastes good cold, getting some extra flavor from the yeast that I like.  Nicely carbonated, with a nice white foamy head on top.  Citrus flavored hops, well done, definitely hangs with the best pils I have had.  Solid part of a Victory mixed 12 pack.
12oz bottle pours golden/orange with a large white head. Aroma is hops, malt, grass, and yeast. Taste has bitter hops throughout, lemon, and slight honey. Nice Pilsener, crisp with a dry finish.

Pours a clear golden/yellow color with a fluffy white head that dissipates quickly. Smells of cooked corn, hops, diacetyl. The corn overpowers the aroma. Taste is malty with a hop bite in the finish. I get some honey and some bready flavors throughout. Medium body, sweet almost sticky mouthfeel, crisp carbonation. Great pilsner I could see a few of these in my future.

Middle of the road for me... was expecting more. I get a lot of hop upfront and nice body but nothing extra. Was hoping for some citrus notes to balance out the metallic hops but didnt get much. Maybe ive been drinking too many IPAs recently but wasnt feeling the pils as much.
Bottle. golden colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, malt, fruit, hop. Flavour is hop, citrus, malt, fruit. Medium body. OK beer.

This is an enjoyable beer, also one of my favorite for the pilsner style. Shiny clear and golden appearance in accordance with the style. Classic pils aroma with a bonus kick of grassy hop. Robust taste with light malts and some hoppy bitterness. Light palate with a clean crisp finish.

A spicy pils with a great hops mix. A tinge of a "pop rocks mouth feel at first sip, settles into a beautiful floral hops burst, a little thin on the finish. All in all a great session beer that is refreshing and light, but very satisfying in flavor.

bright light straw color, white head that eventually fades out, visible carbonation.  Smells of corn, hay, fruity grass, a natural spring.  Flavor is slightly sweet upfront, quickly fading into a rather bitter, sappy, lingering finish.  A bit excessive and harsh in my opinion, but perhaps its just the batch.  Carbonated, light mouthfeel.  Beautiful looking.

12oz bottle.
Clear, pale golden color with nice white head/lacing.  Lots of hops on the nose, more than your average pilsner.  Very spicy and herbal - bready malts.  I like this more than most pilsners, probably because its on the hoppier end.

A bit wild and too bitter when you crack the bottle open. Needs 10 minutes or so resting in a glass to calm down and lose the metallic aftertaste. Then it becomes a champion german style pils, perhaps with a fruitiness that resembles a Vienna Lager?

Draft at Jerrys.  Pours pale yellow with thick soapy white head.  Notes of sour bread, corn, barnyard, and fresh hops.  First impression is lots of carbonation followed by bitter hops with clean quick hop finish.  I dont think theres enough back bone to support these hops.  Okay.
30th April 2009 Pale gold beer, very slightly hazy. Crisp palate. Light malt. Light fruity hop witha fruity bitter finish. Decent Pils.
Beautiful color. Very refreshing and really dry. Aromatics are subtle with that saaz poking through.  Nice creamy head. Once again, very dry...but leaves your mouth watering for a double IPA.

Poured from a bomber.  Light hazy soft golden pour, big frothy head, decent retention.  Light lace.  Aroma was full of earthy, grassy hops, light orange peel and some lemon.  Very nice.  Flavors were right on par.  Light crisp pale malts, light lemon throughout.  Only a light bitterness in the finish, super dry and crisp.  A good bit of carbonation made for a light fizzy mouthfeel that rounded out this Pils in great fashion.  Great stuff.

DRAFT from Wishbone on Lincoln in Chicago.  Nice hoppy nose; bright yellow color almost looks like an American pilsner...think they kept head down so they could fill up the entire glass..but tastes so much better; malt and hops intertwine in here...well.  Very good for sipping with a bowl of shrimp with bacon / mushrooms over cheese grits...would go well with other spicy foods as well.

It pours a nice golden hue with a touch of cloudiness. On draft at local pub so it pours with a nice head and leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Lot of empahsis on hoppiness here with a long lasting finish. This beer seves as an indictment to all those American macro beers that taste like frigging water.

Pours a golden yellow with a thin head that does not linger. Aroma has hints of citrus and malt. Taste is delightful and refreshing. Hops are present throughout and remain in the aftertaste. Mouthfeel is a little metallic. A good beer and an even better Pilsner.

[on tap]
Apricot and vanilla aroma with some base malt. Clear gold under thin, lacy white. Intense, almost resinous hops flavour of apricot, peach, a little pine, and citrus accents from the fermentation. Assertive bitterness. Considerably bitter finish, medium body, medium carbonation.

Pours golden color with a snow white head that disappears quickly. Some citrus and hay in the nose. Crisp hoppy taste, not long on sweetness or bitter. Fizzy carbonation and a crisp, slightly astringent finish.

Pours clear golden with a small white head. Smells like a regular beer, not really malty and mild hop smell. Tastes pretty much like a typical lager/pilsner but with a bit more flavor; not too impressed though. On the lighter side of medium-bodied with typical pilsner-style texture and carbonation, Prima Pils finishes a little dry but not badly. I wasnt impressed, but I generally dont like pilsners.

Poured into a flute.

4.0 A: A tiny bit hazy. Straw colored. Very nice head retention and steady stream of bubbles from bottle of glass. Leaves plenty of lacing.

4.0 S: Hoppy for the style. Grassy and herbal hops. Balanced well with sweet and spicy malt character.

4.0 T: Hops manifest themselves in the taste as much as they do the nose. Quite bitter for a Pils. Earthy first, then spicy. Hopheads will love this. Though I love hoppy beers, I really dont want my Pilsners to be this bitter. Still, it is done really well if you accept that its out of the ordinary.

3.5 M: This is the low point of the brew, but it isnt terrible. It could be a little creamier, but thats about it.

4.0 D: Not a boring Pilsner in the least. This Pils thinks its an IPA. This should keep you happy for a while.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-28-2008 03:22:05

12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear gold color with a small foamy white head and nice lacing. The aroma is apples, citrus hops and light wheat. The flavor is very bitter, but backed with a nice malt sweetness. The palate is light to medium with light carbonation. It is crisp and refreshing. Overall, a simple and excellent beer.

cant believe i havent rated this yet, grabbed a single from valley wines and spirits cause i havent had this in awhile. as michael jackson said in 500 classic brews, there is a reason that this has a hop cone on the label, this has to be one of the hoppiest pilsners ive had and it really works for this beer, golden color, pilsner aroma, and good malt/hop balance but way more hops than usual. would love to give this to every miller fan out there and say, "this is what a pilsner should taste like".

Bottle.  Light golden pour with a 1-2 finger white head.  Very effervescent. Subtly sweet malt in the nose with predominant Euro hop oils.  Very flavorful pils with lots of bitter hops.  Light cereal malt shines through briefly mid palate.  Big mouthfeel for the style.  Not my preferred style of beer but this is quite tasty.

Appearance: Poured a nice golden color with a little haziness. Thin white head that dissipated pretty quick. 

Aroma: Had a bit of an odd smell. Some hay and some citrus from the hops, but something else that I cant quite identify, but seemed off.

Taste: Not too bad at first, a bit of hoppiness, but left a bit of an aftertaste. 

Feel: Light to medium body and a little flat.

Overall: Served from a bottle. Best by date well past and probably contributed to a lower quality. I expect more from Victory Brewing. Ive always enjoyed their beers and needless to say, I was a bit disappointed that I had picked up a beer with an "Enjoy By" date from a little over a month ago. Will definitely have to try this again.
aroma was sweet and hoppy. tastes slightly earthy, and obviously hoppy. dry tarte finish. fantastic brew, another reason I wish Victory would start selling in Canada.

Pours a clear golden yellow, with one finger of foamy white head. Lots of bubbles flowing through the glass for as long as theres beer in it. Smell is somewhat faint; earthy and of grassy hops. Taste is similar but much more clear; a very smooth flavor with a crisp finish of hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is very thin, with medium carbonation. All around an excellent beer, and one I wouldnt mind drinking regularly.

Hands down best pils i have ever had.Big funky, grassy nose hop nose.Clean, refreshing and ’snaps’ nicely with the elevated hop flavour (as opposed to trad. german pils). Bad ass in a refined and laid back way. This beer is ’the dude’ from Big Lebowski in a more gentlemanly form. Great price too (6 pack was $10). Even the artwork is bad ass.

bottle from bierzwerg!
In my glass pours in fact a beer that could be a German Pils. Strong golden yellow and a half high, fine-pored head. The smell is hoppy bitter, as usual, by a Pils. Starts strong bitter, little recent. The beginning section tastes as bitter as north-german beers like Jever or Flensburger. Although the center part is a bit milder, its a quite bitter-herb floral beer! Succeeded!

Bottle.  Pours with a nice finger and a half of pure white really frothy head on a light, bright clear golden yellow that leans away from gold.  Savory and earthy hop notes, very classic Pils in the aroma...crackery dryness, and almost like a mineral hop.  Very lean, dry hoppiness in the flavor as well, savory, minerals, and a dry herbal finish.  Lightish body, no sweetness, and vibrant carbonation.  Exactly what I want from a Pils and one of my all-time favorite session brews.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a large-grained, white head. Smells rich, yeasty, and fruity, with a definite hops note in the finish. Flavor is crisp and clean, with a definite malic note and a strong hops kick at the end. Finishes clean. Extraordinary.
Citrus hop aroma.  Golden straw color with thick white head and light lace.  No malt flavor at all just a good bitterness.  The bitter hop flavor lingers for a bit.  This is a very good pilsener.

Rich golden pour with pillows of white foam. Aroma is ctirus and pine hops, pale and doughy malts. Taste is bready, and for some reason makes me think of a pizza oven. Nice hop kick. Fairly bitter, but it is smooth and does not stick to your palate for long. Spritely carbonation that makes for easy drinking. Im not a big pils fan, but this is a nice drinkable brew that pairs well with most foods.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass.  Very slightly hazy golden color with a small head.  Very crisp, refreshing mouthfeel with a good amount of grapefruity hop bitterness.

Light gold pour with a thin white head.  Nicely bitter with a long finish, but light on aroma and other flavors.  Certainly worth drinking as part of Victorys variety pack, but not my favorite of theirs.
My favorite from Victory.  Im prejudiced since I only live 15 minutes from their Pub & Brewery.   A great session beer.
Bottle at ÖBWF 2010. It poured a hazy yellow liquid with a small white head. Mild fruity flavour with some malt and hops. Fresh and easy to drink. Should work great during the summer time.

Draught.  1/6 barrel at home. Light and crisp this pils is a great beer to enjoy on a warm day.  It is perfect in our SC summer nights.  Victory produces many very good beers.  The only negative is that some may be turned off by the natural unfiltered appearance.  But, for a true beer lover it is a bonus.
Pours a golden, some nice hop flavors, very citrus and grapefruit. Crisp and clean, little off flavors, a very hoppy Pilsner but well done.

On tap at the local option; pour is medium slightly golden with an odd modest creamy head with nice retention. Lights floras and grains on the nose. Flavors are quite impressive and were different from my expectations. The hops are bigger than I would have dreamed and there seems to be a juicy citrus note as well. Soapiness comes across very mildly, and there is also a cereal grain element as well. It finishes slightly earthy, bitter, just excellent
this is as good a beer as you can get everywhere in a six pack.  floral hops dominate at the beginning, followed by the more subtle pilsner flavors.
Pours a light blonde with a little head on tap at Hackneys. Almost no aroma but a bitter flavor.

Floral, grass and slight citrus hop aroma with just a touch of German malt poking through.  Same with a taste, including a finish thats more bitter than any pilsner I have had.  A good beer, but more of a west coast style pale/pilsner hybrid or I would have score it higher.

Not a traditional Pilsner. Thats what the label should read. Drank from a bottle. Maybe I got a bad 6 pack. The aroma was citrus. The palate starts off light fruity malt but ends with pretty strong hoppy bitterness. More like an IPA with that assertive hop finish. Not a bad beer, but just not a pils in my opinion. I feel like the way this beer was described on the packaging was misleading.

This is absolutely one of my favorite beers. Well done Victory! The color is golden with a touch of haze with a thick white head. The nose is slightly floral with some grass. The taste is incredible! Crisp, clean, medium hops, refreshing, great on a summer day or any day for that matter. A must try for all.

I am not a pilsner guy, so I apologize for the downgrade of a pretty solid beer.

Beer pours clear, medium gold colored with a small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing head. 

The aroma is surprisingly malty with moderate notes of slightly husky toasted grain, toasted bread; Hoppy with moderate notes of resin/pine.

The flavor is lightly sweet, moderate bitterness that grows heavy, finish is shorterlightly bitter, lightly acidic. Nets out a touch watery. The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2011 Lucent gold, thin white head, watery medium body, crisp medium-high carbonation.

Aroma: fresh fruity orange floral hops, sweet pale malt, and a hint of alcohol.

Taste: hop bitterness, sweet pale malt, citrusy floral late hops, and a hint of vinous noble hops in the finish.

Good, but not really what i typically think of as pilsner, mostly due to the assertive bitterness and aromatic fruitiness of the hops. More like APA wort fermented cold with german lager yeast. Lack of malt backbone makes this non-sessional for me.
I wouldnt call this a Pilsener, its very hoppy, not my favorite style, but Ill drink it.

Pours clear bright gold with short lived white head. The modest aroma seems to be dominated by spicy hops with thin layers of floral hops and faint sweetness around the edges. The taste is up front bitter noble hops creating a mostly spicy profile with lesser amounts of floral and shrubbery like earthiness. Flavor hops grow to midway aided by faint sugary malt sweetness. It ends with a return of hop bitterness heading into the finish and after taste. Reminds me of a more bitter version of Sam Adams Boston Lager back in the early 90s with my early 90s palate.

A well done pilsner, rated by someone who isnt big on pilsners.  Pours yellow with a nice head.  Not much aroma wise.  Has that bitter pilsner taste with more fresh hops than usual.  Very drinkable.  Its good but not great to me.  To a pilsner lover this is probably top notch.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2010 Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Collins glass. Enjoy by Jan 20, 2011 printed on label.

Appearance: Pours a clear light gold with a 1 finger foamy white head. Decent lacing.

Smell: Floral hops with a hint of spice and lemon zest.

Taste: Sweet florals up front then a subdued mix of bready malt and spices in the middle ending with bitter lemon rind at the finish. The hops really coat the mouth in a good way. Aftertaste is quite bitter.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a good amount of prickly carbonation.

Drinkability: High drinkability. Goes down very smooth so you could drink several of these without any trouble.

Overall: Very good beer overall. I would definitely recommend checking this one out.
Bottle.Pours golden yellow with a small white head.Aroma of herbal, grassy and spicy hops .Flavor is sweet and malty with a nice firm bitterness.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice hoppy pils.

Golden beer with a minimal white head. Smells of freshly cut grass. Tastes like it too, grassy/floral and quite hoppy. Much like a standard IPA, but the bitterness is not as strong, very smooth and easy to drink. Leaves a dry aftertaste. Not bad, but not all that great either.
Draught at Churchkey.  Very light body, well balanced, but overall an uninteresting and rather ordinary beer.

Sample at Beer Geeks in Highland, IN.  Aroma is sweet, honey, and hops.  Appearance is clear, nice 2 finger frothy head.  Clear, very pale yellow, crisp.  More hops than malt.  Crisp and refreshing aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Draft pint at The Lackman.  Its about time I finally got around to trying Prima Pils, the legendary pilsner.  Pours a clear gold color with finger-thick white head.  Good-looking, if not out of the ordinary for a pils.  Aroma of pilsner malts, grassy and floral hops, a little lemon and orange citrus, and straw.  The flavor follows suit closely; nothing complicated, but very nice.  Light-bodied, with crisp carbonation and a usual pils mouthfeel.  Good pils. Re-Rate: Loineshawns wedding- this was one of his two kegs. A lot more bitterness than I remember. Really fresh, crisp, and hoppy- floral and citrusy. Nice pils.
12oz btl. Pours a clear golden with a foam white head. Has a grassy hop aroma. Crisp and refreshing taste with some nice hop and bitterness. Great session beer for an unseasonably warm day.
light to medium color.  Little head.  Distinct hops armoa.  The sharp hops flavor hits your palate right away, and leaves a distinctive bitterness.  Definitely a favorite.
Medium yellow, decent head.  Light scent of hops.  Some malt taste with an interesting hops bitterness thats on the verge of being like bubblegum.  Very good, and one of my favorite Pilseners.

12oz bottle pours clear yellow with a lively light body and a medium frothed head. Smells of Hay and undernotes of flural hops.  Very crisp and dry with a sweet but slightly bitter finish. notes of funky hay and straw up front.  Not bad for a pilsner

Straw coloured, decent head which vanishes relatively quickly,  nose of grass and flowers. Good hoppy bite up front, backed up by a grainy malt body, crisp. A very nice, refreshing lager, the hoppy bite was particularly welcome, definitely something I would drink many times again.

Pours light golden in color with a small, white head of very tight bubbles.  It is grassy in the nose with a sourness that winks at you before it goes slightly sweet.  Flavor is similar to the aroma - grass and straw circle the tongue with a sharpness from the hops giving a bitter start.  It mellows and fades into a malty middle but leaves a bitter finish long after the swallow.  It is tight and crisp in the mouth.

Bottle. Pours a yellow straw like colour, with a frothy bright white head. Armoa is quite hoppy with floral, citric (like lemon zest) and grassy notes. You also get some sweet malty notes. Flavor is also very hoppy and bitter filled with citrus and floral notes. I also get hay, sweet malts, some grassy hops and a faint resinous flavor in the aftertaste. The body is light and refreshing with a quite dry mouthfeel. Overall a fantastic Pilsener, probably one of the best (if not the best), pilsener i ever had!

From a fluted glass. Yellow with a creamy white head that is lasting very well. Nose pleasant grainy malt and a brilliant, flowery hop profile dominate the aroma. The taste starts sweet with a nice blend of flowery and hops up front then some malt and fruityesters come through. Finishes clean, dry and slightly bitter. doesnt seem to have too much carbonation. Very good hoppy session pils.
Draft @ Ginger Man, Greenwich, CT. One of the cleaner pilseners around. Black peppery notes with lemon, lime and slight banana flavor. Very good pilsener.

Draft at Mellow Mushroom. Pours a mostly clear and slightly hazy golden yellow color topped by a small off white head of foam that leaves some sudsy rings of lace. The aroma shows notes of fresh grassy and citrus hops on top of a clean malt base of toasted bread and yeast. The flavors follow suit with the fresh grassy hops lending nice bitterness, while lemons add fresh citrus to the light toasted bread malts. Everything is balanced nicely. Medium bodied with ample carbonation that leads to a dry and slightly bitter finish. This is a nice, easy drinking pils.
Good aroma after open and decent in a large mug, not so nice in a small mug. Overall very nice hop flavour, I can tell some similarities to steam whistle. ++ will drink again
Bottle. Very good pilsner. Good aroma when you open the bottle, lower aroma when you pour it in the glass. Very hoppy like a good pils.

12 oz Bottle -- Pours a hazy gold with a small white head.  Aromas of hay, band-aid, and some citrus.  Funky but not in a good way.  Very bitter, reminiscent of a apple core.  One of the few beers I have had that is aggressively unpalatable.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2012 12 oz. bottle, pours slightly hazy golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma of sweet pale malts, grains and some hops. Flavour of grains, sufficient hops, dry grass, floral notes and pale malt - finishing dry, grassy and bitter. A great refreshing pilsner with plenty of bite.

Pours a pale straw color with tons of visible carbonation, big foamy head. Lots of citrus hops on the nose, but thats all I could get from the aroma.  After the blast of hop flavor on your tongue a certain spiciness runs by before a very acidic aftertaste.  Its light bodied and very bubbly with a taste I just dont care for.

12 oz bottle, courtesy of LiveFREEorRye... Pours a pale opaque golden color. Moderate head. Aroma is very hoppy and floral. Taste was bitter as expected. Palate was rough, but nice full feeling in the mouth, nice crisp aftertaste. Good alternative to the typical American Pilsener
on tap.  a great drinkable pils, just a little to hoppy for me.  very well done and very drinkable, i just prefer a cleaner pils.
Skunky but may have been the bottle. For all the good ratings on this I was hoping for something a bit more.  Couldnt get past the taste so will re-rate when I try again.
Aroma of hay, citrus,spice, Hopped nicely so that it has a good bite without much bitterness.  Lightly sweet, clean finish with a little spicy bite.  Fizzy and refreshing.  This is a very good beer.

Pours a golden yellow with a nice white head. Aroma of citrusy piney hops, some light malt and yeast. Taste is similar to aroma. Palate is light bodied, with good carbonation, and crisp mouthfeel. Finish has strong piney hops presence with some light bitterness, light bready notes and some malt. Overall a descent brew.

4.99 for a sixer at the Navy base, yeah!   Nice floral hop aroma.  Flavor is clean, mildly sweet pale malt with a nice dry hop flavor and bitter finish. Refreshing, smooth and clean, a nice summer refresher.  Very drinkable and enjoyable.  Excellent beer, excellent value.
Rather hoppy for a pils, but that really isnt a bad thing in my book. The pine finish is there, otherwise it is a very light but enjoyable session.

Yellow color.  Very interesting floral aroma with a bit of pinyness (pininess?).  LIght-medium, some complicated flowery stuff going on with a hoppy background.  Not quite a typical pils.  Quality seems to vary a lot depending on the freshness of the bottle, this can be absolutely great or just ok.

Bottle. Fierce yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma is nice and hoppy. It has the pilsener classics, but with a stronger hop-profile, giving it a fresh, citrusy base and a little pineapple, Taste is also very fresh with a lot of pine and a little grapefruit. The hops are even stronger, giving it a quite dry texture. Fairly big body, medium carbonation, medium duration. Quite recommendable!
