pale yellow pour with a quickly disappearing head. aroma has the lager yeast with a fresh hop addition to it. The taste is classic pilsner but with a nice addition of smooth hops, and a moderate bitterness in the finish.  Nice pilsner.

Flower bed aroma.

 Medium body, thick for a pilsener.

 Very hoppy in the balance, but not not in a noisy IPA way, Clean, not too sharp but sharp enough to be fresh.

 Nice at any occasion.
Purchased in Ølkonsortiet, Ålborg.
Superbe bière blonde, très bonne saveur de houblon, goût très spécial jamais vu ailleurs. Dégucté à la brasserie Victory en Pennsylvanie.

On tap at Trinity Brewpub in Colorado Springs.  Pours a crystal clear gold with a perfect white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is crisp, with a good balance of spicy doughy yeast and Saaz hops.  Flavor matches quite well, with a pretty strong hop resin bite for a Pils.  A little strong on the carbonation, but this is a great lively summer brew.  Just hearty enough to not be classified as watery, but light enough to session.

Bottle and Draught, many times at many places. This has got to be one of the best Pilseners. Pours a clear, light yellow with a modest, fizzy white head. Great aroma of straw, floral hops and mild malts. Flavor has light sweetness, but some very crisp, grassy hops. Light in body with fine, quenching carbonation. Finishes with some sweetness, but lots of dryness and hops. Excellent.
Wow, great pilsner! Light in color, crisp and clean. Extremely sessionable and hoppier than most lagers. Appealing to most hop heads, and on a 90 degree day, what a great go to beer.
if you are looking for a hoppy beer, but dont want the weight of some IPAs out there, look no further.  this thirst quenching beer is a perfect summer pounder!
A slightly better than average pilsner.   refreshing,  not to hoppy,  something to enjoy on a summer day in the backyard.
(Bottled @ GBBF).  Just thought this was very classy . Very soft and its  rounded breadiness was excellent . Reminded me a lot of a biere de gared TrosMonts .  PIney , dry and light. Oh yeah.
Tasted at the Music City Brewers Festival. Wonderful Hop flavor and aroma. Very crisp and dry, prefect for those hot weather days. Could this be better than water??

(bottle)  Pours a hazy light yellow color with white head with some lacing. Aroma is of yeast and grass. The taste has a mild grapefruit flavor and hops. A nice choice for hot weather. Victory is a quality brewer but the overall score seems over-hyped.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a very light gold with a 1 cm white head leaving decent lacing on the glass.  Smell is strong with citrus and piney hops.  Initial taste is string with citrusy hops.  Finish is earthy malt with a bit of bitterness.  Light body.  Pretty great pilsener.

Pours a bright yellow cloudy golden with a white head. Lacing is pretty good and leaves age-rings around the glass. Aroma is mostly hops, dominated by citrus. Taste is hops and a tangy bitterness that shows in this light style. As far as pilsners go, this is the cream of the crop.

Bottle. Pours a clear but bright gold with standard white head. Aroma is slightly flowery with oats. Initial flavor profile is hoppy, with flower, perfume, and pine. Also notes of corn and rice. Slightly stale finish of dry hops and styrofoam. This would be better with some more malty qualities to balance it out just a bit.

Nice hoppy aroma.  crisp unmistaken pils finish.   My favorite pils.  I am an IPA hop hound and Prima provides the lightness of a Pils for quenching and enough hops to make one feel near their hoppy home.   Planning to home brew this soon if I can get the right lagering temp.

Entered from backlog, drank one right after a Troegs Sunshine Pils.  Medium gold with a nice gentle white head.  Really nice, gentle hops, crisp, fresh pils malt.  Light malt backbone.  A lot different than the Sunshine Pils, this was more hoppy and more bitter.  Preferred the Sunshine a bit.
A solid if not spectacular pils.  A litle too on the sweet side.  Could stand to be a bit sharper and crisp in my book.  Overall though really nice and a lovely shade of yellow in the glass.

Light golden pour, moderately dense white head.  Seems like this is a pretty fresh bottle from the aroma.  Slightly sweet bread and toast aroma with floral and herbal hop character, a little white grape fruitiness.  Lightly biscuity malt tasting with a lot of floral and hay flavors, and a little earthy character as well.  Probably the best pilsner Ive had, no real flaws and a little subtle complexity to it.  Not a huge fan of the style, but I can enjoy this easily.

Nice and hoppy, but smooth pilsner. 12 oz bottle pours a clear honey yellow with a quickly fading white head. Aroma of dried chamomile flowers and pine nuts. Tastes of apricot, white grapes, very light malts and strong, piney hops that tingle the tongue long after the finish. Alcohol is a bit pronounced for the style, but still, this is a really refreshing session brew.
This beer has the perfect amount of hop with a smooth malt finish. Tastes great!

12oz bottle poured nice, bubbly two-finger head.  Im not typically a pilsner guy, but this one is right up my alley.  Nice earthy flavor.  Lots of hops that results in a pretty bitter finish.  Ive had it on tap before, and it was better then.  But the bottled version is definitely nice to have when sitting in the backyard on a hot day.

Pour is light golden with a big head which settles into no head. Smells slightly of apple and flowers and slight corky flavor. Crisp feel with a bright bitterness which lingers. This is refreshing and big beer.

Its always nice to receive a new brew from the States that is not part of the three big brewers. This is my first from Victory. Pours a glowing yellow colour with a big foamy white head, medium retention, small traces of lacing and big bubble carbonation. The nose is pretty hoppy with this fresh flower scent. The hop is definitely more present in the taste, and makes this quite a refreshing hoppy pils beer. I did not taste the hop as much drank from the bottle. Dry mouthfeel, and much hoppier than most Euro pilsner. Quite a good first experience from this brewery.

Draft at Brick Store.  Pours golden with thick, white head.  Aroma of hops and lemon.  Taste has nice, crisp bite and clean finish.  Not a fan of the style but this is the best pilsener I have ever had.  Good beer.

Unfortunately for this beer I had purchased it, taken it cross border and poured prior to realising the best before date on the label. So its 1 and a bit months old, but still quite palatable. Pours pale yellow with average white head, lingering and somewhat lacing the glass. Floral and grassy hop aromas i expect would be better accentuated with a newer beer, but anyhow this one is due for a re-rate soon as the medium mouthfeel and lingering bitterness combines to complete this fine beer.

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear, light-yellow amber with a white head.The first sip worried me, I thought it was a little lite....like a "typical Pilsner", but after only a second, the hops introduced them self.  This is a very fine example of the pilsner style. Smell of Pilsner hops are prevalent with grass and some scent of lemon. Taste is grassy hops and lemon. Mouthfeel is very crisp, clean and refreshing with some carbonation and a slight malt finish, thanx again Victory for the German malt. Very good beer for a summer day, especially after working in the yard. Or for fishing for Cats at Midnight.
Clean and very true to style with a touch of boldness like Victory loves to do, this plumps the style perfectly.  Clean and crisp, yet powerful and flavorful!  Love it.

Aroma:  Grass-pine hops (brown glass stops the skunk again!).  Brilliant straw-yellow with little or no head.  Almost no lacing either.  Classic pils hops bitterness up front with just the slightest hint of malt sweetness underneath.  Sweetness becomes more pronounced as it warms.  Mouthfeel is flat due to low carbonation, but has enough malt foundation to be satisfying.  Dry and bitter finish.  Appearance is the only loser here.  Otherwise, everything a pilsener should be:  Sharp, clean and refreshing.  Definitely would drink again.

Pours pee yellow with small white head.  A great summer ale with some bitter hops on the finish.  Hands down one of the best and only pilsners I can tolerate, let alone drink repeatedly.  All kids of flavor and hops, but still a light brew overall. Spectacular for the style.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Bottle. Pale yellow pour with a small white head. Aroma is sweatsock (Saaz hops). Honey on taste - very good pils!
The best German style American made pilsner. It has a nice little hop note, and a great finishing bitterness. This beer is very reminiscent of a Bittberger or Rataberger except better.

Pours a very hazy light pale yellow gold
Pretty white foam, simmers down to a fine ring, no lacing

Even though the "best by" date was May 16,2010,
it seemed to have some nice grassy pils aroma.
some malt perhaps?

Taste much like it smelled,  with a nice hop bite.  Very clean finish!  Good stuff!

Nice crisp medium body.

This beer makes me wonder what:
a.  what this tastes like very fresh, and
b.  what a fresh real European pilsner is like.

Would def get again!

12 oz. bottle served in Pilsener glass at Rovers- poured a lightly turbid faded yellow color, huge white foamy head formed and lasted, moderate lace.  Aroma of 100 acres of Saaz hops and a light wheat malt.   Hits the mouth with a low medium body, malt is light and enjoyable, middle has a strong wave of hops, finish is slightly dry.  Classic.
Light yellow color with beautiful clarity. Wonderful light malt character with some grassy hops. Flavor is grassy with beautiful malt flavor and the perfect sweetness to finish. Really enjoyable.

Light malt and peppery hop aroma.  1/2 inch white head on hazy, pale, yellow beer.  Nice and dry with a lot of hop flavor. Again some pepper and floral notes.  Hops dominate on a background of a very clean malt flavor.  Fairly long initially hoppy, then malty finish.

12 oz bottle from Crystal Liquor Barrel.  Slightly cloudy, pale yellow pour with a couple fingers of foamy white head.  Aroma is grassy, a bit citrusy.  Flavor is very hoppy (especially for the style) and it has a nice clean finish with a touch of lemon to it.

THIS BEER WILL NOT WIN ANY AWARDS FOR ITS LOOKS OR AROMA. IT SMELLS AND LOOKS LIKE A RUN OF THE MILL SKUNKY PISS YELLOW BEER, BUT IT SURE AS HELL ISNT!. ITS LACED WITH A SUBTLE SWEET BITTER CITRUSNESS AND ALTHOUGH ITS HARD TO PUT MY FINGER ON IT THERE SEEMS TO BE A HINT OF SOUR APPLE. THIS IS A WONDERFULL SUMMER BEER THAT WILL ALWAYS PLEASE THE CROWD, QUITE POSSIBLY THE BEST PILSNER IVE EVER HAD AND DEFINITELY A VICTORY!

12oz in mug.  Hazy pale yellow with delicate, dissipating head.  Lively, herbaceous, lime aroma.  Crisp, mouthwatering hops over a backdrop of a hint of grainy.  Finish has a bit of sticky lupulin, but thats likely unavoidable at this bitterness and level of aroma.

I was not expecting this to be as good as it was.  Pours a dark gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of grass, apple, lemon and a little resiny as well. Taste is sweet with a clean finish, much more hoppy then I expected.  Hit the spot perfectly on such a hot day.

Pours hazy yellow, small white head.  Slight aromas of pale malt, strong citrusy hops.  Hops are really the hard hitter here; theyre resiny and piney, bit of grapefruit.  Also a bit of bread.  Like a Czech pils with American hops, and thrice the quantity thereof.  Very good pils.

I do not really like this style but I have to say of that style this is one of the best, Big hoppy mild pine citrus. Like a watered down big IPA.
Not bad for what it is.

Slightly hazy pale golden body with a thin white head that leaves some spotty lacing.  Citrus, light hops, and a hint of malt make up the nice aroma.  The brew starts smooth and silky and finishes with a punch of carbonation.  Sugared grapefruit and light malty sweetness meld nicely to a slightly bitter finish.  A great beer that is extremely easy to drink!
This kind of changes my perception of what a pils can be. Wonderful floral hops in the nose are backed up by a nice malty backbone. Nice beer.
I hate to give a pils a 4, but this one was good.  Strong hops and a crisp flavor are great.  I think this is what sam adams was going for with their noble pils.

A light cereal aroma.  Surprisingly flavorful and malty for the style.  Plenty of Central European hops, some sweetness, a bit of grapefruit and grape.  This is a top grade pilsener!  I can see why it is the highest ranking widely available pilsener.  Cheers to Victory for this one.

Pours golden with nice white head.  Hint of grains and malt in the nose.  Crisp with green pine hop flavor and finishes with same.  Hint of grains.  Hoppier than typical pils.  Not sure this bar treats its beers all that well.

slight lemony and grassy aroma,mostly citrusy...cloudy yellow/amber color,thin head that leaves lacing...taste..lemony at first then bang theres that hop hit,doesnt last long but fairly ptoent..hoppy citrusy and bitter flavors linger awhile,not much maltiness but wasnt expecting it..tingly and light mouthfeel easily poundable....once again a macro like abv still reveals powerful flavor and very refreshing taste..excellent beer to have if youre having more than six ,in other words great summer beach  and session beer

Bottle. Aroma is spicy hops and citrus. Appearance is a pale lemon yellow with a half inch of pillowy white head. Taste begins with a powerful burst of dry spicy hops and lemons followed by cereal malt, apricot and some bitterness. Mouthfeel is dry and full bodied with heavy carbonation. It finishes crisp and zesty with a bitter aftertaste. Overall flavor is assertively dry and lemony with lots of German hop goodness in there as well. Very unique and satisfying Pilsener thats perfect for summertime drinking.
Bottle in Fredericton. Pours a clear golden color with a small disappearing white head. Strong aroma of flowery hops and some citrus. Dry hoppy finish. Very good pilsener

Bottle, ridiculously cheap from Rhythm & Booze, Barton upon Humber. Faintly hazy gold thin but lasting white head and gentle condition. Excellent flowery hop resin and sweet honey notes in the mose with a touch if yeastiness, pleasant restrained hop bitterness in the mouth with a biscuity malt note and gentle chalkiness, lingering fruity finish with underlying chalky hop bitterness.
On tap at Flat Street Brew Pub. Nice straw yellow body with short head. Quite hoppy with citrus. Nice taste to it and more than I had expected from a pilsener. Well done.

Beautiful looking pils that pours xtra light with a thick microbubble head.  Saaz hops are prevalent in the spicy flavor and the Northern Brewer hops add a bit to the blackberry/currant-like snap in the finish and aroma.  Biscuit and clean malt flavors are well balanced.  Carbonation is crisp and refreshing.  Absolutely nothing wrong with this American Made Pils.
This is the best session beer ever brewed.   The perfect beer for a summer evening.  Dry, hoppy pilsner with a nice piney bitterness to the finish.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2017 Pours a very clear golden yellow with a frothy white head that lasts and leaves ton of lacing. The aroma is loaded with lots of peppery Saaz hops, with some light citrus and sweet smelling malt. Sweet and clean citrus upfront with a long, peppery, bitter finish. Very refreshing.
This is probably one of the best pilsners Ive ever had.  Aroma of hop and grass.  Taste is a grainy hop with grass and malt.  Very light on the palate and great in the summer.

Hop madness. It really galls me to say that I regret buying a 6-pack of this based on high ratings here AND on beeradvocate. The "long dry finish" is to me insufferably long, dry, and BITTER. Another example of what I believe to be over-hopped American brews, mostly IPAs and PAs. It seems that if it doesnt have a completely overwhelming hop effect its not a proper American style. Im struggling to drink this sixer, and the hops prevent any other characteristic from breaking through. Even the aroma is just hops.
12oz bottle.  Clear golder color with nice lacing.  Great pilsner beer.  Taste is grassy with a dry bite from the hops.  This is a wonderful summer beer.

This is a great pilsner.  And one of my least favorite brew types so Im happy to say that.  Straw yellow pour with a wheat revival at near end.  Tast is a bit hop dominated at first but settles with ease towards the back lash going down.  No head brings this brew to the attention it deserves.  an easy drinking beer on a beautiful day or any day.  simple yet distinguishly favlorful for a pilsner.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2010 12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear golden pear with a frothy white head.  A subtly hoppy aroma with a little hint of fresh citrus. Flavor is, at first, distinctly hoppy (albeit light hops) and fresh. Later, notes of slight malt  and some very light citrus flower develop. Very clean. Very light. A refined palate -- champaign-esque (in some ways). This is the best pilsener Ive had so far.

Throughout the glass there is a solid golden liquid. The aromas are that of a sublte hops at first with an earthy finish. At first the hops are hard to trace but once towards the end the hops explode through the glass. A different style Pils that will leave a lasting mark on your taste buds!
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $1.99 Excellent.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2010 Pour from a growler obtained at Whole Foods in Fair Oaks, VA.  Pours a transparent yellow with a big fluffy white head.  Smell is floral and hoppy with a touch of sweetness, this is definitely hoppier than your average pilsner.  Taste is quite dry, initially dominated by herbal hops, quickly fading into the fantastic crisp finish with just the right amount of hoppy bitterness.  Almost hoppy enough to be an IPA.  This is one of the best session beers, in my opinion.

Aroma: This is in fact a pilsner, weird cause it smells like an amazing IPA! Huge citrus hops on the nose, like a bouquet of freshly picked backyard hops thrown into one of those fizzy yellow beers were all supposed to dislike. Very impressive!
Appearance: A nice pale straw to golden color with tons of CO2 bubbles fighting their way up the glass to escape. The head is maintaining a sturdy two finger height despite my best efforts to restrain it to fit in my favorite pils glass. A very nice champagne looking pils.
Taste: Wow hops! This beer should be its own style IPP because I dont know if you can have this much hop character, at least the huge fruity hop kind, in a pils. After the blast of hop flavor a very pleasant malt accent comes through lending a bit of rich and delicately sweet flavor to balance all those alpha acids. Then the beer hops your face off again.
Palate: Light and spritzy on the palate due to the great acidity and carbonation. This lager is very light in body and left my mouth very refreshed and yearning for another sip.
Overall: The best pils Ive ever had, ever. This beer has so much character and flavor it could be overwhelming to find it in a pils but the balance of flavors comes together to create on extremely hoppy and satisfying lager!

12oz bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a thin white head.  Aroma is of floral hoppiness with a background of sweetness.  The taste starts with a nice bitter punch in the front.  Some floral notes.  Theres some lingering bitterness on the back.  The slightest bit of sweetness near the end.  Mouthfeel is light-bodied yet lasting; very interesting.  Refreshes the palate tremendously.

Pours golden yellow with a fine white head. Aroma of floral/piney hops, fresh grain malt, hints of herbal character. Flavor is light and sweet with quite a pronounced hop-bite for a pilsner, but it all balances off to a crisp finish. Body is light and smooth, finely effervescent with resounding bitterness. This is a king among pilsners.
Ok, Im not a fan of pils, but this one was a bit more than tolerable, so Id call it a win.

12oz bottle in Flute glass (expired though, but cant taste any defects).  Pours bright, opaque golden color with a thin white head.  Earthy, breadlike aroma.  Bitter, with the hops clearly dominating the aftertaste.  Full, creamy body.  A great pilsner, which normally isnt my style of beer.

This one is too hoppy for me.  To me, this isnt quite balanced as I would have hoped.  The aroma and appearance are good, but the taste is not everything I had hoped for.  This bottle is only a day or two prior to best by date so could have lost a lot from fresh.

For those taking note, Id say Boulevard Pilsner is one of my benchmarks for the style.  I think it is a nicely balanced super easy drinker.

I find myself newly sympatico with the pilsner cause. Maybe it has to do with the warm springlike weather. Or with having had almost nothing but double IPAs and barleywines all winter long. But I am so ready for this. A nice crisp pilsner like from the old country. I would give it a 9 or 10 in the taste category if there just slightly more bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2010 On tap at Pizzeria Paradiso, Washington DC, 6 March 2010. Attractive clear gold colour. Moderate white head. Biscuity malt aroma. Not too bready. Good balance of grassy hops and light toasted malt on the palate. Some lasting bitterness. Very refreshing and crisp.

Light and hoppy floral aroma which is quite pleasant. Yellow, slightly hazy appearance with a decent size white head. Theres a nice hop bitterness for a pilsner. Medium-bodied and lively, should be equally enjoyable for pilsner and ipa drinkers alike.
Pale straw color at pour, medium sized head which slowly dissipated.  Citrus and hops aroma, flavor was very hoppy, and bitter finish.  Seemed more like an IPA than pilsner.

A- pale straw yellow body with thin white head. Great head retention.

S- refreshing hop smell with malt backing.

T- refreshing hops upfront all the way through. Small malt backing. Very light taste.

P- Light body and light carbonation.

O- this is very refreshing cold on a hot day. It has a great summer character to it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-15-2007 22:33:01

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Pale yellow pour with a bubbly white head.  Clean, piney hop aroma as well as the bready, Earthy, bitterness, and slightly skunky aroma typical of most lagers and pilseners.  Taste is slightly sharp but clean with a mildly bitter finish.  Im sure that Victory makes a fine pilsener but Im just not a fan of the style.  If this was the only style of beer I would not get excited about beer.  But for what it is I think its above average.

America is still catching up in the Pilsner category. Its a great taste for warmer weather, and the countrys future is bright in this category. So, any step forward is a positive. Prima Pils from Victory Brewing bites and fizzes like a good pilsner should. But the flavor of stinky Noble Hops is an acquired skunky taste with a vegetable-like finish. Pilsners are great beers. I applaud the effort, but would look elsewhere in this category. For a positive comment, the flavor is present and upfront.

Bottle.  Pours golden and yellow with a sizable frothy white head.  Aromas of straw, hay, and some citrusy hops.  Flavor is sweet caramel, bitter pine, and a grassy finish.  Very smooth, creamy, and moderate carbonation.  Really refreshing, good stuff.

First rating of a pilsener.  12 ounce bottle.  Pours a clear pale yellow-gold (like watered down apple juice) with thin layer of white foam.  Aroma is hoppy (lemon, sweet floral) along with bready malts and some yeast.  Flavor is dry and lightly hoppy with a hint of spice.  Very light mouthfeel and dry finish.  Okay, but I would like to try this on draft.  (1529, 263)

12 oz bottle from the LCBO, served in a pilsener glass. Pours clear straw-yellow with a tall frothy white head. Head has good retention and leaves good lace. Aroma is fresh but slightly restrained, primarily herbs and grass, with a touch of straw malts. Flavour begins with dry toasted malts. Hop bitterness enters towards the finish. Long finish recapitulates the hoppy aroma. On the palate, light-medium in body with a watery texture and fizzy carbonation. Overall, this is a crisp and refreshing pilsener. Quite dry overall. The aroma could be more pungent and the malts are rather simple. 2010-03-24

Pours pale yellow with a good sized, white head. Aroma of straw and hops. Clean aroma, sharp. Nice lacing and lively carbonation. A distinctively bitter flavour and also a lingering, bitter finish. A satisfying pilsner but not for the faint of hops.
Nice pilsner.  Had it on tap.  Was a light pale color with nice thick head.  malty aroma.  Very crisp taste.  Full flavor pilsner but very light at the same time.  Really refreshing.

12oz. bottle served in a pilsner glass. Poured a clear straw with two fingers of white head. Fragrant noble hop aroma. Light bodied. Crisp hop bite with some toasty malt. Drying hop finish. Nice American version of a pilsner. Very easy drinking beer.

Transparent yellow with a creamy white head.  Potent aroma of citrus and grass.  Creamy mouthfeel with grainy malt flavors.  Clean finish.  Very good beer, cant say Ive had many better in this style.

The color is a light, yellow straw-color. Very clear, but with a fluffy white head. Decent carbonation. Slightly above average-looking for a pilsner.

Smell is a nice combination of some sweet biscuity malt and a hint of wheat. An unusual hop presence; Im shocked there is any at all! Rich, sweet smell for a lighter beer.

Bitter German malt flavor is actually delicious. Combines bitterness with a sweet, flowery malt as well. Some nice wheat, even a hint of berry. Hops are light, but they are there. Really rich compared to most pilsners.

Feel is bitter on the tongue. Thick for a pilsner, and a bit sandpapery. Still, a clean finish; bitter feel but no film. Fizzy as it warms. Its a lighter beer with some body and rich flavor. Big-time repeater for sure.

Bouteilles de 12 oz. Arômes subtils de houblon herbacé et floral et de céréales fraîches. Robe blonde très pâle, légère mousse blanche. Très bien équilibrée en bouche, les céréales sont savoureuses et bien présentes sans jamais devenir sucrées. Le houblon herbacé et floral crée une belle amertume agréable et équilibrée. Finale bien sèche. Une très bonne Pils.
Yellow-Gold Color. Aroma is of grass and hops. Taste is also of such, and crisp. Not bad.

Tap.  Pours a rather bright hazy yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma is full of citrusy, floral hops.  A bit of yeasty funk comes in with the flavor. Finishes dry.  Very tasty and crisp, but it doesnt have the malt backbone I really love in Czech pilsners.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2011 12oz bottle - Interesting to try a pilsener from Victory.  Smells pretty terrible and the hazy yellow doesnt lend itself to a higher rating.  The taste is substantially better than your average pilsener, but this beer still leaves me wanting something else.  Nice mouth feel.  Probably will not re-buy considering the cost.  2nd rating on 3.13.11 - slightly higher, really digging the mellow bitterness this time around.  Nice drinkability / still smells and looks terrible.

Hazy yellow pour from a 12 oz bottle. Aroma dominated by grassy hops. Light body with strong hops kick in the finish. Nice, distinctive, and tasty, but lacks a bit in subtlety, grace, and balance when compared to other first rate pilseners.

Appearance: Light yellow with a proud frothy snow white head. Aroma: Serious grassy hops, lots of hay, some mild floral notes too. Flavour: Bitter at first, lots of nice bitter hops with an enjoyable grassiness (could my aversion to Saaz hops be abating?) quite malty too. What an enjoyable Pisener... very nice. Very refreshing.

Sampled in 12 oz bottle. Crisp and clear with small head on it. Aroma is very nice with sweet hops. Flavor is a classic pilsner with really nice hopping to it. Drinks really refreshing and smooth. By far one of the best pilsners out there.

12oz bottle, best by May 8, 2010.  Pours pale golden with a nice fizzy and frothy white head that maintains a small cap and leaves some clumpy, although short-lived, rings of lacing.  Aroma is heavy on grassy, earthy hops, some floral hops, a little fruit, white grapes even, along with a little funk and sourdough bread.  Flavor has some citrus mixed in with the other hop flavors and bitterness, balanced against some bready, malty sweetness.  Very flavorful.  Good body for the style, medium carbonation.  Drinks very nicely and is quite refreshing.  I think this is the best pilsener Ive had to date.

I thought I would like this more as I love a good pilsner, but I was a little underwhelmed. It ours a nice clear golden color with a small fizzy white head. The aroma is grainy with some hops and apples in the background. The flavor is very dry and hoppy. A good beer but lacks a little style IMO.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy lemon-juice yellow, foamy white head. Armoa is grass, light citrus, and somewhat surprisingly yeasty bread. Initial flavor is bready, quickly giving way to grassy hops, a touch of citrus, and peppery spices. Light hop bitterness on finish, dry and crisp. Refreshing and drinkable, quite a nice beer.

I call this beer "the converter"  For the masses of uneducated beer drinkers who plug away every saturday drinking bud, coors and miller lite, I hand them one of these and watch.  Within seconds they realize this full bodied beer is now their new favorite beer. Floral flavors and crisp hops are this beers trademark flavors.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2010 12oz bottle from LCBO. As a general rule I hate pilsners, but this one is exceptional. Tastes more like an IPA but with massive hop bite. Very pleasantly bitter, and like the description says it has a dry finish. Probably my favorite pilsner ever.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2010 Not really a fan of Prima.  Its very dry and grassy.  Ive noticed that their beers are often grassy.

Edited a few months later: They must have had a problem with grass flavors from their hops or something because I dont get any grass at all anymore.  This is an absolutely fantastic German Pils.
Im a fan of traditional pilsners and this is a really good one.  A little hops and a really light clean flavor and finish.  Good example of a Pilsner without being too bitter.
12 oz bottle (2010) into a pint glass.  The malt is subtle and the hops are there, but overall its a bit minerally and too dry.
Clear yellow pour with a white head. Aroma of hops, malt, light fruit and spices. Taste is malt, little sweet, nice spicy hop aftertaste. Crisp, tasty beer. Nice lacing.
An excellent pilsner.  Aroma is clean and crisp.  Taste follows with a hint of fruit.  A favorite in s style that is decidedly not.

Pours a pretty hazy bright yellow color with a tall, frothy white head that fades to a good sized topper for the brew. Aroma has a strong lemon nose, mildly spicy with a sharp citrus note. This citrus note is so strong that when a deep breath is inhaled and strikes the tongue provides a lemon flavor just from the aroma. Flavor has a mild lemon fruity note early that fades to a light citrus acidic presence, a light spicy hops note comes out in the middle and finishes with a very light grainy pils note. Body is light but very lively from the high carbonation. Overall a fantastic brew with a great nose and mild flavor, making it a terrific brew almost any time.

12oz bottle from Whole Foods (Tampa, FL). Pours a generally clear light clear yellow color with a one finger foamy white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of grain, yeast, wheat, citrus, lemon, honey, grass, light floral esters. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of honey, wheat, yeast, hops, citrus, lemon, grassy and floral esters with a lingering hop presence toward finish. Light body with a pleasing floral hop and malt finish.

average pilsener color- golden yellow with a thick-bubbled white head. Aroma is of light breads and hops, flavor is very crisp with a little hop sting in the back end. Very clean and very easy to drink. Darn good. Bottle at Whole Foods
Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is light malt and grassy hop. Flavour is malt, hoppy (Saaz), light diacetyl. Nice pilsener.

this is a damn good pilsner. Bottle: pours straw yellow. with thin white head. Very nice floral arouma, hoppy, citrus, and dough. Fruity esters, apples and bananas and a caramel malt profile. Nice, complex hoppy finish, planty and citrus. excellent to pair with food.

12oz bottle from yhe LCBO
Pours cloudy light yello with a small head  
The aroma is sweet wet grass light sweetness,

Bottle.  Poured a straw yellow color with an average sized foamy white head.  Nose is light grain and citrusy, grassy hops.  Medium bodied with ample carbonation.  As far as the flavor, if all Pilsners tasted like this Id be a much bigger Pils fan.  Good malt foundation with a nice dose of earthy, citrus hops.  Mild bitterness from start through the finish.  This is a great beer.

( 12oz bottle) This beer pours a very light yellow color reminiscent of pale lagers, but with a nice 2 finger head. No lacing whatsoever, but nice bubbles throughout. Nose fo slightly citrusy hops, but the Pilsner bitter is there too. Taste of light citrus hops, better as it warms, creamy and clean finish with good coating in the mouth. An excellent pilsner.

pours a golden color with a thick, foamy white head...lively looking and nice lacing.  aroma has maltiness at first and then some grassiness, and light citrus notes (lemongrass).    flavor is more hoppy than the aroma suggests...very earthy and spicy.  reminds me of saaz...very nice!  moutfeel is light, lively, and refreshing.  very crisp and a nice dry finish.  great, refreshing pils!

Bottle.  Pours a clear golden yellow with a white-capped foam head.  The aroma is quite hoppy for a pilsener.  Very nice flavor which is again quite hoppy but there are some subdued malt flavors under there as well.  Dry mouthfeel and a long bitter finish.

Pours straw to very pale copper with moderate creamy white head.  Laces very favorably.  Aroma is surprisingly hoppy with sharp citrus tinge, mellowing to a slight doughy scent.  Flavor starts as cereal with a hint of malt sweetness but gives way to a nice bitter punch.  Medium body with tight crisp finish.  I am not a big pilsner fan, but a really nicely crafted brew

Pours a pale straw colour with a moderately thick white head.  Aroma is quite hoppy, with a little bit of sweet citrus fruit.  Taste is fantastic.  Mildly sweet moving to a slightly bitter finish.  Medium body with a very clean texture and finish.  Overall, not a particularly complex beer, but it executes on the Pilsener style perfectly.

This clear pale yellow beer pours into a flute with an attractive white head and a banana and yeast aroma. There is a crisp pale malt flavor with a bit of banana ester and subtle hop bitterness. A very nice pilsener.
Smells of corn and cereal and pours clear yellow. Very complex for a pilsner and well balanced.  The flavor is light and easily drinkable.

A nice, stiff hoppy Pilsener.  Presents itself with a frothy head and plenty of bubble activity.  The Saaz hops is executed very well.  Full palate and rich in the mouth.  I would give this a higher rating but there was something in the finish I didnt love.   Maybe a thin bitterness or sourness that wasnt part of the hop profile?  Older hops?  Pelletized hops?   However, still a good beer and I love to see craft-brewed pilseners.  One of my all time favorite styles.   Also check out Stoudts Pils.

Pours yellow and slightly hazy with big white head. Aroma is very nice and clean, crisp floral and citrus. Flavor hits you right away with a lot of bitter but clean herbal hops...a bit more bitter than I expected. But it does leave a nice clean aftertaste with a touch of subtle sweet malt. I began to enjoy it more towards the end of the glass. Very refreshing, but a touch too bitter, otherwise very nice.

Pours a perfectly clear yellow with a frothy white head. Nose is floral hops with some crisp sweet malt, nice wafts of citrus and lemon zest. Flavor is a sharp hop bitterness, followed by nice citrus and floral flavors along side just enough sweet to balance it out. FInishes dry and bitter. Excellent Pilsner.

Prima Pils on tap at the Falling Rock. The beer was golden yellow and clear. The head was white and loosely packed. The smell was earthy, dirty, hops. Some mineral too. The taste was also very earthy and slightly crisp. This might be really good for the style but I dont like lagers so I dont know. This was a good choice for a hot day however.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 04-30-2007 17:14:28

Poured from a 12oz bottle. This was great. It poured a clear golden color with a thin head. The aroma is of hops with a floral notes. The taste is just the right bitterness with real clean crisp finish. A must try!!

Pours a crystal clear gold with a thin white ring of foam. Aroma is spicy noble hops and light malt sweetness. Excellent stiff hop presence in the taste, malting is definitely backgrounded, a bit of alcohol, and a lovely herbal finish. Good carbonation, crisp body. This is not my favourite style, but this is an excellent beer - very well-balanced and complex. Prima!

Milky yellow with a large white fluffy head, slowly fading with spider web lacing.  Aroma of spicy noble hops, sweet malt and grains.  Taste of spicy noble hops, pale malt and light citrus.  Semi dry with a mild bitter finish.
Poured light golden in color with a frothy, well-retained head. Nose is grassy hops and taste is grassy hops too. Simple and elegant pilsner.

golden with a lasting head, mmmm hoppy as fuck, almost chlorine pool smell, freshly CHAINSAWED hedge, pine, thats a hell of a hop smell.. fuckin ipas dont got shit, almost pinesol ungh. astringent, alcohol, hops, pine. perfect palate for a pilsner. yes. yes
light and golden smelled like lager tasted hops and bread very drinkable and sessionable very good pils

Bottle served in a footed pilsner. Pale yellow (maybe a slight haze) in color with a large frothy white head. Nice. Aroma is hay and dough. Light body, but surprisingly full of hops. Finishes with a bitter applause. If I there was a brew apocalypse and only three beers were left in the world: Bud, Victory Pils, and Mirror Pond, I would choose the Pils.

355 ml bottle. From Germany (bierzwerg.de).
Hazy pale yellow/golden colour with small white head.
Strong floral hoppy aroma. Floral grassy bitter hoppy flavour. 
Long bitter hoppy aftertaste. Good hoppy Pilsener.
Straw colored with a white foam head.  Grassy hop aroma -  Medium/Heavy carbonation -  citrus flavors bring sweetness, but are well balanced by the hops giving it a slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2011 On tap at Birch & Barley in D.C..  Pours a clear pale yellow with small head that leaves quickly, and some lacing.  Medium body, low carbonation, and light lemon aroma.  The taste is light malt and a punch of bitter hops that lingers.
Bought this in a Victory Variety pack. a big fan of this hoppy pilsener. Bitterness and hops. Def. drinkable.

Thanks for the recommendation Mitch.  A very soft aroma with hints of sunny lemons and hay.  Beautiful colours that remind me of a hazy lemonade made with sparkling water.  Nice hoppy bite with the addition of grassy hay, citrus fruits, bazooka bubblegum, and a nice dry finish.  A little thin on the tongue, but a great thirst quencher.  Much more drinkable than the fizzy water that Bud squeezes out of god knows what!

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2009 (12 ounce beer - pint glass)  Pours a light yellow golden color.  Light head but it still has a great thick lacing.  Aroma is an equal balance of malt and hops.  Citrus hops matched with a hay malt.  Taste is more hops but it is not overpowering like alot of ipas I have had.  Downside to that is the mouthfeel is a little watery.  Lively carbonation,  thin body and oily texture.  Overall I think this will make a great session beer.
Bottle. Yellow with a nice white head. Tastes like grapefruit, bubblegum, and is very sweet. Hoppy dry finish. Very drinkable, excellent example of the style.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with loose white head. Aroma is floral with grass, grain, and citrus. Flavors of grapefruit, melon, strawberry, and bubblegum. Very hoppy with dry finish. Not very malty. Soft texture with light body. An inviting drinkability.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden color with a decent white head.  Surprising aromas of pine.  Also aroma of dough on a deep inhale.  Grapefruit and grassy flavors.  Tastes like a hybrid b/w an IPA and a Pilsener.  Light to medium bodied.  Pretty heavy carbonation.  Its overall rating is high due to its nuances and textures.

(bottle). Cloudy golden color. Medium white head. Light citrus aroma. Flavor of light malt, light hop spiciness, and light lemon. Avg duration. Slightly dry finish. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.
Sweet grassy bread hop aroma. Big white foamy head that disappeared quickly with bubbles clearly seen thru yellow golden body. Sweet, bubbly, clean hoppy taste.

12oz bottle. Pours clear pale yellow with a small head that goes away a bit fast. Nose quite citrusy, quite malty and quite hoppy. Taste is malty and crisp. quite bitter, especially on the finish. Quite dry. Quite drinkable. Overall this looks quite bitter and not as fruity and malty as some other good pils I had. Lets blame it on the uncertain freshness of the bottle !

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2009 I have very little experience with Pils, most of it unimpressive, but I was quite pleased with this beer.  The aroma in a Pils is usually my least favorite part, but Prima has a nice mild citrus aroma that I find capable if not downright pleasing.  The head is quite impressive, and the color is exactly what youd expect from a Pils; I dont really know what a 2 score for appearance would be, and Im trying to be fair to the style on the score.  Taste has the somewhat spicy note of the Saaz that you usually see in Pilsners, but its a bit more aggressive and has nice lemon zest finish.  This is a very good beer, even a great one, and its eminently drinkable.  I just wish this was the kind of beer we could buy for 7 bucks a sixer, or at least 12 for 12.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2010 Victory Brewing Company--Prima Pils--2004 12 oz. Bottle.  5.20% ABV--30 IBUs?   (4.25 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Mild lace head.  Clear bright thin yellow color.  Very light sediment.  Medium floral Saaz hop front.  Crisp clean zesty buttery butterscotch citrus mild sweet tasty Pils body.  Mild creamy clean hop citrus end.  Sampled 2/14/2005.

Victory Brewing Company--Prima Pils--2007 12 oz. Bottle.  5.30% ABV--35 IBUs.?  (4.5 / 5.0)  Pilsner--3 @ $1.99 Each.  Mild lace thin white head.  Clear bright deep yellow color.  Floral Saaz hop front.  Mild creamy smooth snappy butter mild sweet citrus Pils body.  Zesty hop spice mild citrus refreshing clean end.  Sampled 11/26/2007.

Victory Brewing Company--Prima Pils--American Pilsner Beer--2009 22 oz. Bottle.  5.30% ABV--35 IBUs.?  (4.4 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Frothy lacy white classic Pils head.  Clear bright rich yellow color.  Crisp aromatic herbal Saaz hop front.Mild sweet soft butter caramel rich Pils malt body.Dry clean refreshing bitter hop spice mild citrus end.  Rich crisp herbal Pils.Best American Pils?  Sampled 11/27/2009.  2 @ $5.99 Each.

Sample at Buckeye Beer Engine. Pours clear yellow with a big white head. Creamy malt nose with some subtle hops. Sweet malt flavor with a bitter hop finish. Good for the style I guess, but not as good as I had heard.

On tap at Collins Pub.  Pours a pale gold with off white head and some lacing.  This was at the end of my night so notes are scarce.  Aromas are slighly caramel but also a bit of earthy and grapefruit.  Tastes fresh of citrus and finishes on a bitter grapefruit.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2010 Bottle. Clear golden-yellow with thin white head. Aroma is very floral and light earthiness, notes of bubblegum. Strong pilsener taste, good amount of hop kick, again very floral. Nice bitter bite, excellent pilsneser
Pours a nice golden yellow with loads of white head.  Aroma is pretty noble, somewhat spicy.  Flavor is herbal, spicy, piney, followed by malt.  Mouthfeel nice and light.  A fine brew.

Pours a very light color with a fluffy white head and good carbonation.  Nice floral, hop and just a touch of malty sweetness on the nose.  Taste is crisp, hoppy bitterness and a nice amount of citrus undertones.  Gorgeous finish.  Makes you want to drink a lot more than one.
Has very light color, very similar to a light lager. Has a aromas of hops and malts, I also detected a little bit of honey, stragely enough. Enjoyable but I expected a little bit more.

A: Poured with a large, creamy white head that slowly dissipated down to a full 2-fingers, where it stayed for the duration of drinking. Fair lacing on the sides of the glass. Body is light yellow and clear, with a slight touch of haziness.

S: Bit of cooked corn, but very minor compared to so many other pilseners. Fruitiness comes through the most... lemon, apples, and others.

T: An extremely refreshing, fruity taste that finishes with a nice, crisp bitterness. Just awesome.

M: Light-bodied with a creamy texture, and average carbonation.

D: Without a doubt the best pilsener Ive had yet... and I dont know if Ill ever have a better one.

Sampled at 2009 Pittsburgh Brufest. Easily the best Pilsener Ive ever had. Nice floral hop notes in the aroma. Good citrus flavor that finished slightly dry and bitter. Yet another world class beer from Victory.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy straw yellow.  Thin head.  Massive hops on the nose.  Lots of floral hops, almost soapy on the palate.  Citrus.  Crisp, bitter finish.  A serious pilsener.  Probably the hoppiest pilsener Ive tried.

Bottle. had this many times at the brewery and finally rating it... light malty hop aroma, golden yellow body with light head... flavor is very crisp, hop and citrus without too much... nice bitter and dry aftertaste... a nice pils
I enjoyed this one quite a bit.  The simple flavor is refreshing, but its still complicated enough to be interesting.

355 ml bottle (from a 6 pac), purchased at the LCBO Rideau and King Edward (Ottawa) on  November 1st 2009. Pale blonde, thin head. Aroma of dry floral hops, a little citrus. Taste of grass hopped, dry and almost no bitterness. Pleasant light taste!

Bottle. Poured in a standard pint glass.  Nice pour with a light white head and a somewhat urine-esque color.  Typical pilsner aroma but definitely heavy on the hops on the palate with citrus and bitter finish.  Nice pilsner.
Bottle. Clear pale gold pour with a white fluffy head. Aroma of hops, florals, and a hint of citrus. The taste is colossal hops, citrus, and grass with a nice bitter finish.
Bottle, 12 fl. oz. Pours a clear pale yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is hops. The flavor is hops (saaz) and diacetyl. The palate is dry and bitter. Overall a good but bitter beer.
Tap at taco mac in atlanta.  Clear yellow pour with finger of bright white head.  Aroma of floral herbs and grain. Taste of lemon citrus and the grain.  Light bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2011 Poured from bottle into Pilsner glass.

Clear, bright gold with a stark white head.

Aroma of fresh cut grass, straw and some spiciness.

Backbone of fruit (apple, pear?), bread, grass and straw which is quickly overtaken by a very spicy finish. Leaves a persistent bitter aftertaste.

Moderate carbonation (but lower than many Pils; I like it) and relatively smooth light to medium body. Finishes exceedingly dry.

Damn good Pils; in fact, maybe the best. What else is there to say?

355ml bottle 
5.3% ABV 
I tried this beer on September 5, 2009 after purchasing a 6 pack from one of the local LCBO outlets.  The beer poured a translucent medium gold colour with a thin white head that quickly disappeared to a ring.  The aroma was grass, musk, and hops.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied and medium carbonation.  The flavour was a nice balance of hops and malt, with a yeasty note.  Very good.

Bottle. 10 days past best before. Pours a hazy light yellow with a white head. Good lacing. Sweetish, clean, crisp hop aroma with a sharp citrus/lemon note in the background. Flavour is hoppy and bitter, and has the same citrus/lemon note as the aroma. Lingering hop bitterness with grassy notes in the finish. Overall quite alright, but the citrus/lemon note is a bit like the one found in German biermischgetränke, which is  not really my thing, so lower score for that. 29-10-09.
Bottle. Heavy straw, grain and dried hops. Taste is nice, refreshing grain and hop mix, resinous. Great balance in this almost APA pilsener.

Tap @ Brasserie420
Pours a white persistent creamy head, very nicely carbonated with very small boubbles surfacing extreemely slowly.
Gold in color with a green shine just like traditional czech pilsners.
Floreal herbal aromas with a slight subtle sulfur note. Overwhelming hops for a pils stile, very grassy like at the start with a long resinous finish. Thin body, but still not too thin, carbonation plays a role in this beer.
Well brewed and poured with a nice pils stile fat head.
Great Beer!!!

UPDATED: APR 18, 2011 Bottle courtesy of Fratto.  Welp, looks like Im against the grain yet again. Hazed lemon-drop pour. Smell has some grainy pilsner notes. Light scents. Some soured elements as well. Upfront bitter. Hops fill out the middle with a rough finish. Dry to the bone. Rough finish. 1.5
RE-RATE 4/18/11 Bottle from World Market.  Pours a very clear golden yellow color with lots of carbonation bubbles apparent. The head is formed after a bit of agitation and forms into a foamy white crest.

The aroma is dry and malty, with a strong element of grains and a hint of citric fruit. Fairly straightforward by style standards. Smells very dry.

Flavor is dry to be certain, with grainy flavors, bitter malts with a hint of fruit with a dry and bitter grainy finish. Hops are felt and tasted as well and appear as a sharp bittering agent. As far as the style goes, this is very representative of what it should be. Its just honestly not one of my favorite styles, but I cant knock em for that!
Bottle from the World Market in Arlington.  Smells like old garbage.  Really dry, but I cant really taste much.  Aftertaste is bitter and much better than the actual taste.

Pours clear yellow golden color with white head. Saez hop aroma with a bit of grapefruit rind. Sweet, fruity, slightly bitter and hoppy. Light to medium body with lively carbonation. Crisp, dry and refreshing, a very nice pils.

On tap at the Brick Store Pub in Decatur, GA, 04/26/08. Pale golden colour with a mostly lasting frothy white head. Grassy, toasty, and lightly herbal aroma with some spicy notes. Crisp toasty, biscuit malt flavours with an herbal and grassy hoppy but only lightly bitter finish. Light to medium bodied, refreshing, very drinkable. Really nice pilsner.

With limited experience of true pilsners, I will say this is the best pils I have ever had.  full of hop flavours including nuts and maybe even some mild hints of citrus.  heavy hop flavour on the palate.  Served cold, this becomes an easy-drinking beer that is still full of flavour.

straw pour with med head with serious bitterness.  too much for me

Much carbonation; did I mention hoppy?

12 oz bottle. Clear straw yellow with a pure white, long lasting, fluffy head and visible carbonation. Aroma is full of spicy hops and bready malt. The flavor has lots of hop bitterness with a good sweet malt balance. Light to medium body with highly active carbonation and a dry bitter finish. This is a very full flavored German Pilsener, its nice to see a lighter beer not sacrifice flavor.

Opaque yellow with fluffy head that has plenty of lacing. First taste brings back memories of Munich. Hops are there, lemon notes make an appearance and has a clean bitter finish. Light but not watery mouthfeel, bit of a zing from the carbonation. Very enjoyable.

courtesy of Allen - At last, I have been able to put my hands and my nose on this old classic; slightly hazy golden-yellow colour; little white foam; dusty and very hoppy nose with notes of flowers, citrus, apple and grapefruit; good malt body and with a juicy palate, solidly bitter; quite dry and long bitter fruity and flowery finish - tasty and with a lot of character: a fantastic brew

UPDATED: APR 29, 2012 First ratingBottle at Rotary Pub, Göteborg. On October 10, 2009Hazy yellow color, big white fluffy head. Fruity scent. 
Bitter and malty taste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness.6/3/6/3/12=3.0RerateDraught at Tequesta Brewing Co, FL, on Jan 28, 2011Guest tapHazy yellow color, white head. Hoppy, fruity, sweet, bitter, citrus taste. Moussy mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Mango and hoppy scent.7/3/7/3/14=3.4RerateBottle on The Old Beefeater Inn, Göteborg, on April 28, 2012, BB May 11, 2011We didnt say anything, but the waitor realized they had sold an old bottle and gave us money back, thats service!Hazy straw yellow color, smallish white head. Lemon, dough, hoppy scent. sweet, malty, dough taste. Moussy mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.6/3/6/3/12=3.0
Bottle. Poured a slightly hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma was full of grains with subtle citrus hops. Flavor was very clean and crisp with a touch of malts and hops. Very easy driking

Taster at Great Lost Bear - Poured a nice yellow amber in color with a bright white head.  Aroma is of grassy hops with a hint of citrus.  Flavor also strong in hops, but plenty of malts (caramel) backing them up.  This is a very good Pils...

Bottle.
Has a clear light yellow body with a light white head.

A very impressive pour.
Close your eyes, you are in Europe.
Not Victorys "attempt" at a Pils, but a genuine, high quality Pils.
Very nice.

Bottle. Pale yellow colour with medium white head. Aroma hoppy, grass, citrus.
Taste hoppy, , quite watery, good bitter finish, lacking some malt. A decent pilsener but lacking a lot of body and malt to be amongst the best.

On tap, wasnt given a head. Light yellow color. Earthy hop, lager malt aroma. Malty, surprisingly hoppy flavor, some citrus and grass. Quite carbonated and a dry finish.  Very drinkable and very good.
Bottle. High fluffy white lasting head. Clear light yellow body. Mild malty hoppy aroma Slightly sour hoppy malty caramel flavor with low carbonation and short aftertaste. Quite good actually.

12oz bottle, clean yellow color, with a pillowy white head, fresh cut herbal, floral hop saaz nose, with a leafy, grassy bouquet of hoppiness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp sweet light honeyed pale, pilsener malt, flowery hop, leafy character, with an earthy peppery saaz hoppy accent, and a hint of zesty, citrusy, lime, lemon peel, leading towards a grassy, leafy hop bitterness finish.

I am convinced that Victory is incapable of making anything less than excellent beer.

Pours a pure golden colour and smells hoppy, fresh and very slightly citriussy.

Taste is sharp - hops and some malt and even a small herbal component.  What remains is a nice, mild hoppiness that destroys thirst without overpowering the taste buds.  And man, does it ever go down easily.

I really hope that this becomes an LCBO  regular.

Draft. Pours hazy golden, with a creamy, thick white head. Aroma of hops, juniper, clove, and hints of malt. Medium bodied with a sturdy, crisp finish. Carbonation is well balanced with the hops. Excellent pilsner from Victory.
bottle -go lden pils with a small white head . great hops aroma but not overly heavy on the hops flavor.

Bottle - Pours clear yellow with a big frothy white head. Smells of soap, sweet malt, barley, light melon--its just crisp and clean. Taste is sweet but not overpowering. Theres smooth and slightly bitter malt with perfumy and floral notes. Tingling hops dance on the finish, but theres just too much carbonation. Put a bottle of this in a mix-six, but will definitly grab a 6 when I need something easy to drink.

Bottle - 355ml. Hazy blond body with a lasting white foamy head. Fresh, complex hoppy aroma with flowery, herbal, coriander and honeyish hints. Its sharp hoppy taste carries citrusy, malty, and coriander notes. It ends with a long, robust, dry bitter/herbal finish. Awesome!
Bottle. Poured golden with a thin white head. Hoppy citrus and floral aroma. The flavor has more floral with a backing of citrus and caramel. Light body and a mild bitterness.

12 oz. bottle: The aroma is of flowery, grassy hops with a lightly sweet straw/pale malt component. A pale yellow colour with a fluffy and stable white head, leaving a nice lacing on the glass. The flavour has an outstanding noble hop complexity: Grassy and fruity, but also resinous and leaf-like. Those flavours are not bold but kept subtle and appropriate. The bitterness is higher medium for the style. An appetising, high quality Pils.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2010 Bottled. Beautiful pale yellow (very pale indeed) beer with a lacing white head. Absolutely fantastic aroma of sweat, gooseberries, pineapple, clotted cream, wonderful hops, blood orange, rose, elderflower, wild strawberries and basil. Great taste where the gooseberry component is rather present. A cheeky  interpretation of the style. Long dryish finish which is reminiscent of tropical fruit. Good bitterness. Complex. Definitely a top notch Pilsener. Flawless. Incredible. A "must try" for any fan of the style.

12oz Bottle. Pours a very golden yellow colour. Very tasty and easy to drink. I could  drink 37 of these and not feel a buzz. Solid brew overall, definately the best pilsner I have ever had. Then again I am stuck with canadian pilsners who eat a big bag of dicks.
light hazy straw, whispy head. nose; bright hopiness, sharp citrus, fresh bread, forest, almost piney. goes down beautifully, clean, fresh, hoppy, very tasty, very refreshing.

Reminds me of the pilsners that can only be gotten on tap in Germany.  Color, head, aroma are as good as it gets for a pils.  Flavor is amazing.  This is as good a bottled pilsner that can be found stateside.

Bottle.  Pours a fairly clear straw color with a nice white fizzy head.  Nose is fresh wheat, gentle hops (saaz?) and a bit of lemony.  Crisp, highly refined flavor.  The hops are gentle and meld perfectly with the bright, citric qualities.  Has only a bit of lingering bitterness.  Not quite as good as the CBC pilseners from Victory, but a pleasure to drink nonetheless.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, hops and notes of caramel and flowers.

bottle: pint glass: pours a mostly clear pale straw with green tinge, one finger head.  The nose is very grainy, some of that green bottle skunk but actually not too bad.  The taste reveals bitters at first, chewing gives up some lights yeasts maybe biscuits, finishing bitter.

Glad I found this in ontario. Definitely the best pilsener Ive had. Nice amount of hops up front with maybe a little bit of citrus. Mouth feel is just right on the carbonation, really refreshing and a good beer.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a white head of good  duration, with some lacing, over a clear pale yellow (SRM 3) clear body....nose is floral hops with some cereal tones.....taste initially is light biscuit, later balancing mild to medium  hop bitterness arrives, and lingers....mouth feel is light,  carbonation more medium and lends a slightly creamy balance. This is a light refreshing beer, which is an excellent example of the style.

12 oz bottle. Pours a pale opaque golden color. Moderate head. Aroma is very hoppy and floral. Taste was bitter as expected, and it nullifies any doughy/yeasty taste you can get from another pilsener. Palate was rough, but nice full feeling in the mouth, nice crisp aftertaste. Good alternative to the typical American Pilsener

Bottla at home. Pours a crystal clear pale yellow with a white head and a little lacings. Dry and quite bitter. Aromas grass, straw and hops. Medium to light bodied. Medium carbonation. Nice with the high bitterness and the relatively light body. Long crispy dry finish. Good.
clear yellow with almost no head, smells of grass, dust and some hops. tastes of hops and fruits but mostly hops. nothing super special going on here.
Skunked and shitty hay aroma. Hazy yellow with a greenish hue, headless. Bitter lemon grass with a lemon zest finish. Slightly oxidized. Could be much better.
Bottle. Pours a Clear yellow with a thin white head. Nice noble hop, mint and grass aroma with a touch of malt. Smooth crisp malt highlighted by spicy bitter hoppiness. Wonderful pilsener.

Bottle: Pours very light yellow, pretty flimsy white head that left to a small white line.  Aroma is sweet and malty, some grassy characteristics, floral Saaz hops fairly evident.  Flavour is initially all hops, a great helping of floral and citrus bitterness, but I soon found a really nice biscuity maltiness, just a touch of sweetness.  Lots of bitter in the finish, but an all around good brew.

Bottle.  Pours a brilliant clear golden straw with a long lasting rocky white head.  Aroma is mostly hops, grassy, floral and citrus.  Flavor is mostly the same hops combined with some standard pils characteristics, a bit of spice and even some weird skunk.  Very dry.  Light on the palate and generously carbonated.

12 oz bottle from LCBO.  Pours pale golden, straw coloured, with big frothy white head.  Good head retention, leaving a little lace on the glass.  Aroma is hoppy, flavour starts crisp and finishes with bitter hops.  A great Pilsner.

12 oz bottle from LCBO.  Pours a clear yellow gold with lasting soapy white head.  Strong, crisp pils hops in the nose with grass and citrus as well.  Starts like a normal pils but much more hoppy, lots of citrus and some spice.  Big bitter finish.  Probably the hoppiest pilsner Ive had but thats not so bad.

Bottled, 355ml from Bellingers Garage, Grove, Oxon. Yellow gold with white head. Very impressive Pilsener, there is a good solid initial maltiness, not grainy but nice and biscuity, sharp, then the main show is plenty of lemony, citric hops, quite oily butflavoursome. Lots of bitterness, surprisingly so in this type of beer. Really pretty enjoyable, id love to try it on a hot summers evening, but we dont get many of them.
A pale golden beer with a decent head. The aroma was peppery. The taste was peppery hops, was very smooth, & is a flavorful pilsener.

Poured a pale golden yellow with a big white head. 
Nose was clean and feint hops. 
Taste is nice, not too much of a pilsner taste, body is mild and slightly sweet like a pale ale, nice hoppiness. tastes like a bland beer with some nice hop bitterness and flavor.
Light and refreshing. Pale yellow pour with a white head. Aroma of pale malts and hops. Flavor is light with nice hops bitterness at the finish.

Bottle.  Really impressed by this beer.  Pours a bright pee-yellow, Clean white head that lasts a long time.  Not much of a smell, slightly hoppy.  Taste is great. Crisp, clean, a little touch of hop bitterness.  Little bit of spicyness on the tongue as well.  Goes down very easy and clean, highly recommended.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2009 Bottle. Voldby Ølmesse. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Standard pilsner, how it can get so high ratings I dont understand. Maybee its because it doesnt have so many ratings....

Bottle: Clear, pale golden with a greenish sheen, quite stable white lacy head; very solid aromatic piney hoppy nose with some shy pale-malty support; full dry bitter flavour, soft and light bodied; dry - very hoppy - bitter finish. Good hoppy stuff, but lacks the presence of a malty body, that is necessary to become an excellent Pils..........

Bottle . A pale golden color with a small short lasting white head , small amount of lacing left . Aroma of light sweet malt and grassy floral hops , some light lemon notes. Flavor is crisp lightly skunky hops , lightly toasted sweet malt , a little spice and honey . A surprinsingly full body for the style , nice level of bitterness , crisp clean mouthfeel , medium to heavy carbonation, nice hoppy finish . Very sessionable and a good beer all around .

Pours a hazy yellow with a half inch white head that laces nicely. Aroma is all saaz.. Bright, yet musty, oily and dirty... Nice. The taste is quite nice as well. A very nice classy pilsner. Thanks for bringing this back for me Savvy1982!

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2011 A fantastic pilsener from the United States, an all too rare feat.  Prima Pils pours bright yellow with a big white head that leaves plenty of lacing.  The aroma is fresh grain and strong, sharp, spicy hops.  It smells like a wet barley field with a strong whiff of lemon peel shavings and apple slices.  The flavor is fairly hoppy for the style, but theres a wonderful malt presence.  Its a thirst-quenching beer that doesnt cut corners.

12 oz bottle poured into pilsner. Pours a wonderful semi-transparent gold with a good white head that diminishes relatively quickly. The aroma is fruity with floral overtones. Soft and light on the palate but still wonderfully full of flavor. Notes of hops, but not overwhelming, creating a nice, slightly bitter end. Wonderful beer.

Appearance is great with a huge head that lasts and laces the whole way down. Pours a golden yellow, almost completely clear with active carbonation.

Smells lightly citrusy and piney, very subtle but nice.

Tastes damn good, good to have a real lager once in a while. Not much bitter or bite, just smooth and balanced goodness.

Mouth is thicker than expected but it actually works well here.

I could session the hell out of this beer. Very good stuff.

Light golden colour with okay off white head. Aroma is very hop floral. Flavour has a nice hop bitter balance with malts and something sweet almost stewed is in the background, not sure how to describe it. The body is okay maybe a bit more chewy it could be???

Pours brilliant golden with long lasting white head. Aroma of floral hops and a touch of maltiness. Quite hoppy, satisfying malt backbone. Hops are more present in the finish, for a long lingering dryness. Great pil.
Clear yellow of color with a nice white head. An aroma of hops, grass and sweet malt. A flavor with sweet hints, hops, grass and a bitter finish.

Pale golden in color.  Aroma is mainly of malts and hops.  Taste is the same, full of hops with some malt in the background.  Leaves a little bit of a bitter aftertaste.  Another high quality brew from Victory.
On draft. Very drinkable beer with alot of character.Malt tastes up front with a strong hop presence along with some subtle spice in the back.

Bottle 33 cl. from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Pours with a very classic pilsner glance. Its bright light golden with a nice white head. Spreads a nice aroma of dry hops. When you first stuff your nose down the glass you really get the full hoppy aroma... very nice (Why cant more traditional pilsner have a hoppyness like this...damn) The Saaz is very present and citric notes with some yeasts and malt. The taste is pretty malty with a full body palate. Its long lasting bitter with notes of apricots and plenty of hops. Absolutely a lovely pilsner. Good One.

Ahhh in my mind everything that a pilsner should embody, Light in body but a delicate malty sweetness balanced by a hop spicyness. SAd I only have a six pack of this that will be slowly enjoyed, is it true that a gas station in Maine has better selection than our government controlled liquor stores?

Why yes it is, damn NB LC.

Wow, did the LCBO actually get a real beer in there store?? An actual, above mediocre, actually tasty, actual beer??
Why yes, yes they did, big round of applause goes out to the lcbo for finally doing something right, congratulations. Man would it ever be great if they got some other beers from this brewery, there stout is some damn fine brew. So anyhow, this beer pours a liquid gold with a froathy white head. The aroma is classic pilsner, big floral hops, with a very slight malt sweetness. The flavour is wicked, malt base line, hops are big and delicious, spicey, a little citrus, pine. Dang good. Dry bitter finish. Another good brew from Victory.

12oz bottle from an LCBO sixer. Glad I could finally get a hold of this. I was worried this was going to be another American bastardization of a classic European style, but thankfully Ive been delightfully surprised. Pours a pale gold with a nice big fluffy white head. The aroma is amazing, German Pils malts topped with huge amounts of aromatic hops, Saaz, Noble, and maybe a hint of an American variety. Nice! Flavour does not let down. Great Pils malt body upfront met perfectly with descending hop notes, prickly and delicious. Incredibly well put together and the flavour progression is perfect. What I love most is that its not at all an insult to the European classic, but an extremely well done homage with only a slight twist of its own. This is an outstanding Pilsener.
Draught at The White Horse on Parsons Green (London), pours a clear lightish gold. A good malty palate, only a little grainy and quite floral.

The description (of a Pilsner) light and hoppy seem oxymoronic to me. This however has enough bitterness to help it out. The aroma is of a heavier pilsner. Appearance is what you would expect. This beer does not disappoint as long as you are in the mood for a lighter beer.
Fresh floral aroma that reminds me of drying clover, effervescent head that quickly diminishes to a bit of lacing, nice strong malt backbone with a pleasant bitter finish

Bottle, Beer Ritz, Leeds. Poured a clear pale yellow with a plump white head. Aroma right on the money for the stylee, with maybe a bit more hop than you might expect. Crisp, clean and dry flavour with a great hoppy bite at the end. If only more pils were like this....

(35.5cl bottle) Clear, golden colour with a persistent foamy white head of medium size. Very aromatic and fresh citrus-fruity, flowery, zesty and spicy hoppy aroma with a slightly sweet malty background. Bitter flavour, medium bodied with a smooth well-carbonated mouthfeel. Starts dry and like a Tsunami of aromatic and bitter hops on a soft malty base; very dry and almost harsh hoppy finish with a long bitter tail. A somewhat extreme but quaffable hop-bomb (08.VIII.09).

Bottle: Pours a pale gold lager in the pilsner flute with a nice tight-pored 2 finger cap. Good retention and lacing. Moderate carbonation.

Aroma is floral with some fresh cereal and grassiness. Fresh and pungent to the nose.

Soft mineral salts palate. Up front biscuity malts and spicey-piney hops fight for balance then this dries out and lightly bitters in the crisp quenching finish.

Faithful rendition of a German Pils. Artfully executed and properly presented.

A dynamite Pilsner, pretty much sex in a bottle.

12 oz bottle into pint glass.  Pours a light yellow with a small bright white head.  Aroma is grassy with a faint hint of sweet malt and fruit, I think apricot.  Nice hops presence at the front, a touch of bitter wheat, and very faint presence of citrus, start hoppy and strong and finishes dry but smooth.  Light palate, very drinkable and very refreshing.  Great for this style.  Recommended.

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a pint glass.

The color is a cloudy yellow with a orange tint. A nice slight white head with some really nice lacing.

The smell is fruity at first with some slight tangerine some wet hope flavor.

The taste has a strong wheat flavor. There is some nice hoppiness to the taste as well. Some citrus hops with some slight floral hops. A nice fruit feel, tangerine, lemon, and some slight orange as well.

The feel of this beer is delightful. Goes down really well and is a really nice beer for a hot day. Something with some really good flavor that could possibly go well with a burger or other cookout food.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2011 Clean clear yellow, tall fluffy head, grassy sunny aroma.  This is my pils of choice:  clean, crisp, nice snappy hop finish.  Victory got it right.  Know that.  011011  Nice and dry, love this pils.

12 oz - The WIne Source (best consumed by November 09).  Chill hazed gold, creamy white head.  Fresh grassy lemon zest aromas ride soft waves of peppered hay and honey bread.  Crisp spicy peppered hop flavors balance well on a drying citric-grassy backbone.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, snappy bitter finish.  A great summer refresher that to me is best in class...

(Bottle) I was disappointed with this one.  This beer tasted a lot more to me like a poorly executed Pale Ale than a Pilsner...there was none of the grassy quality that good Czech pilsners have, and none of that clean, crispness that both German and Czech varities exhibit.  Hoppier than typical for a Pils, and the malt is too heavy.  Listiglovers below remarked "Seems like the bitterness of an IPA without the strong flavour, instead the flavour of a Pilsner."--I think he hit the nail on the head here.  I think they need to work on this one if they want to really fit the style authentically--and also if they want to produce a truly quality brew.

Very nice Pilsner from Victory. Ive had this beer before and didnt think it was very special. But its a spot on Pils with a little extra hop kick. Golden color wih a nice head and a good hoppy aroma. Flavor was hoppy and very crisp with a soft malt backing which became more noticable when it warmed. Fuller bodied than other Pilsners Ive had. Ill bet this would score pretty high if it were put up against any Czech or German Pilsner. Very solid beer, but its just not my favorite style.

12 oz bottle, Pours yellow with a small quickly receding white head. Aroma is faint hops with some grass/grain. Palate is thin and dry, but smooth. Flavor is mild floral hops. No where near as strong as some raters have discussed. Definite malt background. Not as crisp and clean as I expected. That being said, I will confess to the bottle being 3 months past its sell date. I will re rate when I can get a fresher bottle.

Pours pretty clear, little yellow in there, small head.  Smells very refreshing, hoppy.  Taste is extremely crisp with a strong burst of hops.  Leaves the mouth feeling refreshed and energized.  Delicious beer.

Pour is glowing straw crystal straw with a big head which settle with no head. Smells slightly of apple and flowers and slight corky flavor. Crisp feel with a bright bitterness which lingers. This is refreshing and big, a terrific beer.

Bottle. Bright, Clear Yellow with a small white head. Crisp hops dominating the smell and taste, but not overly bitter. Floral, citrus, spicy. Good malty finish, dry and bitter. Replaces Christoffel as my favourite Pils!

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2009 Pours a pale boring yellow with a fast dissipating head that, even when poured quickly, did not show much strength to begin with. Aroma is floral, with hops. Extremely refreshing, a burst of dryness hits your mouth immediately. Mouthfeel is somewhat boring, seems to trip over itself. Overall? A little uninspiring. Seems like the bitterness of an IPA without the strong flavour, instead  the flavour of a Pilsner.

355 mL bottle.  Gold with a film of head.  Noble hops, straw, citrus and herbs in the aroma.  Flavour is hoppier than most pilsners Ive tried.  There is some pilsner malt in there as well, which becomes more apparent as the beer warms.  Finishes very nicely dry and bitter.  Fullish, for the style.  Very nice.

This is my top pilsener so far! Pours golden colour with minimal white head. Great hops on the nose and coming through on tthe taste as well. Good sweet malt flavours with crisp grassy hops. Very refreshing, this is a perfect summer beer!

Pours a hazy greenish yellow, with a soft creamy, persistent head,  with gentle and fine lacing. Nose is straight up Saaz, earthy, rich, spicy, pepper, tight-sour-malt Pilsener aroma, plenty of lemongrass. Palate is creamy, smooth, and nice and nippy, biting pepper in the finish. Everything I want in a Pilsener, and not som much as a hint of Diacteyl. Solid.

Hazy gold with a white head. Big yeasty, peppery pale lager aromas. Medium body with a rough mouthfeel. Nice flavor is dryish spices with dusty pale malts. Has a peppery dry bitterness to finish. Nice Pils.

The famous Victory Prima Pils Ive heard so much about lately is finally sitting in front of me. Pours slightly hazy with a very pale color and an enormous white head. I can smell the saaz from three feet away! This is one damn pungent pilsner. As I move the glass up to my nose the hop character kind of shifts to one of a much fruiter nature, the fresh hay is very strong on this one, but Im not getting the honey I usually get from a great pils, not that it has to be there, its cool to have something that smells this good but is distinctly different from other beers of this nature. The flavor is nicely bitter with a good lemony citrus character! Plenty of that almost bracingly bitter saaz hop character is all over this one too, and it makes for a really good aftertaste, not something I usually take note of in a beer, but this one finishes particularly strong. There is some good malt flavor for balance here too, its really very minimally grainy but has a very nice honey flavor that rounds this one out remarkably. Wonderfully clean, very easy to drink, Ive almost finished the bottle sitting here typing this, Im generally finished with my rating well before the bottle is half gone, I really want to drink a lot of this!

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2010 Pours clear golden-yellow with a puffy white head that lasts. Aroma of grapefruit and sweet citrus. Bitter up front but also sweet with pineapple flavors. Finishes with a dry bitterness.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz glass into a Pilsener glass.

Appearance: The body has a bright golden yellow color with plenty of sparkling carbonation and great clarity. The head is a wonderful thick and creamy topping with good retention. It also makes great lace rings on the glass as I drink.

Smell: The aroma hits you in the nose with spicy floral and grassy hops over pale malt.

Taste/Mouth: Its flavor is a crisp clean mix of its aroma. Hop flavor steals the show with bold spicy floral and grassy botanical notes. Underneath there is a pale crisp malt base that finishes dry with some nice clean hop bitterness. The palate is light to medium bodied with an easy drinking light wet texture. Carbonation is very active and helps to clean the palate.

Notes: This is a great example an American craft beer take on a classic Pilsener. The hops are bolder than there Euro counterparts.
Bottle at The Rake, Southwark, London, shared with harrisoni. Pale gold with a hoppy aroma. A hint of tropical fruit in the taste and a strong bitter finish.
bright golden colour, lovely bitter hop bite and a pils that lingers on the palate!

UPDATED: APR 15, 2012 Pours a golden yellow with a white head.  aroma of sweet malts, grass, and some citrus and pine from the hops.  flavor is of sweet malt, honey, pine and citrus.  has a nice hoppy bitter finnish but is still very drinkable.  this beer is a very good pilsner and a very refreshing on hot summer days.
