This is a great example of the pilsner! Very tasty on a hot day here in SC!  Golden pour with a light white head. Since joining the site I have been trying some great beers but today wanted a light drinker so I picked this one up and its great!

12oz bottle. About as good an example of the pilsner style as you can get. Its just not a very interesting style overall. But I like that Victory nailed it (yeah Pennsylvania!). Golden-yellow color with a slightly fizzy white head that dissipates. Grassy aroma with nice sweet malt. Crisp and refreshing with slightly bitter grassy hops on the flavor and pale malty sweetness with some honey. Extremely drinkable.

Pint glass, beer was on ice for several hours, hot/humid day.  I had it with tacos with a smoke jalapeno  sauce. 

Very clear yellow/pale color and a a finish to match.  Aroma is dominated by citrus and pine - excellent.  May be slightly over carbonated and a little thin but Im reaching because this beer is very very good.  It may be the best pils I have ever had.  Anyway, nice hop aroma and flavor but very little bitterness.  Wonderful pilsener and perfect summer brew that goes down really easy.  Its a light easy drinking pils thats great with food.  Like the beer equivalent of a fine dry chardonnay.

This is by far the best pilsner Ive had.... but too bad pilsners are lame.  I mean, I hate to be a negative nancy here, but this beer was still just.... eh.  It was good to drink while I was doing other things and too distracted to drink amazing beer.  A fine brew, dont get me wrong, but I just dont like the style itself.
Clear straw yellow and transparent. Nice and crisp. Plenty of hops to be found in this beer. Bitterness on the finish was really right on. Good stuff. On tap at Woodys Smokes on Brews.

Bottle.  Pours light golden, with a medium white head. Aroma is clean noble hops, light malts.  Flavor is much the same.  Very clean taste, nice light spice through the hop/malt balance.  Slightly bitter, just right.  I love this one.
On tap at the White Horse, Parsons Green, 3rd July 09. Bright gold. Strong pilsner aroma. Decent enough flavour but a bit harsh.
Pours a fading white head with a clear straw colored body.  Smells of grassy hops and some malt.  Flavor is the same.  Clean.

Pours from the 12 oz. bottle like oh so many beers ive had before:  golden yellow color, one finger head, fizzy, active carbonation...yada yada yada.  The difference is in the aroma, though.  As the head settles into a medium-heavy collar, an aroma like that of no other fizzy pale lager arises from the glass.  Wait, that smells like hops!  It IS hops, an abundance of em!!  Citrusy (lemon) hops to be exact.  Saaz?  I think so.  Ist sip has an initial hint of malt sweetness followed by those citrusy, slightly metallic hops.  Its a bold, powerful flavor that gets more intense on the swallow & lasts long after.  There is active carbonation on the tongue and a medium-light, crisp finish.  So THIS is what all those BMC pilsner wanna be imposters are supposed to taste like, huh?  Man, the difference is like night & day!!  Drinkable?  Hell yeah...all day & well into the night!!  Bravo to Victory Brewing !!!  Tell the big boys in St. Louis & Milwaukee that THIS is what REAL beer should be like!!!

Bottle, 12oz, at Copenhagen Beer Festival. A clear, almost golden beer with a decent white head. Lovely nose with citrusy hops doing most of the job, but supported by pale malts. Fine flavor of citrusy, piney hops blending with the pale malts that add some sweetness. Fine bitterness too, with a lasting finish. Nicely carbonated, medium body and rather dry. A lovely pils, giving the finger to Scandinavian pilsners. (Or "pilsners"). (090516)

A Mes rate. Bottle drank with Kenny and Mike. Clean pale yellow with a good white head. Perfect pils aroma. Straight forward but excellent. The flavour is not a patch on the nose but its lovely and dry and very drinkable however. The palate and delivery is just right. Its just a very very good pils.

Pours clear golden yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is hops, hops and more hops.  Smells very green, but not vegetal.  The Saaz really seem to be playing nicely in this beer.  Only downfall is that theres a weird soapy aroma and flavor on the backend.  Not sure what that is, but this is otherwise a really nice beer.

Draft @ Belmont Station / Nice golden color with a large fluffy white head, nice lacing. Floral, light pine, and grass clippings dominate the nose. The body is light and hoppy. If more pilsners were like this I would drink a lot more of them.
Pale golden yellow with a thin white foam.  Huge grassy, hay, light malt aroma.  Taste is bready, yeasty, clean grassiness.  Solid pils.

Excited pour throws a firm cap as veils of bubbles tantalize the eyes.  Sea foam dances atop a serious hop freshness, with the CO2 the tickle turns to a scratch.  A much needed one as clean barley and a wall of bittering hops washes over any thirst.  Clean, snappy finish with lingering hops.  A great lawnmower for the geek,  a nice crossover for hophead wannabes. 92

Pours a clear, pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of floral, grassy hops, with some malts. Flavor is also a bit hoppy with hints of citrus, earth, malts, a little fruit, some grains, and yeast. A very tasty Pilsener

From [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */øbenhavnske Øldage 2009. A mostly diminishing, shiny white head upon a very pale, yellow colored body. Superfresh and fruity hop aroma. Also some floral and grassy notes and a whiff of dry, grainy malts. A dry and crisp malt body backed by some well prononced fruity and grassy hops. Crisp and vivid mouthfeel. A fine bitterness lingers in a long finish. An excellent Pilsener!

Slightly hoppy aroma. Looks remarkably like a dehydrated persons urine. Tastes of hops and water, little else. Palate thin and almost undetectable other than hops. Watery. Overall, this beer is highly overrated.

Bottle thanks to Birdiebeagle. Pours pale gold with a rocky 2-finger white head. Aroma is lots of grass, a faint citrus, fresh grain and mineral. Flavor is fresh and dried grain right away a little toasted white bread, lager yeast crispness, a little mineral water, floral hops, and a little grapefruit and mineral to the finish. Palate is light, crisp and clean with a neutral entry and pleasantly dry finish. This is a fantastic pilsener, truly fantastic. As far as the flavor and palate go I really couldnt imagine a pils being any better.

Pours a light straw color with a nice two-finger white head. Hops, grass and grains on the nose. Very crisp and dry with a refreshing bitterness backed by the German malt. Nice bitter finish. Truly an amazing Euro-style pilsner. Fantastic!

poured th color of straw very light and clear with aromas of hops and pale malts taste is of tghe same with a smooth slightly bitter finish the thing that made me like this more was the can of mgd I was pouring on the grill over the chicken but still it was a nice light beer
Pours a clear yellow with a lasting white head. Fresh hoppy aroma with a touch of grass. Spicy taste up front gives way to bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Enjoyable Pils!

Wow.  What a delighfully refreshing take on this style. Crystal clear yellow pour with good white head.   The spiciness of the noble hops shines through in the flavor. Lingering saazy bitterness. Very refreshing.  Im far from a pilsner fan, but this one is great!
On tap at Stone.  Light light pale amber in the glass with a bright white head.  Light subtle nose.  Bit of sweetness and bit of yeast.  Tart and grass in the mouth.  Bit of bitterness.
Aroma fresh and mild. Amber body with a thick, creamy head.  Light and lively palate with a hoppy, bitter taste.

LOVE IT. One of my summer session favorites. Drinks easily without being watered down. Has that nice bitter euro hop kick without causing your mouth to sour and become fatigued. Big bight golden sunny straw colors with a nose of fresh grass, herbal hops, and dry cereal grains. I often bring this camping with friends and use it as an introduction to the world of really good beer.
Bottle. Clear yellow with a beautiful lacing egg white head. Very fizzy. Aromas of grain, cereal, grass and herbs. The flavour is crisp and dry with notes of grass, bread and citrus.

Wife picked up this one while in CA.  10 karat pour that had ample carbonation and a 1/2 inch ivory head.  Lots of spice, hops, and skunk throughout the sampling.  Medium mouthfeel, if not a bit prickly.

Bottle. A solid pils! Pours yellow with a fair-sized white head, a bit of lacing. Nose of soft toasted malts and some spicy, herbal hops. Crisp, slightly creamy malts, nice bitterness in the finish. Light, slightly fizzy in the mouth, very drinkable.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pale golden with a decent head. Grassy hop aroma with some herbal notes. Good hop bitterness throughout. As good as a pilsener as can be.
Pale yellow with a big and lasting white head. Herbal hops dominate the aroma, with a little DMS and malt. Dry, hoppy flavour with a good bitterness
I just cant seem to get past the green taste. Semi-skunk and dry finish bothers me. Bitter flavor overall and light bread and citrus and skunk aroma.
Pours a clear pale gold with no head. Aroma is spicy hops. Taste is lemon, grass, and citrus. Smooth mouth feel with moderate carbonation. Good dry bitter finish. Drinakable and enjoyable.

Top notch for a pilsener.  Lots of lemony yellow hops in the nose, pours a nice rich gold color with a pillowy white head.  Flavor is filled with plentiful lemony hops as well, wiht a nice bitterness in the finish.

Bottle via the Goat. 

Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is malt, hops, water. Flavor is grass, hops, malt, nice grassy bitter finish with a oily mouthfeel. Nice pilz. Thanks Dan.

Pours a luminescently clear piss yellow. Still has a nice dank hop character in the aroma in spite of being a bit past its shelf life. Taste is very sparkly. Lots of carbonation. Pils malt forward. Hops have deteriorated to being quite a bit soapy/bitter and lost their floral quality. Still quite a solid pils.

Bottle.  Light gold with a white head.  Aromas are floral and grassy with grapefruit.  Some light pine.  Very hoppy.  Flavours are sweet lemon with bitter and green resinous hops.  One of the best pilseners I have had.

Bottle.  A light gold yellowish beer with a minimal off white head.  Aggressively hopped so that the crispness actually becomes too harsh.  There is a late development of citrus fruit, but the bitterness comes in again too quickly to kill off those more delicate flavours.  Hmmm.  Really fails to deliver in the same way that Christoffel or Emersons do.

Damn this is good!!!  A most excellent beer after some yard work, it has a fantastic pilsner taste with a beautiful hop bite that is oh so missing in most beers like this.  The beer pours out a medium gold color, slight haze with some carbonation present.  Head was about 1/2 inch thick with an agressive pour and melted into just a scant 1/8" head.  Aroma is lemony, hay, and a bit of sweet fruit.  Medium bodied with a slight twinge of carbonation.  Flavor is mild, with a touch of fruit, more grassy/hay character and a glorious bitterness that just works oh so well.  A nice lingering bitter finish that is uplifting, never harsh.  Incredible beer.

clear gold, thick rocky white head.
malty aroma with grass and flower, some pineapple and a hint of soap.
smooth and refreshing. subtle but good balance between mild flavors of sweet malt and bitter floral hops. finishes dry, leaving fresh noble hop taste behind.
this is very nice, excellent with a summer lunch.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow color with a small, foamy white head.  The nose is crisp hops, light lemon, and a touch of grass.  Medium carbonation with a medium-light mouthfeel.  Citrus (primarily lemon), grass, a touch of floral, and a very light malt sweetness on the palate.  Smooth and very drinkable.  Great lacing left behind also.  Overall a very refreshing and highly quaffable beer.  Maybe a touch on the sweet side and one IBU too much of hops, but that is really splitting hairs.  Damn good and certainly one I will get again!

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2011 Pours a very golden yellow with a thin white head.  Smells of grain, sweet banana and of course hops.  Taste is refreshing, crisp, and clean.  Flavor comprises of light grain and a most dominate hop character.  Finish is slightly bitter and somewhat short.

50ml, bottle. Last drink on the second day at CBF 09. White foamy head, yellow-golden body. Fresh and nice fruit hoppy aroma. Smooth flavour of noble hops and pale malts. Fair bitter endnotes Clean tasting and easy going. Far better than what is called pils in Norway (late on 16.05.2009).

355ml bottle from Beers of Europe. What a difference a good dose of hops can make to a pale lager. This is full of flavour - firm and tangy without being aggressive, leaving a healthy English hop bitterness unusual for a lager. The hop impact is such that it feels immediately American, even though the ingredients are all European.  This is a modern brewing approach to traditional ingredients and methods, and it works well. A very drinkable and attractive brew.

Bottle @ København Ølfestival 2009. Aroma has is well hopped with grassy hops. Little hint of sourness there. Hazy, yellow coloured beer with a white head. The taste is bitter and well hopped. Quality ingredients. Very good pilsener.
On tap. Golden in color with a nice head. Aroma is light of grassy hops. Very dry. Earthy hops dominate the flavor from the beginning. Long dry finish. Well, Im just not a pilsner lover.

12 oz bottle.  Im not a pilsner fan but I thought this one may be able to convert me.  It didnt.  Poured a light yellow with a strong white head -- not far from a cheap American macro in appearance.  Taste was slightly better than the average pilsner, but not much.  Grassy taste, but not a whole lot going on here.  Not my thing.
Bottle at KØ09. OK hop aroma, weakly citric. Clear golden colour. Distinct bitterness, slightly rough and quite clean. Apart from the bitterness, it is slightly boring.
Botella. Golden colour. Sweet hoppy flowery aroma. Good mouthfeel. The flavour has a pleasant bitterness with pine, fruits, good maltiness, caramel and a dry bitter finish. Refreshing pils.

Clear light yellow with a lasting white head. Good lacing. Grassy hay aroma with light biscuit notes. Dry grassy flavor with a nice sweet/dry buicuit background. Light body lively carbonation. Dry bitter grassy finish. Solid pilsner.

Bottle from Bottleworks.  Pours light gold with a very bubbly white head.  Mild sweet aroma hinting of fruit.  The taste is simply bitter with no balance.  Feels oily in the mouth and incredibly fizzy.  A disappointment from Victory, but again, Pilsner is not my style.

A light golden color with slight green tinge.  Even with my cold I can smell some corn.  But thats not necessarily bad.  Also, the smell of honey. Thin white head, no lacing.  A nice medium-dry taste with a bitter hop finish.

bottle Københavnske Øldage 2009
light yellow, small white head.
corny sweet fruity hoppy aroma.
flavo is bitterhoppy and dry.
Bottle. Clear yellow body with a medium white head. Malty and freshly hopped aroma. Flavour is loads of malt, caramel, some pine and grape. Medium bodied. It ends up hoppy bitter. Nice session beer.

A - fantastic looking beer. Golden/straw color, with an enormous head which lasts forever. Tons of CO2 bubbles and crystal clear.

S - Floral/grassy hop aroma with malts aroma providing balance.

T - Mild citrus and spicy hop flavor with considerable bitterness. Sweet malt flavors and faint buttery flavor balances out. Very clean finish and refreshing beer.

M - Very nice prickly sensation from all the CO2. A tad thin.

D - A very drinkable/sessionable pils. Very fine example of the style. Nice beer.

Bottle @ Kbh festival 2009. Pours a slight unclear golden with a small frothy head. Hoppy, grassy and grainy. Very german like. Dry and grassy taste. Clean and well hopped. Medium bodied. Crisp and nice.
Poured from 12 oz bottle, little darker than mosts Pilseners.  Nice off white head, with hoppy aroma and taste, with hints of citrus, more than most.  Quite refreshing on a hot day.

Bottle @ Ølfestival, Valby, 2009.
Pours lightly hazy golden with a nice, creamy, white head. Aroma has grain, grassy hops and light citric. Highish carbonation, super dry mouthfeel. Flavour is fresh, good hops character and soft dryness. Some sugary sweetness as well. Good pilsner.

Flaske: Lysegul med et lille skumhoved. Fik først en flad omgang, men den havde også stået i åbnet i køleskab natten over. Da jeg fik serveret en frisk åbnet var den dejlig crisp og let bitter. God pilsner.
UPDATED: JUL 25, 2011 awesome pilsner when fresh.  crisp.  sharp grassy hopiness.   super sessionable.   great beer.
Enjoy this in your backyard, on a sunny day, at a BBQ. Light, pee color, minimal head. Sharp grassy hops, herbal, grainy hops. Thin palate. Niice pils.
India Pale Pils? Hoppier than Hop devil but tonnes of sazzy goodness. Crisp and refreshing. Victory at its finest.

From a 12 oz bottle this poured a very clar yellow with moderate white head and light lacing.Nose of grassy and floral hops. Smooth clean mouthfeel. Flavor is bitter and so is the finish. A very nice pils.

Overall Impression:
Heres another beer I havent had in a while...
**Old rating just said: "Better then your average Pils"
That is not a lot of info, so Ill just keep this rated here for now and offer a re-rate next time I have one.
Robe jaune pâle aux arômes légèrement épicés et houblonnés. Bière simple, mais gouteuse pour une pilsner. Bonne bière dété.

Enjoyed in a fluted glass from a 12 oz bottle.  This selection pours a clear pale golden color, as one would expect.  The drinker gets notes of Czech and German noble hops (possibly Saaz?), along with some sweetness from the pilsner malt.  The palate is straightforward but enjoyable - malt up front with a nice bitterness on the finish.  Dry and crisp at the end, this is certainly one of the best widely available pilseners available in the U.S.
bottle- the best out there for me- super huge saaz hops nose, followed by a crisp hoppy bite and sufficient pilsner malt support- Wow.

Bottle from Utobeer.  Clear paleish gold, thick rocky white head.  Very grassy pils.  Creamy pils aroma.  Quite nettley on the finish.  Maybe just lacks a bit of balance, maybe just a bit too hoppy on the finish, to be a truly refreshing balanced pils.  Herby nettley hops.  Rest of beer is good, attractive lightish malts.  But maybe just a bit too nettley.
This pils pours a nice golden hazy color with a small head. The nose is slightly herbal and of robust hops. Flavors of tangerine,grapefruit peel, and finishes clean and crisp. Great pils!

On tap at the Peekskill Brewery.  Pours a clear yellow with a medium white head.  Citrus, sweetness, and some grain on the notes.  Thin to medium bodied, with more citrus coming through.  Finishes light and grainy, with a light bitterness.

Thanks adamharnaugh for this 12ozer.  Pours clear yellow with a pillowy white head.  Nose is creamed corn, pale malt, hay, grass, and hops.  Flavor is bittering pine hops intermingle with hay, grass, malt, and a corn/ fruit sweetness that quickly retreats from the truckload of hops.  Well-made, thirst quenching, and medium-bodied (for a pils).  Refreshing.
12 oz bottle.... light golden pour... descent legs... although not much head... a good beer to drink when you can find it still in code...

Maybe my favorite choice for the warm summer months. Pours a pretty pale gold with a light but thick white head that takes a few minutes to diminish. Aromas easy to pick apart - distinctly hoppy with hints of sweet citrus and some floral notes. Hits the mouth with a balanced bitterness and enough astringent character to keep you reaching for the glass. Difficult to do much better in the style.
Dark golden with a moderate pillowy head. A little hops, straw, and fruit aroma. Light crisp and refreshing. An excellent pilsner.

12 oz bottle, pours rich golden color with small frothy head.  Aroma is hops, grass and hay, and a slight tinge of skunk.  Taste is nice and mild, slightly hoppy and malty.  Mouthfeel is light/medium, dry, and quenching.  Pretty nice beer, I could drink a few of these, though I hope the next one wont have that skunkiness going on.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2010 Great German Pilsener, yellow colored pour with a nice white head. Nice hoppy flavor that gets better while drinking, overall very enjoyable..

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2010 golden pour with lots of carbonation and a small white head. Aroma has a very nice balance between malt and grassy and citrusy hops. Flavor is very nice for a pilsener- an intriguing bitterness adds to the hop flavors, the malt is subtle, and there is a pretty dry finish to it. Very drinkable, great brew for the style.

Aroma:  The aroma is clean with flowery notes and hints of malts.


Appearance: The beer poured bright yellow and brilliantly clear with a tall white head. 


Flavor:  The initial taste had a bitter bite and herbal notes.  As the beer warmed up the flavor became crisp flavor.  The malts presents increased and rounded out flavor.


Mouth feel: It has a light body, mild carbonation and medium dry finish.


Overall Impression:  A clean beer, in line with style guideline.  Over all the beer was enjoyable beer to drink.
A beer that summer was invented for.  Nice hop bite, with a bit of floral hops.  It beckons you to keep drinking.  Freshness can be a concern, because without the hop bite the drinkability suffers.
a bright and bitter pilsner. definitely one of the best pilseners. quite hoppy but not too bitter. light and refreshing with a good aftertaste.
On tap at the Jet Rock bar in the PHL airport. Nice aroma, sweet slightly bitter flavour.

Appearance: Pours a clear yellow gold with a tight knit 1/4 inch head.

Aroma:  Bready buscuity malt and modest bitter hopping.

Taste:  A mouthful of bitter hops, dry light malt followed by more bitterness and spicy hops.

Mouthfeel: Thin and refreshing.

Overall:  A nice , well made beer.  I would add this to my session rotation if it wasnt $10.00 a six pack.
Bottle. Floral hop aroma, with some citrus. Goldfish malts and floral hops. Good for a pilsener.

Straw pour from bottle, frothy white head.  Hoppy, sweet fruity aroma is very refreshing.  Best pilsener aroma Ive ever enjoyed.  Really solid malt backbone that accentuates the hoppy overtones.  A very enjoyable, very sessionable pils.  Bitter finish is a nice touch.  One of the Premier U.S. Pilseners. Period.

In the bottle from utobeer. Tried after finishing work at the pub....ive been drinking milds and olds all night so this is nice and refreshing....I dont have much experience with US pilsners but this is damn good! not much in the way of aroma, touch of grainy malt more than anything and that comes through in the palate. Great big malt palate that elongates the hoppy goodness, this beer is made by the palate! nice dry bitterness to finish damn good beer!
Beautiful, pale, off yellow with champagne carbonation.  Very minimal nose with a dry mouthfeel, too bitter of a finish for me, although I have little experience with pilsners

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 My favorite pilsner made within the united states. One of the better the better beers made by victory. Delicious, drinkable, and why is it all gone :-(
 
Needed to be raised, still one of my favorite beers, and never had a bad bottle or draft.

12oz bottle. Pours pale clear yellow with an enormous frothy white head. Nice and crisp moderate hops with some complimentary malt flavors. Finish is clean and refreshing. This is one of my least favorite styles of beer, but Victory has done a fine job with this one. This one for Bud and Miller devotees to try.

I was hosting a beer sampling party and selected the Prima Pils as part of the lineup.  Im typically not a pilsener fan, but many of my guests enjoy them.  In a blind tasting I was very pleasantly surprised by this smooth, hoppy gem from Victory.

Wow.  I am not much for a Pils, but Id take this one anytime.  I have got to put up some of these and serve to my friends and family who are constantly disappointed that I dont have a Miller, or Bud, or whatever on hand.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2010 Re-rate 3/23/10.  Yellow-gold, fluffy head, thick notches of lace.  Wonderful hop bouquet with grassy-herbal notes.  Crisp and refreshing.  Very well made.  Simple is sometimes better.  My favorite Pils.    Original rate:  Courtesy of jerrymorrison. This pours a golden color topped with a thick head which yields notches of lacing after almost every sip. The aroma is malty and hoppy as well as a little zesty and herbal. This is a nicely hopped pilsner for sure. Hoppy, a bit earthy, sweet grassy malts, and a wonderful crisp, bitter, dry finish. An excellent Pilsner. One of the best Ive had. Thanks Jerry!

Nice pour with a bit of head that dissapates rather quickly.  Nice bitter finish and complexities that I do not normally see in a more traditional pilsner.  Very sessionable and I have to hand it to Victory this is a great answer to having Miller light for your beer of choice when you are on a mission if you will.  Nice balance for a pilsner though, but this style is simply not my favorite so I am never going to rate one too highly no matter what.  I do have to recommend this one though as it does have more character and yes I have had 10 of them in one evening more, one interesting evening!
Poured hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Medium bodied. Good balance.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2011 Bottle and for what its worth i think this is a dam fine pils.  Pours a golden orange body with a white head. Citric, grassy and earthy notes.  Dry and bitter finish but still crisp clean and satisfying.  Some grain and hay but still nice caramel and a tea like bitterness maybe even a bit tannic.  Im a fan.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with one finger white head. Aroma is of grass and slight malt. Taste is light and refreshing. Starts off with a bitter kick and progresses into a slight skunky grassy flavor. Very nice. The best representation of the pilsner style Ive tried so far. Thumbs up!

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2009 Bloody light, almost fluorescent with a puffy white head.

Slightly limey cereals. Lightly sweet and crisp.

Good hops, lightly drying. Limes appear again with oiled piney notes.

Good levels of carbonation give wee tickles to the tongue. A good dryness assaults the back of the throat.

Im not huge on pilsener but this is a delightful one.

OK, Ill admit it! This has become my benchmark American made Pilsener. Ive tried many others and they all pale in comparison to the Prima Pils. Colour... golden with delightfully frothy white head. Nose... fresh cut perennial rye grass, crushed hop cone and honeysuckle. Palate... nicely hoppy, citrus, honey, crisp, refreshing and enough malt to keep the hops company!
one of the best american pilsners I have had. Nice bright hops, it is hoppier than a european pils.

12oz. bottle (date stamped "enjoy by May 29 2009").  Pours a clear gold-orange, some enduring 1/8" head but excellent lacing.  Aroma of citrus, straw?. hops.  Starts slightly sweet, quickly turns dry/bitter, and finishes the dry.  Good for a pilsener, but not as good as last years batch.

Tap at Trappeze, Athens GA
Pours golden, thick white head.
Aroma of pale malts, grainy some floral hops.
Taste, light, malty, light hops with faint citrus notes and bitter finish.
Came off a lot better than many other pilsener with a very forward earthly aspect that make is crisp and very fresh.

Drank a bottle at Cleos in chicago. Golden pour with dense, foamy white head. Nose is grassy hops and typical lager. Flavor is good, with a light grassy flavor with a heavy hop finish, some spice. Great body, great taste, awesome pils.

Bottle courtesy of GMCC2181.  Pours a slight hazy yellow with a dense 2 finger white head.  The nose is grassy hops and pilsner spice.  The taste is malt, citrus hops and peppery pilsner spice.  Nice medium creamy body.  Good Pils  thanks G-Spice!

Ive had this on tap and from a bottle.  Pours a light golden color with a finger or two of head.  Smells slightly hoppy and very clean.  Taste is very smooth with a taste of dry citrusy hops coming on late.  Very easy to drink.  This is one of my favorite pilsners.  A great session beer with a good blend of clenliness and hoppiness.  This is not like your macro pilsner, which has no taste.  This beer has hop flavor but is not overpowering.  I am partial to a good pilsner and I highly recommend you give this beer a shot.

Prima Pils pours a pleasant straw color and had three quarters of an inch of creamy head.  It has a very pleasant hoppy aroma, which leads to a nice bitter taste on the front.  While it is not hard to drink, it is not as smooth as other craft pilsners out there.  Odd for the style, it seems to have a flavor on the finish that reminds me very much of a Hogaarden or any number of other Belgian witbiers.  It may be the touch of citrus, but it seems to also have some of the yeasty properties in a Belgian.  It also has a less crisp texture than what I imagine a pilsner to have.  It has an almost creamy mouthfeel.  Its carbonation lends to the creamy feel.   Overall, I do not think that this is a great beer.  It is unique in that it does not taste like every other pilsner out there.
Nice beer.  Only real Pilsener I have to compare it to is Pilsener Urquell, and this is better.  Clean aroma with malt and some grassy notes.  Drinks smooth and clean.  Dry finish.

12 oz bottle. This beer surprised me!  I poured it into my lager flute and it produced a white foamy head that lingered, and left heavy lace.  The nose was PILSNER.  But weird.  It was like it wanted to give a slight skunk... but NEVER did.  The nose was strong pils with thick cut grass and astringency.  The flavor is yummy Saaz hops with the german malts rising in the throat.  This beer is dry, and has distinctive pils flavor.  The Palate is thin, but not quite watery.  The nice thick head adds to feeling of fullness.  Very nice pils, infact, best I have had.

This is a decent pils.  It has a lot of good flavor.  It has a slight bitterness to it at first, and then really packs a punch with the spice, and then goes back to the bitter finish.  It definitely has many layers of flavor.

Pours pale yellow with a nice fluffy white head. Some lacing that falls down.

Aroma of noble spicy hops. Some lemon as well, but not much malt.

Taste starts off with a lemon zest  that follows through with a nice spicy bitterness that just tastes excellent. Not much malt complexity, but it shouldnt be expected from a Pilsner. This beer with be appreciated for fans of noble hops, because this beer has noble hops aplenty.

A light bodied and super refreshing beer.

This is probably the best American Pilsner syle beer Ive had. I also believe this is much better than Pilser Urquell, Czechvar, and Sam Adams lager.

If you like true hoppy pilsner beers then you owe it to yourself to pick this one up.
A good pils,pours a pale yellow little white head.Grassy aroma with a slight taste of spice,bitter refreshing aftertaste very decent pilsner.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2009 330 mL. Pours a clear pale yellow with a very nice two-finger off-white head that is thick and frothy and has good retention. Leaves very good lacing. Aroma of lemongrass, grain, corn, and a nice punch of Saaz hops. Taste is medium-bodied with biscuity malt and lots of bittering hops that creates almost a metallic taste but is not unpleasant. Creamy to metallic mouthfeel. Sort of spicy, bitter aftertaste. Good rendition of the Czech style. 3.4
Re-Rate: This is a fantastic session beer. Amazing lacing, huge Saaz bite without being too soapy. Just really good. 4

If a person wanted to purchase this product just for the smell they wouldnt be wasting their $1.79. Grassy and earthy these hops are masterly incorporated into the brew; think wild clover, think freshly tilled soil or newly mowed hay in the morning glistening with dripping moisture or the lingering residual essence of vegetation on your hands after working in the garden, think summer and green leaves and bark on a sugar maple. I couldnt get enough of putting my nose right in the glass.

Beer pours light pale with lots of bubbles and a slight white head.  Aroma is subdued with mild hop presense and pilsner malts.  Flavor is not very descript.  Hops are of grapefruit and their sharpness covers any malt presence.  Beer finishes clean.  Overall this beer is OK but nothing that stands out for the style

12oz bottle.  About as good an example of the pilsner style as you can get. Its just not a very interesting style overall. But I like that Victory nailed it (yeah Pennsylvania!).  Golden-yellow color with a slightly fizzy white head that dissipates.  Grassy aroma with nice sweet malt.  Crisp and refreshing with slightly bitter grassy hops on the flavor and pale malty sweetness with some honey. Extremely drinkable.

bottle - Pours slightly hazy light gold with a one finger white head.  The aroma is of floral hops and some bready malt.  The flavor has that bready malt taking a backseat to the dry floral and grassy tasting hops.  This light bodied brew is a pretty good session brew.    Im not convinced that rating it higher than the classic Pilsner Urqell is justified though, so I wont.

12 oz bottle.  The aroma on this is decent, but not overly impressive, very grassy, light citrus, and a good amount of mellow grains.  Pretty pour for a pilsner with a medium starch white frothy head, decent carbonation, and a translucent golden yellow color.  Right away in the taste, there a nice basic citrus bitterness, that gives way to the expected crisp grassy hop.  Mellow grain malt is more interesting and sweet than most of its kind with a little bit of corn and honey.  Nice feel, not too watery, quite crisp, with a good finish that brings everything together well.  There are a few subtle things about this pilsner that make it fairly special for the style.  Would be a go-to beer in the hot sun of the summer.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2010 hazy light golden yellow, white head and light lacing.  nice aroma with the hops coming thru, Flavors are mostly moderatly strong hops and a fairly clean finish.  medium bodied with notes of pine, grapefruit and lime.  Overall a decent pils with a little extra bite. - Addendum:  after drinking this a few more times it has become perhaps my favorite pils, and I am upgrading the score from 3.1 to 3.5

UPDATED: APR 8, 2012 Re-rate 4/2/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks zvikar. Clear golden. Slightly grainy aroma with grassy hops. Rather dry flavor with bitter grassy hops. Medium-bodied. OK. 5/3/6/3/11=2.8

(11/13/08) Bottle at friends house in Philadelphia. Slightly hazy golden color with a quickly-diminishing medium white head. Aroma of some grassy hops and lots of graininess. Sweetish flavor with some malt, graininess and a bitter finish with rather grassy hops. Medium-bodied. Not awful but nothing great. 5/3/6/3/11=2.8

Bottle. Poured pale gold with a flocculent white head that looked like ice cream in a rootbeer float. Aroma was citirc, soapy, honey, pilsner malt-cereal. Flavor was sweet cereal, honey, pilsner malt, and resinous soapy bitterness that lasted on the tongue. Palate was light and had a nice carbonated bite that finished resinous. Certainly hoppier than most pilsners however the cereal and malt profile was unfortunately reminiscent of a macro.
12oz. right from the bottle. Flavor is hops, citrus, and something like corn. Not a big fan of this one. Watery and not balanced flavors.
user_location: back in NJ!, New Jersey, USA

text: UPDATED: FEB 2, 2009 aroma of lightened cereal grain and a citric note that is refreshing even before tasting. appearance is standard for the style: sunshine yellow. flavor is of an excellent dose of almost sweet hops and lemonly lager yeast. palate is not dry, the lemony prescence hangs around for some time. keeps the refreshing experience intact with some of the hop complexities rarely seen in the style.

Appearance: Clear, yellow body topped by a foamy, white head that supplied clear-cut rings of lace on our way to the bottom.

Smell: Aroma smelling of grainy pils malt, moist discarded lemon rinds, and fragrant, spicy hops.

Taste: Grainy tasting pilsner malts with a light honeyish sweetness. Hint of lemon. Richly floral and spicy noble hops with an ingratiating medium amount bitterness. Finishes dry and quite crisp.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation.

Drinkability: Keenly drinkable. One of the better American-corn pilsners around.

Pours clear golden, with a puffy white, 2.5 finger head, good lasting lacing.  Smells of apple, caramel, citrus and some light floral notes.  Light, crisp body, just a little dry.  Has a strong grapefruit flavor, with some caramel and apple.  Medium bitter grapefruit aftertaste that lasts for some time.
Pours a light gold with a white head. Aroma of hops and doughy malt.  Mouthfeel is very dry, and the taste is very crisp and hoppy.  A very good pils.
Pours a golden yellow with a white frothy head. Hoppy sweet fruity aromas make them selves known. The flavor is of light hops with a little pine. Bitter end. Ok pils.
The first sip was like, "This is different" the second was "this is actually good". I noticed an light, almost grapefruit flavor to go with the hops. A good Lawnmower beer, I will buy again.

Pours a light golden color with lots of bubbles. Nice palate, very crisp and dry. Hops are a bit too dominating, but it seems like thats what they were going for with this one. Slightly sweet finish. Overall pretty solid pils.
On tap at Novare Res.  Golden color, high carbonation.  Dry, dry, and crisp.  Some nice light hopping.  This is a solid Pils in every way.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 12oz bottle.   Light gold color with a very slight haze and a head with rather large bubbles.   Strong earthy, spicy hops, and distinct bread crust in the aroma.   The hops dominate the flavor profile, with a very light honey sweetness and bread flavor from the malt.   Finishes dry and bitter with plenty of earthy, spicy hops.   Light bodied with carbonation on the loose side.   Seems in the german vein, with the lean malt and bitterness, and I tend to like that style of pilsener a bit less than the more balanced czech style; regardless, this had great hopping and would be a prima go-to beer in warm weather.

Bottle.  Poured a clear yellow color with rising carbonation and a rocky white head that slowly receded and left nice lacing.  Aroma of soft pilsner malt, a bit of dough/breadiness, a hint of honey, and some leafy, earthy hoppiness.  Crisp, smooth entry that leads into a soft biscuit-like flavor that transitions into an earthy hoppiness with some undertones of cracker and honey on the finish.  Moderate carbonation, nice crisp finish.  Easy drinking, and perhaps not exactly to style, but a good beer nonetheless.

A brilliant yellow pour with a mountain of a puffy white head. Big aroma of hops and a grainy smell, while the taste is an excellent balance of hops and malts with a great snap to the finish. I am still a neophyte to this style, but I definitely enjoyed this one.

Pours a bright yellow color with a fluffly white heads.  Lots of bubbles.  Looks very nice in its pilsner glass.  Pretty nice hoppy aroma.  Flavor is dominated by the hops, but has enough maltiness to balance out the bitterness.  Good, crisp finish.  Pilsners are not my favorite style, but it is easy to tell this is a nice one.

Pours a golden color with a light carbonated white head
Taste light and airy with a bit of a fruity side
Good beer for the style
When you poor small white head.this beer drinks like dry champagne.Cloudy and light yellow in color.finsh light on the hops and a little bitter.

Bottle, from Winter 08 variety pack.  Golden pour with a decend head and carbonation.  Hoppy aroma, and initial bite that has some maltiness to it and ends with a smooth hop.  Very nice balance to it.  Nice hoppy pils from a local brewery.  Not nearly as hoppy as the Hop Devil, IMO the prima is a more drinkable beer overall.  This is a quality brew.

Bottle. Another great American style Pilsener that would be a better choice than the ones that have to travel from Germany. Pours with a more golden color and a fairly large frothy head with good retention. Aroams of grain and hops, hop and malt flavors wiht a nice balanced finish, not too harsh. A very nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2008 At first pour there was a skunky aroma which I dont mind under the right circumstances and this worked The skunkiness dissipates pretty quickly.  Pours golden with limited white head. Flavor is crisp bitter and refreshing. Decent pilsener.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2008 Bottle from Tipsy’s Liquor World, Denver. Pours a pale gold with a nice fluffy white head. Lemon/lime and slightly metallic hops with sweet, grainy malts in the nose. The flavor has a nice crisp hop bitterness, none of the usual skunky nastiness, and the malts, although sweet and grainy, are not of the the usual corney variety I often associate with the style. Well balanced and just ever so bitter with a clean, dry finish. Ive enjoyed very few pils to date and this is definitely one of them.

12 ounce bottle from Glenville beverage. Very hoppy, like you would expect. I think mine may have been a little old. The bottle was a little dusty. Smooth beer none the less. Nice and citrusy, nice lace.

Bottle at Eulogy, Philadelphia, in the company of Loz, Casey and Traci on my fortieth birthday, 16-11-08. This was our second visit of the evening we walked just 5-6 doors away to have a Mexican meal and then we were back. This was one another one of Caseys beers and again a decent shout. Pours a lemony yellow colour with a white film head. The Saaz hops are really strung out, good classy, crisp bite to this, some sweetness, its very simply but well done and I my opinion that is how a Pilsner should be. A6   A4   F7   P4   OV16     3.7
Pours light golden with a big white head.  Aroma is light malts and faint hop.  Flavor is smooth, light malts with a nice bitter finish as well.  Great pilsner.

Bottle. Light aromas of grain, lemon peel and pepper. The head is large, frothy, white with good lacing and is fully lasting. Color is sparkling clear gold. Flavor starts moderately acidic and lightly bitter, then finishes moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery and has a carbonation between soft and lively. Just what you’d expect a quality Pilsener to be like.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2010 Pours a great looking golden pour white head .... floral hop aroma .......  intial floral hop taste gives way to a malty slightly bitter aftertaste that lingers awhile ... smooth and citrusy but subtle this is a great brew

Bottle at beer-30. Pours clear light gold with a white head. I’m kinda wondering why this doesn’t show up in the Bo-Pils category. Aroma and taste of flowery hops, biscuit, straw. Maybe a tiny bit of citrus? Nice crisp-dry finish. Rather a nice pils or bo-pils.

Aroma embodies the freshly-cut grass element of noble hops; a peppery spiciness finishes the whiff.  Hazy gold pour, fluffy white head, significant lace, effervescent.  Flavor follows the aroma, grass and spice, with some lemon zest and a bit of bean soup on the finish.  Quite tasty.  Lively on the tongue, with warmth from the aromatic hops.

Ever since the original and classic pilsner was created, all pilsners to this day and far into the future will more than likely measure their worth by the original standard. Having a universally accepted and long-standing standard can be a good thing or a bad thing depending on the validity of said standard. Thankfully, in the case of the traditional Czech pilsner, this is a fine contribution to brewing history which has persisted to this day. Once you go Czech, you quite literally can never go back. Stepping up to bat today is the Prima Pils from Victory Brewing, and as I saddle up to the plate, I wonder if this shall be a homerun or a foul-ball in the discriminatory game of Pilsner.

A gorgeous pale straw with a hint of soft white when held up to the light. Her light golden depths are held at bay by a luscious thick head; much like a cloud she rests on top of my Prima Pils, inviting me to disturb her puffy white purity. Delving into her inviting depths, a scattering of lace decorates the sides as a sweet and crisp nose of freshly cut grass, lemon rinds, and crisp pears fill my senses. Immediately I am struck by how bright and effervescent her body is. I close my eyes and imagine myself at a small bar on the cobblestone streets of Plzen, Czech, people-watching and savoring my freshly drawn pilsner. Lemon, sweet cut grass, pears, and even a note of crisp autumn apples seduce my palate. Some white grapefruit in her finish with hints of a spice I cannot quite put my finger on. Where are the malts in all of this? Lingering in the background, maintaining the balance while creating a beautiful harmony between fresh grassy and citric hops and soft chewy biscuity malts. Perfection.

If I hadnt known beforehand, someone could have easily poured me a glass of the Prima Pils from Victory Brewing and I would have thought it a fresh Czech import. From their beer glass to my beer glass, as fresh and deliciously traditional as possible. Victory Brewing got their Prima Pils dead-for-sights and in doing so continue to honor the classic Pilsner tradition started so many years ago.
Good Hop hit for a Pilsner very crisp and flavorful. With a nice clean finish.

I enjoyed the Prima Pils.  Purchased a pilsener for guests who may not enjoy pale ales, and found that this satisfied my taste for hops.  An unusually balanced pilsener that is versatile and very drinkable.

Victory Prima Pils is a very good pilsner. The beer has a light, unclear orange color and a very small head. The aroma is bland with notes of fresh, flowery hops and and a light malt base. The finish is clean and while the beer is good, it is easy to forget.

How a pilsener should be.  Wow another wonderful beer from the Victory brewing company.  Pours golden with a white head,  good flavor, overall smooth but it is a pilsner.  By far my favorite Pilsener.
[Bottle] Pours a clear light gold with a soapy white head. Aroma is noble hops, malt, and lager yeast. Flavor is grassy and somewhat thin. Moderate hop bitterness and a dry finish.

12oz bottle.  Pours a clear pale yellow with an initially large white head which diminishes quickly but leaves a ring through the rest of the beer.  Aromas, I actually smell hop!  Sorry, its just so rare in today’s pilsners.  I also get some malts.  The German malts and euro hops really become evident in the flavor.  Nice carbonation, an all around great pilsner!

12 oz bottle.  Pours bright clear yellow with a white head.  Smells of sweet malts with some honey aroma, a hint of hops.  Light flavors of biscuity malts with a bit of sweetness and a nice citrus hoppiness.  Clearly a well-made pilsener.

i bought this bottle yesterday, and i just noticed that the expiration date on the label is 10-30-2007 (they really ought to use a bigger font).  take that into account for this review.   slightly hazy yellow, small quickly disappearing white head, some lacing.  aroma of sweet malt and mild floral hops.  flavor of sweet malt, offset nicely by the bitter hoppiness.  oily mouth feel, bitter finish.  a very enjoyable pilsener.  even as old as it is.  just imagine what a fresh one would taste like.

Bottle poured clear pale yellow with a big white head in my pint glass. Aromas of light malts and intense hops filled my nose 

This brew tastes awesome citrus malts and great malt sweetness. It’s kind of strange how the hops stand out first then the sweetness follows on this brew. Nice and light in the mouth and crisp on the tongue.

This is now my go to pizza beer, and now that victory is now in Maine It may be my go to brew for next summer. Extremely drinkable for anyone who was wondering

12oz bottle. Pours slightly hazy, light yellow with a thin, crisp white head. Smells cereal malty and light, green hoppy. Tastes light and crisp, sweet malty with some light, green hops. Thin body, good carbonation.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Clear yellow - white head. Clean pilsner malty, white head, hay, light wet hay, nice hoppy, but not that fresh, bitterness, high bitterness, light grass, light cardboard, citruc, light crispyness. OK.

Bottled. Clear yellow color, medium white head. Nice hoppy aroma, bit flowery, slight grassy. Good bitter pils taste, slight grassy, smooth. Great palate. Very good pilsener style (which is supposed to be and in this case truly is obvious different from the typical american pale like ales).

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2009 Bottle.  Aroma is grassy, with light citrus.  Palate is crisp, slightly dry, a touch thin.  Flavor full of grass, with some malt and hops.  Im not all that impressed, to be honest, but in honor of Victorys faithful recreation of the Pilsner style, Ill settle for judging this beer as decent.  
retried 5/2/09:  OK, OK, I wasnt fair to this beer the first time.  Grassy, herbal aroma in the nose.  Flavor has definite breadiness, grass, light lemon and herbs. Finish is crisp and dry.  To be drank on a warm day, not sipped from a snifter.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2009 Sample, on tap at FFF Brewpub. Pours very light yellow. Light and smooth easy drinker. Lightly hopped, undertones of citrus. Lacking very much depth, but overall refreshing.
Clear, yellow / straw color with white frothy head...carbonated.  Floral, grain / straw, and mild citrus notes.  Floral, citrus, and grain flavours.  Full bodied with medium bitter finish.

Draft at Gordon Ramsay’s at the London, New York.
Great that even two star restaurants have craft beers nowadays.
Full malty flavour, hoppy aroma, dry crisp finish. An ideal food companion.
Nice pils.  Pretty yellow color with a small head.  Aroma of grassy hops and malt.  Nice crisp mouth with good hop finish.

On Tap at the Father’s Office, Culver City. Aroma: fresh cut grass and fresh earthy hops. Pours clear golden with small white head, good head retention for a pils. Flavor: begins mellow and untraceable then becomes nicely spicy and hoppy. Finishes with a surprising roasted malt character in the throat. medium-light to light body. Very drinkable!  I’ll admit it, I’m biased to Ales.  But, this Pilsener is a revelation!  A very enjoyable and hoppy Lager!!  Nice for the warmer spring and summer months.

12 fl. oz. bottle from BOTW (Rochester), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. SE04/08.
App.:  Golden, clear, decent white head.
  
Aroma:  Fruity, biscuits, bread crust, slightly soapy, some green and pepper hops, an odd aroma that I cant describe and dont like...
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, fairly soft carbonation, smooth.
  
Flav.:  Lightly fruity, much more hops  grassy, peppery, and still soapy, may be some light tropical fruit esters; dry with fair bitterness.

Nicht prima, aber gut.

Aroma - Pleasant aroma balanced hop & malt and something else... 

Appearance - Traditional golden fizzy 

Flavor - Complex and Yum strong spicy hop presence.

Palate - the good stays with you all the way to the back of the tongue. 

OI - Great beer will definitely buy again. I am usually partial to ales but never scoff at a great beer no matter the style. This beer has a nice balance on noticeable hops that are missing in many pils

Cloudy golden pour with a nice head.  Aroma is not your typical pils by any means.  You can tell it has some pils qualities but the delicious hops in the nose set this one apart from most.  Flavor is yeasty and hoppy...but not bitter or resiny.  This is a good beer.  I am very glad I finally got to try it.
Decent, but for me I was expecting more. Taste and smells like hops. Just a touch of barely existent malt. Not a repeater for me.

Hazy gold with a white head.  Big yeasty, peppery pale lager aromas. Medium body with a rough mouthfeel. Nice flavor is dryish spices with dusty pale malts. Has a peppery dry bitterness to finish. Nice Pils.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Don’t particularly care for the aroma of pilsners. Tastes prettyhoppy, like an IPA. Very clear color.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2011 Rerate 4/25/10: Dont know how I had this rated so low.  This is my goto session beer.  Clean, tasty, easy to drink with a nice hoppy finish.  Fantastic pilsner.

Pale straw yellow pour with a thick white head.  Yeasty, grainy aroma.  Bitter malt with yeast and cereal. Clean and easy to drink.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2009 Im not a big pilsner/lager guy, but this is good... Being in eastern PA, pilsner drinkers have 4 excellent options with victory, sly fox, stoudts, and troegs immediately in the area... Each is different but all are world class.  This is the hoppiest of the bunch.  Dry finish, not as floral as stoudts.  Very Crisp...
SDFOB-2008. Draft. Very light bitters. Some pineapple flavors. Nothing too exciting to me.
Smells grassy with a very nice malt undertone. Taste is crisp and refreshing with very nice bitter hops flavor. Very nice pilsner, one of the best I have had.
12oz bottle, not impressed, someewhat like a Tecate/Modelo taste to it! Clear pale gold pilsner, smells skunked. Thin head. The taste is a little bit bitter which is nice but also quite metallic.

Some hoppy aroma and typical pils sulfury notes.  Color is light golden with thin white head.  Flavor is bitter with some metallic tastes.  Not as much malt character as I would like to taste.  I’m not a fan of pils so don’t take this rating too harshly.

Aroma is a sweet malt scent that reminds me of a command premium American Pilsener.  Color is a light bright gold with good carbonation and a white head that drops down thin.  Taste is, wow way bitter.  Starting with a light body it goes down with a crisp feel.  Finish jumps out hoppy with some sweetness and then a bold bitterness with just a hint of malt.  After taste is bitterness with a foamy feel.  This may be the hoppiest Pilsner I have ever had.
12 oz bottle pours golden.  Floral hoppy aroma.  sweet bready malt with a nice hoppy bitterness
Clear golden with medium white head. Hoppy aroma with notes of flowers and rubber. Sweet and hoppy flavor with floral, caramel and fruity notes. Ends bitter.
Golden colour with a white head. Hoppy floral and light malty sweet aroma with notes of hay. Flroal, perfumy flavor with hoppy bitter notes.

crystal clear bright golden pour. aroma of bready malt, and some slightly skunky hops. Flavour is sharp, and the hops add a slight soapiness, along with a touch of sour apple. and it finishes with a bready malty aftertaste. Interesting pils, maybe a little past its date, but still nice, but not my favorite, i think its a little over hyped.

Pours a very clear, see through bright, light yellow with a big, frothy white head that lingers for several minutes and remains very lacy. A nice look to this pils. Smells of sweet and spicy German malts with a good amount of hoppiness. Grassy and citrus. Nice to smell a pils with some life. Lots of grassy taste to this and quite bitter. Sweet and malty throughout as well as spicy. A sharp citrusy/grassy hop bitterness kicks in about half way through and lingers way past the end. Excellent balance. Overall, a great take on the style. The added hops make this truly enjoyable and easily my favorite pils.

Golden pour white foamy head.  Slight hops pine, citrus aromas.  Very surprised by the malt in this one, complimented with nice grassy body.  Not overly carbonated with just enough body.  Very clean and bitey at the finish.  One of the best pilseners I’ve had to date.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text: Light yellow pour with a light frothy white head. Lots of grassy aromas reflected in the flavor with some good bitterness. decent overall
Light yellow with a small white head that diminishes.  Nice hop aroma and bitterness.  Quality ingredients make this an excellent pilsner.
Pours a light yellow color with a big white head. Aroma was very grassy and some nice citrus hops. Flavor was also really grassy, a bit skunky and some hops. Pretty decent pilsener

Bottle 12 fl.oz @ Amerikaner blindsmagning @  Papsoe, Bottle #02.]Clear light to medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, hay, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (190608)

Bottle, Nice light malt aromas a touch of spice, a bit of hops. Nice very nice taste, slight sweetness, bitter initial taste, tons of carbonation, a bit more complexity and texture than any pilsener I have had. Very enjoyable.

Pours a light straw with a strong head. Aroma is of the mildly grassy Saaz with hints of bready pilsener malt. Refreshing but lacked the crispness and lingering iron-mineral like finish of better examples. This isn’t the easiest style to produce. So hats off to Victory for a fine effort.

Quality to be sure. Pushes the pils to the limit. Not exactly what I was expecting considering the high rating. Hops are grassy and subtle. Not over the top at all. Taste is light yet satisfying. This did not take long to drink, 5 or 10 minutes or so. Quite quaffable. Not a ber that I would ever seek out, but may try again when I’m older and have diminished taste buds. Overall, great for a lager, but just not my style. Doesn’t compare to a good hoppy ale.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2011 Updated to reflect my mature palates appreciation for pils....everyone should be forced to re-rate this beer after 3,000+ reviews.   The pour gives a lightly hazy, glowing, golden-straw body with a moderate head of smooth eggshell foam.  Fading at a decent clip, the head settles as a swirly film with a tight, bubbled edge.  Tall striped flares of lacing slowly break apart into small, hard spots.  The nose is pils in its purest and most divine form.  Fresh grassy hops burst from the glass, biting with subtle hints of white pepper and drier notes of straw and earth.  Hops are perfectly balanced by notes of subtly sweet dough and bready lager yeast, taking a nod at farm-fresh egg yolk and baking bread.  Awesome.  It simply begs for a gulp.  There I go......GULP....GULP.  So damn refreshing.  The hops dig in to the tongue, reminding of fresh cut grass and peppery lemon rind.  Beneath, Bohemian malts are soft, round, and super-yeasty.  Everythings fresh and balanced, each sip begging the next....and the palate backs that all up.  Well carbonated, semi-dry, and fairly crisp, the body distributes the flavors throughout every square millimeter of the mouth, leaving a lingering grass bitterness that almost never fades.  THIS.  IS.  PILSNER.  My newfound go-to beer of choice.
Pours golden with a quick fading white head.  A much more full pilsner.  Slow drinking, but very nice.
Golden color with white head.  Crisp Floral Hops aroma.  Pine hops taste.  Not the best product from Victory.

Pretty strong crisp, floral notes in this pils.  A bit fuller than I prefer in this style which makes it a bit tougher to drink, but the hops and malts all come together very well.  I wouldn’t reach for this if I wanted a pilsener,  but I’d still pick it up again.

12 oz bottle from premier gourmet. pours hazy golden with a nice white head. aromas are grainy malts and faded hops. the flavours are similar but the hops come through near the end. very nice pils but i think mine was a little past its prime. id love to try a fresh tap sample. id buy this if local.

12 oz bottle from Grapevine in Fort Mill, SC.  Poured into a pilsener glass a somewhat hazy gold color with a two finger white head.  Lacing was minimal.  Aroma was floral...very appealing.  Flavor was bready with a generous bitter hop bite on the end.  Body was rather light, with medium-high carbonation.  I agree with some of the previous reviewers that this beer probably isnt representative of the style.  I am rating this beer in a general case.  I would classify more as some kind of Pale.  Great beer though.

Bright glowing golden colour with a bubbly, sudsy head. Grassy aroma with some melon and honeydew notes. Mouthfeel is smooth and crisp with a strong dryness in the finish. Balance is very nice and easily drinkable. I could see this as a good "bridge" beer for the uninitiated.
Hazy orange-gold, towering white head. Very hoppy aroma, floral and resinous, beautiful! Generous quantities of malt and hops fill the palate. A very well-crafted pilsener, and absolutely delicious!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle poured to glass.  Pours bright yello with a fine haze and a small white, rocky head.  Lighty toasted pale malt grain aroma and flavor.  Crisp hops to the nose.  Slightly sweet and acidic taste with quick mellow bitter after.

12 oz bottle from John’s Grocery (Iowa City, IA). Pours a very light yellowish hue with a decent white bubbly head that quickly dissipates. Aromas are slightly of pilsner malt and light hop notes. Taste is similar, some "stinky bread" malts as I like to call them balanced well by some spicy bitter hops. Refreshing and quenching, but just as good as any other brew of the style that receives considerably lower ratings than this bad boy. Overrated for sure. Still, I’d drink it again and it was a decent beer

[1505-20080702] Bottle. Grassy straw aroma has slightly wet hay hints. Clear, yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head and some centralized bubbles. Grainy straw flavour is a little watery. Medium body has some astringency. Average, drinkable.

(Bottle).  Aroma of hops and malt.  Pours a bright yellow with a large white head.   Flavor is pilsener all the way, with a hopsy bite that shades it much closer to a Bohemian than a typical German style.   The malt under-layer provides some complexity and balance.   The finish is lengthy, with just the right touch of bitterness.  Excellent and refreshing.   Pure drinkability.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2013 First of all, let me say that Pilsener is my favorite style of beer.  And that I have worked in 4 German Pils breweries.  This is not a Pils, has nothing to do with Pils.  It is an aggressively hopped American microbrew that tastes like a West Coast IPA.  The hop nose is overpowering, the extreme hop oil flavor does not belong here.  I do like the bitterness, but I get very little malt sweetness in the aftertaste.  Just another over the top, sledgehammer beer from amateurs who have not yet learned how to brew a sophisticated Pilsener.  "Prima" it is not.

Bottled.  Pours a clear golden, yellow colour with lots of carbonation and a thin white head.  Nice citrus hop aroma plus some sweetness balance.  The hops are the first thing to hit the tongue, then the malt balances it well and it finishes with a bit of dry spice.  Definitely near the top of the pils class.

Pretty cool beer for a style I commonly pass on. appearance was normal slight gold yellow and a spicey smell that was worth sticking my nose in all during the tasteing. What really impressed was the progress of flavor. off the bat is a hops spice that goes into a quick berry like sweetness and than finishes with the bitterness which lingers.

Poured very light yellow into the glass with a thin white head.  Aroma was a touch of sweetness and some sharp dry hops.  Taste was a touch of grainy sweetness and a quick punch of musty and earthy hops.  Nothing that detracts here, just super stripped down and simple.  Not the best balance for a pils.
I am not a big fan of pilsners and I really enjoyed this one.  It is quite strong in my opinion but was not overly bitter.

Pours out a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is of hops and grainy malts. Surprisingly full-flavored, very hoppy, with nice malt character to it as well. Medium-bodied, long dry finish. This is a great Pilsener.

Aroma is slightly hoppy, spicy, earthy.  The appearance is straw gold, thin white head.  The flavor is somewhat malty, grassy and certainly hoppy.  The hops leave a little sting on the finish.  Not bad, better than some German pilseners out there.   In fairness, this is far from my favorite style. Not bad overall.

I tried this a few months ago but the beer was over a year expired.  This time, the beer was only 3 months expired so I am working my way up.  Aroma was slightly hoppy and with a hint of czech spice.  Flavor was again slightly hoppy, smooth, and an easy drink.  Not a bad brew at all but nothing I would write home about.

Possibly the best example of a Bavarian/Bohemian pilsner I’ve ever had. Pours bright golden with a nice white head. Hop aroma shines through, which is a definite plus. Taste is malty but with just enough bitterness to keep you coming back. A very good example of the style.

Great, refreshing beer. Pours a hazy gold with a nice white head that dissipates. Unlike other Pilsners, this has a hoppy kick which makes it very unique, dry, and refreshing. It certainly gives this pils some characters. Has very sweet undertones that consist of some sweet fruits, maybe some citrus, and caramel. Sports a fairly heavy malt undertone as well.

pours a light yellow golden color with thick puffy white head.  scent is of bitter hops.  taste is the same with also some hints of wheat and grass.  very nice pilsner.  I would purchase this again.  very easy to drink and also high quality.

(USA) Pours a light golden color with some nice carbonation and a sm-white head. The aroma is sweet, grassy, and with a hint of spices. The taste is crisp  and matly,and very hoppy. The mouthfeel is smooth and would be a very nice pils to drink on a HOT day.

12 oz. into pint glass.  Light golden with pretty big-bubbled carbonation; pretty creamy white head.  Aroma is very light, smells like pale malt with just a dirty little hint of hops.  Flavor is very soft too, with not much going on.  Just refreshing with a descent resiny hop presence on the finish  definitely more so than most other pilsners.  Pretty dry finish, no alcohol.  Light to medium bodied on the palate  more body than I expected from the style.  Crisp.  Overall:  one of the better pilsners I have had, but Clipper Citys Uber Pilsner is way better.  Still, this is a great example of its style and is definitely a refreshing un-flawed beer thats great for the summer.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2010 12 oz. bottle best by October 13, 2008. Straw colored pour with a 2-finger head. Decent retention and little specks of lacing. Grassy aroma with an earthy tinge. Grainy taste with a bitter finish. The hop tastes lingers quite a long time. Medium body. Very refreshing.

Really nice, easy drinking warm weather beer that isn’t over complicated.  I’ve not sampled a lot of pilsners, but this one provides the best combo of what I think they’re supposed to be.  Clear gold with a greenish hue.  Smells grassy but with a little mineral twinge, like a grain field next to a stream. Taste is more of the same and crazy smooth.  Mouthfeel is very smooth but not at all heavy, nearly perfect for the style. When the warm weather comes, so should this beer.

Very good for a pilsener.  Golden, light foamy head etc.  Just like you’d want and expect from a pilsener.  At first the flavor is very, very bitter.  Then it eases up and gains complexity.  Light and refreshing.  I usually drink heavy, dark beers, and drinking this cold on a hot day is a good way to enjoy it.

Draught @ Collins Pub, Seattle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a malty grainy bready aroma with some hoppy hints.. Crisp malty grainy flavor with some hoppy hints. Sweetish malty crisp grainy finish wit hsome hoppy aftertaste.

Brings back memories of my visit to Germany.  This beer is a very good representation of a true German pils.  Very fresh Spalt and sazz flavor.  Yellow straw color and a nice brussels lace.  

If you are looking for a stronger hop profile with these hops try HOP IT by Urthel or Golden Promise by DogFish Head  (Formerly Golden Showers)

(Sample from July 18, 2008 Beer Club Meeting) Super light pale yellow color.  Aroma... like rubber gloves?  What the heck?  Taste is skunky and yet interesting.  Light, though.  Very floral, not as hoppy as I expected.  Tastes almost like I’m licking surgical soap, but it’s still good if that makes any sense.

12 oz. Bottle.  Classic golden yellow in color with a quickly dissipating white head.  Nose is full of the Noble hop varieties with a bit of a spicy aroma. The flavor has a sharp bitterness and a bit of a grassy hop taste.  The malt is present, but subtle with a mild sweetness that takes the edge off the hops. Body is about right for a pils, maybe a little thin behind all the hops.  Finish is crisp with a lasting dry bite.  Not my favorite style of beer, but it works great for Virginia during the muggy months of summer.

Well folks, I won’t call it heaps of hops but they are there.  Bottle pours a nice yellow gold with asticky lacing and a quickly diminishing head.  Body is malts covered by hops but not by much. Refreshing and hoppy. Easy drinking.  A solid product from Victory.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2009 hops. Some hops. Some more hops. I was impressed with the amount of flavor in this for a pils, but the rest I found lacking at the time. Early rating so will have to re-rate.  re-rate pours super clear pale yellow with an eager but fading head. Primary taste and aroma is floral bitter hops, mouthfeel has a little honey like creaminess to it but not enough of a backing for my taste.

Bottle.  I haven’t had too much experience with high quality lagers, but I’ve been looking for more pilsners to try.  I really enjoy this pilsner.  A nice, golden lager with a hoppy lagerish flavor and a crisp finish.  A nice session beer that almost anyone can appreciate.

Bottle and I feel like I’m repeating myself but its once again impressive.  Malt is balanced very well with hops on the nose.  Very short sweetness followed by a long bitterness.  Very smooth and drinkable.  This brewery consistently rises on my list.

Bottle:  Courtesy of my Secret Santa...thanks Jason.  This is really a beautiful looking brew...pours a clear gold with a two-fingered white pillow-like head.  Aroma is chock-full of hops and some ?Munich malts.  Other notes of grass and very light citrus are present.  Nice body for the style and very crisp and clean tasting.  Flavor of malt and hops, very basic and not overly complex but wonderfully executed.  Very nice brew that I wish I could buy in my area.

Bottle from Trader Joe’s in Orland Park, IL.  Pours clear gold with a big, soft head that didn’t take long to disappear.  A good example of a German-style Pils done American.  Nice strong hop taste with a clean finish.  Please, American brewers, more like this!
Wow. This is the best pilsener from a domestic brewer that I’ve found after years of looking. A really crisp, snappy beer in the finest Czech style. This is really good stuff.

Pours a pale gold with a medium frothy white head. 
Aroma is light lemon and honey hop aroma. 
Very nice, 
Flavour is grassy hop, grainy malt and some corn tones? Light lingering lemony bitterness.
First thing that hits you are hops. Then comes flavors of honey and pine.Nice strong even carbonation thats not overwelming. Very Nice.

12oz bottle.  I think this is my favorite American Pils.  Transparent deep yellow color with an almost green tint to it.  Deliciously crisp and surprisingly hoppy for a Pilsener.  Creamy yeast still manages to shine through and compliment the initial bitterness.  Excellent as a slow sipper or a session ale.  Classic.
crips, clean, hoppy, this was a perfect beer to enjoy with lunch on a hot summer day.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Very clear body with a thin white head. Mild floral aroma. Crisp and lean with lots of hops to finish. Good.

Bottle, Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX.
Pours light yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma of pilsner and hops, I also got faint bannana. Flavor of malt with a generous hop flavor and bitter that works out well.....Medium body with med-high carbonation. Over all, a very tasty beer....did enjoy it.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2010 Bottle.  Looks like yellow piss with a white head.  Aroma of grass, light floral hops.  Flavor of wheat, light hops, maybe some light fruits, a little skunk.  Quite flavorful, although I couldnt quite identify all of the flavors.  Very tasty, simple, easy to drink.  Id love this on draught.  Great pilsener. 
Update 3/7/10: Had another bottle which was super lemony, like sucking on a lemon drop.  Plenty of other light fruits and sweet malt but the lemon really stands out.  Tasty stuff.

Bottle, best by Aug 04 08. Aroma lemony with solid malt background, herbal hops. Lots of the hops in the flavor, herbal, grassy, almost spicy, with that strong malt base holding strong. Dried apple, apple skin, almost leathery. Full bodied. Very nice.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Courtesy of MaltOMeal. Pours a clear golden with a small, dense, white head. Malty aroma with flowery hops - very fresh. Medium body with clean malts, flower notes and a rather dry and hoppy finish. 190608

Botte #2 at Papsoes blindtasting.
Cloudy yellow coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of tea and hops with notes of citrus.
Fruity flavour of citrus, grass and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.
Pours cloudy light golden color with small white head. Has a nice light hopped aroma with pepper. Similar taste, with a mild fruit and spice notes. Very refreshing and enjoyable beer.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 Pours a golden yellow with a full head.  Can smell the hops.  Not really a fan of the style.  Crisp and hoppy with a dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2011 Bottle, #2 at Papsoes blindtasting. Pours slight cloudy yellow with a lacing white head. Mild citrusy hops aroma. Light hoppy flavour, quite mild and citrusy. Holds light bitterness and only a vague caramel malt flavour. Ends dry and light citrusy and with a vague spice note in the far finish.6-3-6-12=3.0

From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mild citrusy and crisp hoppy. Citrusy, grassy and slight hayish. Crisp and vibrant hops flavoured. Bitter and mild citrusy finish.7-3-7-3-15=3.5

Bottle. [After party @ Papsoe, thanks buddy] Clear pale yellow color. Spare lacework. Aroma of light hops, mild caramel and hint of fruit. Over the palate came lovely mild pepper, almost liquorish like, apricot feel. Light bodied with an average carbonation and light dry texture. Light sweet and bitter in balance. Light dry and bitter finish. 5 / 3 / 6 / 3 / 12

Bouteille de 12 oz achetée chez Julios Liquors (Westborough, MA). Arôme: Odeur dhoublon floral avec une pointe dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde pâle avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe de pamplemousse. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #1754)

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2010 Bottle. Aromas of fir trees and fresh grain. Deep deep golden, almost copper with huge frothy head, scattered lacing. Creamy mouthfeel, great carbo level carries all the flavors around the mouth. What gorgeous hops!!!!!!! Leafy, piney, earthy but bright. Brighter than many if not most IPAs out there. Some endive-like bitterness. A near-perfect hoppy pils, really and it has become one of my go-to beers. One of my favorite sessionable beers, period. Every time I go to have one Im afraid it wont live up to memory and every time it actually does. This is quality stuff. It sorta fills that IPA spot without the heaviness, and yet Id hesitate to compare it to an IPA just on the basis of its being hoppy. Truth is, the malt character, the quality of the hop, and the body of the beer combine to make it unmistakably pilsener that would live up to New or Old world standards.
Pilseners are not my thing, but this one is nice.  Pours a light yellow with minimal head.    Nice hoppy flavor.  The best Pilsener I have had.

Pours a clear golden color with foamy white head. Some grassy hops and malts in the nose. Flavor was malts, earthy hops, a bit of lemon zest. A slightly bitter and dry finish. Real nice Pilsner, just right for a hot summer day. Very refreshing and drinkable.
Nothing too impressive about this pilsner. The hops dont even shine. Sure I can tast them, but its all watered down. Poor pilsner.... Sorry about the loss...
Straw yellow color with no head.  Aroma of yeast, malts and some hops.  Balanced taste of yeast, malts and hops.  No bitter edge, but has a dry finish.  Refreshing beer.

Pours a very light, pale yellow in color.  A nice half inch head forms on the pour.  Smell is malty with some underlying floral qualities.  Taste is much the same, but with more of the underlying floral hops coming through.  The taste is much better than the smell.  Clean and non-cloying on the mouthfeel.  This is a good pilsener.

Poured golden with 2 finger head into pilsner  glass.  Head quickly disappeared.  It was a hot and humid day today, I was looking for a clean and refreshing beer and this one fit the bill.  Sweat sock like malty aroma, not a bad thing.  Crisp for an American Pils.   Like a Pilsner Urquell at its best (not skunked) with a bit more malt finish.  I really like this beer.  Solid Pils, does not suffer from the "all the beers taste similar" curse of a lot of "micros"  see Sierra Nevada, Sam Adams, Petes

Pours golden with nice one finger head. Aroma of citrus, spice, a hint of hops and sweet malt. Quite strong actually considering the style. Flavor is a mix of sweet malt, some hop presence as weel as spicy notes- most notable ginger. Almost tangy mouthfeel with quick, dry finish and not too much aftertaste. Quite flavorful and refreshing. Nice one.

Bottled.  Very sweet malty aroma with a hint of alcohol and a decent note of noble hops.  Nice malt flavor with a slight bitter finish.  Hops come through more in flavor.  Aftertaste is kinda bleh.  I expected more hop aroma.  But tasty.

The beer pours a clear yellow with a quickly disappearing thin white head. The nose is a mix of light aromatic hops and grass. The taste starts clean and finished quickly but the middle of the palate has a funk to it. Almost like wet paper or rotting straw.

Poured a clear bright yellow with a nice foamy white head that left good lacing. There was a slightly grassy hoppy aroma with a hint of grapefruit/citrus. A nice crisp clean initial taste that was slightly bitter. The finish rolled into a little stronger bitterness, but was generally mild and refreshing.
