12 oz. Bottle.  Pour a light golden color with a substantial long lasting white head. Excellent lacing.  It carries a light grainy aroma with subtle hops.  The initial flavor has a faint, sweet maltiness and closes with a dry, somewhat bitter finish. This is a light bodied pilsner that is refreshing and quite drinkable.
The pilseners are not my favorite type of beer and I dont really find much special about this one. It has a tart flavor with a grapefruit accent and malty undertones.
Pours light golden colour, small white head. Aroma is of soft hops, lemon and gigner. Slightly bitter, and slightly hopped. Clean and refreshing throughout the beer. Finishes soft.

Tasty. The hops come through in the aroma, and the balance in the taste with the malt is perfect. Not too weak, not too strong. Very clean, easy to drink beer. For a pilsener, its great, but if you dont like pilseners in general, it wont hurt to pass this one up.
Great pilsener. Strong finish with lots of hops.  I like it alone, good at the end of the day.

OK-I really love Pils and this american version makes me proud to be from the US (but of German ancestry). Has a nice proteiny head that laces the glass, good floral hop aroma. Bigger than usual hop bitterness- bridges the gap between continental pils and big hoppy American beers. Easy drinking, good clean flavor, very nicely brewed, I could have a keg of this on tap at all times. Few if any other US breweries can make a pils like this. Gets a solid 4.

One of my favorite American pilsners. Sweet but hoppy aroma. Kind of bready. Nice golden color with a white fluffy head. Pretty sweet for a pilsner but a nice bite in the finish. Medium bodied and refreshing. Very good choice for a pils
pours a off gold with a cloudy texture.. smells of grass and hops. at first there as a sweet malty taste followed by a decent hop profile which doesnt overpower. refreshing, liberating.

12 oz bottle.  Poured a "macro" clear pale yellow with a small and quickly dissapating white head.  Aroma was mostly sweet German lager malts and a decent Sazz hop profile too (which was pleasing).  Taste was mostly the sweet lager malt up front but a nice dose of hop flavor and bitterness.  It tastes alot like Heineken and other macro lagers but with more crisp and fresh flavors and a stronger hop profile and finish.  Mouthfeel is a little sticky but light and refreshing.  A good pilsner but not my cup of tea.  If Im gonna drink a basic lager thought I would much rather it be this than a dreaded macro.
On tap at the brickstore.  Pale yellow color.  Some Saaz hop aroma.  Also some feet in the aroma.  I dont think the lines were clean.  I need to try this again from bottle or something.

Light, clear, golden pour with thin white head. Nasty aroma of every crummy lager Ive ever smelled. I guess this just isnt my style. With all the build up and hype I had heard about this beer, I was really expecting something more. I dont get what all the fuss is about. The  "heaps o hops" are definitely hidden...umm; why have hops if you are going to hide them? But I sure get a heap o lingering German malt unpleasantness on the back of my tongue. Like licking an ashtray. For all you folks who like this stuff, knock yourselves out. Ill take a nice a pale ale or IPA any day.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2008 A clear pale golden beer with a small head that doesnt last. Aroma is that of your standard euopean mainstream lager (bready malty pilsner) with a little more spicy hops on top, but the flavor packs more of a punch: malt up front, followed by spicy noble hops, finishing with hop bitterness that lingers. Good lager!

12 oz. bottle.  Pours clear yellow, thin and short lived white head.  Smell is mostly skunky, with an underlying scent of hops.  Taste is no different - immediate skunk, but if held in the mouth goes to an almost pleasant bitter and has a hoppy aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is a bit thicker than other pilsners, and almost has a slight syrupy consistency.  A very average tasting pilsner which I would have no problem passing up again.
Pours yellow with a moderate, fine white head. Aroma is kind of musty in a strange way. Mouth feel is moderate with a very excellent clean, hoppy flavor.

Man, this smells nice and refreshing.  bready , pilsner malt smell.  subtle hint of flowery hops.

straw/gold. bubbly, small head.  

bready taste up front, balanced with some bitter hops at the end.  a little stickier than i would like a pils.  

not a wow beer, but definately a great pilsner.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2011 on tap. pours slight hazy gold color with white head. nose of spicey, grassy, and leathery hops. very clean flavor profile with spicy hops cutting through. Big pepper and grassy bitterness. this is one solid very bitter and refreshing pils.

Serving from a 12 ounce bottle. Appearance- very pale straw colour with a slight haze. Head comes and goes quickly. Nose- grassy spicy hops. Taste- quite spicy in the front end, which quickly dries out into an aspirin like bitterness in the finish. Malt is very clean- a little bready. Carbonation is medium. Its tasty- just seems too harsh for this delicate style.
Draught. Very clear yellow with a nice white head. Nice grassy hop, flowery. Clean palate, very dry with an assertive lingering bitter end.

I enjoyed this, but I felt it was a very average pilsener. It was better than normal, but not above. It smelled of some like hops and it tasted like every pilsener Ive ever had that didnt taste like asshole.

Bottle: pours a clear, golden amber with a frothy white head, hoppy, citrus and honey aroma, taste is mildly hoppy with a slight sweetness, crisp and clean.  A great pilsner.  Worthy of all the praise it gets.
Another fine vrew from Victory. Nice subtle hoppy aroma, great color. Thin head that dissipates somewhat slowly. Excellent beer when served in a tall pilsener glass, chilled well.

12oz bottle.  Aroma of honey, citrus hops, white wine.  Average sized foamy white head that mostly diminished and left great lace.  Light yellow gold hue.  Clear and sparkling body.  Flavor is sweet and fruity with a slight crisp hop finish.  Palate is lively and watery.  Light bodied and refreshing.  Wow, what a great beer.  Very refreshing and quite drinkable.  Far and away the best pilsener Ive ever had.
12 oz bottle. Pours golden with white head. Aroma is floral hos, citrus and malt. Flavor is hops, citrus and malt. Refreshing and not heavy. Perfect for ahot muggy summer day.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2008 Nose has a great, fruity balance with grapefruit and raisins and picks up a funky, cheesy blanket near the finish. Golden body with large, long-lasting white head and loads of lacing. Taste is a beautiful balance between huge hops and a bready, sour malt character. Palate is alive with hops. Beer finishes with less bitterness than starts, but balance is still present. Serious beer.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2008 Grassy and moderate hop flavor; beautiful in a pils glass.  Traditional to the style, PA folks should support the local brewery with this one and put down that case of Heinken... Stella on the other hand, maybe....

Yellow color; small, white head dissipates into a small, white ring but can be resurrected a bit with some swirling.  Aroma citrus, grass, wheat.  Flavor is strongly unbalanced with overwhelming bitterness, which, to me, completely invalidates the high rating of this beer; aside from the overdone hops, I do appreciate the rest of the flavors, which include bread and grass.  Nice body; surprisingly full for such a light beer.  Overall, this is a decent beer, but its also a great example of the ridiculous bias here toward overhopped beers; badly unbalanced, and the bitterness overwhelms the rest of the flavors.

12-oz. One of the classics of the American craft brewing revolutions, I know. But its really just ok. Pours crystal clear medium gold with a fluffy, spritzy platinum blonde head. Settles quickly to just a smear. Plenty of attractive rising carb. Big skunky nose. Probably not their fault, but theres very little left here in the way of hop aroma. Medium/light watery body, lots of artichokes and skunk on the mid-palate. Theres a little bit of hay and biscuit in there as well to show its not completely broken, but this beer is really not ready for prime time.

A- Yellow in color with a nice frothy head that sticks around for quite a while. Looks very carbonated.

S- Smell is not too expressive but definitely malt forward with some hops.

T- Tastes sweet and malty but definitely has a hop kick for a pilsener. Very smooth and tasty.

M- Mouthfeel is very carbonated (perhaps a bit too much) and medium bodied. The carbonation, while somewhat overkill did add to the light smoothness.

D- This is sublimely drinkable. It melds a lighter pilsener style beer with a flavor that is so well balanced and smooth it makes you want more and more.
From a bottle poured a nice anber color with a good amount of head.  Nice hoppy flavor with a lingering finish.

Hate being a buzz-killer, this is not a bad beer at all, Im just not into APAs, even disguised as bottom fermented Pilsners. Golden with tiny bubbles ascending, and an extremely clean grassy aroma. Prickly crystaline hops on a medium-bitter mouthfeel lets you know its an American. Sharp and green at first with a smooth tail at the end. Decent. The Storm King and the Monkey still rule their roost in my book.

THIS is the ultimate summer thirst quencher.  I call it my gatorade with a buzz.  Pour light golden yellow with a small white head.  Beautiful aroma of fruity, well picked hops.  Taste of hops isnt as strong as the aroma which makes this an easy to drink beer.  Another good beer by Victory!

12 oz bottle.  Poured slightly hazy.  Aroma of hops. Dry and slightly crisp.  I just returned from Germany so maybe I was a little spoiled but I expected more from this beer.  It was good but not as great as I had heard.

Ive been drinking this pils for years.  I agree with the NY Times panel abbout being the best pils in the world.  Its always consistent, great dry finish.  Subtle malt notes and just a great crowd pleaser.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a clear, light-yellow amber with a white head.  Magc_Dave doesnt know shit about beer.  Of course we already knew that.  This is a very fine example of the pilsner style.  This has a pilsner hops are prevalent with grass and some scent of lemon.  Taste is grassy hops and lemon.  Mouthfeel is very crisp, clean  and refreshing with some carbonation and a slight bitter finish.  Very good beer for a summer day, especially after working in the yard.
Bottle Cheers Dave i think ... Crisp clear yellow ... lager hop nose .. overfizzy ... lagery and not even very good lager.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 Bottle from jj57jdnbf86789dbnd7hj3 or whatever his name is. My god what a disapointment, any half ass german pils will rip the tits out this overrated fellow. Aroma is cornish,m grainy pale malts, grassy hints of lemon. Taste is similar, easy goling yes, but dry grassy pritty bland, incredibly average. RERATE: Upto 4.3 from 2.5. Bottle in the rake. Alround rating: Gorgeous hoppy fresh, awsome mix of great lager malts and leafy hopness. Alround one of those ones i wanted to rerate as i knew the bottle i had was old and poor and i was right.
Pours a clear yellow body with a thin white head. Sweet-ish up front with a finish of grassy hops. Good lawnmower beer.
Bottle. Pours a clear light yellow color with a huge white head. Aroma of malts, hops and citrus. Has light skunky smell. Taste of malt, dry hops and citrus. Has a dry light bitter dusty finish.

Bottled shared with J at PP Bottle Shop. One of the best damn Pilseners Ive ever had. Lots of straight up hoppy goodness for this type of brew, crisp and refreshing. It has a nice lingering citrus character after each sip, just a pleasing session brew all round.
At PP bottle shop w/ J. A nice thirst quenching, hop forward pils with notes of grass, citrus, hay.  This is far from my favorite styles - but this one delivered.  Very enjoyable for a sunny day...

Pours golden color with small white head and good lacing.
Aroma is floral and hops.
Flavor is strong fresh resininous hops and light malts.
Palate is good for the type.
Overall a crisp, refreshing brew. Would not have guessed this was a pilsner if it wasnt labelled as such.

Another long-overdue rating in the form of a staple that somehow just never got entered.  When you are looking for microbrewed lagers, PA is THE PLACE, with a number of great brewers (such as Victory, Stoudts, Troegs) that are true to the German style.  Love this beer.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2010 Nice yellow pours with white head, thick with some protein shells.  Smells crisp, hoppy.  Taste surpising citrus a la cascade/amarillo but spicy as well; smooth with many lager characteristics present at the same time; mysterious, hard to define, identity crisisd (Im not sure); but a good brew from Victory. Addendum 2/8/10: this has moved up in my books; a Victory go-to; I still think this is a little over-hopped for the German Pils style, but Im down.

Pours a pale yellow leaving a fluffy white head which settles into a lasting cap. Smells mostly of floral hops and sweet malts. Taste is citrus malt up front and bitter hops finishing it off. This is the hoppiest pils Ive ever had. Very well balanced and definately a session beer.

Pours a hazy gold with an average sized head, lacing through the pint.  Nice of bittere citrus, spice, and some hop.  Flavor is also lightly bitter and a little spiced.  This pils is different because it doesnt have the heavy grain profile that most pilsners do.  Its a well balanced brew with a nice bit of hops.  Lightly bitter finish.   Mouth is light.
Frothy white head on a clean pale yellow body. Crisp and a bit of grassy acidity from the hops. A good summer beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a crystal clear yellow with a massive amount of white foamy head that simmers down to a thin mostly lasting layer.  Aroma of floral hops and a hint of sweet malts.  Initial flavor is balanced between hops and malt.  No other flavors come out distinctly.  Aftertaste dominated by the hops and hint of spice as it drags on.  Some lacing, moderate aftertaste, light body, and limited alcohol noted.  Overall a nicely done beer when in the mood for something lighter and maybe a good starter beer for people not into the bigger beers.

Bottle.  Pours a bright golden yellow with medium white head.  Aroma is of clean hops.  Pretty damn hoppy for a pils.  Dominated by grassy hops, but there is a slight malt background to balance.  Great session beer.

On draft at Jerrys. nice clear straw yellom pour with big white head. Classic pilsner malt in the nose, some floral and grassy hops. Flavor is more spicey and grassy hops with some subtle fruit. Very nice dry spicey finish. Great meal time beer.

From bottle : Pours a slightly hazy light yellow, with a very white foamy head, about 2 fingers tall, that sticks around for a few minutes.  Nose of esters, and skunkyness, and some corn.  Taste has a slight bit of fruit, but continues with the skunkyness from the nose, and the corn.  Medium body, with a lively palate.  Aftertaste is of corn again.  I cant say that i care for this very much.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2008 I usually avoid Pilsners, but a recent review of this brew in Draft Magazine had gotten me interested  and Im glad I picked up a bottle... Poured a straw, yellow tone with a thin white head.  Fruity hops and esters on the nose.  Dry and foamy palate and flavors of bread-like hops and malt with a nice crispness and balance.  Other fruity flavors like apples and oranges.  Victory really made a great Pilsener here.
Pours a light golden yellow.  Body is light with a light mouthfeel.  The skunky hop content is quite a bit of a surprise.  One of the better light beers around.

Good, but overrated. Yes, its hoppier than the average pilsener and, honestly, its a solid beer, but I get over it pretty easy. Has a few nice dried fruit (apricot) and spice notes. The malt aftertaste is a touch skunked/metallic but still fairly clean. Just dont see why this beer is so highly rated.Then again, if you (like most american microbreweries) equate hops with quality, you may have a new favorite pilsener.
12oz bottle. musty aroma. golden pour with white head. flavor is bitter hops, slightly watery with a sour finish.
Gold pour with white head, nice spicy aroma with good bitterness. Decent Pilsner brew.
Nice yellow color; Head left something to be desired; Grassy, wonderufl nose. Dry, spicey palate. A satisfying pils- maybe one of the best I have encountered.

Botle. Pours a slightly hazy pale golden with a small short lived white head. Aroma of floral and spicy hops with pilsner malt in the background. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium mouthfeel with a moderate amount of bitterness and a dry crisp finish. Very good.
Bottls.  Pours gold with a thin, frothy head, very clear.  Aroma of hops and bread.  Flavor is of grass,and hops.  Has decidedly bitter finish.

Victory Prima Pils
ABV: 5%
IBU: ?
Calories: 150
Volume: 12 fl oz
Glass: Tulip
Purchased at: Joe Canals
Price per fl oz: $8 / 72 fl oz = $0.11 per fl oz
Consumed on/at: home on March 18th, 2008

sensory first impression: No head but a beautiful yellow golden beer. A pilsner, to be sure - pale, clear, and plain, visually. Aroma is smoky. Aroma is deep and rich. Aroma is hints of pork and cabbage. Taste is delicious, rich and hinting of other flavors. I taste bologna. I taste bread. I taste lettuce. I taste toast. Its wonderfully balanced, a superlative taste but so very simple and unidimensional. Lacing is nice, but head is minimal. Warm with light alcohol. A great simple beer.

Aroma/Olfactory:
Malt flavor is: bread, cereal, nuts, toast, oats.
Hop flavor is: resinous, floral, very herbaceous
Yeast flavor is: doughy, thick, moldy, leathery, deep.
Other flavors include: bubblegum, lightly cherry, ginger, raisin, smoke

Visuals/Appearance:
Color is: pale, golden, amber, light, thin, white.
Liquid is: clear, immaculate
Head and lace are: minimal, white

Taste/Flavor:
Maltiness or Sweetness level is: medium to heavy
Hoppiness or Bitterness level is: light to medium
Sour level is: none

Palate/Tactile:
Body or Mouthfeel is: medium
Texture is: creamy, thick, silky
Carbonation is: lively
Finish is: long and wonderfully balanced.

Overall experience: Visually this is not a stimulating beer, but so rewarding in other ways. Its delicious in terms of taste, though not overwhelming in any way. Its feel is enveloping, smooth, and mellow. Its aroma is enticing, but not overwhelming. Its a wonderful beer, and easily my favorite pilsner.

THIS could very easily be one of the best American Pilsners Ive ever had.  First time was on tap at Map Room in Chicago, loved it.  Pours clean with fluffy white head that lasts all the way through.  The body and hops truly accentuate each other, and the mouthfeel is perfect for the style.  Have one if you get the chance.
Golden in color with a small head.  Smell is more hops than a normal pilsner with some malts as well.  Taste is clean and crisp with slight hops and finishes dry.
Easy to drink, not too heavy.  Quite solid overall.  Pours nice golden with thin head.  Has a nice pleasant floral hop aroma and crisp, slightly bitter finish.  Great session beer.

Draught - various places in GA. The aroma was faint but had all the characteristics of a solid pilsener. Pours golden blond, very thin head. Sweet and hoppy. It has a strange malt character that I cant place.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2009 The aroma is hoppy with corn malt. The appearance is milky white gold with a thin head. The flavor is sweet with grassy and herbal hops. There malt is corn like but not too much. The palate is thin. This beer fails somewhere between average and pretty good.

Pretty light golden color almost reminds me of a white ale when pouring. Thin white head that leaves almost no lacing. Nice nose of hops and sweet grain. Nice sweet, citrusy taste at first. Good, bubbly body with a deliciously smooth hop finish. Leaves a pleasantly dry sensation. Excellent pilsner

Clear golden pour, thin white head. Some spicy hops on the nose. Light and refreshing mouth feel. Nice hop taste with no bitterness. A hint of fruit in here too. Great beer for a warm day. I think I could drink 10 of these.
For a Pilsener, this beer is amazing. Beforetating this one, I couldnt have imagined what a good pilsener would taste like.

From unclemattie via trade.  Thanks!  The pour was golden in color and slightly turbid.  A fizzy, one-finger plus tall head formed and provided decent lacing.  The aroma was tart lemon initially, with spicy saaz hops coming in and trying to offer some balance.  The flavor was sharp, tart citrus with only a bit of the expected spicy hops coming through.  The mouthfeel was thin and the finish was clean.  I think this one was a tad past its prime.  Would love to try it fresh on tap as it seems to have plenty of underlying potential.
12 0z. bottle, a golden pour with nice rocky head, very smooth and refreshing, an excellent pilsner

good pilsner, I definitely think this is one of the best pilsners I have ever had. I probably wouldnt but it again but thats just because Im not a huge fan of pilsners not because this beer is bad.
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: nice full flavored pilsner.  not watered down as i find most are.  good hop aroma and flavor.  way overcarbonated though...

Cloudy and lemon yellow looking with a foamy head that looks like beaten eggwhites.   I almost expect it to taste like PineSol.  A nice floral hoppy aroma with a decent hoppy bitterness flavor.  A little flat on the palate.  Overall its not too bad and it gets better as you drink it.

Pours a nice light gold color with a thin white head.  Quite a nice aroma, with a nice hops balance.  I liked the citrus tang, which was fresh and upfront.  This is not a wimpy Pils, but neither is it overpowering.  Im not a huge fan of Pils brews, but this one is different in my books.  All in all, a very nice brew, and Id like to pair it with some grilled chicken and vegetables on a warm , sunny day.
Color is golden with a decent head. Aroma and Flavors are pleasantly hoppy with slight citrus notes. A very solid pilsner.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2008 The past year has been quite a beer journey. Ive explored Belgium in far more depth than I ever knew existed. Ive explored the American extreme brewing phenomenon. And I find myself appreciating a great classic beer all the more. This is the best pilsener Ive had so far. I would characterize pilseners as smelling like grass and straw, weak malts, and little or no hops. This beer pours with a full white head that lingers throughut the poor. It has a nice hop aroma distinctively devoid of the grass, straw, and corn of weaker pilseners. It is vibrant on the palate. The taste is slight citrus, crisp, with balanced malt and bitter hops. The hops are bitter but not overpowering. The finish is clean. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2008 Fluorescent yellow (clear) with a decent head. Hops, grass and malts detected in aroma. I cant wait to taste! Amazing! It is such a crisp and clean taste that it disappears as soon as you swallow. Wonderful hoppy taste. This is what a pisner is..wow! I could drink 12 of these!

Rich, golden body with a respectable, white, lacing head. Assertive hop aroma, and that gives you an idea of what to expect in the flavor department. This Pilsener is aggressively hopped, yet Victory added enough malt to keep everything in check. Actually, this is one of the few Pilseners that go very well with the winter months; yes, I think its that bold. Anyway, the carbonation level is nearly perfect, and the overall mouthfeel is quite satisfying. This truly is a very fine beer, and I will definitely purchase it again in the near future.

I love bitter pilsners like this with spicy food.  I have to eat to get the bitterness off my tongue, then I have to drink to quench the heat.  Its what systems engineers call a positive feedback situation.
Thanx to ElMatador for this.A real solid offering from Victory.I have good things about this brew and they are true.A solid flavorful lager.Clean, crisp and refreshing.A small bitter finish.

pours a bright golden color with an average sized white head.  aroma is of sugary lemons and grassy hops.  flavor is complex starting off hoppy and ends with a spicy bite.  Ive yet to be unsatisfied with anything from Victory.

A very hoppy pilsner.  Aroma is curious and fun with spicy and grassy notes, with a tinge of orange rind.  Flavor is dominated by hops (spicy, hints of resin begin to appear) with a strongly bitter finish. Some malt flavor.  Overall the flavors are bold.  The finish is interestingly dry.

12 oz bottle.  Bought it with good intensions.  I wanted to have another good victory.  This one was not as good as the others.  Poures a light head and golden yellowish body.  Grass and light hops are present.  Good, not great.

Pours gold with a decent sized white head.  Sweet grass,  hops,  and bread aroma.  Flavor wasnt much different.  A little bit of metal in the hop flavor,  and the sweet is a bit overpowering and a funky earthy flavor pops its head in in a not so great way.  Finishes clean,  slightly bitter,  thin.  Decent.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2011 Original rating from back in the day. Not too impressed. Grassy hops with some light grainy malt, kinda boring. Huge, frothy, white head with decent retention covering a nice golden colored beer. Taste is moderately bitter on the back end and very watery for 5.3%. Again, boring. Watery mouthfeel with lively carbonation. Victory makes better beers. 636314:3.2  A clean hop forward pilsner. Spicy and a touch fruity hop aroma. Flavor is balanced bitter, but the malt profile (sweet, bready grainy) out shines the spice and slight mint hop flavors. Lingering bitter finish is crisp.
Victorys Prima Pils is a very good pilsener with a light golden color and a short-lasting head.

Stylistically, this a perfect pilsener! Unfortunatelly, pilseners are boring. This is a very tastey pils though.  A bit of hops aroma with the traditional lager malt. A nice smooth beer. A great sell to turn people onto micros.

Pretty good american pilsener. A little hoppier than a pilsener should typically be, but not a bad thing. Very crisp and refreshing but has a grassy taste. Give one of these to your friend who only drinks miller lite for a special treat.

On tap at the Purple Onion, Saluda, NC.

Pilsner? Really?  It certainly looks like a pilsner in the glass, but beyond that, I wouldnt even peg it for a lager, let alone a Pilsener.  To me it was much more reminiscent of an IPA or  and APA. That being said, its a great beer in its own right. The palate was somewhat thin and sulfurish, and the nose somewhat sweet, but Id gladly have more.  When I want an American-made Pilsenser, I think Ill stick to Trumer.

Poured a hazy pale yellow with minimal head and no real lacing.  Slight aroma like lemons and a little hops.  A hop malt subtle taste and dry.  I would say hopi but is kept in check, for me average all around.

Not much nose.  Hazy gold appearance, almost looked like a Wit.  Decent balance, a little on the sweet side.  Heavy body for a Pilsner, was not very crisp.  Overall not too bad, just seemed like a misdirected Pilsner.

Bottle poured into a nice pils glass.

Appearance: Pale, golden yellow. Nice white head. Great lacing and a nice bubbling effect.

Smell: Strong, grassy hops. Memories of mowing the lawn from this one. 

Taste: One smooth beer. The hops are strong for the style but not overpowering. Faint malt presence. Good hop bitterness. Spicy fading to grassy/floral. The malt remains faint throughout, but never fades completely and compliments the hops well. Just a hint of sweetness just before the dry finish.

Mouthfeel: The bubbling glass made me worry about the carbonation, but it was spot-on when drinking. Very light in the mouth, but just chewy enough.

Drinkability: This is probably my favorite session beer, and is always in my fridge. The right level of alcohol and refreshment for a hot summer day (or any other day).

From a 12oz. bottle--Poured a golden-straw yellow body with a small, but attractive white head.  Sweet floral nose with some Pilsner spiciness in there.  Slightly earthy and grassy, but overwhelmingly tasted of honey.  Very nice beer from a solid brewery!

UPDATED: APR 10, 2008 Its a beer with that excellent pale straw yellow pour. The head is nice and laces the glass like it should, moderately light. This beer has a supreme bland skunky aroma like a good pils should and I havent even tasted it yet. Dare I say its pale yet cloudy... awesome. The flavor is something to relish in. Its underground, earthen, medium hop bitter, a little funky and sour, full, full flavored, and the taste lasts. The consistency is pure refreshment. Prosit!

Pours fairly pale yellow w/ bubbly white head. Its pretty good, if only falling slightly too far onto the grainy side (not sweet though), but I bit if this were very fresh with more hops in the aroma, it would be even better. A little metallic. Finishes dry and crisp as it should.

bottle. good light gold color. white head that didnt last. great lacing. didnt care for the smell. the description says "heaps o hops" and their not kidding. a tad too much hops for my taste. kind of had a sour orange feel. really not ok with the palate on this one. leaves my mouth feeling like an orange basket from lips to my stomach.

bottle. pours a light golden color with large white head. heavily carbonated, bubbles last throughout the entire glass. has an herbal, grassy, citrus smell. lightly sweet with a good balance of hop bitterness. beautiful thick lace clings all the way down the glass. very refreshing.
Heavy malt base spiked with a very apparent herbal, grassy, floral presence. Moderate lemon citrus. Eclectic malt body. Satisfying amd refreshing.

Pale saffron body with a one-finger light-tan head that gradually reduces to a thin cap.

Husky malt with a very herbal hop sharpness on top. Some lemongrass and floweriness.

Grassy hops are at the fore here. The herbal quality runs over the light biscuity malt flavor before melding into a refreshing bitterness. The finish maintains this raw hop bitterness and introduces a sweeter malt flavor, perhaps honey-like. Some lemon zest on the sides of the tongue.

Lively carbonation, light body, and extremely refreshing. Smooth in the mouth and very easy to drink. This is the Reality Czeck of German Pilseners.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2009 Poured from a 12oz bottle and served in a shaker.  This pilsener poured a clear golden with a large, foamy white head that slowly faded away.  Thin, spider-web like lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma of the beer was made up of spicy hops,  fresh bread, and hay.  The flavor included upfront herbal hops, biscuit, lightly sweet malts, and also a bit of lemony citrus.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and crisp with a moderate amount of carbonation, finishing with a dry, lasting, light bitterness.  A really nice pilsener, and a great session beer. 7,3,7,3,14-3.4
Rerate: As time goes on and a decent number of sixers have passed through my fridge, this is becoming one of my go-to beers.  Awsome Saaz aroma and taste.  Consistent quality and ever enjoyable.  A great pilsner! 8,4,8,4,16-4.0

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2011 Bottle picked up at SL... Clearish yellow color... drank right out of the bottle.... Decent aroma of some hops crystal malts.. Taste is nice clean crisp beer. Light hops, grass, crystal malts... easy drinker... Nice brew
very light and grassy aroma. Clear dark yellow color with med. head, good lacing. Full lemon citrus and grassy flavor with a nice hop finish. Dry but smooth palate. Med. Body.

Pale caramel gold, white head that settles away fairly quickly. Pungent, spicy herbal hops, unctuous, and toothy. A bit of mint. A little dill. The smell of tomato plants in the sun. A nice tart lager note that blends happily with the garden quality of the hops. Full chewy hop character that feels charged with little bits of electricity, elegantly blended with a surprisingly big malt structure. A lingering cinnamon note. Very hop forward, but with a rare balance and grace. 

After several weeks of some kind of sinus bug totally killing my ability to smell, this is a welcome way to celebrate the return of scent, glorious scent! Thanks so much Alaskanwarren for this fine beer!

Bottle. Pours straw yellow with a bone white two finger head. Nose is green grass, earthy malts, a touch of caramel and a twinge of spice. Taste is sweet malts upfront with subtle caramel notes, finishing crisp citrus, grassy and Saaz like spicy hops. Finish is light and dry, thin refreshing body, great for a hot day.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a straw color with a nice head and lively carbonation.  Aroma is earthy with spicy hops.  Light with a creamy fruity flavor, and a subtle spicey malt backbone.  Crisp and definitely refreshing.  Nicely balanced.  Very good Pils.

a ornagish yelloish hazy color.  very hoppy aroma.  I have died and  gone to heaven.  this beer has the perfect balance of  huge hops and enough maltyness to balance it.   there is an amazing crispness, and refreshment.  a must try.
A decent pilsner....definitly good on a hot summer day. Crisp, clean and refreshing...but in a good beer way, not in Busweiser way. Nice malt flavor and aroma.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2010 Re-rate. Bottle. Pours gold with a white head. Balanced and very drinkable. Spicy and floral hop notes.
Clear gold with a slightly sour malt aroma with just a dash of floral hops. Earthy hop presence in the taste over sweet malt. Slightly metallic dry finish. Not bad for a pils.
Draught. Strong aroma of pretzels and straw. Light yellow body with a slight haze, but mostly clear. Full bodied palate carries a well-balanced malty sweetness.

The aroma was saaz hops and a crisp spicy lager aromatic. Some light caramel was notable coupled to the hop presence and a bit of DMS was there as well. The beer poured into the glass clear golden straw with a white low head which was persistent and laced the glass. The flavor was malty on the front end with a bit of caramel which was kept in check with spicy hop bittering and flavor. The flavor was almost grassy with hops and was well done, but a bit stale (probably due to the age of the sample). The finish was dry with lasting bittering and flavor hops into the aftertaste and beyond. The body was medium with a moderate carbonation and a creamy texture on the palate. A nice pint, some aroma missing due to age and a bit of the fresh hop characteristics, but still holding up very well. 12 ounce bottle, best by Dec 25, 07.
user_location: North of Raleigh, North Carolina, USA

text: Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Hogtownharry. De couleur jaune dorée et légèrement voilée. Nez de houblon herbeux (herbe fraîche, traces de foin) aux notes florales, léger de malt pâle avec des notes de miel et de fruits (agrumes). Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et assez croustillant ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse et aux petites notes aqueuses. Léger goût fruité (agrumes et zest) accompagné dun goût moyennement amer de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) et légèrement floral (présent toute la gorgée) avec un léger goût de grains de malt pâle lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de céréales avec des notes de miel puis en finale il y a un léger regain damertume asséchante et plus herbeuse (petites notes de foin). Post-goût moyen et  sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux aux notes florales avec un léger goût fruité (zest dagrumes).

Draught at Pub in Ida Noyes.  Clear golden with one finger white head.  Aroma is grassy and citrusy, you can tell there are some hops in this.  Clean and refreshing, with hops in the middle and end.  A really good pilsener.
great golden yellow appearahce. crisp, light feeling and a small straw gold head. sweet notes with a nice dry finish

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2008 Great.  Smell and taste have...honey...  It sort of comes through as well in the texture.  Very sweet and refreshing.  I would drink this for dessert...

Now...in the bottle, I got none of the honey that I was describing earlier.  Still absolutely delicious.

12oz bottle - Poured glowing straw color with small head. Aroma is grassy hops and also citrusy scent. Taste is citrusy with subtle hop finish. A very clean dry finish with this brew. Overall a very good lager and one of Victories better beers.

Pours a beautiful, brilliantly clear dark gold, with a pure white head of dense foam that remains a small cap on the beer throughout the glass. Aroma is hugely hoppy, with notes of green grass, some apple, and hints of alcohol. On subsequent sniffs, malt sneaks in as an afterthought. Flavor is hoppy upfront, with lots of noble character, backed by a significant malt backbone and a nice medium body to support the strength of the flavor profile. Overall, this is a very clean lager, with a nice clean tail, emphasizing noble hops throughout, but with a significant malt background. Did I mention all the hops?
A deep yellow pour from a 12-oz bottle. Smell of grassy hops. A crisp, clean taste of floral and grassy hops dominated the taste up front with a small malt flavor in the background.
Thin white head with yellow, sort of cloudy body. Easy mouthfeel with a slight citrus flavor. Strong hoppy, bitter finish.

Bottle.  Poured a very thin white head that dissipated pretty quickly with the beer a light yellow color.  Taste was an alright citrusy hops ordeal.  Theres just not much an aroma at all.  For the style, not bad though.

Looks a bit pale in the glass...the head is a nice clean white but fades quickly. Aroma is mostly lemon and grass, with a little bit of hops. Flavor is pretty good, more grass, a bit of citrus, hay. Hops are more pronounced than in the aroma, but still a bit subtle for my tastes. The finish is pretty clean, but not on par with some of the better european pilseners Ive had. Mouthfeel is solid for the style, pretty smooth going down. Overall a pretty good beer.

purchased at the puget sound wine cellar in port orchard.
pour is a clear light yellow, with very thin white head, some lacing.
smell of hay, lemon, grain, few hops.
taste is cheerios, citrus, grain, bit on the watery side, slightly bitter kick in the end.
for a pilsener this is actually quite good.
Ginger ale aroma with slight citrus hops.  Vibrant lemon/straw color with slight haze.  Very fruity flavour, white grape, apple.  Sweet finish with lingering white grape taste.  Cheers!

Bottle. Slightly cloudy straw color with a big, soapy white head. Nice citrusy nose with a hint of banana. The flavors citrus, bitter hops, and bread. Quite champagne-like mouthfeel leaves the mouth feeling clean. One of the better pils out there.

Bottle poured into a pilsner glass.  Pours a solid gold with a pristine white head.  Aroma is malty with some hops.  The taste is of crisp grains, malt and hops.  One of the better pilseners Ive had.

12oz bottle, courtesy of Degarth.  Straw colored body, pretty hazy. Small, slightly off white head. Nose of grass, hops, citrus some cereal grain. Taste is pretty similar, light hops and citrus, with a nice grassy background. Tastes really fresh, very vibrant on the palate. Lively carbonation adds to the experience. Medium bodied, very clean tasting and very clean and refreshing on the tongue. Medium astringency. Finish is grassy, grainy and then bitter hops, very lengthy and pleasing. A great Pilsener!
Bottle. Very clear, pale gold color. Aroma was slight grass / straw and hops. Flavor was slightly sweet hops and malt. Had a slight champagne feel to it, in that it was sort of dry. A nice pilsner !
Pours a light cloudy golden color with nice sized white head.  Weak aroma with hints of hops, wheat and citrus.  Easy drinking beer but was very bland and watered down for my taste.
Bottle. Clear gold pour with substantial fluffy white head. Aroma of grain, hops, wheat. Flavor is crisp and hoppy. A good pilsner.

Gorgeous golden clear pour with a giant white head. Aroma is noticeably hoppy, with some grass, grain and a general crispiness. Flavor is really rich, I taste lots of citrus, some spice and lots of sweetness that I hadnt anticipated. The finish is really clean with a bit of bitterness. I dig it. Really drinkable and full of surprises.

Bottle. Pours hazy light yellow with a pillow of white head. The aroma is some fruits, some grass, and sugar. The flavor is some hoppy fruits, some grain. Some crackers and yeast come next, and then a medium-dry finish. Pretty refreshing.

Overall - a good pilsner.  I dont usually drink this kind of beer but the liquor store had this beer advertised as a RateBeer 100 percentile beer so I figured Id try it.  Very hoppy aroma for a pilsner.  Very smooth somewhat bitter finish, but it goes down easy.  This is a pretty good beer, but I cant see myself frequently buying it.
user_location: originally from Michigan, New York, USA

text: Nice poor into a glass with a good head.  Hops arcome to the forefront the moment you place your nose near the glass.  Nice hoppy flavor with a smooth finish.

Pale yellow lager, with a large thick and frothy pure white head.
Elegant grassy hop aromas,lemongrass, pink grapefruit.
Crisp, lemon, grapefruit sweetened with demerara sugar taste,small malt background, semi bitter and sweet at the same time.
Nice drying palate at the end, but with a goodly hop after taste.
A very drinkable Pils, slightly unusual but refreshing to the max.

Pours clear yellow with a small porous head. Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, hops, and malt sweetness -- the aroma is mild, but very well balanced. The flavour begins malty. Fruity, caramel malts transform into hops. Again, the balance is great. Dry, slightly bitter finish. Im appreciating the presence of /hops/ in this pilsner.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2008 Bottle.  Poured a golden yellow with a small white head.  Incredible amount of effervescence, very similar to a champagne.  Aroma is of hops with a bit of citrus.  Taste was of hops and the finish was quite clean.  Not a big fan of pilsners, but this isnt a bad attempt.
Poured hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of hops. Big hop flavor backed by sweet malt to balance. Refreshing.

RIght out of the gate the strong aroma hops. My bottle poured a translucent gold with a small, but forthy head. The appearence was like a wiessebier. The taste was hoppy and clean. Slightly strong w/a nice kick. A very good Pils.

12 oz bottle Discount Liquors Voorhees, NJ-Poured a clear golden coloring with a slight head. Aromas were malts with a noticable fruity aromas. Nothing overpowering, but very drinkable. Id say your not going to be wowed, but youll be able to sit and enjoy it.
light yellow lots of foam, nose is definate german pils has some nice czech hops good smooth dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011 (bottle) Pours clear gold with a thin white head.  Aroma has some slight sweet malt, grain, and when it was cooler had a faint hint of lemon zest.  Taste is quite malty, grainy, not really too bitter, just a touch on the finish.  This could be because the bottle said drink before Sept. 07.  But other than that not a bad Pils, full mouthfeel too.

[Bottle, thanks Guerde] Pours golden with a small white head.  Aroma is malt with a very faint floral sweetness.  Taste is slightly bitter up front, then a lot of malt that blends with a small amount of hops in the finish.  Medium-thin mouthfeel.  Not bad but certainly didnt blow me away--quite drinkable and would probably be a pretty good session beer.
12oz BB 12 Dec 07 Bright gold liquid under fleeting white head, no real nose, bright hops and light citrus on palate.  Good

Pours a perfect golden pilsner color with a foamy white head.  If you saw it poured, you may just think that its a Bud, but thats just the style.  I got a bit more of a cereal/malty note than I thought I would, but aroma is dominated by crisp floral hop notes.  Flavor is crisp and light with hoppy complexity on the back of my palate.  A nice beer.  Im not sure this is the most complex style, but Victory did a nice job on this one.  Ive been underwhelmed by some of their other styles...  this is their best that Ive had yet.

Not a bad beer. Had it on tap at the pub on campus (college can be great). All in all, it certainly wasnt bad. It was smooth and refreshing, a little bit of complexity in the taste, but it left me wanting something in the end. Im not usually one for pilseners, but this was pretty tasty.
hmmm, yummy. Picked this up on sale - loved the the label....what a surprise. Very crisp and clean, exactly how a good pilsener should be. I enjoyed every drop. Wonderfully refreshing  bitter finish.

Rating #350.  Bottle.  Pours a gold color with a fluffy white head that dissipated fairly quicly for the style.  Aroma is malt with slight grassy hops and maybe some earthy and herb characteristics.  Taste is grassy hops with a slight malt sweetness and a little tartness as well.  Very smooth and drinkable, not overbearing at all, and finishes with a lovely taste of Saaz hops.

12oz bottle. slightly hazed lemon yellow color pours with one finger of white head. clean and malty nose with a lively herbaceous quality. faintly grassy with a touch of citrus. good body with a hefty dose of german hops. bright and clean with a long and persistent hop finish.

Bottle. Pours an extremely light gold with quickly dissipating frothy head.  Typical german spicy hops on the nose, pale malts, slightly herbal.  Quite bitter on the palate, nice smooth mouthfeel, dry bitter finish, refreshing but perhaps slightly unbalanced towards bitter hops.

Floral and hoppy aroma. Pale yellow color, white irregular head, fair lace. Light sweet, light malty, bitter, floral, well hopped. Medium body with a dryish finish. Refreshing, well brewed.

(Bottle) Pours a golden color with a nice white head. Good lacing. Crisp hoppy aroma and high quality malts in the taste. Some grassy hints, with a distinct lemongrass-like finish. This is probably one of the most flavorful and crisp Pilsners I have ever had. Definitely a winner in an otherwise lackluster style.

355 ml. Crystal clear, pale golden with a medium sized, lasting head. Aroma is spicy honey, cereal grain, and grass. Flavor is honey on the front, slowly bittering to a grassy, lemon-herb, and very hoppy (for a pilsener) finish. Smooth body is thicker than most pils; maybe almost medium. Has all the same characteristic flavors of an industrial American pilsener, but the smooth body and taste of quality ingredients comes through anyway. This pilsener is to a BMC as a cheeseburger at your local grill is to a McDonalds.
On tap - this beer has a bright yellow appearance, and good flavor.  I dont find Pilsners to be that interesting, but this one was very good.
12oz bottle.  Nice pour, rather smooth taste that finishes mildly offensively.  Not really a fan, but I appreciate its complexity which goes beyond most pilseners.

A pilsner has to be a cut above average for me to enjoy it because the style tends to remind me of the low quality, mass-market American beers.  The Prima Pils from Victory did the trick.  This is the perfect beer to have with a cold sandwich on a hot summer day.  It pours a very pale straw color.  It was crystal clear, with a lot of carbonation.  The flavor is light and is pretty balanced between the malt and the hops.  A clean, crisp, summertime beer.

Drank over the summer and must say it went well with a steaming hot chicago summer day.  Pours out very BMC looking, but BMC it is not.  Nose of light hop and beer (seriously). Flavor was plain but quite refreshing.  Mild hop, but again very beer tasting.   Not bad for a nice hot day.
Must have had a bad/older bottle because I found this not too much to write home about.
I just dont like pilsners, but if I have to drink one, Ill take this. It goes slightly beyond the blandness most American pilsners bring. But then again, this is Victory. So they can pull it off.
Hazy yellow. A little too bitter, but i think its because the expiration past. Still not bad dispite that. Straw hoppy taste, slighty sweet grains.
Bottle. Good thick frothy head.  Very little aroma of hops.  Taste is pleasant with crisp finish and light hoppiness with very little alcohol warmth.  Very dry.  Would buy again.
Doesnt really smell the best, but other than that this is pretty darn good. A nice light, crisp flavor with a light amount of dry hops at the end. Great stuff.

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is mild: bready, faint hops.  Also a very mild flavor, a good balance of hops and malts... a little citrus peel.  This is not my favorite style--its really nothing too exciting... but its drinkable and well done for what it is.

12 oz.  Easily my favorite domestic Pils, a little bit softer than normal with hops that are well balanced by a fair amount more malt than I am used to (or maybe it is the alt german malt that makes the difference).  happy it is available in my area.

Pours a slightly clouded straw gold with minimal head that falls to nothing. Nose is a matured and subdued lemon.Yeast that is light somewhat and is reminiscent of a Belgian strain. Flavor is slightly citrus like with a smooth and slightly heavily bodied character. Veryeven, never drops off. Just fades away over time. Feel is just a touch thicker on the liquid and medium to high on the carbonation level. Very drinkable. Smooth,even and pretty well made. Worth a shot. Or buy a case of it for a party.

bottle from ucusty...BB 10/15/07. pale gold/straw colored with a wispy white head. light malt aroma with some yeast, alcohol, citrusy hops and aluminum sheeting.  creamy mouth feel. flavor is all of the aforementioned. lager qualities w/o typical corn or skunk. leaves no unpleasant aftertaste. very clean, nice all around.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2007 Bottle "enjoy by" 12/12/07. Pours a slightly hazy straw color with decent white head. Smells like beer. Medium body, lively fizz. Flavor is balanced, with some cereal maltiness and a good dose of hops. Its not really bitter, although there is some grapefruit on the edge. Crisp finish.
Nice bright yellow color with little head. Noste of rich malts mixed with some hops. Bit of a European taste with malts. Decent beer.

Poured from the bottle.  Produced a pale yellow body with a medium white head of foam.  This beer was very aromatic from the moment I opened the bottle, with a crisp hoppiness and some malt notes thrown in for good measure.  First taste was bitter and dry developing into a crisp, light bodied beverage.  While pilsners are not my tea, I liked this offering.
A great pilsener from Victory. Pours with a good head and hop bitterness and good malt balance.  On tap at the Olympic.
Another great beer from Victory. Excellent hops and bitterness. Someone else mentioned "crisp", not sure I can describe it better.
A great aroma! Nice combo of citrus, hops, and grain. Also, a slight malty flavor at first. A great finish. Very unique beer. One of my favorites.
Bottle.  Clearish body, nice white head.  A hoppy bite at first taste, but clean finish rectifies this.  Improves as it is drunk.  Crisp.
From bottle. Fresh aroma of hops. Clean golden colour with a thin dissipating head. Fresh, crisp taste. Refreshing hop flavour. Decent lager.
12oz bottle enjoy by 4/02/07-Clear golden body with a huge white head which has an aroma of hops, malt, citrus, and grains. Taste of the same with a nice dry finish. Nice tasting pils.

12oz bottle best before 10/29/07.  Pours a pale, completely transparent yellow with a big foamy white head and lots of bubbles of carbonation clinging to the sides of the glass.  Light lemony, citrus aroma.  Slightly spicy hops.  Cereal.  Pretty mild.  Clean, light, watery aroma.  Very crisp.  The least offensive tasting beer Ive ever had.  Tiny bit of malt taste at the beggining.  Cereal.  Not too bitter or hoppy.  No finish.  Id like to try a super fresh bottle as this one seems to be lacking on the hops.  This is not in any way bad it just isnt that good either.
Bottle: Pours yellow with a small head.  Decent yeasty flavor and aroma.  Smell of bread or similar item.  One of the best pilseners that I have had, I am just not a big fan of them.

12 oz. bottle. Hear about this one on Craft Beer Radio. Poured an impressive yellow golden color with ample sparkle and a big creamy white head. Superb taste! I am very delighted with this pilsner and look forward to the next five bottles from the six pack I bought.

Pours a straw yellow color producing a thin white head which fades quickly to a paisley patterned thin film. Clean, pleasant aromas of lemon zest, flowers, fresh baked biscuits, cut hay and herbs come to mind. Palate is a bit thin, light and watery; but a shows off a lively carbonation. Taste is surprisingly quite hoppy for a Pilsener. Herbs and spices make a strong presence here with a moderate bitterness. A subdued honey-bread, lemon candy sweetness follows up in the background. A bit on the light side, but clean and refreshing nonetheless.

Date: 12/24/1998
Mode: Bottle
Source: Norms, DC

golden yellow, lots of tiny bubbles, frothy white head, fresh hop aroma with a touch of malt sweetness, light malt flavor followed by big hop burst and lots of bitterness, sample was a little old and cardboardy, otherwise rating could have been higher

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.8/5.0Score: *4
-------- />
The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Poured into pilsner glass. nice trail of bubbles with 2 finger head. Probably the best pilsner you can get outside the Czech Republic
hazy golden color with a slight white head.  taste is of sweet malt with a nearly perfectly balanced hop finish.  a very nicely subtle version of a delicate tough to master style
Hazy straw-yellow appearance. Straight-forward but very well made pilsner. A little hoppier for the style. Very high drinkability. Surprisingly hard to find around here for some reason...

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2008 Pours clear yellow with medium white foamy/sudsy head that sticks all over the glass.  Strong hop aroma with some nice sweet doughiness.  Sweet, bitter, hoppy and doughy and extremely drinkable!  Finish is dry and slightly bitter.   Carbonation is perfect for this type of pilsner, accents the cleanness.  Incredible balance.

pours like weak yellow lemonade with a thin white head...smells of hops with light citrus, maybe some floral....thin crisp taste with a definate spice/clove finish....malts in the finish with very little hop bite...from the logo I expected a very hoppy bite....not at all disapointed with the beer ...just disapointed with the expectations of the label...overall this has to be one of the best pilsners Ive had

Bottle: light gold yellow color, nice white head. Bready and floral hop aoma. Flavor is light and crisp with a nice light hoppy bitterness and floral slightly spicy and citrusy hop flavor finish that is nice and crisp. Extremely drinkable, especially on a sunny day.

Slight smell of spicy hops, blended with the standard lager smell.  Pours a clear light yellow, with a head that quickly fades away.  This is probably the most palatable Pilsener Ive ever had.  Slight taste of hops, blended with the nice taste of a good lager.  Somewhat thin in the mouthfeel, but its something I can drink.  Not going to be the first thing I reach for, but not something Ill turn down.

Bottle. Pours light yellow and not offensive. Fizzy small head that gives no clue of the palate.  Super malts with a Czech feel and palate-just enough thickness to taste and to drink. Very rich through the mouth and palate with wonderful body. Especially enjoyable down hhheeeaarrr in the hot south. Thank you Victory for the wonderful pils.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Very tasty pils.  I enjoyed the aroma after I poured it into a pint glass.  First sip was very pleasant.  Goes down quite easy, with only a slightly tangy aftertaste.

Orange color with small head and no lacing. I didnt enjoy this one too much. Light aroma and flavor, a little bitter, and mix match of other odd flavors. Not a lot of hops or fruitiness, just boring awkward flavor
I really enjoy this one for what its worth. The hops in this are grassy. The malts and somewhat secondary and it a real lively carbonation fizz.
Bottle.  Hazy straw color.  Light hop aroma and hop and malt flavor.  Not as hoppy as I expected. Crisp, balanced finish.  Very little bitterness.  Very easy drinking.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2014 Had a taste from grimreesers glass.  Very nice crisp aroma but the taste had a densness to it that didnt match the aroma. I was expecting a nice hop bite, unless these types of hops are like that. 
Re-rate. Got a fresher bottle. Much better. 
Re-rate again.  An exceptional beer on tap. I cant believe I have gone so long in between trying this again.
On tap. Clear light golden color. Aroma is a little weak. Decent malt flavor, enough bitterness to let you know that it is there.

So bright and clear.  Thin creamy head.  Light on aroma, sweet with a touch of lemon.  Clean and light body, bitterness that balances a sweetness in the background.  Refreshing and palate cleansing finish.

12 oz. bottle.  Extremely pale yellow, extremely clear.  Good carbonation and nice head that quickly dissipates.  Aroma is so faint but slightly sweet.

Tastes nice with very appreciable bitterness, dry and earthy.  Palate is amazingly smooth and clean.  Felt like was missing out on some hops aroma and flavor, possibly had been sitting around too long at the store.  Will try to get one fresh.  Still, as it was, a great pils.

12oz bottle.  Pours a pale straw without much head.  Not too much aroma to speak of.  Flavour is bit of a letdown.  Im not getting much of the Saaz hops that everyone else speaks of.  Aftertaste does not linger as long as preferred.  Pilsners certainly have their place in my fridge, but this one isnt standing out for me sadly.  Based on all the glowing reviews, I wonder if I got an off batch.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2008 2008-09-09, 7-3-6-3-13=32It pours a hazy blond color; the head disappears but it leaves some lace. At first it has some Saaz aroma, but later it mutates more into a common beer. Not much malt flavor, but at least a strong hopping, with a lot of Hallertau and some Saaz. I waited long to re-try this; its not bad, but when I see people naming it as top Pils, I cant help thinking about a Tipopils tasted fresh at the brewpub.2006-12-28, 7-4-8-5-16=40Hazy blond color. Light aroma. Very good taste, with some malt crispness, smooth, and an excellent European hopping, leading to a strong long and aromatic final. Excellent amongst bottled Pils.

Hazy banana yellow body with a nice white head. Noble hops aroma is spicy and lemony. Light body is well carbonated. Taste is refreshing, with a spicy hoppiness that blends well with the doughy malt backbone. One of Americas better pils.

3/29/2005 - After buying a 12 pack of this on a whim, I have to say it grew on me. Im not a huge fan of Pilsners, but it has a nice crisp taste with a touch of something (lemon?) that makes it quite refreshing. Not sure Id buy it again, but Id drink one if offered to me. Re-sampled 2/22/2006. Man, this beer is much better than I rememembered. Maybe this years version is far superior, maybe its just a LOT better on draft. But my previous 3.3 rating is jumping up. The aroma and flavor was sweet and slightly buttery. Smooth as butter, too. Really nice! I will go out and grab another bottle of this on my next shopping trip...just to check!
one of the better beers i tried last night.  the taste was great, the aftertaste was great overall another great beer from victory.

Pours a clear gold into the glass with minimal head.  The aroma is bread-like with some resinous notes.  The taste is above average of most microbrewed pilseners Ive had, but still comes up short of the Czech originals.  Not a bad beer, but at the same price as Pilsener Urquell I probably wont buy it again

Pours yellow with some haziness with a medium head.  The aroma of hops with a slight sweet malt allow the flavor to drive more of the sweet citrus of hops and malt in balance.  The finish gives that yeat like German quality.
Bottle.  Surprisingly good and refreshing pilsener.  Nice hop flavor and aroma, and not an overpowering sense of grass.  Good bitterfinish to this beer.  Another victory for Victory.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow color; fluffy white head with solid lacing.  Lively citrus and herbal / grassy hops in the aroma; not an overwhelming hop bomb, but crisp and lightly-sugared with the slightest hint of resin.  Medium mouthfeel: some chewy citrus at the forefront (resiny, lightly acidic), with lively carbonation and a creamy dough character underneath; a beautiful palate (striking a delicate balance between hop zing and malt density and drinkability) that smooths out into a soft, doughy and yeasty finish.  An excellent pils.  Clean, well-built, and immensely drinkable.
Clear golden with nice head.  Hops,   wheat and light spice aromas are there, but otherwise not much to smell.  A nice sturdy hoppy body, and quenching finish yeild a decent brew.

The color was a hazy pale golden.  The head was thin, fizzy, and white.  The aroma consisted of some malt and hops.  The flavor was crisp with some hops.  The palate was thin bodied.  The finish had a little bitterness to it.

"Crisp, clean, carbonated. all good qualities in a pilsner. Grassy, hoppy, dry, slightly bitter. other good qualities. This lacks that overwhelming skunky taste in most pilsners, but there is definitely something funky going on, just in the backround. This is a great starter pilsner. I actually prefer this to classics like pilsner urquell. **UPDATE** the more i drink this, the more i like
Bottle. Light body with a dry finish, no real taste with a yeasty smell. Ease of drinking with taste and lightness.

Aroma:crispy malt,commercial beer nose...
Appearance:hazy yellow,light head..
Flavor:good pilsener bitterness,light crispy malt.....

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2008 Rerate 5/26/08  Pours a crystal clear gold with a loose, frothy white head that leaves patchy lace in its wake. The nose is of clean, sweet pilsner malt with a solid, grassy hop finish.Light-bodied and slick with a lingering, lightly bitter finish. (Definitely a departure from the crisp/clean finish I observed in my first rating/sample.) The flavor is of solid, grassy hops over slightly sweet pilsner malt. I tend to prefer my pilsners with a little more subtlety in their hop profile, but while it isnt as "balanced" as some examples of the style, this is a pretty nice brew.  Bottle from Corral Liquors in Granite City, IL. Pours an effervescent, lightly cloudy pale yellow with a frothy white head. The nose is composed of bready/grainy malts backed by light earthy hop notes. This is not the nose I expected from a beer with a hop cone on the label. Light and thin with lively carbonation and a crisp, lightly bitter finish. The flavor is of crisp, effervescent, bready malts with a tight, clean and lightly bitter hop finish. A nice pilsner, but I was not nearly as excited about this beer as many of my fellow RateBeerians have been. Original #s: 5/3/7/3/12

My first pilsener in a long time.  Pours an extremely clear light golden color.  Nice off white head on a semi-hard pour.  Lacing ok...below average.  Head retention very low.  Looks as if it will be a sub-par brew to this point....but the tastes changes that.  Starts off classic pilsener, a little malty, but mosty dominated by the noble hops...just more of them.  Nice hops flavor throughout...although I think it needs a slight more bitterness.  Great balance however.  The aftertaste is nonexistant...so somewhat good for the style.  The biggest downfall however, is the aroma (6/10).  If that was better, the flavor, aroma and appearance would be better.  Still, one of the absolute best pilseners out there....period

Draught at d.b.a. Crystal clear golden colour. Small fine-laced white head. Saaz-hop aroma. Very crisp. Nice malty aroma as well. Crisp bitterness. Solid malt backbone. Juicy malt flavours. A nice pilsener. Little aftertaste. Flavour stops abruptly.

bottle.  one of my favorites from victory.  rising bubbles to thin bubbled head.  nice clarity.  grain, slight lemon and fairly malty aroma.  lemongrass, nice hoppy bitterness.  richer than most pilsners.  great brew.

12 oz bottle wife got for me from Wi. Had grainy aroma also odor of metal keg barrels. Hazy gold body with white head and some lacing left on the glass. Flavor was sweet malted grain and sourness present gave me a candy jolly racher taste. Slightly dry and sweetness lingers on the palate. Not bad.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2013 Bottle, best before October 15, 07. All right! Finally got a fresh bottle of this stuff. Pours a hazy light gold with a firm white head. The nose is very grainy and doughy with hints of ganja, soil, and cardboard. The flavor has a thick doughy, papery attitude and a dry finish. It tastes the way a brewery smells, very grainy. While I do like the balance , the intensity of the overall flavor profile,and especially the lingering, semi-dry finish, I cant get into the traditional European lagers. My personal taste interferes with my enjoyment of this one. However, I can tell that this is a clean, robust take on the style (my preferred pilsener so far) and I would definitely recommend it to any of my friends who are more into lighter colored lagers than I am.

[April 10, 2010]

Saw a fresh sixer of this stuff at Greens in Columbia and couldnt pass it up on a warm spring day. Ive been wanting to revisit a good pils and this definitely fits the bill. Very strong and assertive clean hoppiness is the true character of this lager. Wooden type bitterness along with some citrus zest is plainly obvious in the aroma. The palate is lively and medium light, a fantastic fit for the flavor profile. Clean cracker and doughy malt flavor provides a body for bitter hops throughout. A really fantastic pils, though admittedly Im still more of an ale fan. 

[September 2, 2010]

Bottle at Folly Brew. I am really digging the Prima Pils. Its the only pilsner Ive ever had that I still drink often, especially in the warmer weather. Its in a league of its own. I really love the fact they date stamp these bad boys. Huge props to Victory! Why does no one else make a pilsner this good?

Bottle. Pours Pilsener gold, with a white head. Aroma is grain, wild hops, and hay. Flavor has the same, but with more than its fair share of hops, which causes the finish to be quite bitter and drying.
Not much aromatics to speak of.  Mild sweet maltiness and hay in the body with an earthy noble hop finish.  An OK beer, good for a pilsner I suppose, but its just not my style.

Smells of light bitterness with sweet backgrounds. Moderate carbonation with quickly retreating head. Color of sunlight gold. Tastes of hay, and honey. Slight bitterness throughout. Sticky palate yet very refreshing middle and finish. Aftertaste of sweet malt and bitter hops. Great for camping.
Light grain and moderate hop aroma. Light clear golden color with a medium head that dissipates. Smooth refreshing start with hop bitterness to the finish.
this beer is very refreshing and easy to drink, very nice hop flavor and finish, this is a strong beer from victory, if you like pilseners dont pass this one up!

Pours a crisp, clear golden color with a tight inch head and decent lacing.  There were tiny bubbles cascading up the pilsner glass during the tasting.   The scent was of hops, floral notes, grain and honey.  Very clean and refreshing with a very dry affect on the palate.  Excellent summer beer.

Bottle.  Poured a golden yellow, slighty cloudy with fluffy white head.  Nice floral hop aroma.  A little dry on the palate, medium body with light carbonation.  Hints of grass with a nice malt backbone.  Crisp hop finish, but not too bitter.
just figured some yard work, and I figured "why not?"  light gold in color, light on head and laces.  wonderful pilsner taste with a hoppy finish.  I just love victory
outstanding beer. it says what it is , its a primo pilsener pretty much the best pilsener that you can get in my opinion. nice body with tastes of malt, grass, grain , hops and honey. good stuff
Bottle @ The Map Room. Thanks Brian. Golden coloured with a medium sized head. Nice body with notes of bread, malt, metal, grass, grain and hops. Well balanced.
Light body, slightly hoppy, great example of a pils.  Got it at my local store, glad they sell singles.

12oz bottle, rated on how it hits me, not as the style is... certainly a good brew, light crisp easy drinking with good effervescence, this is a great beer for summer on hot days, lawnmower as some may say, but i like my beer chock full of heavy flavors which this is not, but im sure for its style its fantastic.
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2007 very good pils... had it on tap at the Brick Store Pub in Decatur, GA.  nice golden color.... could drink this all summer long.  Best pils Ive had in a long time.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2010 Draft at Jerrys.  Golden with good, foamy white head / Floral, honey and grain nose / Medium body, creamy with some sweetness, and more malty than most pilsners / Flavors of clover honey, jasmine, smoke, and grain / An outstanding, fat, pilsner.
My original rating was deleted for some strange reason...I saaaiiid....this is probably as good as a Pilsner can get...
Pours a clear, light golden color with a large white head.  Fresh hop aroma, although not overly pronounced.  Clean, crisp, refreshing...  just not very complex.  Good summer beer.

12 oz bottle. Im shocked to see this one rated so high. Poured a clear golden/yellow with an average size bubbly white head. Aroma came off with an overall bitterness but there were strong grassy notes and some malts as well. Palate is smooth with a thin body and a slightly dry finish. Flavor is basically absent at first and finishes with a malt flavor but rather bitter, and not a hop bitterness either, weird I know. A nice beer but worthy of a 3.64??

Pours yellow, more substantial than usually from the style. The head is medium thin and white. The aroma was sharp hop, very mild basement, some sweetness, good for the style. The flavor was a bit waxy hoppy, sharp bitterness, and mild grassy basement. The palate is bitter and a tad crispy.
Pours a watery yellow color with almost no head. Bubbly body and bitter smells. Tastes like barley and has an extremly dry refreshing finish. Not to bad for a pilsner.
Aroma is sweet bready malt and hop aroma hiding underneath. Is light gold in color. Nice malty flavor is what dominates, but some definite strong hoppiness comes through and leaves a dry mouthfeel. A
Bottle...not my favorite style but good nonetheless. I think Id opt for a Pilsner Urquell over this if nothing else due to its extremely dry aftertaste. Good for summer.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2009 pours a light golden yellow with decent carbination, smells of malts and hops as one would expect. taste is very good for a pilsner, better then the smell leads on, not usually a fan of this style but this is not a boring beer by far. loads of hops make a nice brew with some citrus flavors as well.

Pours a typical but attractive clear yellow, not much head. Aroma is malty and pleasant, seems to have a peaty hint. Flavor is fuller than that of most pilsners I have tried - mainly malty, a hoppy hint and a suggestion of fruit flavor, maybe apple. Jazzier than the typical pilsner, not at all watery - savory and satisfying.

Draught in pint glass at Flying Saucer Raleigh.  Clear light gold with lasting white head and lace.  Faint aroma of yeast and tart hops.   Flavors of honey/lemon with a crisp snappy bitter finish.  Medium high carbonation and light body.  An excellent example of the style, deserving of the hype.

Cant believe Ive never rated this....just one of those that slips through the cracks. Clear golden with good head. Crisp slightly sweet hop aroma. So refreshing, and yet it has taste? Wow, imagine that. Just enough hop bitterness, and balanced very well. Very crisp and clean.

Wow, now Ive had a few well say "imperial" pilsners.  Magic Hat and Troge, but this one, after a couple of tries, I was convinced, this is the best of the other ones Ive had.  Great hoppy flavor for a pilsner.  Pick this over Miller, Coors, Bud, Corona, Yuengling Light.  Sam Light is pretty good.

Not a fan of this one. Maybe because I am not a fan of many of the pilsners and lagers. I think that they lack taste. The only great thing that this beer provides is the normal great bitter taste of beer. The palate of this pils is nice; very smooth, and almost creamy. The aroma is okay, smells like it tastes. My brother told me when he was drinking it he tasted a little bit honey. I dont really taste a sweet note in this beer, but be on the lookout. The beer is growing on me but still it lacks that taste that I am searching for. I hate to be hard on pislners as a whole, but I cant help it. I havent tried too many pilsners but I must say this has a decent flavor and palate for a boring style of beer. There has been a movement of the Victory brand in Atlanta so I am trying to try all of them while I can.
Pours a  nice gold.  Taste is pretty bland, maybe it has to do with the style.  Hops are there but very muted.

BB 06-17-07.  Pours a golden straw color with clear, sparkling effervescence and a fairly full, white, rocky head which disappates quickly leaving minimal.  Nose is light floral, grainy, graham cracker, and sulfur.  Flavor is simple but fitting for the style; graham cracker and light lemon peel start, followed by a moderately high bitterness with nice floral notes.  Palate is lively, somewhat light, and crisp with some refreshing character.  Finishes with nearly all bitterness and floral notes with lingering lemon peel notes and a certain dryness to it.  Nice German-stlye pils with plenty of bitterness to complete the crisp, summer-type beer.  Decent American example of the style.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2008 Score one for the Americans...12 oz. bottle in  a willibecker...Coors light pall with head that wavers slightly...still, opaque...malt is noticeable in that crisp, welcoming bite that only a good pilsner can deliver...I wonder if, like Brewery Ommegang, the Downington brewers didnt take a few notes from a European master...perfect for the oncoming summer...Id score this higher, if only pilsners werent so unimpressively colored or scented... I guess God cant imbue beauty on everything!
Pale gold body with a clean aroma.  Hop taste at first with a malty finish.  I didnt care for this much the first time I had it but its growing on me.
It hit 92 degrees today and I hit the Pils.  What a clean and crisp quencher this is.  This beer is well crafted and hits the spot.  Works well with lighter fare too.
Pours a very light gold with a thin white head. light hops and sweet malt on the nose. Clean taste with faint hops with little citrus. Finishes clean and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2009 White short lasting head, with a nice balanced smell of fruity and floral and very fresh, clean hops.  Decent amount of bitterness up front with a honey, malty sweetness following.  Good hop presence that fades into a semi quick slight bitter finish.  Grassy, and floral and very fresh hop like flavor.  2nd time Ive had this and I really like this beer much more than the 1st time around.  Great, refreshing beer.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2008 Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a small white head that stays. The aroma is typical pilsener nothing too much here but the taste is very good with citrus and a hoppy flavor. A great session beer.

Prima pils about sums it up. No over-the-top flavors or aromas, just beer. Im not sure where the heaps of hops went that they claimed to have used in brewing, but I couldnt detect them. I can see it being a good session beer, but for this thing to be in the 91st percentile is just crazy.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2007 Real beer... maybe the best quality is that those who are unable to recognize real beer will really hate this beer. Malt bitchslap on the  piehole, bitter as a soccer mom. Balanced like a well made bra. Drink now.

Aroma of grassy hop supported by a light malt. Pale golden color with a frothy white head that leaves shards of lacing. Slightly less than medium bodied, something of a floral and fruit hop, and the malt tends to be dominated by the hop. The finish is relatively dry and the bitter is moderate. Not quite my concept of a pilsener (floral?), but generally in line with the style. It is a mouth pleaser. It is just excellent with string cheese!

Good beer. Very nice pour and lacing for a pilsner.  A very basic pilsner, but very well crafted.  Notes of hay, grass, hop.  A good amount of malt, finishes with a characteristic dryness.  Very good.

pours pale golden with large off-white head.  Aroma is big spicy grassy hop.  taste is spicy, grassy and somewhat haylike.  it brings just the right amount of pils malt character to the plate but still showcases the hop.  finishes with a nice spicy bitterness.  very tasty and drinkable pils definitely the best pils ive had.

On tap at Map Room in Chicago.  I am not a pilsener person.  They are usually too light in body and flavor to catch my interest.  But this one is not too bad.  It has that nice saaz hop flavor to keep your interest, and the typical dry finish to not linger in your mouth.  One of the better pils Ive had.
Hazy yellow with a faint head.  Sweet citrus hops on the nose.  Watery with a bitter hop flavor and a hint of citrus hop body.
On tap @ Coles Buffalo NY . Pale pils with huge hop aroma. Good offering from Victory. Nice thirst quencher in summer heat

12 oz Bottle-Clear golden color w/a moderate foamy white head. Had quite a hoppy bite on the inital taste, mellowed out some as you drank it, but not a lot. I didnt detect any malt at all. Reminded me of an APA or IPA. Long dry finish-just OK, not one of Victorys best.

Bottle from Total Wine in Huntersville NC.  Beer pours a light cloudy gold with a small white head.  Aroma is all hops.  Taste is rather sharp from beginning to end, but a good pils to start off the evening session with.  Bravo.
Solid Pilsner by victory.  Everything as expected.  Very refreshing.  Somewhat light and sessionable

Beautiful golden color (cant think of a better colored pilsner).  Refreshing and hoppy, but not too much so like an IPA. I can imagine that this would pair nicely with many foods.  Floral aroma and great taste.  Quite a pilsner.

Clear golden color shows off the bubbles nicely.  Small white head fades quickly to just a small slick of foam.  Smells beery, by which I mean a little hops and a light malt smell without abything jumping out - smells cold, too, if thats possible.  Tastes reminiscent of German pilsener, but maybe a lttle fruitier, probably because its fresher.  I like it, its refreshing and although it obviously has less flavor than the bigger styles that seem to dominate craft brewing today, the flavor it does have is clean, well balanced, with enough hop bite to make it interesting.
