This ones looks will fool you.  Looks like it should lack flavor and taste but its loaded with it.  Has to be one of my favorite pilsners.
light golden yellow color, the flavor is very crisp and dry.  The flavor is great the best pils Ive every had, light felling in mouth

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2006 Pours light golden color with a head.  Crisp and herbable aroma.  The flavor is awesome; very crisp, spicy (from the hops), clean and dry finish.  One of the best pilsner I ever had.  Really enjoy it.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into footed pilsner.  Head quickly dissipates to approx 1/4 inch and stays. Crisp malty aroma. Quick hop flavor turns to malt and back to hops where it lingers for quite a while.  Lively carbonation. Bitter hop flavor is quite intense and astringent.  Very refreshing.
This is one of the better pilseners Ive had.  The Penn Brewery may be the only one that compares for me.  Tastes like a pils, except it seems really well balanced and dry.
Pale but beutiful and just the right amount of bitter hop malt mix for a warm afternoon... no real celebrity hop stand out but a well crafted stand by.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2006 Pale yellow pour, large head at first, but it quickly faded away. Some hop on the aroma, as well as some sourness. Flavor had little sweetness, followed by a slightly building bitter finish. I think the bottle I had may have been slightly skunked, it was best if used by 1/6/06. Will rerate when a fresher bottle is found as Im sure this one is best early in its life.

I had this on tap tonight, nothing impressive, but a little better than the old bottle I had previously.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2006 12 oz. bottle.  Pours a light straw color with a small diminishing head.  Aroma of sourness and some earthy hay mustiness.  Some peppery notes with some sweet maltiness up front, and finishes with a hint of bitterness.  Not a bad beer overall, and a really good beer for the style.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Definately a great pilsener!  Pours flaxen with a small white head, lots of bubbles.  Big farmland aroma of freshly harvested hay.  Nice and crisp, just a like a good pils should be.  I will definately have this one again, great with flavorful food.
Poured a golden yellow with a big white head that settles to rocky foam. Aroma of new mown alfalfa. The flavor is crisp and citrus, with lively carbonation. Vey good with spicy salsa and chips.

Crisp and clean. This beer is somewhat grassy in aroma. Its pretty lively in my mouth and has a nice smooth malty initial taste with a great transition to hops with a lightly bitter, almost citrussy finish.

Bottle at moms over christmas.  God I hate this style.  I thought every heineken and urquell I had had was skunky.  Now I know its the pilsner style.  Overpowering bitters is not what I need in a beer.

12oz bottle.Pours clear light straw yellow with thinnish white head. Liquid skunk, both in flavor and aroma. Willing to try it again if I find it on tap and/or in a fresh bottle, though I detect that even a fresh bottle would not live up to, say, New Glarus Edel Pils or Sierra Nevada Pilsner. Drainpour.

Poured a pale gold color with a white head that didnt stick around long.  Nose is hoppy and grassy/straw laden.  Sweet malts in the flavor with a very nice hoppy bite.  Not your normal pils to be certain.  Almost like an APA, but still a decent drink.  Nice beer.

12 oz bottle.  Being an IPA fan this style ,albeit, well done is not quite to my taste.  Poured a slightly hazy, yellow color with an smallish frothy white head with very good lacing for a pils.  Picked up straw and some lemony honey in the aroma.  Had a slightly sweet inital flavor with some grains and perhaps a straw taste to it and hoppy for a pils.  Bitter after taste.  Overall a pils with body and some3 texture, not bad.
Lingering bitterness, very robust.  Nice and hoppy.  Probably the best pilsner Ive had.

Bottle - 1 inch head that faded in a minute, hardly any lacing.  Light Golden yellow, a bit cloudy but nothing like a hefeweizen.  A bit of lemony zing to the initial flavor like a Corona Extra, but not, and much hoppier.  Has a fizziness in the taste, but keeps the thicker more robust nature intact.  Thats what makes this a great pils.  The fact that a robust pils can exist in the first place surprised me.  All the ones Ive had before this were just straight up watery.  Victory has props.  The thickness of it stays on the tongue as well.

On tap at Firkins, Libertyville, IL.  Clear yellow pils having a giant white head with good lacing. No discernable aroma or carbonation.  Medium palette that starts with light sweet malt and hop flavor flavors.  Finishes dry with light nutty malt aftertaste and lingering bitterness.  Well balanced.  Good drinkable hoppy  pils that goes great with a Caribbean pork sandwich.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a thick fluffy white head that fades to a nice cap, and leaves behind a small amount of lace.

Smell; theres a definite spicy hoppiness to this, and has a bit of a floral scent. It has a nice clean smell to it.

Taste; slightly biscuity malts, with some piney hops with a bit of spiciness in the finish and just a little bit bitter. Mouthfeel is light and just slightly oily. Prima Pils went down very easy, my glass was empty before I knew it. This is not my favorite style, but I still found this to be rather enjoyable.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: Hazy yellow with moderate white head. Aroma of fresh straw, grass and a bit of perfume. Flavor starts with malt but yields to hops  grains with slight lemon and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Nicely carbonated. Overall, a well balanced, excellent pilsener with big flavor.
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2006 Pours a clear light yellow with small white head.  Very hoppy beer.  Bitter finish.  Pretty damn good for a pilsener.
To style and done well, slightly watery, grassy nose, bitter but not overpowering.
An aroma marked the smell stale hops.  Turmeric in color with no head available.  A tangy hop taste that does linger well.
Pours a nice golden yellow.  Aromas of malts, hops.  Crisp hop bitterness and dry finish.

Pale yellow gold, big bubbled beer with yellowish tinted dense head, collapsing. Fresh flowery hops nose, going grassy but retaining a honeyish-blossom streak. Nice pils aromas, but somewhere in the back a little bit of cardboard or sprouts. Again honey, flowers and dry hop flavours, going over in a dry grainy malt taste. Excellent balance sweet-bitter, going nowhere too far in one direction or another. Just a tad metallic retronasal enforcing the hops character. Light but nowhere watery; very slight burning feeling. Very enjoyable pilsener. Not great, just right. Big thanks to Pivo and Nat!
This beer had a nice appearance to it.  It also had a nice smooth taste for a Pilsner.

Pours to a pale yellow color with a little head. Im not usually a Pils fan, but this was very surprising. I was expecting skunky, but was treated to hops, slightly bitter but very good. Probably my new favorite Pilsner.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2005 Had during a beer tasting party.  Poured almost a glowing light yellow color, very interesting.  Very perfumey, less bitter than other Pils. 

Favorite Pils.

Beautiful clear gold color with an egg foam head.  Mild bready hop aroma, earthy.  Soft pale malt taste with a modicum of hop bitterness.  Like any true-to-style pils this isn’t very complex, nor should it be.  This is probably one of the best (if not the best) domestic pilsners there are!
Poured a nice golden yellow,with a small head and a great pilsner aroma.The flavor was balanced very well,and you could actually taste the hops!A fantastic pilsner!

Fresher taps are highly recommeded, and a bit different than botles.  Fresh taps lack the intense floral aroma, but cater to a wider audience as a result.  Very crisp flavor, a hoppier, very American rendition of a European classic style.  Head is full but light out of the bottle, for a pilsner the aroma will knock you out.  New York Times rated this a top pils in a global test.
Golden appearance with a nice lingering head. Taste is clean and crisp with a strong hop bitterness and a dry finish. Still not a big fan of the style, but probably the best pilsner that Ive had.

Bottle (12oz).  Poured clear, oily bright brass, with an average white foamy head.  Smells like most pilsners, maybe more pungent hops than normal, plenty of fresh hay and a hint of honey.  Taste - oh yeah, thats a great pils!  Plenty of hops, fresh sweet grains, dont get corn or adjuncts at all, very crisp with a long, pleasantly bitter finish.  Maybe the best pils Ive ever had.

Bottle. Perfect 1/2 inch head on a honey/straw body. Nose-Sweet Pils Malts and some spice. Light dust smell. Taste-light skunk (perfect), medium bittering hops, nice crisp eastern European hops, and some lingering sweetness. This is damn good for such a blah style. Very refreshing and satisfying. I may have found my everyday drinker.

The grassy, lemony aroma is the perfect prelude to this crisp refresher.  This is the lightest colored, yet fullest flavored lager I have come across.  The body is surprinsingly full and complex, noting sour fruits, honey and straw - a wild mix of sour, sweet and earthy flavors that work wonderfully well together.  The loads of bittering hops add a great finish that lingers.  Wonderful stuff.
A good attempt at a difficult style. A bit on the hoppy side. Aroma is somewhat underwhelming but the flavor does not disappoint. Good head and color.

Bottle, # 800 for me - seems to be a decent enough beer to celebrate the occasion!  Light yellow pour, small white head.  Strong pils hops in aroma - probably more so than usual.  Medium frothy active mouthfeel.  Taste - wow, what a flavourful pils. Tons of hops true to their style roots, lots of light malt taste even though it looks really thin, this is an excellent refreshing tasty pils!  Long lingering dry bitter finish.  Well done Victory, not my favourite style but one I would reach for again any time of the year.
Bottle.  Good aroma fairly typical of a pilsner but a bit more hoppy.  Pours a clear light golden color with a medium white head.  Malty flavor, nice hop bitterness.  Clean dry finish.

Bottle. Im not a Pilsener fan but I trust Victory to surprise me. Pours a clear bubbly gold with an average size lasting white head. Very nice looking. Im not loving the aroma, theres something about it that I dont care for very much. The flavour is that of a Pilsener but you can actually taste hops and its quite tasty. This is probably hoppier than a Pilsener should be but Im not complaining, its an improvement. Kudos to Victory for making a Pilsener that I really like, its probably the best one Ive had -- now if they could do something about that aroma.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2005 12oz - enjoy by Jan 06, 2006 - Aroma is a bit skunky.  Hops, but not the floral ipa kind.  A nice malty back.  Pours a transparent yellow with a medium head that leaves great lacing.  Flavor is german malt with a touch of yeast balanced by the hop characteristics.  Clean and crisp palate.  Tasty.

from the bottle. poured a yellow, with white head. aroma wheat, yeast, asome sourness, hop, and some malt. flavor, hops, malts grainy, as it warmed got honey and citrus. mouthfeel was dry would be a good session beer.
little much on the hops for a pure pilsner.  good body, color and head.  very easy to drink infact I recently used it to get over a hangover without incident

Aroma is huge for a pilsner.  Average white head.  Looks almost like champagne bubbles.  Taste is similar to a european lager.  A hop presence is ... slighty detected.  Better than american macros.  There is only so much you can get out of a pilsner flavor and this one does a pretty good job.  Good for its style, but I think Schell from MN does an even better job.  Still, one of the better of its style.  This is pretty decent.

Pour is light bright yellow with a nice tight bubbled lasting white head...smell is strongly hoppy and grassy...light citrus notes too...taste is crisp and malty up front turning slightly bitter and quite dry in the finish...slight notes of skunk are in there still...very nice...

Pours clean and clear with a frothy white head. Big floral hop aroma with a hint of vanilla. Great malt and hop flavor with some grassy notes and a hint of black current. Finishes with a satisfying bitterness. Very good.
Surprising find in Bangor Michigan. Nice head out of the bottle, lacing good.  Golden appearance, lots of hops aroma. Dry crisp finish ,very good pils.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2005 First time in awhile that I used my footed pilsner glass.  Pours to a fully lasting rocky white head with excellent lacing and a glowing golden body with visible carbonation.  The aroma is bright.  Lemons, sourdough bread, and dandelion wine.  This is definitely thoroughly hopped.  The flavor is crisp floral/perfumey hops, subtle spicy hops, decent biscuit malt.  Drying finish on the palate.  Yet refreshing given the carbonation.  Worth a try.

I picked up a sixer of this.  The more I drink it, the better it is.  This is SUCH a well made beer.

Beautiful flaxen gold in the glass with a half-inch white head that generates some lacing.  Aromas leap from the glass: dandelion, lemon, mown grass, and some light, dry malts.  Crisp with good acidity on the gentle hop bite, leading to a full and somewhat tangy finish.  Smooth and natural.  Very good.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2006 4/10/06  Re-rate:  Im an idiot and I managed to buy a 6-pack from the same exact batch, from the same store as my previous rating.  That bottle was already a good bit past its enjoy by date (6/22/05), so by now its almost a year past.  I always forget to check the dates on the bottles, which Is really dumb since I know that the stores around here have a tendency to leave this stuff on the shelves forever (I can get pretty much any of their seasonals year round).  Oh well, even though its the same beer, my palate has changed significantly.  I still dont like pilseners, except for this one.  Definitely has that noble hop crispness and yeasty breadiness that I found last time.  I get more complexity, though.  There is this one flavor that I just cant place, but the best way to describe it is lemon and basil.  Since I said basil, it does have some herbal tones, but not in the way Im used to.  Its more like a fresh picked herb like basil or maybe even cilantro.  Definitely honey in there as well.  Lively carbonation with a rich but clean mouthfeel.  While this beer doesnt
taste any different to me than the last time, I enjoy it significantly more.  Because of this, the old rating is scrapped.  


10/22/05  4/3/5/3/12  2.7   
I knew I didnt like pilseners much, but I had heard such great things about this that I had to give it a shot.  Turns out I just dont like pilseners.  Lots of noble hops in the aroma and flavor.  Has that noble "crisp but not bitter" quality.  A bit bready with the yeast.  Definitely drinkable.  Even though I dont like it much I find the glass to empty very quickly.  If you like the style, this is a great pick.  If not, you wont get too excited.

Tap at Flying Saucer, Houston.  Pours a pure gold with a faint sour aroma.  Flavor is crisp, light hops with a nice sweetness in the finish that balances everything.  Palate suffices.  Oh yeah... KEVIN WAS THERE.  EASTSIDE, BITCHES!
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
Bottle acquired from a trade w/kramer17801.
Hazy pale yellow.  Almost Belgian White in color (like the Golden Monkey). Frothy white head that sticks to side of the glass more like a krausen then a lace.  Peppery aroma.  Thicker mouth feel.  Malty with a small bit of diacetyl (which seems out of place in this beer).

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2005 This is a pleasant pilsner, if thats your thing.  If you get it as part of the victory sampler case, you wont regret it, but if youre like me, youll gravitate to the hop devil and the golden monkey, with this pulling in a respectable third among a variety of great beers.  Im not quite as enthusiastic as the other reviewers given the context of the other beers, though if youre going for a pilsner, this really is not a bad choice at all.

Re-rate, 12/24/05: Aroma of apple juice, tastes grapey, bitter, a bit like a kolsh - that german malt I suppose.  Looks really pale, light yellow with no head.  Mediocre.  The high average rating here is rather undeserved.  It is not better than 92/100 of the other beers I am drinking.  Quite good for a pilsener, but it really doesnt appeal to me, and I think its ridiculously overrated.

Bottle: hazy blonde yellow.....nose was of bananna and a hint of clove, some orange tended to come out as it warmed, beautiful snow white creamy head that stuck around awhile. Mouthfeel was perfectly medium, going down ultra smooth. Flavors included banana, wheat, candied malts, honey, and other sweetness. Awesome

Poured light golden with minimal head ( I used a standard pint glass).  Hayseed aroma with a malt character that reminded me of a rolling prairie. The hops  kick you on the way in and on the way out. I will revisit this pilsener
Bottle. Pours a clear straw gold with a nice white head and lacing. Great malt profile with an earthy hop bitterness and spicy hop flavor. Very clean. Good. Beer.

Clear, magnifying neon gold with an icy sheet for the head and sticky, cascading lace.  Aroma is a sinus elixir, laden with hearty sourdough, grass stains, hops, lemon rind scrapings and pine fresheners.  Crisp, yeasty flavor.  Flakey biscuits with a honeyed / carnation / floral hop profile.  Lemons never sear, they sweeten like the top crust of fresh French bread.  Chafing, drying palate presence but consciously smooth and balanced.  Finish is musky, husky and lemon herbed sourdough.  Ranks right up there with the styles best.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2005 bottle-This beer poured out golden and crisp with a decent head.The smell at first was a turnoff as it smelled skunked.However the taste was hoppy and it had a great malt profile.This is a really fine American pilsner.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2006 Re-rate. First one was bad bad bad. Much improved now. Crystal clear with a nice white head. My standard everyday pils. Spicy, crisp, respectable hop bite but not near the IPA category. VERY drinkable and one heck of a thirst quencher.

12 oz. bottle. Clear golden hue with beautiful white head, well maintained. Refreshing malt flavor well balanced by floral hops, most likely Saaz. Dry in the finish, an excellent example of the style.

Fine, dry pils that pours golden with a frothy white head. Beautiful in the glass. Nice aroma of hops and grass. Flavor at first reminded me of Pilsner Urquell but the malty body wasnt quite as firm. Therefore, the balance seemed a bit shy of perfection. Loved the hoppy flavor but it lacked body in the finish. Very enjoyable and would buy again but the price is a little north of my normal budget.
Bottled. Plae golden with a rich white head. Dry hoparomatic grassy nose. Dry and grassy flavour with notes of lemon zest. Long dry and spicy aftertaste. Very good pils.

this is a goodpilsner.  dry - crisp -clean -clear- but its not the a great example of its style.  Its lacking a little  in mouthfell.  it also dosent have a nice bite to it.  Pilsner urquel is still the best in my humble opinion

UPDATED: APR 12, 2008 Pours a cloudy pale golden with a smallish, mostly diminishing head. Aroma is floral hops, some pine. Flavor is quite hoppy, grapefruit, lemon, malt presence is very light, some dough. Dry finish. Medium/light body with moderate carbonation. Delicious.

after a bad day of flying, t (subway), shuttle bus and walking...my mate had this one waiting for me when i walked into the hotel room in boston. you could of given me cold piss an i would have been happy...instead i got a solid what they call  a pilsner that was hopped nicely compared to most youve had.  drank about 3 of em.  gave me that tangy flavor that cllings to the back of your tongue. all in all a good memory.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2009 Bottled. Pale golden colour, small white head. Vegetables and malts in aroma along with strong hints of peas. Vegetably malty flavour with strong hoppy finish. Lame, so lame. Bulk stuff! Either bad production that was at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival, or then clearly overrated. 3 2 3 2 5

Pale yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is grass, freshly cut wood, some mild notes of earth as well as some floral hopping. Flavour is quite much the same. Rather wellbalanced and refreshing to drink.

Bottled
Very pale yellow, not much head. Rubbery, grassy hoppy nose. Harsh, malty flavor. Some late hoppyness and  a bit of sugar. Suprise to have such a bulk from craft brewery.

Pours yellow like a Pilsner should...  I only drink pilsners when only macros are available, but I WILL drink this one again.  After reading a few other reviews, TheHoff said it tastes like Model, and I agree... It does kind of taste like Modelo, but that was good, too.

(12 oz bottle: Hi-Time Wine Cellars in Costa Mesa, CA) I definitely think this is one of the best hops-dominated, American pils out there, and its an example of how my tastes have changed over the years.  I used to hate this beer; way too bitter for me back then.  But while its still not my favorite pilsener, I at least can drink a bottle of this beer and enjoy it.  It has a pleasant, mildly malty base, but its obvious claim to fame is the crisp, assertive, fairly bitter and grapefruity hops that dominates this beer from start to finish.  The graininess is a bit more apparent in the nose, but even here, the grapefruit citrus dominates.  Light bodied, and as clean and crisp as any pilsener Ive ever sampled.  Medium straw in color and slightly hazy.  The snow white head rises to nearly an inch before slowly subsiding to a filmy layer.  A sporadic ring of lace remains behind near the top of the glass.  If I were to desire a hoppy pilsener, this would probably be my choice.  But the thing is, I rarely desire such a beer.  If I want a pale lager, I want it to be more malty than hoppy.
Thanks to Fantomas23, pours golden yellow.  Has a yeasty aroma with some spiciness.  Dry up front, some malty sweetness, and crsip hop spice in the end.  Excellent Pilsner.

Thanks to ClarkVV for this brew.  Bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with some slow small bubbles and a frothy white head that minimize.  Sweet yeast (dough, sweat) and malt (hay, straw, meal) aroma with citrus hop notes.  Bitter acidic citrus hop flavor with a dry yeast finish.  Light and fizzy palate, dry.

Bottle, clear pale gold pour.  Floral hop aroma, some light malt.  Flavor is more of the hop - floral and spicy.  Balanced amount of malt.  Crisp, but not acidic.  Very well done beer for a style that usually doesnt do much for me.

Pours a light golden color with a white fading head.  Smells of bitter roses with a slight hint of citrus.  Taste is an excellent floral bitter citrus.  Not a big fan of pilsners, but this one holds up very well.
Nice large white head.  I agree with peoples comments that the hops are quite floral, which actually makes for an OK pilsener.  Not my favorite style, but i still find it crisp and refreshing.

Sampled at Stone 9th Ann. party.  Not bad for a pisner.  Such a boring style to try and do something outstanding with.  Seems that as soon as you do something great with it it turns into another style.  Still tasty stuff and I would drink it anytime.

Clear pale gold pilsner, smells skunked.  Thin head.  The taste is a little bit bitter which is nice but also quite metallic. Not bad really, tastes much like a Mexican beer to tell you the truth. Modelo maybe.  It is OK but forgettable.

One of the best Pilseners from the U.S. Nice clear yellow, lively carbonation, a foamy white head - - All of that sets you up for a crisp, tasty beer, sweet malt with solid floral hop bitterness.  That hopping comes out excellently in the aroma as well as in the snappy, bitter finish.  This is a beer to keep on hand to get your BMC friends introduced to quality craft beers.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Armanetti, Willowbrook, IL<font size=-1>
Really great pils...with its wonderful spritzy carbonation and rampant beading.  Good hop bitterness and floral notes.  Light malt sweetness under the whole thing.  So very good.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy straw color with a bountiful white head.  Aroma is of soft floral hops, with an emphasis on Saaz.  Notes of grass and light malt.  Flavor is very sharp with a great hop bite and finishes very clean.  There is also a strong german malt backbone to it that comes out in mid swallow.  This is what a true pilsner ought to taste like.  Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated with a light fizziness.  This is just a great refreshing knock your socks off beer.  An American classic.

Original rating in april 2004. Beautiful golden body, clear with a huge rocky and foamy pure white head. Aroma is grassy, full on Saaz: spicy and flowery, herbs and bready hay. Milder than expected, but I love the saaz here or maybe it had been too long since I last smelled it. Tongue-biting body, airy, creamy, great support fom a good medium body. Malt bite early on, in a honeyish fashion, but most of the flavor development is all about the flavorful saaz that makes us believe were actually chewing on flowers and some lemon peaks. Something makes me say hallertau too, but Im no expert at picking hops used. Extremely refreshing and crisp. Wonderful beer for a hot day.  Re-tried on tap at the Gingerman (NYC) and I was very impressed once again by the fragrant hoppiness of that one. Bottles dont keep their freshness very long, but this particular pint was vibrant with floral, herbal, spicy hops that overcame the soft, biscuity malts. Immensely dry and satisfying to me hence the score bumping up.

Not the style of beer Id be inclined to reach for, but to my surprise, it was quite enjoyable.  Rich golden color with a  head that is thin and short-lived.  Potent cut-grass, herbal aroma.  The flavor is crisp, but oh, what a finish!  The fizzy carbonation combined with the balanced hoppy bite make it  memorable.  Very nice.

Extraordinarly clear pilsner.  Big, white, foamy head.  Grassy, haylike aroma.  Full mouthfeel despite thin, watery appearance.  Down to earth on the malts and hops.  Seems to be a very pure example of the style, which Im not a big fan of (but this is quite enjoyable).

Has a strong aroma almost smells like a skunk. The flavor is very good it starts out with fizz and carbonation then comes the flavors of hops, malts, and honey with a crisp finish. So far this is my favorite Pilsener

Nicely done pilsner.  Pours about like an american lager... light honey color with lots of bubbles, but with a bigger head.  Aroma is a little weak, hops come through.  Lacing is pretty substantial.  Taste is a little hoppier and more bitter (but a nice bitterness, not skunky) than most pilsners.  Crisp due to high carbonation and hops bite.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma is mild hops. Taste is amazingly clean and crisp. Good hop profile as well. A world class pils.
a light bodied pilsner with a distinct smell.  Minor head but theres a lot going on when you taste the beer.  Seems very fizzy as leaves a pleasant bitterness on the back of your throat.

Pours golden with a white frothy head that disapates.  Aroma is grassy with a bit of hop spiciness.  Flavor is a classic Pilsner, a balance of hops and malt leading to a dry but not prickly finish.  Thanks to hey_kevin for the bottle
this is my favorite Pilsner...  other pilsners tastes like liquified dry white toast to me, this one lacks the gag tickle in the back of the throat, its a good, clean, crisp beer.

12 oz. Bottle:  Unremarkable golden color with white head which doesnst last long.  Nose is mostly adjunct on top of a big malt base.  Flavor was pils-esque as it should be, malt goodness, finishes with grass and hay.

On tap.  Even after living in Prague for five months, this is the best pilsener Ive ever had.  Pours vibrant golden under even, foamy head.  Aromas of hops and straw, or dry flour.  Taste is big and hoppy, with a touch of citrus keeping it from being too dry.  A perfectly balanced pilsener.
Build like the classic pilseners of Pilzen! Great summer beer with excellent color and balance of hops.  Excellent from the tap, still good from the bottle.
Love this Pils when its on its on- id rather have it than any European Pilsner.Howeaver ive had it hazy,flat and slightly sour at times :(

12oz bottle received in a trade with pjk33 - Thanks Pat!  -  Pours a beautiful deep golden color with a nice 1/2 inch white foamy head and a load of carbonation bubbles rising to the top throughout.  Absolutely beautiful to look at..  Aroma is of a grassy meadow a touch of alfalfa and some light grains.  Flavor is quite hoppy for a pilsner.  Very grassy and natural tasting.  Some light grains, a little dough, a bit o honey, and a touch of citrus at the end before the nice dry finish.  On the palate this is crisp and clean and a real thirst quencher.   Im not usually a big fan of this style but this one is tasty.. This is the best pilsener Ive tried and would be a regular summer beer for me if it was sold here in Ohio.  Outstanding..

Medium golden with a nice white head.  Crisp and hoppy nose.  Taste is front of the mouth hops.  Body is smooth, fluid and indistinct.  Finish is crisp and clean.  Hops are bold and in my opinon, a bit much.
Ive only had this beer in variety pack a couple years ago.  i remember it being a really good beer, but nothing i would order at a bar or at their brewery

After the overwhelming sweetness of a DD Stille Nacht, this overwhelmingly dry pils balances out well. Tastes like a tough piece of bread. An enjoyable pils to be sure, and a perfect representation of the style.

12oz bottle. Light gold color. Medium sized white foamy head. Aroma is grassy, grainy and spicy. A medium bodied pilsner. Malts are fruity and sweet. Hops are spicy and crisp. Light, crisp and refreshing. Nice pilsner. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Bottle. Pours a clean golden color with a medium sized, white, foamy head. Nose is straw and hay, with some fresh grasses and yeast thrown in. Taste is very fresh with some light malts and straw, finishing very clean and crisp.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2006 Draught. Clear golden color. Hint of hops in the nose. Sprucy with a nice grainy aftertaste. Moderately carbonated. Crisp finish. Decent pilsner.
Had this at the Flour City Brew Fest. Slight hops aroma.  Some citrus and hops in the body.  Crisp, a fine brew.
Had at Rohrbachs summer brew fest on draft.  Not positive this was the pils they brought.  No aroma, heavy hops in the palate, typical of the german style, watery finish.
Bottle.  Clear light golden color with a short lasting, nice looking head.  Floral, hoppy aroma.  Bitterness is most pronounced in the flavor.  Not my favorite style but a nice beer nonetheless.

immense aroma of noble hops and grass, on a straw colored body.  very refreshing, but a tiny bit too bitter and stinky--too many dusty german hops, if thats possible.  its good, but why so highly-rated?  i need the hops version of "cloying" to describe this.  smells more balanced than it is.

Let me preface this by saying that Im by far the best beer reviewer on this site. I say this with neither malice nor hubris, but with love. Now, on with the show... Victory Prima Pils. Delivered in from Ohio via my brother from a diff mother.  Aroma is jagged lemon hops, good-homegrown skunkweed, gorgeous, light as wafer. Pours golden delicious apple, thick in the glass with brief and bubbly head. Finestkind spidery lacings; Im caught in its web, good god. Flavor: eternally hoppy, bright but quickly dead, bitter butter aftertaste, but too bitter (believe it or not), not enough butter. Thin side of thick on the palate. You know what that means; think! Why does it smell so-o-oooo much better than it tastes? Mens Journal rated this North Americas best beer. North Americas best beer is ... is... Ill keep you guessing, beastardo! Hint: this one aint it...

Bottle, from Julios. Enjoy by sep 03 05. Good nose, sweet and sour. Sourdough, little lemon, grass, Classic clean yellow/gold color.  Good fluffy white head that faded quickly. Bitter flavors, lemon/grapefruit, a little tinny, some skunk, toasted grains. Thin body, lite creamy mouthfeel, bitter dry finish, nice spice on the finish. I like it, Ive had APAs that dont have this much flavor
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle. Light golden color with white head. Mostly light malt and yeast on the nose, with a slight floral hop aroma. The hops blossom as the beer warms, both in aroma and flavor, which is interesting for this style. Light bitterish malt flavor in the beginning and throughout the middle, with a citrusy hop finish. Very crisp. Liked it better at room temp for the hop aroma, flavor, and bitterness. Im slowly becoming a Pils fan because of beers like this one.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2007 pours pale golden with a large white fluffy head, the aroma was bready and not very appealing mostly yeast and malts, taste was weak and smooth with some hops present adding a little bite, good pilsner.

Draft at Mellow Mushrooms Victory tasting party. Huge white had atop crystal clear yellow brew.  Nice hoppy flavor not typical of any other pils Ive ever had.  If all pilsners were like this, Id be a bigger fan!  Hop Pocket is a better beer.

Blonde w. huge, fluffy head.  Sharp, hop-oil pungence, w. hint of skunk. Overly hoppy, pine-needle flavor, again w. the appearance of skunk. Very bitter for a pils and rather unorthodox for the style.  Nothing special.
pours golden with a whiite head.  Aroma is floral and sweet.  Taste bitter with just a touch of sweetness.  Good pilsener.

Pours gold with a fingers length white head and nice medium bubbles that subside quickly.  Smells of bananas, nutmeg, grapefruit and some other scents I cannot quite place.  Unusually malty in taste and not quite as bitter as Ive come to expect out of a pilsner.  Slight bitter finish.  Not bad overall.

Draft at two eastside Cincy locations. Clear amber color with a medium white head that diminshed slowly. Well balanced aroma. Medium body. Well balanced flavor with a solid pilsner finish. Very good pilsner draft.

12 oz bottle-pours a thin white foamy head.  Color is clear yellow-light gold.  Aroma is usual pilsner or lager-grain&yeast?  Taste has initial ____toasty? note.  Good flavor, mild, nice carbonation.  Nice finish.

Light golden pour with a generous off-white head.  Huge aroma for the style, with plenty of hops, honey, and apricots.  Very smooth in the front of the mouth, with bready malt hitting the taste buds first.  Hops come through after that, and carry through for a nice long slightly bitter finish.  Loved the hop presence in here!  Very easy drinking, and easily the best pils I have found to date.
Completly and overly suprised about how great this pilsner is.  Pours a golden yeloow with a white head.  Aroma and flavor are a bit hoppy but the balance is super!

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 although the favorite amoing the pilseners i have tried thus far, i cant get over that lack of malt presence.   very complex flavor makes this much more fun to drink.  victory is your name, beer is your game and you are far from lame

Rerate: Looking back at my original rating and notes is funny but it also makes sense.  This is one my go-to beers these days.  One of the best and most consistent American made Pilsners out there.

Took me a few tries before I got over the macro taste and then I realized: this doesnt taste like a macro, the macros are diminished and mass produced versions of what this is not embarrased to be. A wonderfully yeasty and wheaty brew that is rounded out with some lovely hops. Great for a hot day and perfect with BBQ.  This is the John Deere Ride-On of lawnmower beers.
A well carbonated, hazy, yellow pour. Has a small white head with light lacing.  Aroma has floral hints.  Mouthfeel is crisp.  Flavor has a good balance of fruit and hops.
Nice yellow gold color, but I could use a bit more head.  Excellent session beer and very refreshing after mowing the lawn!
Pours light gold with not much head.  Aroma is light and crisp.  Flavor reminds me of apple.  An excellent summer beer.

Cloudy yellow gold despite my best attempts to keep the yeast in the bottle.  Massive foamy white head that required at least four pours.  Crisp pils aroma with spicy hops.  Refreshing character with Saaz hops and clean malt flavors.  Some citrus fruit in the finish though.  Mouthfeel is crisp, fairly dry.
Probably the second best pilsner next to Rogue.  Lots of bitter ear-wax hops but not enough malt to balance.  light in color and body

Standard pilsner flavour with some major bite.  This is a pilsner with attitude.  Im not that big of a fan of the style, but it is very drinkable.  This one has more than you normally get from a pilsner.  Good, try one.  Nice golden pour, loads of spicy aroma coming off, and some nice bitter bite.  Good stuff.

bottle. translucent pale golden in appearance with a short-lasting frothy white head. great pilsener aroma - dusty saaz and sweet cookie dough. Perfectly drinkable! a good portion of hops and adequately bitter along with toast bread flavours. Nice balance. Lingering bitterness. I think this is an excellent example of the style when consumed fresh.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2007 Clear golden bronze, large white head with decent lacing and retention. Aroma is a boatload of grassy/spicy hops with fresh bread. Its big for a pilsner, but stays within the limits of the style. I dont think Id change anything... if it lacks anything its a wow factor.

On draught at the Horse Brass in Portland, OR.  Wow!  Amazingly fresh aroma and flavor.  Pale golden color.  Really nice hop aromawith a good portion of malt.  The flavor has a bit of honey.  Great beer.

Pale straw color out of the bottle with a fizzy white head.  Great nose of light citrus and strong hops.  Very clean and crisp taste.  Lots of hops with pine and mown grass flavors with some orange citrus.  Some toast and dough.  Very easy to drink.  Ive had old bottles before and didnt even rate them, but this bottle was several months shy of the best before date and was very tastey.
Beautiful creamy-gold color.  Spectacular taste (though a bit light).  Quite sweet, but with a nice bitterness in the aftertaste.
nice gold colour.  sweet aroma and seemed kinda then but had a good taste.

Bottle.  A light hoppy aroma, and poured a clear golden color (typical of a good pilsner).  The flavor caught me off guard -- there are more hops hiding in this beer than the aroma or appearance lead on.  Definitely one to keep on my list.

Pours light yellow with a thin white head.    Smells strongly of yeast with a bit of a hop kick to it.  Light and yeasty with a slight bitter taste.  Long everchanging aftertaste from sweet and mild to a little bitter kick at the end.  Nice pilsner which is a style I dont usually care for.

Draught.  Appears a light golden yellow. Perfectly clear with a small quickly dissipating head.  Aroma is of malt and grassy/spicy/floral noble-ish hops with a bit of mild fruit.  Flavor is doughy/malty sweet with plenty of earthy/citrussy hops to balance.  Bitterness is moderate.  Moderate fruity ester profile which is unusual for a lager.  Body is fuller than expected from a pils and quite smooth. Great lager, with lots of hops.

Herbal, leafy tobacco and grainy malts in the nose.  Clear pale gold with thin but lasting cover of bright white head.  Floral, spicy hop flavour with fair bitterness and an apparent cereal malt base.  Light, refreshing body with fair carbonation.  Sampled at Mondial de la Bière 2005.

A very pale yellow with fine carbonation and a creamy head, the aroma is noble hops and clean malt. The flavor is a fine balance between hops malt and finishes dry with a firm bitterness throughout. A fine example of a pilsner- if only the German imports were so fresh.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 Re-Rate.  Hop/Vegetable aroma. Hardly any head, golden.  Well hopped with Pilsener and other hops.  Roast malt and a bit of spice.  Clean and crisp.  High quality pilsener.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Blonde paille, mousse blanche adhérant bien à la paroi du verre.  Aromes de foin et un brin poudreux rappelant les aspirines.  Noble houblon épicé est dune bonne présence, juxtaposé au grain.  La texture rappelle la craie en bouche, poudreuse et très sèche.  Échantillon, mondial de la bière, Juin 2005.

Sampled at le Mondial de la bière 2005. Pours a clear golden color. Appealing aroma of saaz hops with malt and citrus. Good flavor of saaz hops with malt and citrus. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Very enjoyable pilsner.

Bottle poured an ultra-light, ginger-ale-yellow with an average sized, fast, white head. A skunky start faded quickly to mustiness over grainy malt aromas. A quick-drinker, this was thoroughly light & bitter with a mildly sweet finish. A damn fine beer to drink over a hot barbecue.
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Wine & Spirits, Countryside, IL<font size=-1>
Mondial de la Bière de Montréal 2005. Robe blonde claire, mousse blanche. Houblon bien présent.

Bottle.  Pours clear golden with lots fo carbonation and a small white head.  Aroma is grainy and slightly bitter.  Flavor is typical of German pilseners and somewhat crisp.  Could be a little tighter, but it did taste wonderfully fresh compared to the good German pilseners I have had here.

Draught.  Little more bitter and fresher flavor even still.  Draught is the way this beer should be consumed!

Bottle:  Aroma is lemon, grassy, and a touch of spice.   Pours a transparent yellow with a white head that is somewhat quickly diminishing.   Lemony and grassy up front with a light-moderate hop finish.  Even with the hops its still a pilsner and I just cant get into the style.  Yes its one of the better pilsners, but nothing fantastic in my opinion.  For those that are a fan of the style, probably quite the find.
Gold with slightly greenish tint.  NIce graininess with a little malt sweetness.  This stuff is dry, hoppy, with plenty of noble spiciness.  This is good pils.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2005 Golden lager with a white head that fades to lace.First smell is corn macro
followed by floral hops.Taste is a pleasing hop bittererness that really is refreshing.Its a light tasting minimal malt brew but has enough hops to keep it interesting.

okay....wow....is this the same beer that everyone else has tried?  this is by no means a wonderful beer, or has any potential to be a beer in such a catergory....golden brown body that is somewhat transparent and similar to a miller high life....aroma is indistinct and is only of wheat and florals....flavor is of a light macro as well, with a touch of flowery hops...nothing special by any standards
UPDATED: SEP 20, 2005 Clear, light golden body with abundant carbonation and thin white head.  Spicy, flowery hop flavor with a busy palate.  Another good Victory beer.

Pours a very pale gold with a thin snow white head. Not much head retention but some persistent lace. Fizzy but not overly so. Smells of grassy pale malt. Nice hop aromas, floral and citrus in the nose.

Taste is grassy and with a crisp, bitter hops finish. Floral and hints of grapefruit in the flavor profile. While crisp, the malt is actually a bit sticky in the mouth. I would like the mouth to be a bit more crisp and the stickiness to be muted but this is a damn tasty pilsener anyway. Really smooth and very drinkable. Oh how refreshing this beer is on a warm Georgia afternoon and oh how bitter I will be when this six-pack is gone and there is no more Victory of any kind to be found in this state.

Bright white head.  Fairly quickly dissapating.  Quite a bit of a carbonation.  A good bit of hops in the aroma, not overwhelming.  Malts are soft in/on the mouthfeel.  Went well with mildly spicey wings.  Pretty good pils.
Light yellow. White head. Light flowery hop aroma. Mouth drying. Very high hop flavour. Like a double hopped Pilsener.

Bottled. 
Pale yellow. Airy, lemony nose. Thin body. Citrus, vanilla and metal flavour. Reminiscent to Jämtlands President. True micro brew but more of a German Style than Czech.
Pours gold with white head.  Nice hoppy aroma, clean scent.  Hops, grassy, earthy right up front, then malts take over at the end.  Nice and smooth going down.  A real nice pils.

Nothing hazy here, poured clear and golden... Very nice white head and some lacing. Nice hops scents. Has a light hops bite with a dry finish. Local store had a sign saying this was a Ratebeer 100 percentile... Not sure how they came up with that. I tried it anyway.
Alefest 05  -  Good solid beer for this style. Fuller flavor than most pilsners.  Try their Hop Devil for an even better experience.
pours golden with lively co2, hop bitterness upfront, then slight maltiness follwed by a pleasent lingering hoppiness, overall a very enjoyable pilsner
UPDATED: APR 12, 2007 Golden pour small white head. Crisp malty goodness with a great clean noble hop finish, just a good tasting beer.

Light to medium gold in colour with a fair amount of carbonation. Surprisingly strong malty aroma with some good notes of floral hops as well. Good balance between malt flavor and bitterness with loads of wildflower honey flavors as well. A bit heavier in the mouth than expected, but this is some seriously good pilsner.
Light gold, long lasting white head.Faintly spicy hop nose.Spicy hop flavor with lots of malt and lasting bitter finish. Great lace
bottled.  golden color, very clear.  it has the aroma of malt.  slight bitter aftertaste.

Light golden in color below frothy suspended foam.  Grassy aromatic hops in the nose with clean yeast and light malt elements, providing a seemlingly honeyed haystack and raw grain aroma.  Maybe the label and other users comments fooled me, but I was expecting a powerful amount of hops in this brew, and while the hops were fairly forceful, they werent very flavorful or aromatic but more just extremely bitter.  The malt seemed to be a bit overly sweet and thin and more importantly, just very boring.

Bottle.  Pours, well, like a pilsener.  Clear and yellow.  Big fluffy head.  Aroma was dry and hoppy.  Let it sit and honey starts to appear.  Its dry, not too bitter, and mildly hoppy.  After a bit, theres a hint of some sweet malts and caramel.  Im not a big pilsener fan, but this is pretty good.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2006 Slightly over-bitter and spicy. This is a good pilsner but is not what it looks to be. Dont judge it by its reputation try it for yourself. Be honest!
very good example of one of my favorite styles, perhaps high expectations hurt this one, it was good not great and I never really found the abundant hops that I was expecting, good pilsner though
[bottled] Nice appearance, a bit unclear, with a nice full head. Aroma of a weak IPA. Soft but very refreshing. Sweet flavor with a hint of elder flower. Well balanced bitterness.
pours a clear golden with barely any head. taste is hops and malt. not a fan of pilsners but this isnt bad. probably a good lawn mowing beer.
A hazy orange beer with a disappearing white head. The aroma has notes of straw and hops. The flavor is sweet and again with notes of straw and hops. Good for a pilsener.
Im not normally into pilsners, but I must say that Victory Prima Pils is one that I would select again. A top-notch pils, better (and fresher) than many Europeans.

Pours golden and clear with a quickly diminishing head.  Floral and fruity scent.  Perfect balance of malt and hops for a pilsner.  Nice and crisp with a pleasant bitter taste that runs through til the finish.  Slightly malty flavor also appears on the finish.  Great palate--totally refreshing pilsner.

active yellow pour with a fluffed white head . honey and hay aroma. straw malt taste with a great slightly sour crisp bitter finish. very satisfying  a great food beer. lingering straw flavors with a perfect bitter balance.this is what a pilsner should be. thanks slob for the trade.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2005 Bottle, dated "Enjoy by Mar 09 05." Reviewed in my basement as I watch a rainstorm seep water all around my beer fridge. Thanks to Dorwart for putting this in his fine trade. Yknow, Eric Asimov, wine critic for the NY Times, channels his uncle Isaacs smarts by reviewing beer once in a while, and his latest article had a thumbs up for this. But I think he missed the mark when he said that pilseners are not complex. This beer is very complex. I popped the cap to a whiff of strong beer that could be a slight skunk, but the odor dissipated. The pour is very pale, more like a macro, with a stiff, foamy "TV Beer" head. The malt taste is very light, probably light as you can get without adding corn. But malty, not sugary. Hops are there, but they are more for tang than bitterness, like a few bits of lemon peel. Finish is just fine, with a happy little hop prickle on your tongue. A well rounded pils tasted at the height of its maturity.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2005 Sampled on draught and was very impressed. Well balanced and expertly made pilsner. Malt with fruit, sourness, and a nicely bitter finish. Its not a big brew, nor does any aspect of the taste dominate over others. Vert smooth, tasty hop finish.
This is an Ok Pilsner.  Straw, bitter, and grassy flavors.  Finishes clean, crisp, and dry.

This I liked. The Braumeister is very similar, though far less bitter. I felt that what this had was more body and flavor, as well as bitterness. I was happy to be able to find another nice session ale from this place. A great beer.
Tap at Victory.  Slightly hoppier version of the Braumeister pilsner.  Id put them on par.  Both really good for the style, but theyre still pilsners.

This is probably Victorys most common beer. Not as flashy as HopDevil or Golden Monkey & not as rich as Storm King it can appear unadventurous. Think again because this is one tasty beer. Pour yourself a glass and right away you will see what Bud would be like if it was a good beer. This is a true pilsner.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2005 Golden yellow with a decent size white head.  Trix/Fruity Pebbles like flavor.  Nutty, malty. Very Crisp and refreshing.  NIce
light yellow pour, with a white frothy head. citrusy hop flavor, kind of sour, with a decent bitter finish. nice crisp refreshign mouthfeel. a good easy drinking pils with good bitterness.
Pours a golden colour with a big white head. Hops and some citrus in aroma. Smooth taste of malt and a nice hop bitterness. Certainly alot less bitter and lighter than I expected but nicely balanced.

Wow, this was better than I was expecting! A nice golden color with a white head. The smooth, crisp taste of a classic pils with a nice hoppiness to it that most pilseners seem to lack. It is not overpowering or strongly bitter, but takes chances and leaves you happy that you picked this one. My favorite pils so far.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2008 Bottled: Golden coloured. Hazy. Off white head. Grainy and hayish aroma. Some hops and fruitnotes. Is medium hopped and crisp. Some fruitnotes. Ends on a light bitter and flowery note. This might be a really good beer when fresh, but this is a little too old. Thanks Springslicker for trading. Rerated at a blindtasting by Papsoe 19th. June 2008. Original rate 7-3-6-3-12

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2007 Bottle. Clear golden color with a medium sized head. Mild hoppy aroma. Crisp, clean flavor of mild malt and a nice dry hoppy finish. Very refreshing beer. Next time Im looking for a lighter beer to drink, I think Ill have another of these.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2005 Very solid Pils, can understand why it is at the top of the Pils pile.  Very smooth and easy to drink.  If this was what other light looking beers tasted like, I would understand the appeal.  Easy to go down, I regret that I only bought a single.  Delicious frothy head.  I can imagine enjoying this during a nice summer barbeque.

Smooth pilsner, hoppy.  Hints of citrus, in aroma and taste.  Easy to throw down...I drank 11 last night and wokeup on the floor, but when I was drinking them they were easy to drink. So, yo, Im about to rate my next beer...lata.
Nice golden colour with some head. Aroma of citrus fruit and hops. Nice hop bitterness with a light body. A good, crisp pilsner, Ill have to get some for summer.
Beautiful pilsner.  Very slight haze, golden colour with a big lasting white head. Aroma of bread and hops. Smooth and dry on the palate with a gentle carbonation. A nice balance of hops and malts.

Trying a single 12 ounce bottle.  Pine forest and citrus is the aroma.  Pours a light gold/yellow.  White frothy head that dissolves in a few minutes.  Lemon citrus and hops stand out in the flavor.  A little watery, but still enough flavor to put a smile on your face.  Finishes with a slight hop bitterness. It would be easy to drink several of these.  A good Pils..
Pale yellow color with a small white head and good lacing.  There was more smell to this beer than taste.
Light, Heineckeny product with  a salty, crackery taste that finishes with a hoppy hint.  Not a favorite, but Im not a Pilsner man.

This one pours out golden-orange and the aroma is of a floral perfume. The white head disappears quickly leaving a small lacing on the glass. The flavor is hoppy bitter citrus and leaves you with a dry lingering hoppy finish. I enjoyed this one very much. Try it.
(bottle) Hazy gold with nice white head. Floral hops aroma. Flavor is mostly hops and a distinct flavor of raspberry.

Smells pilsy.  Looks pilsy.  "Heaps o hops?" How about "Smattering of Saaz?"  Must admit that the creamy (dangerously smooth finishing) mouthfeel of this brew is the only thing keeping it away from the pee-water brews most ratebeerians detest.  Okay warm-weather session, for swilling while jumping off a pontoon boat, but I wouldnt try to muscle this past any serious northern-latitude drinker in the middle months of winter.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2007 Massive white head that will not disiipate and forms Alps-like structures, yellow in a pilsner glass. Slightly hoppy, sweet aroma. Very hoppy flavor profile, a bit sweet with hints of dark fruits. Complex. Finishes in balance of bitterness and light caramel. Was looking for a world class American pilsner and found it.  Wonderful.
A superior Pilsner which tastes like the perfect combination of hops and malt. Flavor is very full and smooth on the palate. Highly enjoyable.
Good clean taste with not too much hops and not too much malt.  An easy drinking beer that the masses should look for more often.
Great color, nice foamy head that is lasting.  Taste is honey, citrus and hops, simple but nice.  Very nice pils.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2007 My second rating of this beer was an improvement. Its amazing what freshness does for a beer. Beautiful color and ample head. Aroma of noble hops and malt. A well hopped bitterness backed up by good maltiness and fullness of palate. This is a fine example of a German Pils that is no pansy.
Bottle courtesy of BuckNaked. Figured I would take a chance on this. oops. Great grassy aroma for a pilsner but everything else is still pilsner. Just o.k.

12 oz bottle:  pours a golden straw color with a white frothy head.  aroma is spicy, grasy, floral earthy. smototh blalbce hoppy malty flavor. spicy, herbal grassy. slightly fruity.  i get the taste of unfermented wort. very clean and smoth i have grown to like pilsners.

This is my favorite micro brew pilsner.  While it is most enjoyable during the summer, one can drink this anytime.  It is a hoppy pilsner with a really great color and aroma.  They go down really really smoothly.  I cant cut the grass without downing a bottle of this afterwards.
bottle.  while I am not a big fan of the pilsner style or of strongly hopped beer for that matter, this is one of the best pilsner I have ever tried.

This beer is awesome I swear,
Really good pilseners are quite rare.
Victory has given us a pilsener to drink, 
that is extremely good I think.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2008 Thin white head. The body is a rich gold color with few bubbles. Aroma is floral and slightly herbal. Also notes of iced tea. The taste the taste has strong vegetable notes with some earthy hops to back it up. A little carrots, ginger and some white bread. Interesting and solid for the style. Thanks civforprez for bringing this one to me. Trying agian recently as it arrived fresh in Iowa. Solid and it is a prime example of the style.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2004  This beer is quite enjoyable.  I am drinking it as we speak.  The Aroma is a little weak, but the taste and the aftertaste make up for it.  The aftertaste is even better then Pilsner Urquell.  The overall taste is quite similar to that beer.  This beer has more hops which I dig.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2007 Pours like filtered gold with a clean and lasting white head which lingers with good lacing throughout the glass.  Mild hops and straw in the aroma.  Very crisp solid pilsner flavor but with a fantastic and unexpected fruity finish/aftertaste.  I may be crazy but Im sure I detected plums, apricots & even blackberries or casis.  Ive rarely been disappointed by an offering from Victory and this one was no exception!
My Favorite Pils ever... hard to go wrong with this one.  Great for the first time anti-macro.  or for the seasoned vet!

Pours crisp, clean, and golden. Very light color with lots of carbonation. Head is fluffy, pure white, and leaves a good amount of lace as it quickly settles. Aroma is cool and hoppy with hints of malt. Somewhat typical fragrance for a lager but has a bit more cleanliness to it. The bottle I sampled expired back in April but I cant really tell the difference. I guess Ill have to find a fresher bottle somewhere and sample it to see if I am missing something. Flavor is sweet, hoppy, a bit fruity. Definitely not typical of the style. This is a clean crisp beer with good hops character and lots of malt complexity. After sampling a nice variety of beers I have decided that I am definitely an ale guy, but this is a lager that satisfies my palate. Overall, Prima Pils is a great session beer. I like it!
Pours a clear, golden beauty.  Drinks far much too like its pedestrian sibilings.  I was hoping for more crispness - instead it had a round palate and a pear taste.

Light yellow with a decent white head.  Nose was a little weak, with only hops apparent. Very light flavor, the hops dont overpower anything.  The finish is very smooth, with some hints of fruits.  Goes down easy without a bitter aftertaste like some other pilsners.

Poured a light gold topped with a nice foamy head with very nice retention.Slight grassy aroma that was overpowered by citrus.Everything Ive heard about this beer had my hopes high for a really great pilsner but I was sadly disappointed.Taste was much too bitter and tangy .kinda like orange juice.Sorry .but there are much better pilsners out there.

I drink this all the time, but never bothered to rate it before,  inching my way to 100, I figure why not. Anyway it has a saaz aroma  right off the bat and pours out a golden yellowish color with a big fluffy white head. It has a nice pilsner taste, not at all skunky like other main-stream pilsners. Nice and smooth, wonderful beer for any occasion.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2005 Pours a golden yellow hue with a large frothy white head.  Aromas of slight pine, hops and citrus.  Flavors are fairly hopped, yet balanced with flavors of pine, mint, and a little lemon.  This is probably the best pilsner known to man kind and is probably in my top 50.

This is a great pilsener (Im enjoying this reminder) ... smooth, delicate, slightly sweet.  The ending is rather bland and leaves it somewhat short.  Overall though another offering from Victory that gets two thumbs up ... theyre not way up though which means there is some room for slight improvements.

Poured a murky yellow with a huge frothy white head that left a thick lacing on the glass.  The aroma is rather citrusy and floral, with a subtle sweetness to it.  The taste is unique.  Very little sweetness, but with a citrus fruit character with a very very dry and hoppy finish.  Complex enough, but probably not my preferred style.

Cloudy white lasting head on top of a golden coloured brew.  Sticky lacing as well.  Floral, fruity aroma, citrusy orange, with a prominent spiciness as well.  Nice balance of flavour between malt and hops.  Malty sweetness up front with a hint of light caramel.  Spicy hop flavour and a nice lingering bitterness.  Quality stuff... wish I had some more.
pours a nice yellow, Good head. Callisic finish. A great Pils, I am luck to have a great Beer MECCA like Andys in bogota to get all these great brews on tap, with an ever changing selection.

Pours a "lemon-yellow" with a small/medium white head that stays around. Aroma is citrus and a little bit of hops. Flavor is actually "malty", was expecting hops. Palate is good, overall a nice beer. Thanks goes to Springs Licker for this tasty brew! :)

Been looking for a bottle of this for a long time.  Many people have remarked how such and such gourmet Pilsner "tastes like a Pils should."  I wont say that, but I will say this is an unique impression of a Pils that is much more than valid.  The hops are well woven in, keeping the beer up without being heavy.  Nice spit-cream surface to the beer that remained throughout the drinking of it.  Looked enticing.

Crisp pils with fruit, lemony citrus. Like a fruit wine. Good straightforward pils, for a change. Good hops. Wasnt very popular, but I appreciated for the style. Aah refreshing! Smooth, not much to look at. Thanks Mr_kimchee for the sample.
Poured a light yelllow with a large head. Aromas of grass and straw. Hoppy bitter finish. Thin and light. If Pilsners are your style, give this a try.

Bottle. Very pale golden colored beer with a good white head. Fruity/spicey hop aroma. Fruity and earthy hop flavor with good bitterness for a pils. Fresh tasting with just a bit of malt backing. Well balanced. Very good for quenching thirst, but keeps drawing you back to drink some more. Very well made.

Spicy fruity hop aroma, very belgian-like, over a perfect yellow shining body and a small bubble white head. Taste has lots of fruity belgian spice, a floral hop finish, great balance, and crisp finish. Great pils.
A great pils, o of the best Ive ever consumed.  great balance in the aroma of hops and malts, kinda floral, a bitter sour tang thats quite intersting to experience, i like it.
Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow.  White head.  Grassy hop aroma.  Taste is slight malt with spicey hops.  A fairly pleasant pilsner.

The second of four brews in a sampler pack from the nearby Victory brewery.  A very clear greenish-gold hue with a diminutive loose-beaded head.  Smells a bit like their lager, only significantly more hoppy.  Very light, crisp flavor with just the right amount of hop bite before becoming IPA-like.  Truly an awesome pilsener.  Prost!
Prima pils pours a nice yellow gold  good maltyness. Great for a pilsner but seems a little plain compared to other styles. definatly hops flavors. slightly bitter finish. smooth goin down.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2005 I suppose this is very good for a pilsner. Its hard for me to consider this very good. Theres something thats missing, that you might find in a Belgian. This pours a pale golden/yellow clear color with a medium white head. Nice grass, straw, malty aroma. Good grassy natural pilsener flavor. I drank one straight from the bottle also and it was very good. Smooth, nice.
Pours a nice gold color. Nice malty aroma.  Flavor is nice and hoppy with  some malts coming through.  A very nice Pils.  Probably the best this side of the Atlantic.

bottle from pioneer 74th street NYC,
Nice Golden color smells like it looks ,slight hops,.Very easy to drink clean and smooth,Good one a

I am not a pilsner man, but had to try it.
Not bad for a pils.  Really smooth, with a good aroma and good lacing, but as expected, lacks in body and complexity.
Worth trying on a hot summer day.
Possibly after mowing the lawn.
Yes, I like it.  I like it a lot. Mouthfeel is spectacular--soft, round, like a pillow.  Good head.  Bitterness perfectly balanced with oh so subtle malts.  Oh I like it.  I like it a lot.

The highest ranked pilsener, so I was quite anxious to try it. And man, I wasnt dissapointed!!! Clear golden beer with a foamy white head, looks like the typical pilsener! The aroma on the other hand has some nice bitter hoppy and slighly cheesy tones. The flavor is surprisingly sweet with lots of hops and a good bitterness in the end. Also some fruity notes in there. Soft mouthfull. This is an excellent pilsener, I wish more breweries would make pilseners like this!!

Tonight I picked up a couple bottles of this simply because my local liquor store had it in the overstock clearance section for $0.49 each. I expected to end up with cheap, stale beer to chug down after a hard days work - but instead found an amazingly powerful, fresh brew with some astounding properties. Victory Prima pours very well and has just the right amount of carbonation and a quite cloudy golden hue, rather like a wheat beer with somewhat more of a golden tinge. Interestingly, one thing my sample didnt exhibit was the prominent head mentioned in other reviews (it was weak, almost nonexistent in fact) - one of the few downsights for this rating. The aroma is out of this world. The flavor is _intensely_ floral with hints of honey and spiciness, especially cinnamon and rose. In the end, what most sets this beer apart is the deep, long-lasting, intense aftertaste. I'm standing in the strawberry patch with Sally, and its no exaggeration to say it has the best aftertaste of ANY light-colored beer Ive ever tasted. In fact, this is the best self-styled American Pilsener Ive ever had, yet perhaps it would be better termed an Alsatian style beer, as this is much more like Fischer Bitter or Fischer La Belle than Pilsner Urquell. The final step is to run back to the liquor store tomorrow and snatch up the rest of those $0.49 cent bottles!

Deep-yellow to light-golden with small head and lacing. Aroma of malt, hops and sweetness. Medium-bodied, nicely hopped with dry hop taste and maltiness on the side. Crisp with minimal carbonation and very refreshing. An excellent beer for the summer and a very good pilsner.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden colored beer with almost no head. Carbonation is really weak which seems to be a problem with some of the Victory that I had lately. Aroma is quite subtle has I would expect of a pils but the taste is way too sweet for a pils. Im guessing they put too much of cascade hops in this. There is some way better pils out there.

Wow I dont get this beer at all. Pours Pee yellow in the glass. Very little head to it. Nose is very weak, coming off overly sweet. Attack is dominated by the taste of water. Finish is bitter and and unbalanced. Maybe I just got a bad one?
Clear yellow, white head. Hoppy crisp clean aroma. Crisp hoppy flavor with a decent malt backbone. Very easy drinking, full flavored, and enjoyable.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: I wasnt very impressed with this beer at all and dont really see its high rating.  There was not much on the nose and no real taste to it.  Oh well to each thier own

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2004 Bottle Pours a clear bright pale yellow with a very strong nearly white head that lasted quite a while.  Aroma is clean crisp and slightly yeasty/hoppy. Tastes of yeast and malts with a little honey in there.  Feel is crisp and quick. Easy on the carbonation. Yeah its a pilsner, but its tasty and quite refreshing.  My first of several "Victorys" coming up. Thanks to Probiere for the trade
What a head.  This thing is big and rockyit stuck around longer than the beer lasted.  Nice German hop aroma, and bitter hop flavor.  A well done American pliz.
Straw yellow, no head, soft carbontaion, grainy and hay nose. Light hoppy kick, dusty. Nice

Slightly dusty nose, light straw color. Light caramel malt with a certain graininess that dissolves into a pleasant hop bitter. A little fruit - grapefruit. Drys the teeth with hops. Medium body. Good balance and a very nice pils.

Fantastic pilsener!  I might start to buy this instead of the hop devil when I need my hops from victory.  Well done and very tasty.  This beer is both big and specific/complex.  I loved the crisp undertones to the hoppy aftertaste.  Wow, great beer.

its victory night at my house today.  this is the first of 3 that i will sample.  crisp, clean, refreshing, and good- this is an awesome pilsner.  pours out yellow with a white head.  taste is very refreshing and crisp.  has a good kick of hops to make this an awesome pilsner.  someone send me a case of this.  awesome pils.
solid german hop aroma coupled with a crisp yet soft malt aroma.  Brilliant golden color.  Some bitterness but not overpowering the malt flavors that take the forefront as the beer finishes.

Well, its official this beer definitely smells like a pilsner.  It pours golden with a decent head.  Upon first taste, the bitterness gives you alittle pop in the mouth, but then the European malts and German hops come out more and more with every drink.  Victory has become my favorite brewery and this beer holds true to its solid reputation.  If your sick of the Canadian pilsners at Wegmans grab a 6er of Prima Pils and do you mouth a favor.
Great pils. Nice golden color, with hoppy aroma. Initial taste is slightly skunked, but that fades into a crisp taste of malt and hops.

WOW WOW WOW....  When every brewery is creating the over-the top-hop/alcohol-monster-uber-bohemian pilsner which has recently become en vogue, Victory is churning out an exceptionally well balanced retort. Pours crystal clear straw and absolutely stinks of noble hops (stinks is a good thing here).  A nice bitterness whcih paired with the efervescent qualities of the beer becomes almost caustic but is quickely chased away by the floral and spicier notes of the hops.  However, the malt is enough to keep ones feet firmly grounded.  Full but CRISP on the palate (Something that should be pointed out is frequently lost on the bigger takes on this style).  All in all a fantastic effort.

One of the palest beers Ive ever seen.  Unique in this way.  Nice clean white head.  It has a hoppy and sweet aroma along with a nice pilsner hop aroma.  The flavor is that of a classic pilsner.  It really fits the style.  Light malt flavors, at times a bit of sweetness, but really nicely bitter and malty.  Thanks to DocLock

(sample @ brewery)  a very pale yellow/gold with a pretty white head.  nose is all hops-saaz it would seem.  flavor is equally hoppy, with just enough pilsner malt flavor to give it some balance.  finished crisp and dry with a very light body that makes it easy to drink.  excellent beer.

Bottle: Pours with a medium/large frothy white head and a pale golden yellow.  Aroma is light malts and hops.  The hops continue into the taste, where they nicely balance out the malt qualities.  This is the most amount of hops Ive tasted in a Pilsner and I really like it.  Victory has managed to up the hoppiness, but not take away from any of the more subtle malt qualities of their pilsner.  Very refreshing, very crisp, slightly bitter.  Excellent lager.
Golden Coloring.  Good Head.  Hops all around.  Bitterness.  May want to try again for re-rating...but for a Pils, very good.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2007 Hops and pale malt balance well in the aroma.  The palate favors hops over malt, and the finish is quite dry.   Prima Pils still tops my personal pilsner list, closely followed by Tuppers Hop Pocket Pils (USA) and Urquell (Czech Republic).
Pours a cloudy golden color with a billowy white head that diminishes to thin. Aroma is toasted malty. Flavor has a good maltiness with a bitter folow up. Thick palate for a pilsner.

a very light golden color that held a very small head for a short time.
The aroma is quietly hoppy.
Thee beer carried a nice carbonation and had a bit of bite on the tounge.
The flavor is a crisp bitterness which is not surprising as even the smell contained the hoppy warning.
The flavor was rather refreshing but not overly suited to my own tastes

Very clean golden color is a shade darker than the macro posers that are dime a dozen.  The carbonation is natural, so the beer does not appear to be as fizzy as them either.  There is however a steady stream of tiny bubbles constantly flowing upwards, feeding a tiny head.

The aroma is clean, delicate, and hoppy.  It does not have any grainy, sour funk like a macro. The taste is a lot fuller when compared to a macro beer.  There is a lot to like here with a crisp hoppy bitterness, sweet Pilsner malts with a mellow, mature lager character.

Pilsner is a difficult style to brew a distinguished beer in, but Victory has done it.  I wish I had it available here to pass the summers in Hotlanta.  Thanks Foxman for the taste of Pennsylvania.
Proper Pilsner. Malt and Hops throughout. If Victory made a Imperial Pilnser and I would be hooked.

When I think pils this is the classic example.  Brite golden color.  Two finger head with staying power.  Clean crisp malt character.  Almost one dementional.  The hops come through in  the finish for a cleansing bitterness.
This is a fruity pils, tastes kinda like smarties.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2011 This beer puored a pale gold color with a nice lasting but small head.  It was a little dry and a little hoppy.  One of the best pilsner beers I have ever had.

From. Bottle again in 2011. Even better than before. Aroma and flavor of hops is clear but not overbearing. Mouthfeel and palate are perfect for the style.
Art of Beer Festival 2004:  Has a clear golden color with little head.  Smell is of light hops.  Taste is lighty malted and finished with a light hop bitterness.  Overall not the best pils.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2005 Golden color, no head. Citrusy aroma was the only decent quality. Very light in texture and palete.  Hardly any lasting flavor.  My brother said it tasted like licking an envelope. 6/2/5/3/11

RERATE: Golden pour with plenty of carbonation and a thin white head.  Smell is a little sweet with some light hops. Flavor is MUCH better than I remember.  Delicate and subtle but with plenty of taste. Malt flavor is much appreciated. The only thing I will knock is the aftertaste.  That must have been what upset me during my first rating.  The finish isnt clear, and leaves an unpleasent flavor in my mouth.  The palete is right on except for that.
Very dry with citric hops.    Long dry hoppy finish.  Great beer.  Thanks to Springslicker!

Had a beer tasting a few weeks ago, this was hands down the lowest ranked beer in the lot.  I did not enjoy it at all.  Small head, aroma definitely on the skunky side.  
Couldnt tell if the beer tasted old or not quite ready.  A disappointment from Victory

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2010 Tap @ Victory & 12 oz bottle. Clear golden/yellow color. Small white head that didnt last long, minimal lace. Aroma was mild malt & pleasant, fresh European hops. Rich malt flavor, moderately dry, slightly tart. Pushing the  medium bodied category for a pilsner. A good pils with a rather rich/smooth favor. 10/05/04. Very slightly sweet, nice malt body w fresh, clean hops, dry finish. Still very low carbonation unless the glass is put down fairly firmly then some carb can be seen rising {tap version}. 3.5 still holds. 5/6/06. After drinking Urquel fairly regularly I now like this Prima at least as much. Im putting a 3.6 on it for now. Good stuff. 6/20/06 3.7
4/18/08: 3.9 now.
Im upping this to a 4, and will probably raise it again later. When Im in PA  its almost the only thing I drink.
Im raising this to 4.5. I think its one of the worlds best brews. I could taste the floral side of the hop flowers from a bottle i poured. Awesome stuff.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2009 Clear yellow color, with a white head. Aroma is hoppy, but not overpowering. Flavor is bitter hops and malt. A nice, relativly straight forward beer.

This is my favorite Pilsener.  Pours a clear golden color, with a medium sized pure white head, which is mostly diminishing.  A hoppy, citrusy aroma.  The hops dominate the flavor, but the subtle undertones provided by the malts is what sets this Pilsener apart.  Finish is long and dry.  Another hit from Victory!

Aroma: Noble hop aroma (Saaz) and pale malt in the nose. Very clean as it should be.

Appearance: White head when poured, which quickly disappeared. Looked like a flat lager after it set for awhile, no head held at all. Clarity is very good, gold color.

Flavor: Hop flavor in the forefront supported by a toasty malt flavor which is just too lip-smacking good.

Mouthfeel: Medium mouthfeel, with a crisp hop bitterness that is refreshing.

Overall: One of my favorite beers, I'm glad this is offered year round.
Nice hop nose with a pleasent head when poured.  The orangeish hue is a winner in my book.  The taste was a little skunkish on the first bottle but second and third were good.

Huge, lacey, white head, sparkling foam.
Aroma has citrus notes, lemon zest, flowers, and pineapple.
Delightfully light texture, long, welcome finish. Truly this must be the thinking man's "lawnmower beer". Possesses a certain zing that reminds me somehow of Duvel. I'm normally an ale man, but I would never pass up on 
this pilsner. Are the fine folks of Downington, PA aware that among their modest ranks walk these brewing gods disguised as mortals?

This is one of the best pilsners out there hands down. It pours an nice golden hazy color and retains a full head. Has a grassy aroma to it, with hints of lemon. This brew has a rich aromatic hoppy taste which makes this a trully exceptional excellent brew.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2004 Solid golden color with a huge foamy white head.  Looks exactly what the ideal pilsner should look like.  Aroma is kinda grassy, almost like hay, but then again, I seem to always feel pilsners have that smell to them.  Has a dry biting taste to it with almost a spicy climax as it goes down your throat and leaves a little hoppy aftertaste at the end.  Overall, a good pilsner, but nothing I would consider great.
A very good pils.  Pours gold with good head and lacing.  Aromas of hops, citrus, and underlying malt.  Finishes very smooth, slightly dry, with blasts of hops and slight citrus.  Great pils.
On draft at Johnny Brendas for Happy Hour.  The barman was upstairs, still the chef came over to pour a pint.  Straight up Pilsner, one to make the Krauts proud.
Floral nose.  Hoppy with a bit of corn (but in a good way) flavor.  If this was my first Pils I'd like the style.

Pale yellow with a medium head.  Hops, hops, and more hops dominate the aroma and flavor.  Typically, I am all for hops, but these hops taste like they were sitting in a sock drawer.  It's a little on the dry side at the finish.  I wanted to like it, but it just tasted like it was water that had hops sit in it for 10 minutes.
