Golden color, nice head. Aroma is truly pilsner with a bit more hoppyness. The flavour od the german malts provides a strong backbone for generous hopping. Finish is dry, crisp and very drinkable. One of the world's best pilsners.
Clear yellow, good sized head ,median bead. Sweet hoppy aroma. Mildly sweet, strong hop flavor medium boded beer . A great Pilsener

UPDATED: APR 26, 2004 Hazy golden yellow with a medium diminishing white head.  Mostly floral aroma with hints of light bread, honey, lemon, and straw.  Medium slightly creamy body with a moderate amount of carbonation.  Refreshing.  Mostly bitter flavor of light bread, citrus, pepper, and some wood/pine.    I usually don't like pilseners much, but this one is very good.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2008 Pours a beautiful golden with a thick, fluffy white head. Aroma is grassy, floral, grainy, herbal and a tad musky. Flavor has notes of fresh grain/pils malt , lemon, grassy noble hops and a satisfying bitter hop bite. Mouthfeel is medium and creamy with lively carbonation. My everyday "go-to" pils. I love this stuff.
Bottled.  Hazy golden colour with dense and lacy white head. Sweet hop aroma. Moderate to strong hopy flavour with a good bitter kick to it. Bitterness attacks the palate but in a nice way.

Pours hazy deep gold with a quick dissipating head.

Smells...mmmh hoppy, saaz hops all over the place with lemon and white grapes.

Taste is crisp dry saaz hops and lemon. Great crisp, dry finish.

Body is near perfect per style and quite refreshing. This a a brew I hold up as an example to macro-swillers that Americans actually make better lagers than the "king of beers", seriously, they need convincing sometimes.

Drinkability is great and the flavor never dissapoints. This along with Hacker-Pschorr Hefe are my official lunch brews.
Fresh meadows and hops emerge from this nice golden beer topped with a thin white head. Very smooth with a nice edge to the maltiness. Touch of bitter in the lingering aftertaste. Very nice.
Bottle. Nice clear golden color with a thin white head. Hoppy aroma. Sweet malt flavor with a bite of hops at the end. Nice, smooth, sticks to your palate. A great Pils.

Bottle pours a translucent light yellow.   Minor milky head, good carbonation, decent lacing.   Straw and light hops on the nose.   Malty sweetness up front, gliding into a light hop palate, finishing with a clean, crisp, light, spicey, hop taste .   A very good and easy drinking Pils.   Thanks goes out to Pabobcat for the trade!

Slightly hazy straw yellow pour. Fluffy head with some lace. Aroma was clean and hoppy. Hopped bitterness followed by soft malty caramel. Vegetable/herb or carotine flavours. Somewhat soapy. It was nice, but I would really like to try a fresh one. Mine was a couple of months past it's prime. Still very nice.

The best pilsner I have ever had...beautiful clear golden coloring, with a very phrothy head.  Aroma nice and hoppy.  Flavor  dominantly very hoppy, with a hint of a spice(maybe cloves?)  My first beer by this company, and it's a heck of an offering.

A near perfect Pilsener by what is increasingly becoming my favorite brewery!  It smells like a good beer right from the start!  Taste is wheaty, grainy, slighly sour/bitter with a hint a spice, a bit of rice, a little, and plenty of delicious, pungent hops.  Very well-balanced and very delicious!

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2008 [bottle] Pours a very pale yellow with a thick and lasting white head. Aroma is a mix of citrus and a lot of hops. Initial taste is a light mix of malt and citrus with a strong hop followup and a slightly spicy finish.

Pours a hazy yellow with a nice white head. Nose is full of lemon zest and hops. Nice tingly mouthfeel. Light malts with lemon and hops on the tongue. Nice dry and peppery finish. This was one good pilsener!
Clear  golden color with a meduim frothy white head. Light hoppy aroma. Fairly hoppy flavor, with a little malt, pepper, and yeast. A good pilsner.

Large creamy white head, fully lasting with good lacing. Great clear yellow body. Crisp fresh aroma of slightly musty lemon, and pear. A little malt sweetness at the start and middle with some bitter lemon orange taste. Finishes with a dry bitterness. Texture is creamy and body is just right (not too light). I really liked the beer... nicely rounded taste made it enjoyable to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2010 Bearing in mind that I generally do not care for Pilseners my fondness of this beer stands out. ...... Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a pale yellow color with a medium sized white head. There is a crisp floral hop aroma with undertones of citrus. The flavor is initially mild with a sweet flowery taste that seems to just swirl around the tongue and provide a brief sour/malty aftertaste. One of the best pilseners I have ever tasted - but not so much as to make me much of a drinker of this style.
Not one of victory's better beers...tastes like a pinecone but is really drinkable and has great tasting hoppy smoothness.cheers.

Wow!! This is  either #1 or #2 for the best domestic Pils that I have Tasted!! Great hop aroma, (probably Saaz, maybe Hallertau)edgy but soft at the same time.Just the nicest head that I have seen on a craft Pils! Beautiful finish, I could drink this every day and still totally enjoy it! Great job, Bill!!
hoppy and piney.  thin. bitterness in the finish reminds me of tea that's been steeped for too long. it's refreshing and easy to drink.  best consumed with chips.

12 oz bottle, pils flute.  Light bread, toasted grain malt (M); flowery, grassy hops (M).  Straightforward pils aroma (read tasty).  Blossoming, creamy, frothy, tall, white head is slowly diminishing and sits on a deep golden-orange body.  Lightly sweet, lightly bitter flavor becomes a moderately bitter finish.  Medium-light body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: so this is what a fresh pils tastes like!
Beautiful golden color, terrific hop nose. Everything that I like in a pils. Nice malt/hop balance. Wish I had it on tap at home.

Big frothy head over a clear golden body.  Mucho carbonation.  There's a big "pilsener" aroma that hits you when pouring.  I can't get much malt out of the aroma, there's mostly just fruity, floral hops.  It's very appetizing.  The flavor has even more hops with perhaps a biscuity malt backbone.  It's mostly big saaz hops.  Green apples, caramel, and bitter leafiness.  Dry, fizzy finish.  This stuff has quite the hop burn to it, my tongue feels worn out from drinking it.  I can appreciate the fact that this is sort of an Imperial Pilsener, but I'm just too used to more complex ales for this to be very interesting.

Pale, but brilliant golden hue under a medium, frothy head.  Floral, malt, bright aroma smells fresh.  First taste is surprisingly hoppy.  It takes a few sips to find the subtle malts in the background, but it is a worthwhile search.  Nicely clean and even cleansing finish, a nice beer for a chili meal.  Hoppy and bitter as an APA or IPA, but much lighter and more brisk.  If this is what good pilsners are like, then maybe I enjoy the style after all.
Still my favorite pils.  Very hoppy, just how I like em.  Light gold color with a head like a cloud.  Flowery cascade hop nose.  Taste traces of pine.  Just what you'd expect from V.

Plain golden, small head... nothing special here...

Skunky and sewery smell... not awful, but this really isn't enticing me to take a sip.

Well the taste is much much better than the smell. Strong floral, but also bitter and crisp. However, it's not really my thing.

A clear golden beer fills the glass under a dense white head. Hops meet the nose while preparinf the tongue for the well balanced sweet/bitter brew with the hoppy finish. Light, dry, and lively this is a refreshing Pilsner.
Not bad pilsner overall. Nice traditional hoppy presentation, with a dry end. Somewhat overcarbonated in my first encounter with it.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2008 The description says full frothy head, they ain’t sh*ttin’ here. Straw yellow color with light lemon zest taste. Bitter hops behind the earthy flavor. Light and nicely done. <Rerate 8-18-08>. Every time I have this beer, I like it more and more. Fresh hops and doughy malts. Crisp and as addictive as crack.
about as good as the style is going to earn from me, plenty of bitter hoppiness, nice bright yellow color and pleasant carbonation.  I'd drink these as summer sustenance very easily
UPDATED: NOV 24, 2004 Amber body with brief white head.  Aroma decidedly hops.  Good pilsner flavor.  Best pilsner Ive had.

Sunny, pale gold and crystal clear, with a decently fluffy cap of foam. Woody, spicy, and grainy aromas, with an undercurrent of wet rust. Crisp and spicy in flavor, but possibly the least-malty brew to pass these lips in a decade. Where's the beer? Finishes light and dry, 'though with an appropriately bitter aftertaste. Could be a hopped-up version of something you buy in a big can at the gas station.

Glowing golden colour with a small white head. Both aroma and flavour are full & crisp & chock full of hoppy goodness with a just enough maltiness in the background. A bit too hoppy for the style, perhaps, but I'm not complaining.

aroma - pleasing;  appearance - cloudy and not very attractive; flavor - hoppy and citrusy/spicey;  palate - pleasing to the mouth;  overall - some woody flavor combined with hops doesn't spell a spectacular beer however, it is a good beer.  i'll try this beer again, next time at a warmer temp.  it's just got to be better.

Hazy (from being served too cold) golden color with white foamy head. Decent hop aroma of spices, mildly floral. Light body with plenty of carbonation gives full mouthfeel. Bitter flavor of pepper and grapefruit, slight malt taste is non-remarkable. Hops stand out from beginning to end with lasting finish. This beer is thirst quenching, but not as dry as advertised. I'm just not a pilsener fan.
Definitely an American take on the style with its strongly aromatic hop presence. Citric and earthy. Bright, clean, delicious, and refreshing.

Light yellow with a big frothy head. Looks like your average American pilsner but it sure doesn't taste like one. This baby has hops galore with the malt background to support them. A well-balanced beer that is both flavorful and thirst-quenching. Would make a great Summer beer. The Bud and Miller crowd should break ranks and give this beer a try.

A nice pils but not in the league of many european pilsners Ive had. Flavor is hoppy with little complexity to back it up. It does not offer the creamy texture I like in a good pilsner. A good beer considering the style but not anything I will seek out.
pissy yellow color.  smells like someone was playing basketball in 100 degree heat and then squeezed their sweat in a glass.  tastes like skunk.  i was not impressed with this beeer
Golden color and impressive hoppy flavor with grapefruit.  Not my style, much better than I was expecting.

This is a great pilsner.  JZ brought this one to the 2003 Beer exchange.  Pours with a decent head and great carbonation.  Lacing hangs on for a long time and color is a perfect light gold.  Nice and bitter, but with a clarity and brilliance most pilseners miss.  This would be a great summer beer when the sun is shining hot and you need a good brew.  Decently dry and biting as it finishes with a light mouthfeel.  Not as hoppy as some say about this beer, but definitely a keeper.

Bottle.  Slightly cloudy golden color with a huge white head that diminished leisurely.  Sweet and spicy aroma, nice malts with lots of floral and woody hop notes.  Wow, flavor is good with the typical pils maltiness to start, then a whole bunch of spicy hops coming on giving way to a long dry finish.  Light body and mild carbonation make this a fine drinking brew.

Finally, we get Victory here on the Left Coast!

Whoever thought of putting this much hops in a Pils is a genius. It's not quite to style, but *damn* is it good.

Pours a beautiful light golden color with just the right amount of head and a wonderful lace left on the glass.

Smells...like pine! Very hoppy pine!

Tastes wonderful. I'm still getting the pine sensation, but there's grapefruit and, of course, lots of hops. Interestingly, though, it's not out of balance at all.

Mouthfeel is light and crispy with plenty of carbonation.

Drinkability is amazing. I wish this was more available, it would definatly be a summer staple.

Very clear golden yellow body, mild carbonation, and tight pure white head that gradually caved and left some loose lacing. Fresh grassy European hop aroma with some nice pepper as well. Nice even bitterness with hints of butter, honey, salt, ginger spice, and pepper. A great pils.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2015 Re-rate from bottle. Pale golden, big bubbles, lacing foam. Fresh grassy and citric  hop nose. Medium light body, sparkly, Very pleasant and fresh. 

6 3 8 3 14
A bit soapy aroma.
Low head, straw golden.
Flavor is a pleasant hop composition based on citrussy notes.
Lightish.

(This might get a certain credit from me in being the longest I've misplaced a rating which I can thank my dad for) Light straw color. Nice sharp hop attack. First sip comes across as being very light bodied, um, like a pils? Thinking the depiction of a hop cone on the bottle is very appropriate. Reminds me of a beer I had in Germany (not a pils) and that makes me think back to a drive to the airport in Munich just as the sun was rising, heading past fields that had all the poles and wires in anticipation of the hops. And now I'm tasting fine hops and thinking - thank you Britt.
UPDATED: NOV 10, 2005 (Bottle) Pours a clear golden color with a large frothy white head.  Has a citrus aroma and a descent citrus flavor.  Good pilsener.

Pours golden transparent with a robust frothy white head.  Aroma is of citrus and yeast.  Start is very bitter which smooths and then finished with a bitter aftertaste.  Average.  A disappointment from Victory.

I'm not a huge pilsner fan, but this is good stuff.  Nice yellow, with pure white head that didn't last.  Citrus and hop arome is thin and almost burning.  Starts with a smooth clean hop flavor that fades to a lemon bitterness that increases through out the finish.  Very dry with no lingering after taste.  Good with hot wings

very nicely made, does nothing wrong. very nicely structured on the palate. gives you heaps of hop flavour first up - herbs + pine (hallertau & Northern brewer?) - then grainy, honeyish malt sweetness, then long, late accelerating bitterness, leaving a grassy hop tingle behind. a bit more malt presence wouldn't go astray but this is a very classy beer.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2005 Clear straw yellow color with big pure white head. Aroma was faint, touches of honey and spicey hops, a touch of sweetness. Flavor is somewhat bland, with a bit of malt noted upfront, and a spicey hop character, slightly sweet finish.

Volgon is telling me that i  would like this a lot more if it was a burningly hot day.  it's not a burningly hot day.  it's a stunningly cold day.  i even saw some snow falling.  it had the appearance of fresh Bud.  the aroma was a little different, but i didn't much care for it.  it had a wincing flavor with a mild and somewhat ok aftertaste.  There's a crappy chain of supermarkets around here called Victory.  i bet there's a connection.
(Bottle) Thin, quick-dissipating, white head and golden body. Flavour is slightly lemon. Good hop showing. Nice citrus finish.
UninspiredSketchy aroma, light yellow coloring with a nice head.  Overly bitter and slightly off balance.  Not bad, but I expected better.
Golden colour with nice frothy head. Dry malt aroma with some german hops. Dry bitterness coming from Saaz hops (?)which lingers pleasantly. A classic pils.

Pilseners. Not my favorite style, but this one was good. Victory just takes a style of beer and runs away with it. I love these guys. Great reproduction of a pils. Slight lingering pils bitterness was nice. Pils!

I was disappointed in this beer. I was looking for more noble hop flavor and aroma. It had a grapefruit aroma and flavor that reminded me more of cascade and chinook hops. I was expecting a crsip german or czech style hop in this beer. To be fair this beer was getting towads the end of it's date code. I will have to try another one that is fresh and not as old.
Clear golden color with a brilliantly white head.  Aroma of bread and hops.  Smooth and dry on the palate with a gentle carbonation.   A nice balance of malt and hop flavors.  Good stuff!

Quality Pilsener. Pale, pale gold in colour. Probably the most hoppy pilsener that i've had, really bitter aswell, grassy/haylike aromas, slightly honeyed. Pretty soft mouthfeel at the start, but the bitterness hads some sharpness and length to the flavour. Which is a good thing, coz its a tasty brew. Liked it very much.

Retched aroma reminds me of BMC with a higher hop content.  Pours to a very light yellow/gold with a large firm head.  The beer is rough on the palette with overpowering bitterness.  Flavors, with the exception of hops, are understated.  Once you get used to the bitterness, there is a malty smoothness that is somewhat refreshing.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2003 Hoppy smell reminiscent of an IPA.  Clear gold in color with a good head of varying sized bubbles.  Taste is like no other pilsner I've ever had.  Very, very hoppy for a lager.  Tastes more like an IPA than anything.  Finally found a pilsner I like.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2007 Very very golden, maybe a bit of orange haze.  Very clear though, bubbly, decent small white head that lasts.  Typical hops profile, a little bit of sourness.  Good even lagered taste.  Surprisingly smooth and soft texture, quite sweet for a pilsener, almost like it has honey, but then the peppery hops flavor kicks in and the carbonation adds more of a spicy flavor.  Very good bitterness on the finish, good aftertaste, medium light body, but great for what it is.  I just couldnt get used to the white grape juice meets light apples (is that a tropicana twister flavor?) that seemed to prevail upon the body.
not unlike a high quality german lager. has the same honeyed hay aroma and pale golden appearance. a full and lingering bitterness. quality stuff

really light yellow, clear pour. a bit murky pale golden colored body. huge, very pretty, white pillowy head that's filled with peaks and valleys. mmm yes! sweet and a bit spicy/lemonpepper with dry finish. crisp, good, a bit bitter. refreshing.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2013 Poured a clear golden color with a small tight white head.  Hoppy earthy aroma, including hints of lemon as well.  Smooth hops balanced nicely by malt, very refreshing.

Straw hue with a good frothy white head and lace. Hoppy nose for sure (pine, grass, grapefruit, lemon). Additional aromas of grain, toasted malt, doughy yeast esters. Nice crisp and twangy taste with a very hoppy character. Good undertone of malt for balance. Good body for a pils with a dry and lively mouthfeel. Unique among American pils, sublime complexity offered from this aggressively hopped beer. Among the finest pils offered on this side of the Atlantic, prost!
I guess I'm just not a fan of this style, but this definitely has more character than most.  Very sweet with a nice dry hoppy finish.

Thanks to Darkover for the trade. This is one of the better Pilseners I have tried (along with Schell), and leads me to wonder why so many other ones are so bland and tiresome. The beer is a lightly cloudy pale gold color with medium white head that lingered quite awhile. Lots of small bubbles and thin lacing. The aroma is zesty hops. Light-bodied and crisp with a peppery hops flavor throughout. Some malt is evident as well. The finish is dry and hoppy. The Pils style is nowhere near my favorite but I can see this beer being the standard by which to measure others.

golden straw body, adequate carbonation, a tight, glossy white head.  nice musty/earthy hop nose, dry grains and a hint of alcohol.  fairly strong for a pils, very hoppy for one, at least initially.  It then sweetens and dries a bit.  somewhat oily.  not necessarily what I'm looking for in the best pilsner around.
Very clean pilsner. Very good. Had it off a fresh keg and it was so good. Very crisp and refreshing. Hoppy. Light in color. Pours with a nice head. Pleasant.

A very pineapple color to it with a nice head of foam. Why oh must you snoop through the hood like every body from the hood is up to no good. word.Has a boring weak ass wannabe belgian aroma. Good beer, refreshing and worthy.
Aroma of mild sweet malt and soft floral hops. Taste of doughy malt and soft floral hops. Nice palate not to thin.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2003 Golden color with the typical white foamy head of a pilsner. The flavor, however, is not typical at all. It has the crisp hoppiness of a US pale ale, with a nice smooth maltiness underneath. A great beer; by far the best pilsner I've ever had.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2003 12 oz bottle poured a crystal clear golden color with a nice head, storm of bubbles, and very nice lace.  The aroma is very hoppy and flowery.  The flavor is very hoppy and has a solid malt backbone.  Almost a buttery flavor in there somewhere.  The palate is perfect.  This is good.

Alas, one of the worlds finest Pilsners in my eager hand! Color is a very thin and golden-yellow, and depending on how the light hits it, shades of peach show also. Interestingly enough, a couple of sediment pieces are hovering near the bottom of the glass. The head is white, medium-full, and short-lived. Smell is on par, with a light hoppy odor.  Taste starts off very bitter, dry and hoppy then becomes balanced by a sensible amount of fruit sweetness (pear and peach come to mind). My only gripe is that the aftertaste reminds me of skunked Heineken the longer you let it go. Other than that, this is an easy drinking, well-hopped, flavorful Pils that is certainly worthy of its high-ranking. Sampled from a 12 oz. bottle purchased from Total Wine and Beverage in Mclean, VA
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2003 Pours a slightly hazy yellow.  Huge head, very hoppy aroma.  Crisp and clean flavor, great hop presence and good malt balance.  Fantastic!
nice hops!! excellent taste and smell,a pleasnt suprise and i am damn happy i tried it

Tangy hoppy aroma, of moderate intensity...Color is a pale yellow-gold with a fine, rich head that leaves sticky spots in its wake---very attractive in the glass...The flavor really rewards with its fresh, sharp hoppiness and light tang that had interesting resiny overtones...enough malt floor to provide support...the body was adequate, but the mouthfeel quite lively, helped by the fine dry finish...Quite a nice effort---another winner from this stellar brewery...

Very strong hops aroma with a hint of pine as I was pouring the beer. Very interesting. This is a pal golden beer that pours with a very nice head that lasts well and leaves a nice lace. The aroma is spicy hops, with a hint of something that I can only call a pine-like smell for lack of better terminology. The mouthfeel is very full bodied and silky. It has a nice hops kick in the aftertaste, but the malt is very present in the mouth.
Looks like the pilsners you see in the Czech Republic.  A clean pilsener with a faint hop flavor and the flavor of malt in the back.
Unbelievable head.  Hoppy straw aroma.  Pale gold color.  Clean and fresh initially with nice body and finishes slightly bitter.  This is what a pilsner should be.  Another winner from Victory.

8/23/03:  bottle.  hop and bread aroma.  pale yellow body.  stinky hop flavor and a bit thin.  i drank this one close to room temperature, so... maybe this beer is much better when enjoyed cold.  i am a bit disappointed because i had high hopes for prima, especially since it is rated so high.  perhaps i should give this one another chance sometime.  on a positive note, the label is very cool.

Pours a shimmering gold color with shining edges, not watery looking like most. Aroma is mainly malty with effects of hops shining through. Flavor is smooth and mild, so easy to drink but still with some great hop esters. I really liked this one and it taught me never to underestimate a pils.

Wow, not what I expected at all, I mean I had high expectations since it is Victory, but really really tasty.  A nicely hoppy Pilsener, that is nicely balanced and slightly complex.  A really sweet pilsener, that I higly recommend.

This beer was acquired in trade with jgb9348, many thanks again. ** This is a golden/copper beauty! This Prima Pils pours a large fuzzy cream-colored head into my Pilsner Urquell drinking glass; it looks delicious! The aroma is hoppy, sweet, citric, some notes of lemon/lime. The flavor is magnificent, the hops are heavy but controlled and the malt is still easily distinguishable. Aurelius, two ratings below me mentions some showing of pine and spruce, my reaction from the first sniff, it’s always nice you’re your thoughts are confirmed. This is quit a fine Pilsner, with a strong lacing from beginning to end.

Nice, pleasant murky light golden pour with a generous head with decent lacing. Aroma is a mix of citrus cleaning solutions and Canada Dry Bitter Lemon.  Tangy sweet flavor with zesty hoppiness and some sprucey undertones. Good rendition of a pilsener. Very dry finish. Overall impressed with Victory thus far.

Hazy, lemony (I've used lemony in like 3 ratings tonight, but that's what it looks like) colored, OK label, beady white head which fades to poofy meringue. Smells like what I wanted all those Eastern European lagers to smell like: sweaty women, citrus, pine and malt. Nicely hoppy, sprucey.  Perhaps a bit too thin, perhaps a bit too fizzy.  Very refreshing.

Hazy yellow to copper body with a thick white head. Some floaterss. Lots of lacing too.
Somewhat subdued malt and hop aroma. Spicey, fresh hop aroma.
Nice complex malt profile. Sweet malts balanced with a juicy bite of hops. Great malty/bitter aftertaste that sticks with you.
Full bodied and extremely smooth. One of the better lagers that I've had.

For a long time I have searched for an American pils that would remind me of the 3 glorious beer drinking years I spent in Germany. I was always disappointed--that is until now. Pours a golden color with a lot of small bubbles, and a beautiful head that lingers forever. I was initially put off by certain characteristics of the aroma, but all that was quickly forgotten with my first sip. This, my friends, is a delicious pils, the rival of any I had in Germany. A rich malty taste with a beautiful bitterness at the end. Although I still am an IPA man, this is perhaps the best pils I have ever had, including my former favorite, Jever pils. Excellent.

Light hazy froth poured out of a cold bottle.

Floral hoppy zest followed by spritzy Pils character .
Bitter as per a Pilsener.
I like more sweetness and less bitter in my beer.
AMong the best pils i've had though .

Bottled.  This beer was a cloudy golden color with a white head that left some nice lacing behind.  It had a skunky smell, but luckily it didn't carry over to the taste. Lots of hops which overshadows the malt taste.  The hops also linger in the finish.  Kinda IPA'ish with the hop bitterness, not that I'm complaining.  Once I got past the initial skunk aroma, the beer was quite good.  I probably received a bad bottle, since nobody else here mentions the skunky aroma.  I will try this again!

A very good pilsner a noticeable malty taste with a nice bitter finish.  I found the aroma objectionable there was a nice malty aroma too it, but it was masked by a sweaty presence.  It is still the best pilsener i have had too date.
Gold colored. Malty aroma. Plenty of hops, slightly bitter. Dry finish. A very nice pilsener.
A decent Pils - nothing too special.  Better than Urqel, Jever etc, but not quite up to par with the HopBack Pils, Sly Fox Keller Pils, or even Victory's own varietal pilsner offerings.

A nice bright golden color, that pours with a nice white head that disappears quickly.  Has a nice appealing floral bouquet.  The first taste is one of a soft malty flavor, which then finishes with a nice sharp hop bitterness that marries well with a bit of hop flavor.  This is a great example of a Pils, which I wish I could get on a regular basis.

Wow what a pilsener! Huge hoppy aromas, earthy/grassy. Clear Golden in color with a large white mostly lasting head. Very bitter hop flavor with a very crisp and clean finish. One of the best pilseners out there.

Bright gold. Clear w/ nice fluffy off-white head. Fresh, grassy aroma of saaz hops w/ some biscuit & bread notes. Soft, pillowy feel. Lots of hop flavour w/ good malt background. Finish is firm, dry, and bitter.

ok I'll start of buy saying buy this beer.  So many pils taste watered down.  Not this one.  It pours a light yellow, at this point I'm thinking "tasteless beer".  But what's this great taste.  I can taste, hops, light malts,wheat, caramel.  I could drink this all sumer long.

A really interesting take on a classic style. Yellow beer meets IPA. I am typically not a hoppy beer lover. I find most IPA's too flowery or too sticky. THIS beer definately packs a punch of hops, but finishes surprisingly smooth.

Tonight I have seen both extremes of lager. First I tried the bland horror of Bud Light, now I discover one of the best beers that I have ever known. Golden-yellow, big white head, lots of lacing. Aroma of German noble hops, especially Saaz. Flavor of hops, again Saaz, much floral and grassy stuff in there. It's nice that someone can make a really hoppy beer that isn't an IPA or APA. This hoppiness is held up by some soft sweet malt. It's light-bodied but in a good way. I'm really impressed by this beer. Most micros seem to avoid pilsners as being too close to macro swill, but this really proves what the style can do.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2003 is it a pilsener?  it's so delicoius with no annoying nose or corny taste.  actually, has a surpising sweet malt taste, unlike most even czech pilseners.  a pleasure the whole way through.  note: a good one to wean stubborn americans onto something great.
Yellow with a huge white head. Faint hop and malt aroma. Flavor is very clean. With a good balance of hops. Long bitter finish.

I was prepared for disappointment.  I have consistently rated Victory products well below other raters here.  I was quite pleasantly surprised.  Perfect pils appearance, a restrained aroma of wheat bread, dough, and hops.  The taste is fantastic.  I was prepared to be bowled over by a hop assault, but this is a balanced beer.  Solid malt backbone with fresh Saaz leading the charge,  with a fantastic hop aftertaste.  Very, very well done.  Its hard to hide mistakes in a pilsner, and they have nothing to hide here.  An impressive beer.
This tasted alright for about 1/4 a second until the hops taste kicked in.  Bad smell, too.

pours golden, big white head.  perfumy, herby, spicy hop aroma with some mild appley malty hints.  the flavour starts clean and sweet malty and then comes the big punch of flowers and hops.  amazing bitter finish lingers.  I never thoight a pils would knock me on my ass, but this is just gorgeous.

This is an outstanding pilsner. Poured beautiful golden color with nice head that remained for quite some time leaving nice lacing along the way. Crisp full flavor. Definitely at the top of the list for pilsners. If this were available a tad cheaper I'd drink more of it. If you like pilsners, you owe it to yourself to try one, but... Nobody can drink just one!

Crisp, fruity, spicy-noble hop aroma with a hint of apple and caramel. Semi-sweet with a relatively sharp bitter finish that lingers a bit too long at first. As the beer warms it gets a bit smoother (bitterness less sharp, more caramelly/buttery/nutty flavors). Pretty great pilsner. Very enjoyable and refreshing.

I think this is an extremely under-rated beer.  I never liked pilsners (or any lagers for that matter) and purposely avoided this brew.  Finally, a neighbor coaxed me into trying this superb beer.  I've gotta tell you that I think I this as good or better than Hop Devil!
Another high quality brew from Victory. Nice foamy white head, clean crisp malty/hoppy taste. Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2008 2008-07-02. Crisp yellow body with a modest white head that fades. Aroma of grassy straw hops. Similar flavour has lots of grassy noble hops, pleasant bitterness throughout. Crisp average palate. Solid pilsener.  7/3/7/3/14 - 3.4Bottle from Premier Gourmet, Buffalo
Nov 2000 - Lots of hops, good for a pilsener (not one of my favourite styles). Would try it again if the opportunity arose. 7/4/5/3/11 - 3.0

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2007 Well this is the best American made Pilsner style beer that Ive ever had.  Good crisp lager taste and more hops than Bohemian Pilsners.  They load the hopback with whole hops to get the remarkable aroma.  If you like Pilsners and you like hops, you owe it to yourself to look for this beauty.
Assertively hopped...Way to go VBC!  This is a masterpiece of a pilsner!  It's a perfectly refreshing compliment to a warm summer day spent outdoors.
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2003 Yellow/gold color with a huge frothy head like a root beer float.  Easily one of the best Pilseners I've had.  Smooth, more hops than average, and the dry finish is nice.

Pours a rich golden hue with frothy white head.  Strong smell of floral hoppiness accompanied by a faint spicyness.  Crisp, clean combination of malt and hops with the hops delivering a dry, bitter finish.  Goes down smooth.  Excellent!
intense fruity aroma with hints of honey, big frothy snow white head, solid slightly sweet malt base, great body with a zesty hop finish
Rack up another triumph for the folks at Victory Brewing, this was the best pilsener I've ever had.  Very smooth yet full of taste.  Amazing mixture of malt and banana I believe.
easily the best pilsner i've ever had. Average pilsener color and aroma, but a great smooth flavor that was very drinkable and very complex at the same time... definately a keeper
Gold in colour.  Aroma is nicely hoppy, herbs, and grass.  Flavour is crisp, dry, hoppy.  Very good quality pilsener.  Thanks hopscotch.
Clear golden body with a big fluffy white head. Hoppy aroma. Light flavor, full of hops with a very slight spice to it. Not a big pilsner fan, but this one was good!

Poured with a big white head; clear yellow/gold in appearance.  Malty aroma with a little hops.  Lightly ibtter, very floral and lightly malty in flavor, with bitterness lingering.  Best pilsner I've ever had.
Excellent Pilsner; these guys at Victory really know their stuff. Strong hops and a nice malt follow.

Nice golden color with a slight haze to it.small white head that faded very quickly leaving a slight lacing on the side of the glass.Malty,fruity aroma with a pretty decent hop presence.There is also an almost off aroma there as well hard to describe it,but it isn't the most pleasant.The flavor was great Mildly malty semi-sweet with a very strong hop presence,a mild lemony taste as well in this brew  with the after taste being mostly bitter hops but a harsh bitterness but a quite pleasant one instead,with the brew finishing off with a semi-dry feel.IMO this is one hell of a good pils,probably the best I've ever had.Thnaks to Wawood for sending this bad boy.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 sometimes clean and brilliant, sometimes musty and fusel and sloppy.  but decent enough.

Good pilsner. Sufficient maltiness, with pronounced hops, but certainly not too bitter or over the top. Has the classic pilsner smell to it. Sadly, it is a pilsner and is probably incapable of getting a high rating from me.
This was a very good pilsener.  The taste was full of hops and refreshing, and this is definitely a beer I will try again.

This was a little more then average pilsner due to its bigger bite and flavor. Color was a cloudy yellow, no head, just some light fizzy bubbles on the top. Light minimal lacing in spots. Smell was a bit bitter from a fresh hop and some sweet maltyness. You could tell it was gonna have some bite just from the smell. Which it had, some favorable hop bite and bitterness, not bad, could've been smoother for a pilsner. I liked it more as it went along. Its a pretty decent pilsner and quite drinkable. The bite is right, but a little much for a pilsner in my book.

Clear golden color with a thick white head. The aroma was strong...pepper, hops, sweat sock, herbs, flowers. The flavor was equally substantial...pepper, tons of hops...cigarette ashes, herbs. Crisp, tight feel...dry finish. This is certainly the best pilsner I've ever had...or could ever imagine.
This is a very good pilsner...clean and crisp.  Nice golden color with lots and lots of hops!! Yet again another wonderfully crafted beer from Victory! Keep the Victory beers coming!

Very strong aroma of hops.  Gold and cloudy like a wheat beer.  Crisp bitter taste with lots of hops and some clove.  Thin.  I like a pilsener, but I can't find what everyone is enjoying so much in this beer.
Straw colored with fresh hop aroma.  Clean, bitter refreshing taste.  Hop heaven.  Strikingly good pilsner.

For me, this is a true pilsner. A beautiful head and a somewhat cloudy body. Everytime I have this beer the first sip is never quite like the rest. The hops really stand out in this beer. Bag the wheat beers, and drink this all summer.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2005 Enjoy by 11-21-05.It seems after doing some pilsner soul searching, I find that this pils reminds me way too much of a heady heineken or something.Tuppers Hop Pocket Pils is king along with the Troegs Sunshine Pils.Dont get me wrong now,I Love Victory! Just not my favorite pils~
Crisp, clean taste with just the right amount of hops.  Slightly bitter finish balanced by a smooth malt sweetness.  Good!
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2003 Light yellow color with a small head.  Floral aroma,the hops are here in big way.  It has some malt sweetness.  Dry, bitter finish, really good pils.

Emptied the bottle and it forms a white fluffy head with a luscious amber body. Slight hoppiness in the aroma and perhaps a hint of citrus. The aroma seems to remind me, for a second only, of Pilsner Urquell. The taste is very pleasant and much more smooth than than the afore mentioned beer. Definite sweetness on the tongue. The hops are present but not overwhelming and this is good for this type of beer. This is a great "refreshing" beer. I will plan on drinking this along with wheats this summer. Finishes very smooth as well with a lemony taste lingering but it is not annoying.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2004 2/14/04.  Poured out of 12 oz. bottle, obtained in a trade with Secret Santa on RateBeer 12/17/03.  Pours a lightly hazy pale golden, very sleek-looking.  Lots of tiny, pulpy-looking particles floating inside.  Billowy, white, rocky head dissipates to a thin and uneven whisp with spotty and very fast, but surprisingly resilient lacing.  Aroma is of bright but only subtly sweet fresh honey, pale malt, and faint, clean hops.  Very nice pilsner I can tell.  Flavor is immediately plant-like but not necessarily hoppy.  Grassy, I suppose, but it's more like a green-leaf herb or vegetable, maybe spinach.  Probably a bit too strongly vegetabley.  Bold, medium-full mouthfeel with very dry, leafy finish.  Very drinkable, despite its vegetablish persuasions, and it's quite lovely but a little odd for my palate.  Almost like drinking something from a juicer.  Nice background appearance from the malts that are in there, but they could use a little stronger appearance to push this one over the top.  They really come out in the long, elegant and delicate finish (definitely leaving you wanting more), but as soon as you taste more, it's a little jarring to experience again the vegetable assault, and you almost begin to question why exactly you wanted more to begin with.  Still quite a good beer, just a little bit odd. 7/4/7/4/16/3.8

5/3/03.  On tap at Hopleaf in Chicago, IL 5/3/03. ORIGINAL RATING.  Very good pilsner.  Elegant is right.  Thick, creamy head leads to a dusty-colored golden body.  Nicely malty and hoppy flavor with a long, bitter finish.  Very well-balanced.  8/4/7/4/15/3.8
Final rating reflects averages of the two ratings.

A great pilsner from Victory Brewing here, gang. Nice and fresh, with that really nice fresh maltiness to it, with a nice hops blast
at the end. Highly recommended.

Nice golden hue. A bit cloudy. Fluffy head could form more easily, nice staying power. Aroma is pleasantly grainy, lemon. Hops add floral, slighty spicy smell. The flavor is more of the clean crisp dry malt. Hops come through on short dry, bitter finish.

I liked the smell and presentation of this beer but i wasnt ready for its foresty flavours that followed.
Honestly it almost tasted like pinecones. But it was a different beer.

Pretty pale blond color,nice pils look.Good laceing.Bready floral nose.Great mouthfeel, good carbonation.Medium bodied with spicey hop flavors and decent malt backing the hops up.Dry finish with a good bitter bite in the end.Nice drinkin brew.Brewed in the bohemian pils style,i believe? I,m not much for lagers but this is one of the better ones.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2007 Very clear golden beer with a floral nose.  This is shockingly great flowery, hoppy wonderful light lager; for all the "yellow beer haters" ... this beer is as big and flavorful as all the American IPAs, but comes in the guise of a pilsner.  Drink it.  Love it.  Touchdown!
Like Mrs. Dash, this one hits the palate with a bit of lemon and spice.  A clean, refreshing yet dry pilsener.  Not my favorite style by any means, but I can understand why Prima is highly regarded.

This beer stretches the limits of a pilsner a bit, but it is so damn good I don't mind. A nice citrus aroma and flavor followed by a sweet snap of hops. Sweet, but not so that it sticks to the mouth. Overall refreshing, tasty and quite impressive. My hats of, once again, to Victory. Peace.

Very light golden color with
a light sweet smell.
Smooth and creamy flavor on the light side with some pop to it.

Just a bit of haze in the golden color, underneath a healthy head of white foam. Nice hop aroma hints of the bitterness to come. Excellent balance, satisfying mouthfeel with a crisp finish. Hats off to Victory for attempting to make the best pilsner; a brave undertaking that works very well and raises the bar. Wish I had bought a sixer.
Bitter herbal anise aroma.Cloudy blond appearance.Dry herbal bitter flavor with a hint of peach.Reminds me of Orval.lingering licorice bitter aftertaste.

I am not a lager drinker, and especially not pilseners, but I thought this beer was outstanding.  Great German noble hop aroma.  Brilliantly clear golden beer with a thick white head that laced my glass.  Flavor is well-balanced between hops and malt, there is some good bitterness present, and the finish is dry.  Absolutely no skunky/nasty flavors or aromas that I usually detect in lagers.  Overall, this is a crisp, flavorful, refreshing beer!
What a great pilsener. Tons of hops,very clean, bursting with flavor. A true standout in its style.

Bottle - Has a nice yellow, amber color.  My first thought - this is great tasting beer.  Though it is from a bottle, it reminds me of the quality Pils you get in the pubs in Parague.  Great, great hop aroma.  My only complaint is that the head dissipated quickly.
This is a great pilsener from the time you pour it out to the last drop that smacks your mouth.  Great color and head with a wonderful balance of hops and malt.

Very nice on this hot day in San diego.  Lively carbonation, crisp, malty, and well hopped.  I like this a lot.  I didn't care for the beer I drank in Prague, and I drank a lot.  This is fuller, stronger in alcahol, and tastes better in almost every way

One of the better "slight to style" Pils I've tried.  Bursting with Hops and definately well balanced malt v. hops.  My problem is with the carbonation.  Way too carbonated.  Overall, one of my favorite pilsners and would drink often if they lightened up on the CO2.

Pours with a deep golden body topped by a medium thick white lasting head with a good amount of lace left on the glass.  The aroma is slightly sweet yet sour with grassy hop note and a touch of malt.  Bitter slightly sweet flavor with grassy hop notes and a strong bitter finish.  Dry and light bodied.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2003 Really a stand out pilsener, this one!  Its average appearance lulls you into a sense of complacency before a nice lemon/citrus notes in the aroma and a great hop character in the flavor, leading to a very dry and full finish convince you that this is no ordinary pils.  Really a superior example from a somewhat underappreciated style and, in my opinion, one of Victory's better brews!

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2003 Straw golden in color.  What an aroma:  the beautiful smell of hops.  An excellent Pilsner.  Someone shoudl send a couple cases of this over to Miller so those bozo's can taste a "real" pilsner, and maybe they will stop advertising Miller Lite as one!  Re-rate:  just had the draught version.  No real difference:  both are excellent!!!

For a pilsner, this destroys the myth that only the Germans and their Eastern European cousins understand this often complex style of beer. Thick and rich palate. Crisp clean flavor and not overly hopped like many American brewers lean toward. Delicious golden color. It screams for a warm spring or summer day. For pilseners, this is one of the best. Not a hint of skunk!
Had this on draft at the Grey Lodge in Phila. Pilseners are not my favorite style. This tasted like any othe German pilseners

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2006 2/24/03:   Pours a fizzy pale yellow with a foamy white head. Looks like a pils, taste like a pils, but not bad, for a pils. 
3/12/06:  Light sweet aroma with a hint of grass and maybe corn. Flavor starts lightly sweet followed by a crisp hop bitterness finishing kinda dry. Medium bodied and creamy with  lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 Head was quick in forming and overflowed glass. Cloudy in appearance.  Hoppy aroma. Classic pilsner. Overall impression was good but not great. Does not impress you as much as other Victory brews. At Holden Beach in NC I was able to try another Prima Pils.  The impression was very different.  There was lemon and bitterness in the taste from start to finish. This is an excellent Pils.

Nose of toasted malt any piney perfumed hops.  Pours from the bottle a sparkling light golden.  The large frothy/rocky head is fully lasting with stellar lacing.  The flavor has exceptional balance and finish.  Great depth for this style.  The soft light and smooth body finishes clean.  Victory proves that BIG beers do indeed exist in the style of Pilsener.

Calling this a great pilsener is like saying how great Kentucky is because Cincinnati is such a nice city--it has appeal because it crosses over to different territory.  Full marks for appearance--have I ever said that for a pilsener?--nice cascade, hazy off-yellow, and wonderful mass of whipped egg-white-like head.  The aroma and flavor emit masses of quality hops, giving a floral but at times Juicy Fruit-brand chewing gum flavor.  Here is where my mind was thinking "IPA"? "American pale ale?"  So distinctively hoppy, it was enjoyable except for, to me, an overly sharp bitterness hanging on.  I'm not a hopaholic, so this didn't strike my fancy as much.  Sort of like being in Cincinnati (when I'd rather be in Kentucky, or better yet, New York).  Still, very enjoyable, very drinkable, very interesting.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2003 What in the name of Josef Groll is this crap. My first reaction of this stuff when trying to poor it into one of my nice pilsner glasses was it had gone bad since I had 1 inch of beer and 7 inches of foam.  After scooping out the foam and while holding the glass and bottle nearly horizontial I was able to get a half glass of beer.  Next reaction was that I had a bad batch since the beer was cloudy.  The taste is like a fish who drank a IPA and pissed this out. So I was going to give it a pass until reading the reviews here and found out it is supposed to be cloudy in appearance.  Highly disappointing given the rating for this beer on this site.

Re-rate:  Tried again when it was nearly frozen and it was less offensive.  The cap did not explode off the bottle, the head more managable, and the flavor more subdued.  The other flavors come out while the hops are hidden better than when this beer is warmer.

Very light in colour...obviously a pils. Tons of small bubbles similiar to champagne. A mild hoppy smell. Somewhat hoppy taste with a very noticable lemony taste. Light malt flavours, but an overall good taste, especially for a pils! One of the best pilsener's i've had in my life.

Imbibed in November 2002. A light hoppy aroma with a faint yeastiness. Poured a light straw yellow color. Slightly cloudy with a lemon merangue head made up of small bubbles. A steady stream of carbonation persisted the whole time. Hoppy with light malt flavors and a citrus twang. Crisp and clean. I'm not a pilsener fan but I could drink this on a nice summer day.
A good full pils, excites the taste buds and stays with you in just the right way.

generally, i don't like pils beers at all, but this one i did. hoppy (of course, coming from victory), a little bit bitter, but light enough that you can drink it all night. a beer i enjoyed a great deal.

Mild bitterness but not nearly as much as I expected.  Good, dry aftertaste and a quenchable palate that isnt skunky like a lot of the imported Pils Ive had.  Not as good as some native European beers but surely the best in America.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2003 A nice "hoppy" beer.  Light and refreshing as most good pilsners are but with a good almost fruity flavor and an excellent finish.

I guess this is what they call a good session beer. Light and drinkable, without being dull or skunky. A little more hop flavor, and lots more character, than the macro-brews it otherwise resembles, which makes it a good, not-too-threatening way to introduce your Bud-drinking buddies to good beer.

????? When I was looking here for another Pils to try I checked the top 10 page and noticed this one being number 1! I thought well, I gotta try this one if its true what the reviews are saying then i am missing out on something. Said and done I went to Bevmo and got me a six pack (which I thought was very expensive 8.99$ but well you gotta pay for quality). After cooling the beer I couldn"t wait to try it. It pourd in with a nice white head. The color was light golden with a bit of a haze. But then..... bummer!! The taste of this one is not what I was used from a Pilsener! Bitter fruity sour flavor which is definately overhopped for this style of beer(and I consider myself being a hophead cause I like heavily overhopped IPA"s) . Not that there is a rule but again I found it disturbinly overpowering and not suited for this style. You keep this bitter/oevrpwoering sourtaste in your mouth for quite a while! The aroma was also a surprise which means it didn"t smell as pleaseant as I expected (to be not offensive). So overall I didn"t like it and I am surprised about the rating it gets here. Maybe it is better freshly draft but for 8.99 the six-pack it was definately not worth it!

Decent thick head.  Very strong aroma of hops and a slight ovetone of fruit?  Light golden color.  Smooth taste with more hops.  Finish is dry and slightly bitter (yummy!) with more hops again.  The best pilsner I have had yet.  So much better than most of those imported (skunky) pilsners.  PRIMA Victory!
I, too find Pilsners drinakable but boring.  However, Victorys version, "bohemian style" is easy drinking complete with fresh hop aroma and mouth feel.  Left me very "hoppy".
It tastes good,looks good and its overall great

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2004 First Rating 3.5
As I promised I gave this beer second try. As I suspected the first sample was not as fresh as it could be. Great hop nose, soft medium with sweet well refined malt. Very Bohemian like. Gold pils with great lacing .Medium body, slightly dry with unusual oily tone. Bitter roundup supported with strong enough for that malt. Dry alcohol is just great add-on. I did worry that this Pils as is in many cases will be over hopped. Here it is not the case, hefty but sensible amount. Great brew!
Hoppy, and some sweet malt aroma, golden, with a very foamy head. Great hoppy taste, good balance of malts. Fine bitterness, in a fine beer, I was surprised to have so hoppy a Pilsner. Thanks Radek.
All pilsners should taste this good.  Nice light hop aroma that hides that traditional pilsner skunk.  Golden color with fluffy head.  Dry palate and nice aftertaste.

Poured a glassful of head. A small volcano going off in my glass from the carbonation streaking upwards. Has a mildly fruity taste. Like others, Im not a pilsner fan but this is very tasty and well done.

Im not usually a pilsner drinker, but I ended up with some of this in a Victory variety pack and tried it out. Its still a style I dont particularly care for, but this is definitely a well-made example of a pilsner. Very pretty appearance and a nice head, smooth flavor with a bit of the sourness at the end that other reviewers have mentioned.

very hoppie,nice texture,
taste stays long after you finish.head looks like beaten egg whites.good pilsner but not close to urquell,or bitburger.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2007 [upon gaining an appreciation of pilsners, this has become on of my favorite american-made examples] Im not a fan of pilsners at all, but Ill try anything made by Victory that I can get my hands on.  Looks pretty much like a standard pilsner should look, light golden color with a medium-sized head.  The aroma is a subtle mix of hops and malts.  The subtle malt character is in the flavor, and the hops come through very much.  The finish is all hops and bitterness that I really didnt enjoy very much.  For the style it is very good, at the very least drinkable, but still not my thing.  Nice try Victory, but not even you can make me like pilsners.  [RE-RATE] (original 12/17/02, now 12/21/02) After a second bottle, I must give the beer props for being the best of its style.  That is saying a lot.  And I cant remember the last time 
I was able to finish an entire 12 ounces of pilsner.  Bravo, Victory.  This may be a bad style of beer, but there is still something to be said about making the best of the worst.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2003 re-rate: This beer deserves a little more than I had originally given it.  Crisp, sharp finish is very refreshing in warm weather, and the hops are mild, but fill the beer with their goodness. Definetly not my favorite Victory Beer. Original rating: In fairness, I don't care for most of the pilsners I've had in the past either. However, in general, I don't like my beers watery no matter what the style - Prima Pils has a watered-down flavor and a sour finish.
The best beer of this style by a long shot. Im not a big pilsner fan but this was very good. Golden in color, nice hop presence.

A soft pour yielded a glass 75% full of foam.  The bottle must have been mishandled.  Semi-sweet mild hoppy aroma very accurate to the style.  The body is smooth and finishes moderately bitter, but crisp.  A great pilsner.

Light , hazy, poured into a huge long lasting head.I looks like Mr Bubbles has entered my glass.Light crisp clean, a touch bitter, quite refreshing. Something about the after taste just doesnt set well with me .grassy,malty some hops, perfume. Not really my style still another good one from Victory.
I am not a huge fan of pilsners, let alone American brews.  However, this is hands down the best pilsners Ive ever tried, and now one of my new favorite beers.

Re-rate:  Still a good beer, but not quite deserving of the 4.1 I gave it before. 10/31/02:  Best pilsner Ive ever had.  At first I thought it was not even really a pilsner.  However, the qualities of a pils come through, despite the immense amount of hops.  The hoppiest, tastiest example of a pils ever.  Well done.
Head to head with 3 Floyds Burnham Pilsner.  Cloudy lemon, huge frothy head.  Tangy hoppy mouth feel. . .bitter finish. . .lingering citrus notes complete a pretty good beer.

Pretty good, although it seems a little bitter for the pilsener style. An IPL, perhaps (India Pale Lager)? Warm, malty nose followed by heaps of hops. Just seems like theyre trying to fit too much in here. Id rather have a Czechvar for pure refreshment.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2003 They really hit you over the head with the hops on this one, and it feels good. Piny, bark like flavor. Great bitter effervencent finish. One of my favorite pilseners.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2003 Rerate: Sticky, lasting head that coated the side of the glass. Earthy and lasting hop profile, fairly light though. I can see this as a great compliment to pasta salad. I appreciate this much more than the first tasting!

Assuredly the  best Pilsner that I have yet tried. A hazy yellow color with a tremendous head that slowly dissapates into a smooth layer that teaves a nice lace as you drink. Aroma is hops, and a sour grass herbal feel. Flavor is the same with just the slighgtest presance of malt. A wonderful beer, and Ill be looking for more  of the Victory lineup in the future.

Okay, this beer poured a dark yellow color and formed a white bubbley head that left some nice lace. The aroma, well, lets just say the hops exploded in my olfactory area. There was also some grassy, earthy elements. The flavor, once again, was most definately hops. Also present was malt and citrus. The finish was fairly dry. One of the best pils I have had, but I admit to not being a big fan of the style.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2010 poured almost clear with a yellow stain..The head started over 2″ thick but settled completely lopsided and evil..the aroma was filled with straw, grass, soil, wheat, bananas...Flavor was wheaty with banana flickerings..spicy..almost like a hidden hefeweizen..re-rate. I like this much better than the 3.6 I originally gave it.  Boost this mutha
Very hoppy.  Bitter finish with some dryness.  You can taste the evergreen in this one.  Still another fine product from Victory.;)

A nice beer.  Not really much like a Pilsner.  In a tasting with some colleagues it beat Pilsner Urquel stone cold dead, but not sure how it would have done against a real Pilsner Urquel draft in Berlin or Prague a dozen years ago.  This seems to be as far from real Pilsner as the stuff that Urquel and Budvar sell in the US now, but in the other direction.  If I had to pick I would choose this one, but it is a bit overhopped for the type.

pours a clear but ordinary legal-pad yellow (if legal pads were clear that is, but things legal are seldom clear); the head graced my glass briefly with a wispy yin and yang symbol; pretty, but as thin as my chances of dating angelina jolie.  i honestly wasnt dazzled by the aroma at first, but i kept at it, sniffing and swirling till i was lightheaded. finally i opened a goose island pils AND a gordon biersch pils to taste beside it.  suddenly, it all became clear: this one has subtlety and elegance, its more sweetly yet delicately perfumy than the rivals, (tho the goose island is a close second).  clean, with danjou pear, swiss cheese, and dry white wine aromas. a very smooth, full tongue bitterness just slightly edges out the staid malts and minimal sweetness. the snap of those saaz hops is remeniscent of the old pilsner urquell.  and hey, after finishing those three beers, my chances with angelina suddenly seem much brighter.  hic.
Clean, crisp, hoppy, all the things Ive come to expect from well made American craft Pilseners in general and Victory specifically. Big white head, firm body and a suitably bitter finish.
One of the better pilseners that Ive had.  Nice finish.
Sweet bread and sugar pops cereal(?) in the nose.   Crisp tiny bubbles.   Very smooth and drinkable, slighty   bitter finish.

Huge hop nose and flavor.  The hops are floral, herbal, pine and spruce by turns and the finish long and bitter.  At the right temperature, the malt comes out and actually enhances the wonderful hop experience.  Very similar to Tupper Hop Pocket.  Both outstanding.

Yummy....great Pilsner from Victory. Pours a golden yellow color with a large white head. Thirst quenching indeed, this one goes down smooth. Re Rate: I just got some more of this and it is fantastic. I had to bump up the aroma and flavor points because I had it rated too low.
Definately a strong pilsner.  Very hoppy feel gives a great bitterness.  The nose is nice and fruity, which leads to the nice citrus flavor makes is memorable.  Definately a great pilsner

Hazy yellow-gold hue with a thick bright and white head. Classic saaz bitterness throughout the beer. Full bodyfeel, crisply hoppy, very grassy/earthy characteristics and a clean finish. A pleasure to drink

Citric, fruity, lightly grassy aromas, along with some faint yeast, how unusual is yeast aroma in a pils...  Appealing dynamic golden yellow color, some fine haze.  Carbonation and head are most impressive and the lacing is also very nice.  Flavor is nicely balanced between the light but bodifying German pilsner malts and the fresh-tasting, spicy hops.  Finish is on the dry side, and the malt plays its part well here, too, adding a little light, bready sweetness to the drying effect of the hops.  Yeah, this is just about the best Pils I ever had.  Lots going on here for that style of beer. They may be German ingredients, but theyre in American quantities!

An exciting pils, with a big sour apple and grapefruit nose.  Yellow color with a thin, white head that dissapears comletely.  Light, subtle malts are hidden beneath a wealth of hop flavors (grapefruit being dominant).  This is one of the best examples of what citric hops taste and smell like.  Finish is dry and bitter, and the beer is fairly clean overall.  Big body for a pils.  Nice.

Yellow, big fizzy head.  Very fruity, yeasty and sweet aroma.  The body has a substantial amount of malt and smacks of American hops.  There is an overwhelming amount of carbo in here and the excellent flavors that are lying beneath cant quite escape.  Too bad, i loved what was going on, but I couldnt get past the carbo.
Very hoppy.  The finish is bitter.  I think the appearance is perfect.
Golden clear color.  I was expecting a traditional pilsner, but the fruit overtones was surprising.  Tart tastes of green apples, and spice.  Good complex hops and a clean texture.

Light hazy yellow body with a quickly vanishing foamy head. Green apple notes in the nose along with clean citrusy hops. Green apple is present on the tastebuds, with a finish that is all hops.  The sweet malts that do come through as it warms are fresh and sweeet, but overwhelmed and hidden by the big hops. Very good pils.
light gold with a nice white head (typical).  Nice hop/bitterness to this.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2005 bottle-it has been 3 years since i had this beer.  Well, i had to lower the ratings since this botte wasnt that good really.  pours a golden yellow hue with a foamy white head.  Ohh no, this beer has diacytl.  Since when did a victory beer have the big D?  Its not overbearing, but its definately there.  Some notes of bell pepper, malty sweetness, lemon and spicy german hops and yeast.  Malty flavors with some notes of butter from the big D.  long hoppy finish with lingering diacytl.  Man, i have become very sensitive to that stuff.  The body of this beer is one of the best in the style.  full and rich!  some nice herbal notes come out as it warms.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2003 Pours slightly cloudy and golden in color.  Has a monsterous and explosive head that slowly descends leaving nice lace behind.  Aroma is Hoppy, floral, maybe slightly sour.  Flavor started off a bit sour (lemon), middle had some nice hops and spice to it, end was very dry, slightly bitter.

Typical Victory product. Tasty, well made, and hoppy as hell. nice golden color with cloud white head. Big hoppy, floral aroma. Incredibly hoppy taste for a pilsener which I enjoyed thoroughly. Dry, bitter finish.
Beeeauuutiful looking beer.  Nice balanced flavors and a very clean finish.
Pils just isnt my style

Another good Victory Brewing product.
Smells good.  The bottle I just opened 
almost sounded like a champagne bottle
upon opening.  Highly carbonated and pours
the biggest head of any brew I have seen.
Wonderful hop, kinda spicy flavor with a dry 
finish.  Very good pils.
UPDATED: NOV 10, 2010 Spicy, grassy hops on a soft cereal carpet...Dry feel of hay accompanied by a light herbal note and an eagerness to try more...This is a superbly efficient trip to Bavaria...
This stuff is great.  Sharp, crisp, and hoppy.  Probably the best pilsner not actually from the Czech Republic.
I dig the cloudiness compared to other pilsners.  Definitely the best pilsner Ive had.  Not skunked out.  Has a lemony flavor.  Good all around.

An incredible clear yellow color.  Another great appearance for a Victory brew, yet I was not as impressed by the aroma or flavor.  The aroma an flavor immediately reminded me of Grolsh, which I am not a fan of.  Also, the beer had a tremendous amount of carbonation.

My absolutely favorite pilsner. As noted below, it pours with tremendous clarity and a delicate yellow color. The head is absolutely magnificent for a lager almost Duvel-like! A gentle aroma somewhat indeterminate, then the taste Pure heaven!

First and foremost, Saaz hops, then more Saaz hops, then a delicate maltiness, then a gentle but persistent malty finish with more Saaz hops. Oh so crisp (I hate that adjective!) and refreshing. Served ice-cold, its fun to drink  the hops and malt more than hold their own.

Ok, I was skeptical about this one. I have never described a pilsner as a good beer. Ive seen the ratings for this one, and read the comments. I said to this beer prove it(I crossed my arms). Needless to say this brew lived up to its hype, but first off this is no typical pilsner. It has terrific hop character, full body, and a great apearance. This aint yo mamas pilsner. Victory truly created a great pilsner, and probably one of the only ones I would say that about.

This is a striking beer with golden yellow areas that fade into pale straw transparent edges, all beneath a fine grained solid white head. It misses your nose by a bit, leaving little but far off hints of honey. The flavor is big in lemon and hops, citrus and bitter, followed by a malt sweetness that lulls you into a sense of security, then it leaves with a substantial hop finish. This is a good pilsner. Ill definitely be getting more of these.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2003 Clear golden hue.  Frothy white head, with nice lacing.  Aroma mostly sweet with a hint of pine. Sweet first then a long refreshing saaz finish. Big hops, very nicely balanced out.  Excellant pilsner, outstanding.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2006 Re-Rate:Hazy,goden color. Pillowy head settles to a milky ring. Aroma is grassy with spicy,floral hops. Huge,sweet,malty,front is one to not forget(for a pilsner).Very clean malt taste as well.Followed by grassy,straw-like flavors. Finish is top notch for a pils.Very pleasently dry.The combo of hops and the USE of malts make this a pils not just for the lighter fans.Full of flavor and SPICY!! hop burps
A very good pilsener.  A prime example of how a lighter style doesnt need to be flavorless.  HOORAH!!

Not really what I wanted in a pilsner..
Perhaps I got a bad batch, will try again soon to make sure. 
Much like an overwight female riding a tiny tricycle, it was good, but I wasnt horribly impressed.

Think I got a bad sixer of this stuff. I just didnt like it a whole lot. Giving Victory the well deserved benefit of the doubt, Ive rated high (Yeah I know it doesnt seem that way but what I got out of the bottle seemed like a macro holland import). Ill have to re-review this later.

Light golden in color with a nice creamy white head. Sweet hoppyness in the nose bit of mown grass as well. Lots of dry hop flavor with a bit of cardboard taste in the background. Bit of veggie flavor in there also as well as a tartness that runs around the tongue.

Light golden color, huge bubbles, generous fast-dying head.  Big, big nose:  apricots, 7-up (lemon/lime), slight date/caramel maltiness.  Great dry/bitter flavor -- at the opposite end of the spectrum from Lakefronts Klisch Pilsener, my other favorite American Pils; this is like the driest of champagne, with dominant grapefruit and orange flavors, giant hop bitterness, but a decent body and woody maltiness to balance.  Long tough finish.  Absolutely great pils, refreshing but not something you can toss back brainlessly.  Starting to get the picture on this brewery...

Had this for the 1st time at the City Pages beer fest in Minneapolis a few months ago, and loved it, but the 3 oz I tasted were not enough to form a complete opinion. Now that I have, I have nothing but positive things to say. The 1st impression is a citrus fruit hoppy aroma. The appearance is unique; the cloudy, amber-gold hue with a thick white head provides an alluring attractiveness. This is quite possibly the best pilsner Ive ever had, which means it supplants Urquell from the top of my list. There is so much flavor and complexity here, it is almost unfair to other Pilsners for Prima to be an entry in the Pilsner category. Nevertheless, the bar has been raised, and we all will benefit from competitors attempting to best the Prima!

Best American brewed Pils Ive ever tried...has that un-defineable extra certain something that makes it stand out, not sure if its the fantastic malt flavor, the perfect balance, or the picture perfect noble hop bitterness and flavor...Prima pils is definitely "all that"!
Truly one of the finest American pilseners. No need to travel to Prague!
Top notch Pilsener. Do these guys make any bad beers? Plenty of descriptions already so if your thinking of trying it, do yourself the favor.

I had to go mail order just to try this Pilsener out and I have to say, it was one of my better decisions. Ive never tasted a more bold sample of the style: Enormous hop flavour when first poured..almost like its a totally unbalanced brew complete with enormous carbonation but wait a few moments and everything seems to settle down. The taste of malt finally creeps in and the huge bubbles are now small. Almost like 2 beers in one; the foamy head is retained through both stages of this beers life. ;^)

This was a good clean and crisp beer. but after i read the description i expected a little more kick. im not a big fan of pilsners. They seem to lack some flavor i expect in beer. but if this is yer thing you might like this one.
My second favorite beer to drink.  My first is Vicotorys Hellerbock.  There is nothing more refreshing than drinking a tall cold Prima on a hot humid North East summer day.
Too hoppy for me ...

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2003 This is my kind of pills, golden color , nice foamy white head, leaves a lace in my glass, hoppy aroma for a pils, balanced flavors in this nectar , it has a very tasty hop bite and finishes dry.

just as the description reads. very frothy head with a golden color and lots of carbonation. hoppy aroma and i think i caught just a hint of vinegar, but my sense of smell isnt the best. awesome pils with a dry aftertaste. victory is awesome!
Pretty good for a Pils.  One of the few Pils Ive really found a pleasant noble hoppiness from aroma to flavor to bitterness.  A great beer but Im still not a pilsner fan.

Yellow fizzy beer in the kindest sense of the term. Wonderful hoppy, malty aroma. Huge frothy white head that lasts til the last drop. Quite bitter, crisp, clean, spicy, malty, hoppy flavor. Medium body. As first, I thought this was overhopped but by the bottom of the glass, the strong hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma had grown on me. This is a damn fine beer.

This may well be a perfect beer.  From the bottle to the glass, it screams drink me.  There is a floral/spicy mouthwatering aroma.  Wonderful. And the taste is pilsner perfection. A beautiful meld of hops and clean malt flavor.  This beer is a must-have.
my favorite regularly produced beer from this excellent brewery
nice color and slight floral aroma. Greats pils

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2011 What a heck happened? It now smells like yeast, and the hop aroma and flavor are rather dull and restrained. And the pilsner malt sorely lacks vividness. Rather unclean. I continually revisit new batches in hopes of finding a good one. After years of doing so, I give up. This beer is far from the brightly lemony, herbal, peppery, and cleanly malty pils it once was. My last  bottle was truly nauseating with downright putrid notes of circus peanuts,
spent tealeaves, and vitamin B. Over the past five years or so, this beer has varied from almost drinkable to utterly poor, with this particular bottle being representative of the latter.  My score represents the average relative to my countless experiences.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: better than any pils i had in germany or the world for that matter on draft at the brewery is the way to go a great hops and malt masterpeice

CORRECTION: I have just been informed that this beer does not contain Cascades bot Saaz and Tetts. Still, I swear I feel the spirit of Sierra Nevada in the hops.. Certainly doesnt taste Bohemian flowery to me.
ORIGINAL COMMENTS
Very experimental pilsner, with Cascades instead of Saaz. It has a strong Cascade aroma reminiscent of Hop Devil or the SN stuff. The taste is like a lighter, crisper version of Hop Devil, with a brutal blast of hops and a long bitter finish. Not as malty and delicate as czech pilsners. The head is a sight to behold, Ive never seen Pilsner Urquell or Czechvar produce such a beautiful, rocky head.. Looks like molten marshmallow.. Suprisingly easy to drink considering its extreme bitterness..
Nice yellow color; Head left something to be desired; Grassy, wonderufl nose. Dry, grassy palate. A satisfying pils- maybe one of the best I have encountered.

The number of wines I have sampled is greater than the number of beers reviewed by the three most prolific raters on this site combined.  Im fairly new to beer, but I know what to look for in an alcoholic beverage.  The first beer I recommend to friends is the Prima Pils.  Even the staunchest Bud/Corona/Phlegm fan can instantly recognize that this is a quality brew that goes far beyond what one expects of a Pilsner, yet it is not an oddball brew.  With decent body and a head that can only be described as ridiculous, this can easily fill the bill for ones standard brew.  Victory may well be Americas best overall brewery.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2003 This beer rocks!
I'm not a huge fan of pilseners, but this is a damn good beer.  The nose is spicey, buttery and slightly floral...with a hint of honey. A sharp, well-hopped beer with a very crisp, dry finish. A hint of clover honey at the wee end. As I stated, not my favorite style, but a damn nice effort nonetheless!

Re-Rate 06/29/02: Clear gold in color, frothy white head, sheets of lace. Nose is clean and crisp, and malt dominates. Starts malt, the top is light, the finish is nicely hopped, dry, somewhat acidic and quite thirst quenching. Thanks Jayme
Finally a pils with some flavor and body.  Nice bitterness in aroma and flavor.  Body is light, but at least you notice it.  A refreshing beer.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2003 Certainly one of the hoppiest Pilsners you're likely to run across. In the mold of the best, dryest, bitter German Pilsners, this is premium, top shelf lager, gentlemen. Deserves its reputation. 
Note to California raters: after about 10 'second' chances, I officially declare Beverages and More utterly incompetent in the matter of storing beer.  Nearly all the beers I buy there have a peculiar melonish infection that completely ruins the flavor. They'll let you trade it for another six, but why bother - that one will be infected too! Use them for their terrific liquor selection, but find a new purveyor of beer. That is all.
A very well crafted pilsener.  I really enjoyed the fresh tasting hop notes, and the beautiful golden color and rocky head.
Wow, One of the best Pils I have ever tasted.  A beautiful balance of superior hops and malt.  Very crisp and refreshing. Great Job.

While Im not a fan of pils, this rendition is solid. Pale golden color. Pours with a big foamy white head. Flowery, bright, hoppy nose. Light and crisp on the palate. Medium hoppy, crisp, bitters taste. Seems a bit one-dimensional, still a good choice for those seeking a light and refreshing beer. Good BBQ beer.
Great pils...theres a great hop bite to this one.  Well balanced with a strong bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2014 Bottle (BB Nov 5, 2014). Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, lemon). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Holy moly, Victory finally cleaned up the doughy yeast in this beer!  Or at least they did in this batch. Thats the difference between a high 2 and a mid 3 in my book.  Yeah, its still a bit too sweet and comes off a bit ale-like, but its a decent rendition without all the residual raw yeast!
A very smooth pilsner.  Light aroma, Goes good anytime

This was a pilsener.  This beer easily stretches the definition of what a pilsener can be.  The aroma could have been stronger and unfortunately the golden color dosent entice.  It was just about as clear as one can get though.  Has a great balance between smooth, sweet maltiness up front and the hops bitterness at the end.  I can see myself repeatedly drinking this.

Lovely floral hoppy aroma and pure pils color.  The flavor when right out of the fridge has an astringent quality.  When it warms up a bit it loses the astringency, but also some of the flavor.  Theres definitely a strong hoppiness, but its not quite the quality I seek.  Good, but not great.

The hop on the label says it all -- prepare to be bombarded by the aroma and flavor of that yummy ingredient.  Victory can call it a pils if it wants (and based on how it made the beer, it probably should), but the hoppiness is APA all the way.  Good stuff!!
Bottle.  Wow!  A huge frothy white head on a bubbly golden pilsner.  A wonderful crisp and dry beer with enough hops to make it kick.  Stands above other beers in this style.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2003 Great white head with a wonderful spicy hop aroma backed by a nice wiff of malt.  The palate is first malty then hoppy with a dry finish. Great balance on a hard to get right style. Excellent well made pils!

Re Rate 5/29/02--What the hell was I talking about the first time I rated this. This is great stuff! Nice grassy/floral hop notes with a nice dose of sweet malt that balances it out. Wonderful and certainly my favorite pilsner.


A good domestic example of a pilsner, but Im just not a huge pilsner fan. The Saaz worked for me though.

Pours with an impressive white head over a yellow body. Huge nose of malt and freshly cut grass (with a hint of horse manure). Flavor is intensely hoppy--dominated by bitterness and pine notes, somewhat out of balance to its relatively delicate malt nuttiness.
A tasty pislner, very frothy head. A little carbonated for my liking, but goes down smooth with an excellent finish.
