UPDATED: APR 5, 2003 How can ya hate Pils???  Why, oh why do so many people here not like Pils.  Methinks they've been drinking too much Heineken... Stick with the German stuff.  Anyway, this is NOT a classic German pils, more reminiscent of an American IPA.  Though good, very good.  Wonderful floral aroma with a hint of citrus fruit, pours a light golden, slightly cloudy color with some lace and a nice hoppy smack in the face.  Great beer, though I don't think it really belongs in the pilsener category.  Aber trotzdem isses Prima.  Prost!

As a general rule I hate pilsners, but this one isnt bad. Tastes more like an IPA. Lots of hoppieness and fairly bitter, and like the description says it has a dry finish. Probably my favorite pilsner ever, but its still a pilsner and thus not all that great.
great pilsner. a little more hoppy than i expected. crisp and spicy.

From draught. Small head that dissipated but left some lacing. Weak hop aroma. Nice golden color and smooth palate. Slightly sweet and nicely hopped. Slightly bitter/hoppy finish. Crisp and refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2005 Additional comments: Noble hops and mild vanilla and malt nose. Lots of hops. Late malt flavors are lightly buttery. A cross between a czech and german pils. A little to hoppy to set and enjoy a bunch on any given day, but a good one for just a single or two night. Original Comments 5/8/02 - I decent german pils.  A bit overbalance hops of Saaz and Northern Brewer.  Nice clear straw color with good head and lace.

Flavor is much better than the aroma.  This beer smells like a wet dog that has been smoking dope.  Flavor has a hop bite, citrus and flower.  Not a bad beer, but I dont like it as much as everyone else.

My least favorite style of beers are pilsners. Even craft bewerys usually dissapoint. That being said this is one of the most refreshingly delicious beers Ive had since the first time I tried Petes summer ale. It pours like a weisse beer and smells somewhat similar without any of the citrus notes. Pour vigorously and youll be rewarded with a full creamy head that will stand for a solid five minutes. Taste is crisp and complex with the perfect balance of hop bitterness and golden malted roundness. My girlfriends gonna go bonkers for it. Re-rate 4/28/02 Anyone else taste grapefruit in the aftermath? Man what a great light brew, one of the most refreshing beers ever!

Light golden/yellow,slightly hazy, awesome fluffy head and lace, loads of german malt in the nose along with a substanial floral hop presence.  Tasty, a well defined almost sweet malt, subdued spicyness, grassy and light citric notes all show themselves on the palate and is then flushed away beautifully by a huge slap in the face of addicting saaz hops. Very sharp, clean and refreshing. Fanastic brew.

Long lasting head with heaps of lacy foam and a rich floral perfume.  In this case, florality is florality - it really does smell like a late summer garden, when the air is heavy and an exquisite drowsiness buzzes over all.  Tatse?  Well they get more out of their Saaz than anyone else, thats certain, and the rest of the beer is almost grand enough to pull it off.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2003 - a clear golden color, highly carbonated with a nice head, aroma is nicely hopped with a malt presence; very smooth, hops are highly present along with a malty flavor, not even a bit watery, has some fruity characteristics - a truly great beer
Way over the top with the Saaz taste and aroma.  A little extreme, but Im not a pilsener fan to begin with.
I am not a huge pilsner fan, but this is a really great brew.  Refreshing, nice and carbonated, and a nice sweetness to it.  Definitely Prima.
WOW!!!!  This is a great beer!  The hop bite is most unexpected, and very welcome.  I cant get enough of this wonderful beer.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2006 9/16/06: Yep, this is arguably my most favorite lager if you dont count doppelbocks.

New commentary, 1/16/06:

First time I had this in a long time, not having been able to find it.  I missed it, and for good reason.  This is basically the Urquell without the skunk factor, making for perhaps the most satisfying lager this side of a doppelbock.

Wow. Ive been a Pilsner Urquell fan for quite some time but this offering from the superb Victory Brewing is just outstanding. Crisp, hoppy, clean and truly the standard bearer of Pilsners. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2007 Lovely Saaz nose, crisp, and, unlike some imported green-bottle Czech pilsners Ive sampled, NO SKUNK! Victory continues to impress. RERATE: Ive decided that this is my favorite beer, so I give it the mighty 5.0. No apologies. RERATE yet again, 09/07: This brewery continues to decline. This beer no longer has the big hoppiness that once made it a favorite. Sad, really.

This is my first post so i figured i would rate my favorite beer.  This beer took some getting used to, as I didnt particularly like it the first time I tried it.  After a few of these, it became very enjoyable.  The aroma of the saaz hops are almost overwhelming but that is a good thing.  The appearance was outstanding, pour this one in a glass and you will understand.  Suprisingly huge overall taste, despite how clear and light it looked.  A light whitish head that had a great retention.  This is my favorite beer from my favorite brewery.  Thanks Victory!!

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2006 Very traditional pilsener, perfectly clear golden color, soft & subtle white head, generous lacing around the glass, lots of abrasive hops in the nose, the hop character all over this beer really smacks you in the face, very hoppy flavors but incredibly smooth & drinkable, very refreshing on a hot day, clean but dry finish, excellent pils
I only really drink it in the summer.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2007 A great summer beer, lots of hop flavor without the added alcohol of most IPAs

Re-rate 5/26/07:  World class pilsner, only complaint would be the borderline harsh hoppyness.
I usually do not like a strongly hopped beer, but this one was able to pull it off nicely.  The biterness was complex enough to make it very drinkable.  Nice crisp taste.

Very nice pilsner aroma, crisp and clear golden color.  A spicy flavor, that finishes pleasantly bitter.  I was very impressed with this beer, as I tend to enjoy more darker beers, but this one is very nice.

A full smooth bitter flavor with unusually spicy hop flavor and aroma.   A very fine brew.  There is a refreshing, almost menthol character to the hops that make this brew so unique and enjoyable in the often bland world of pilsners

Im not a big pilsener drinker,
but this one is excellent. Great color & flavor. Victory beer is hard to find
here in So. Calif, but this one (along w/ all their others) is worth
seeking out.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Mine has only the slightest bit of haze, a nice golden color and perfect two minute white foam. The aroma is half-full but with a lucid display of freshness -- the greener qualities subverting the heavier peppery character. Wee bits of bubblegum in here. The body is a fine medium with medium carbonation and makes a solid delivery platform for crisp, clean and substantial well-balanced lightly sweet malt flavors and hardy hopping. This belches very well. In my humble opinion, among the best of its class.

This is everything I want in a pilsener, golden color, spicy hop aroma, robust bitterness and good finish.  Makes me pine for the time Ive spent in the Czech Republic, beers in the store for 10-15 cents a bottle and 50 cents in the bar.  Oh well, Id fork out the cash for this beer any day.  Pity it isnt distruibuted in Iowa.
Golden coloured. Dry, crisp, well hopped, bitter. Very nice pilsener!
Mmmmm. Bitterness never tasted so good. Cant tell about the head cuz mine basically exploded when I opened it, but the color, taste was great. Body is thinner then Lagunitas Pils.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: UPDATED: JUL 3, 2005 This is one of my all-time favorites.  A true American classic.
I usually dont care much for hoppy brews, but this ones spicey pinesap punch really appealed to me.  Good clean distinguishable and distinguished malts, too.

Pale yellowy golden color, light cloudiness. profusion of small, precise, pinprick sized, bubbles. Wonderfully flowery aromatic nose, infused with herbs, a little minty, piney and suggestions of citrus. There’s some mild fruitiness, and a pale, almost toasty malt. There’s a hop flower on the label and this indeed is what makes the initial taste impression, tingling and challenging the taste buds, leaving bitter hop notes right across the palate. There’s some sweeter malt, that I struggled to define satisfactorily, but do provide an excellent balance, as they swim just below the more hoppy surface. The sweetness does materialize a little more as the beer warms, a subtle sugary lemon, while mid-palate there’s a tropical fruitiness, maybe pineapple juice, maybe pink grapefruit, but not quite full enough for me to define with too much certainty. The bitterness develops yet more noticeably in a tangy and exquisitely dry finish, lingering well into the aftertaste, while slowly and gradually, the sweeter lemony flavors come back to put out the flames. 
Very refreshing, exceptionally crisp, deliciously bold and flavorful, a pilsner, for those of us who want a beer to taste what its supposed to taste like.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2008 Bottle:  Clear golden with a thin white head, starts and ends lightly bitter, hay and grassy hops in the aroma, thick body for the style.  Leave it to Victory to make a pilsener that doesn’t suck.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2010 Rerate for 2010: This is back to form it seems. Strong grassy and floral hops in the nose and flavor but still a nice biscuity malt presence, not overly grassy or resiny or bitter. 
As hoppy a pilsner as Ive ever had.  Aroma is curious and fun with spicy and grassy notes, with a tinge of orange rind.  Flavor is dominated by hops (spicy, hints of resin begin to appear) with a strongly bitter finish.  Malt is hard to detect.  At this low gravity, this beer is almost as puckeringly bitter as some 100+ IBU hop monsters, and probably explains some of this beers appeal.  To me, its unbalanced.  Cutting the hops back even just a little bit would greatly improve its drinkability while retaining its bold character.
A little more hoppy than a crisp pilsner one might expect. But very good especially if you like hops.
I must say I enjoyed this brew.  Highly carbonated, full head, excellent hoppy flavor.  Though Pilseners are generally the last beer Id try at a brewpub, this one scores points with me.
this does not taste like a european pilsner, tastes like all other american micros
Like a few others have noted, i too really dont care much for pilsners. Few that i have had have done anything for me. Simply said, this one is just really good.

Not a typical pilsner.  Crisp and clean, this beers flavor and aromatic characteristics are dominated by hops.  Some underlying pineyness to this sharp, but not biting, pilsner.  Low on yeast, high on personality, this is unchartered territory for me: a pilsner I like.
Normally I really dont care for pilsners, the hops added to this one make it quite enjoyable though. Smooth for how gitter it was, and the yeast was barely prevalent. Give it a try.
An above average pilsner. Very hoppy, very carbonated, fairly smooth, with a decent flavor.

even though im not  a pilsner drinker i enjoyed this a lot.
Strong Saaz hops flavor was unmistakable. very smooth and refreshing.
Another winner from Victory.
Up there with the German Pils, one day I will have it on tap.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2005 Bright and heady. Citrusy, floral, and piney nose lofts into the air. Soft, smooth, and clean. Sharp, snappy and refreshing. Bold version of a pilsner, and I really like the interpretation. Tremendously aromatic with a healthy bitterness. Well made and unbelievably tasty beer. Every time I get the chance to drink this I like it even better.

A very good classic pilsner.  Its crisp, clean, nad has a nice hoppiness, but its maybe a bit too crisp.  I prefer a slightly more noticeable finish, and this one goes down just too clean.  Still, very refreshing.
Though Im not much of a pilsner fan, this is a quality brew.  Very dry and bitter at first with a sweet malt middle to balance and a big hop finish.  Love that Saaz!
When I saw it, I said Im not going to like it. Its too light. When I tasted it, I thought it was very good. Nice flavorful, hoppy beer.

Spose the only thing bad to say about this is the slightly less than crystal clear aspect. Not as fully hopped or heavily malted as an Urquell. Wonderful floral nose, and graceful as a gazelle going down. An excellent light-bodied American pilsner.
This one is heavy in hops!  A true pils, holds up to all imports!!
Nice, crisp noble hop accented pilsner.
Fantastic pilsner.  Hop-heavy with good malt background and a lot of style.
